Reviews: 有人问，你玩了那么久的CSGO玩到了CS2都到来了，还有必要买这款游戏吗？我想说的是虽然新生的CS确实很棒，但是这款游戏所承载的是曾经的童年，时过境迁，星海横流，我们已然不是曾经那个坐在电脑前就可以无忧无虑晚上一整天的少年，CS是我接触的第一款FPS射击类游戏，以前玩的还只是离线版的CS，以为那些人机就是真人，当时的人机也很强，即使技术很菜也能玩上一整天，整天研究那个位置最有可能蹲着人，想想还真是有点可笑呢，这款游戏或许放在现在并不怎么优秀甚至在某些人眼中可以说是“差劲”的，但它在我心中有着无可替代的地位，每款游戏都有它独特的魅力，拥有属于那份属于玩家的回忆，时隔多年，为曾经的“我”买下这份CS | A legendary tactical shooter that shaped the genre. Simple yet deep gameplay, excellent weapon balance, and iconic maps keep the game relevant even today. Pure nostalgia and classic FPS action. | 10 sene önce steam bilmezdik tabi csduragi oyun yoneticisinden oynadım. Rahat 5-6 bin saat basebuilder zombi, biohazard zombi, furien falan oynamışımdır. En güzel yıllardı dünyanın en iyi serverları türklerdeydi vee her güzel şeyin de bir sonu var yıllar geçtikçe iyi serverlarda kapandı. Zaten oyunda en iyi server maks 1-2 sene ayakta kalabiliyor serverları açık tutmak için yöneticinin para ödemesi lazım. Neyse şu an bile en az aktif tüm serverları toplasan 20-30 bin oyuncusu vardır. | bazı oyunları küçükken crackli oynarsınız işte o oyunlar büyüdüğünüzde size kendisini aldırır, sizi o anlara döndürmek istediği için ,,,, en az 1k saatim var crackte | So greetings, I played this game as a kid (cracked version) and I never enjoyed playing games more than when I was playing CS 1.6. Until recently I played CS 2, that game is heavy shit full of cheaters, geifers and trolls, since I went back to CS 1.6 I enjoy Counter Strike again.

I would recommend this game to everyone like me without friend :( ..... Its a really simple shooting game but singleplayer .... I love this kinds of games... One annoying thing about it is when i die to a bot  have to wait the whole game... Thankfully i found i way to get hat off your mind... When u die u just press the button above tab (aka "`" button) and type in the terminal : bot_kill ........ Have FUN! (totally recommended) | A modified version of CS 1.6 with a single-player campaign. The bots are smarter, but overall, the game didn’t bring significant changes. Feels more like an experiment rather than a true sequel. | «Counter-Strike: Condition Zero» - это однопользовательская версия популярной многопользовательской игры Counter-Strike, которая сильно удивила и порадовала в своё время.

В игре представлен одиночный режим, состоящий из шести миссий на разных картах. Каждая миссия имеет свои цели и задачи с линейным геймплеем, а искусственный интеллект ботов оставляет желать лучшего.

Графика в игре достаточно хорошая для своего времени, но не сравнится с современными играми (ясен пень, скажете вы). Звуковое оформление выполнено на высоком уровне, с реалистичными звуками оружия и окружения. Те, кто не играл ранее будут испытывать боль от визуала, но истинные олдфаги пустят слезу с ностальгией.

Condition Zero включает в себя мультиплеерный режим, который остался без изменений по сравнению с оригинальной Counter-Strike. По сути непонятно зачем он тут нужен, если для этого есть оригинальная мультиплеерная часть.  

«Counter-Strike: Condition Zero» - это игра с интересным сюжетом и геймплеем, но устаревшей графикой и искусственным интеллектом. Она подойдёт любителям серии Counter-Strike и тем, кто хочет окунуться в атмосферу игры и того времени. | Я застал то время, когда в компьютерных клубах рубились в кс, но condition zero не была так популярна, как классическая. Честно признаюсь, я в то время не играл в эту игру так часто, как играю сейчас.
Да, что еще интересно, за последние 2 года я проехал на велосипеде раз в 5 больше, чем за всю предыдущую жизнь) | 反恐精英：零点行动，经典的CS系列，提供了多个单人关卡可以游玩，虽然AI有些弱智，不过20多年前的游戏，还是值得收藏一下的

Esta es una experiencia para la que no tenía expectativas demasiado elevadas, y quizás por eso me ha acabado sorprendiendo. 

La historia es prácticamente nula, pero en los distintos niveles existe la suficiente variedad entre escenarios y armas y herramientas utilizadas como para que no se me haga aburrido en ninguna de las horas que me ha durado el juego, las cuales, me han sorprendido debido a su buena cantidad. Pensaba que iba a ser un juego bastante más corto.

El gunplay es básicamente el del Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, lo que de base ya lo hace mejor si lo comparamos a juegos como el primer Half Life.

Sin mucho más que comentar, solo decir que es un juego que está bien. Eso sí, me he encontrado con unos cuantos bugs que casi me impiden avanzar a la hora de tener que empujar cajas, y he sufrido dos crasheos. | Das Game ist GOLD!!
Ich liebe dieses Spiel. 

Ist zwar alt, aber für Nostalgie- Fans ein Muss. Besonders für Gamer, die Anfang der 2000er schon gespielt haben und gerne Mods vom 1. Half- Life spielen. Das Gameplay ist simpel aber durch viele Skript- Sequenzen ansehnlich unterhaltsam. Es ist erstaunlich, was die Entwickler aus der alten HL- Engine alles herausholen konnten. Das bewegt sich fast auf dem Niveau vom Paranoia- Mod (meiner Meinung nach der schönste für HL1- Engine). Die Synchronisation auf Deutsch ist zwar... aber das verzeihe ich allemal. | Сильно недооценённая игра. Очень сильно. Миссии интересные, куча новых механик и сюжет. Для кого-то сюжет покажется плохой затеей, а для меня - новое и хорошее направление! Всем добра! | A fun vintage fps game that is in my opinion really quite well put together, especially for it's time. | 长官自己引爆核电站那里还挺感动的，就是剧情有点难啊

Rating: 10/10

Released in 2005, Day of Defeat: Source is a masterpiece of tactical, team-based combat, offering players an incredibly immersive World War II experience. Powered by the Source engine, the game manages to blend historical authenticity with thrilling action, all while delivering highly strategic, competitive gameplay. Even years after its release, it still holds up as one of the best multiplayer shooters out there. Here’s why Day of Defeat: Source earns a perfect 10/10 rating.

Why Day of Defeat: Source Is a Must-Play
💥 Authentic WWII Combat
Day of Defeat: Source stands out by offering a truly authentic World War II experience without sacrificing fun gameplay. The game features historical maps that take players across iconic battlegrounds in Europe, such as the Normandy beaches and the streets of Stalingrad. The sound design, including gunfire, explosions, and ambient battle noises, creates an incredibly immersive atmosphere that makes you feel like you're truly on the frontlines.

🔫 Varied and Balanced Classes
The game offers a wide range of playable classes, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. From the rifleman to the machine gunner and the sniper, each role adds depth and tactical complexity to the game. The classes are perfectly balanced, ensuring no single class is overpowered, and teamwork is essential for success. Whether you prefer to lead the charge or provide supporting fire, there's a class for everyone.

🎮 Strategic, Team-Oriented Gameplay
At the heart of Day of Defeat: Source is its team-based objective gameplay. Unlike many fast-paced shooters, success isn’t determined by your individual skill, but rather by how well you work with your teammates. Objectives such as capturing points or defending strategic locations encourage coordinated team efforts, making every match feel dynamic and rewarding. This focus on teamwork sets the game apart from others in the genre.

⚔️ Smooth and Engaging Combat
The combat mechanics in Day of Defeat: Source are smooth and engaging, with a focus on accuracy, strategy, and timing. The game’s shooting mechanics are satisfying, and the different weapon types require careful control, whether it’s the bolt-action rifles or the automatic submachine guns. The Source engine brings this all to life with excellent physics, realistic recoil, and fluid animations, creating a satisfying shooting experience.

🌍 Classic Maps and Modding Community
Maps such as Avalanche, Dawnville, and Kalt remain fan favorites for their brilliant design, balance, and flow. These maps are also mod-friendly, encouraging players to create custom content, expanding the game’s replay value. The active community has contributed to the longevity of Day of Defeat: Source, with fan-made maps, mods, and servers providing new ways to enjoy the game even years after its release.

What Makes It a 10/10
Day of Defeat: Source doesn’t just rely on nostalgia; it holds up as a compelling and timeless shooter. The blend of historical accuracy, strategic depth, and intense teamwork creates a gaming experience that is both challenging and rewarding. While its visual style might feel dated by today’s standards, the focus on gameplay mechanics and team collaboration makes it feel as fresh and exciting as when it first released. It’s the kind of game that stands the test of time, offering unmatched fun and depth.

If you’re looking for a WWII shooter that’s all about tactics and teamwork, Day of Defeat: Source is a must-play. Whether you’re a newcomer to the series or a long-time fan, the experience it offers remains second to none. 10/10, this game remains an all-time favorite for those who love tactical shooters. | I have a lot more in this game than 173 hours, trust me. I started playing DoD v1.3 way back when, and naturally progressed to Source for my Friday evening de-stress. Though it is just an off-brand Quake and obscure Valve title with only a handful of real people playing, Deathmatch Classic is addictive and as basic as an arena shooter can be. Start each match with weak weapons, run around the map to find better weapons, and kill your opponents with said weapons. 

Collect power-ups like armor, health kits, temporary high damage/invulnerability orbs, and sometimes a bio suit for swimming thru lava briefly. You can also telefrag if you get the timing right. Just don't get fragged yourself. That's all to the gameplay loop.

No UAVs online, no care packages, no level prestige, and not a single microtransaction in sight. Just every man for himself living (and dying repeatedly) in the moment. | There are no characters that get naked!

Other than that, pretty good game, underrated as hell. | 6/10

[h2]Half-Life: Opposing Force — гра для терплячих або відчайдушних[/h2]

Це той випадок, коли хочеться поставити лайк за ідею, але відчуття після проходження змішані. Початок, як завжди у цій серії, інтригує: спокійно, атмосферно, все налаштовує на цікаву історію. Але далі — привіт, Рембо в світі Half-Life. Купа нових монстрів? Круто! Купа нового озброєння? Ще краще! Але от баланс явно пішов у відпустку. Монстри оверсильні, навіть на легкій складності ти вмираєш від кількох пострілів. Патронів, як завжди, не вистачає, навіть при великій кількості зброї.

Під кінець гри взагалі починається чистий хаос. Бігаєш із 8 HP, аптечки — дефіцит, кожен кут — потенційна смерть. А якщо цього мало, то ще й баги додають спецій. Мій Шепард іноді просто вирішував "закопатися" в землю і відмовлявся йти далі.

Закінчити проходження було справжнім полегшенням. Але все ж таки, попри всі мінуси, гра має свої моменти: ті ж нові монстри й зброя додають різноманіття, а ідея поглянути на світ очима військового дійсно цікава. Просто треба бути готовим до нервового випробування. | Half-Life: Opposing Force is the third game in the series and could be considered a full blown sequel to it or simply an add-on. Opposing Force was a short and sweet game just like its counterpart Blue Shift and was a new character as well to play as. On this game you were playing as the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit soldiers who were sent to scrub the facility clean and cover up everything.

It was quite cool playing as this faction and getting to see the perspective from there eyes. Similarly to the other games you aim was to escape as well and help take as many men as you could. There was an introduction of some new weapons and new puzzles to tackle plus boss fights. 

The one thing i didn't like about Opposing Force was that the character wasn't given a proper story or ending to it. He only appeared in this game alone and so far there has been no new content with him at all. His character hasn't been worked on anymore neither has he been given a sequel to play through which is a shame.

I would recommend playing through the game and seeing the perspective of another character who's on the enemies side. Its interesting to see his transition from enemy to survivor and watch as he tries to redeem himself. | This game is a mixed bag for me and that's why I'm not recommending it.

I enjoyed the game about 50% of the time and didn't enjoy it the other 50%.

Basically, this game pisses me too often to recommend it. Kinda like Half Life 1. There are parts where I'm having fun, but it often only takes a few minutes for me to be annoyed by the next thing to face. It's constantly like that for the whole game.

The main issue for me really is that most of the strong enemies are just not fun to fight. Their AI is not particularly good and they're just annoying to deal with. If I compare the enemies' AI to the enemies' AI in Halo 1 for example, Halo has amazing AI and it's fun to play against it. That's the main reason why the Halo campaigns are so replayable. That's also why playing through Opposition Force and Half-Life 1 is kinda painful for me.

Also, often, the weapons that are strong and or very powerful have limited amounts of ammo, so you have to use cheap tricks like saving/loading multiple times or making an enemy place itself at the edge of a wall so it stays there and tries to shoot towards you, but fails to because their projectiles just hit the wall and can't reach you. Once again, if I compare what I just described to Halo 1... In Halo, generally, that is not something that will happen. For one, there is a checkpoint system that works pretty well and you'll usually have the tools you need to deal with enemies. But the main thing really is that Halo 1 is fun to play while Half-Life Opposing Force is annoying about 50% of the time.

More thoughts :

Why is the game designed in a way where we have to crouch jump (and so often)? 

A lot of unavoidable damage when doing the platforming parts. Same thing for ladders.

First 90 minutes not great. I often have to check a walkthrough because I either don't know what to do or how to solve a specific puzzle.

Game is not getting that much better after?

More unavoidable damage (this time from using the movable platform).

Overall, I didn't like the first half that much, but I enjoyed the 2nd half more.

My playthrough is often interrupted when I have to check a walkthrough because IDK what I'm supposed to do next.

*** I think I spent 1 just on hour saving and loading, which is about 15-20% of my playtime... | Its more Half Life 1. This time there's more Black Ops and explosives. Make sure to disable original models in the content settings tab to use that sweet M16. |    grafikler ve oynanış oyunların en önemli mihenk taşıdır. fakat bu aralar çıkan oyunlar sadece grafikten, görünüşten ibaretken bir de bunu fahiş fiyata satıyorlar. aldıktan sonra çoğunlukla istediğimiz keyfi alamıyor ve kısa süre sonra bırakıyoruz.
   halbuki kitaplığın raflarında tozlanmış, çoğu insanın unuttuğu efsaneler var. evet opposing force da bunlardan biri. hl serisinin yan hikayesi olan bu oyun bir hecu askeri olan adrian shephard'ın başından geçiyor. fakat bilgisayarın başına oturduğunuzda adrian shephard siz oluyor ve aksiyonu damarlarınıza kadar hissediyorsunuz. 
   gerçekten emek verilmiş bir oyun olduğunu, paranızı çalmak yerine gönlünüzü çalmak istediklerini anlıyorsunuz. bu sebeple valve ve gearbox'a teşekkür ediyor, sizin de oynamanızı tavsiye ediyorum.

да. очень даже.

[h2]Half-Life: легенда, яка поділила геймінг на до і після[/h2]

Якщо чесно, після проходження першої Half-Life враження залишилися змішаними. Спочатку гра здалася "душною" — особливо ближче до фіналу, коли тебе закидають у той злощасний Зен. Але, що дивно, вже за день я почав згадувати моменти проходження з ностальгічним теплом. Є в цій грі той особливий вайб кінця 90-х, коли світ здавався спокійним, а дитинство — безтурботним.

Це було моє перше повноцінне проходження. У дитинстві я лише грав уривками, тому повернення до цієї класики стало свіжим досвідом. І, мушу визнати, що для людини, яка хоче відчути саме той "чистий" експіріенс, як задумували розробники, краще грати в оригінал. Але... графіка, механіки та загальний темп гри зараз виглядають дуже застарілими. Half-Life перевірку часом, на мою скромну думку, не пройшла. Якщо ви вперше знайомитесь із серією, Black Mesa — значно комфортніший варіант.

Попри все, не можна недооцінювати значення цієї гри. Саме завдяки їй ми отримали Counter-Strike, ігрову фізику нового рівня та величезний вплив на весь індустріальний ландшафт. Тому Half-Life — це легенда, якій важко поставити щось інше, окрім "лайка". Вона дала початок епосі, навіть якщо зараз її часи трохи позаду. | [hr][/hr]

Half-Life: Blue Shift — це невеличкий, але дуже атмосферний шматок історії світу Half-Life. Доповнення захоплює своєю камерною подачею та унікальним поглядом на події через очі Барні Калхуна — охоронця, який завжди був десь у тіні Гордона Фрімена, але цього разу опиняється в центрі подій.

Так, гра коротенька, але це навіть на краще. Вона не встигає "душити" чи перевантажувати, залишаючи після себе приємне враження. Цікаві загадки чергуються з перестрілками в ідеальному балансі, а сюжет — нехай і простий — тримає увагу до кінця. Особливо круто спостерігати за тим, як цей світ розкривається з іншого ракурсу.

Мабуть, саме ця камерність і дозволяє повністю зануритися в атмосферу занепаду комплексу "Чорна Меза". Blue Shift чудово нагадує, що навіть поза глобальними катастрофами та пригодами Фрімена, у цьому всесвіті вистачає історій, які заслуговують на увагу. | Half-Life: Blue Shift continues through the first game of Half-Life but from new areas of the game and a entirely new perspective of a completely new character. In this sequel or add-on depending on your perspective you play through the game as a security guard of the facility the game is based in. Once again your role in the game is to fight through areas of the facility and escape like the first game.

The game is more short and sweet than the first one and why some may consider it a mere add-on compared to a full sequel. The game comes along with a variety of puzzles and some require a bit of back and forth to complete them depending how long they are and what for in the game.

Because its short and sweet there really isn't much to say about it other than it follows the same style and gameplay as the first Half-Life. The good thing about this game is the character in it comes back in the sequel for Half-Life 2 and his story isn't wasted here at all. 

I would still recommend this game to anyone who wants to try it out or likes the first game and wants more content or other characters points of view as well. | 7/10 a very fun way to make a half life spin off, very bite sized, but ultimately nothing too special in its own right. | классное дополнение к сюжету но цена ... игра маленькая по содержанию 3 часа сюжетка но я ее купил по скедке и теперь это очень хорошая игра(: | Half-Life: Blue Shift Review
Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

“Back to Black Mesa, this time with a new perspective.” Half-Life: Blue Shift takes players back to the iconic Black Mesa Research Facility, placing you in the boots of Barney Calhoun, a humble security guard caught in the chaos of the resonance cascade. While it’s a shorter and simpler experience compared to the main game, Blue Shift offers a fresh perspective on the events of Half-Life and remains a solid expansion for fans of the series.

Story and Setting
In Blue Shift, you play as Barney Calhoun, a security guard who’s just trying to get through his shift when disaster strikes. As Black Mesa descends into chaos, your goal is survival and escape.

The story adds new layers to the Half-Life universe, showing what life was like for the "everyman" during the alien invasion. While it doesn’t reach the narrative depth of Half-Life or Opposing Force, it provides a grounded, relatable perspective. Fans of the series will enjoy revisiting Black Mesa and spotting connections to Gordon Freeman’s journey.

Gameplay
The gameplay in Blue Shift sticks closely to the formula of the original Half-Life. You’ll navigate familiar environments, fight alien creatures and military forces, and solve puzzles to progress.

Where Blue Shift differs is in its simplicity. The campaign is shorter, the puzzles are more straightforward, and there are fewer weapons and enemy types compared to other Half-Life titles. While this makes the game more approachable, some players may find it lacking in variety.

One notable addition is the High-Definition Pack, which updates the character and weapon models for Blue Shift and the original Half-Life. It’s a nice bonus that gives the game a fresh coat of paint for players revisiting the series.

Graphics and Performance
As with the original Half-Life, the visuals in Blue Shift have aged, but the iconic art direction and atmospheric level design still hold up. The High-Definition Pack significantly improves the look of the game, making it the definitive way to experience Blue Shift.

Performance is rock-solid on modern systems, and the game’s compact design ensures it runs smoothly even on older hardware.

Length and Replayability
Blue Shift is a much shorter experience than Half-Life, with a campaign that can be completed in about 3-5 hours. While its brevity makes it less substantial than other expansions like Opposing Force, it’s still a satisfying journey for fans looking for more time in Black Mesa. However, the lack of new weapons, mechanics, or enemies may limit its replay value.

Final Thoughts
Half-Life: Blue Shift is a worthwhile expansion that offers a nostalgic return to Black Mesa with a unique perspective. While it doesn’t innovate or expand on the Half-Life formula as much as other entries, it’s still an enjoyable experience for fans of the series.

Pros:

Offers a fresh perspective on the events of Half-Life
Solid gameplay that stays true to the original
High-Definition Pack is a great addition
Short and accessible for newcomers
Cons:

Lacks new mechanics, weapons, or enemies
Short campaign with limited replay value
Simplistic compared to Opposing Force
If you’re a fan of Half-Life and want another reason to explore Black Mesa, Blue Shift is a great addition to your library. It may be shorter and less complex, but it’s a fun trip back to one of gaming’s most iconic settings.

A monumental game in my gaming career, Half-Life 2 was that defining experience that made me realise I was in for something next level. For the first time i picked it up on The Orange Box in 2008, and from the moment I booted it up, I knew I was in for a wild ride. It wasn’t just a game—it was an event. The environments were absolutely massive, the atmosphere was unreal, and the soundtrack? Edgy as hell. Every moment felt like a cinematic journey.

In Half-Life 2, you play as Gordon Freeman, arguably one of the most reluctant action heroes in gaming. You awaken from stasis, burdened with the trauma of the previous game, and are immediately thrust into action as the figurehead of an uprising. This isn’t a simple revolution—it’s a battle against a multiversal alien threat, shrouded in dystopian themes and orchestrated by secretive organizations manipulating events behind the scenes.

Set in a world dominated by the Combine, an alien regime that combines interdimensional authoritarianism with advanced technology, you must navigate a planet under their control. Armed with little more than a crowbar and your signature nonverbalism, Gordon becomes the key figure in the resistance. As you progress, you'll engage in intense combat, solve puzzles, explore diverse environments, and uncover the unsettling truth that nothing in this world is as it seems.

And let’s talk about The G-Man—a mysterious, interdimensional CIA glowman who pops up like a bad dream and probably controls the entire charade like a cosmic puppeteer. Is he good? Is he bad? Is he just playing the long game? Who knows, but he’s definitely got his hand in everything, watching Gordon like a hawk, pulling strings like an invisible god. 

You’d think it’s just a sci-fi conspiracy, but after a while, you start questioning if anyone really knows what the hell is going on. Does G-Man even have a purpose, or is he just a cosmic observer who gets his kicks out of watching a man with a crowbar take on the end of the world?

The game’s narrative feels like a giant puzzle, and each step forward opens up even more questions, all while you’re tearing through enemy lines, trying to get answers. And the best part? It’s not all about combat—there are puzzles to solve, mysteries to uncover, and a sense of isolation that keeps you on edge, constantly wondering who or what will show up next. The pacing is incredible, making you feel like you’re a tiny piece of something far larger, with consequences that span across dimensions.

为什么这个滑梯不能上去，这个跷跷板是可以玩的，原来这里也有小巧思，这里的电线是视觉引导物，怎样保持一个休闲和紧张的平衡，能在游戏里亲自上手跟看GDC或者工具箱是完全不一样的体验，我会贪婪地希望每一个我喜欢的游戏都添加开发者评论。 | "Half-Life 2" is one of the most influential and groundbreaking first-person shooters ever made. Released in 2004 by Valve, it redefined what players could expect from a video game in terms of both storytelling and gameplay. The game’s narrative is immersive, unfolding without traditional cutscenes, which allows the player to feel like they are truly part of the story. The protagonist, Gordon Freeman, is a silent hero who navigates through a dystopian world filled with alien invaders and oppressive human forces. This unique approach to storytelling pulls the player into the game’s world, making every action feel meaningful.

The physics engine in "Half-Life 2" was revolutionary for its time. The way objects interact with the environment feels natural and intuitive, and it became a major part of the gameplay. From solving puzzles using physics to creatively using the environment as a weapon, it was an innovation that influenced many games that followed. The gravity gun, which allows players to manipulate objects in real-time, is still one of the most memorable and fun weapons in gaming history.

The level design in "Half-Life 2" is another standout feature. The game introduces players to varied environments, from the dark, industrial city of City 17 to the eerie, remote marshlands. Each location feels carefully crafted, with attention to detail that makes the world feel alive. The pacing is also masterful, alternating between moments of intense combat and slower, atmospheric sequences that allow the player to soak in the environment and story.

The AI in "Half-Life 2" was also ahead of its time. Enemies behave intelligently, using cover, working together, and reacting to the player’s actions in a way that makes combat more dynamic and challenging. The enemy variety, from the terrifying Combine soldiers to the creepy headcrabs, keeps the gameplay fresh and engaging. The interactions with NPCs and the world around you help build a sense of tension and immersion, keeping you on edge throughout the experience.

The game's soundtrack, composed by Kelly Bailey, perfectly complements the atmosphere, using subtle but effective music to enhance both the action and the quieter moments. The sound design is top-notch, with ambient sounds adding to the immersion, whether you're in a busy city street or exploring a deserted warehouse.

Ultimately, "Half-Life 2" is a masterpiece that still holds up to this day. Its innovative gameplay, storytelling, and technical achievements make it a game that set a new standard for the industry. It’s a game that’s not just fun to play, but one that’s easy to appreciate for the way it shaped the future of video games. Even though it’s been years since its release, "Half-Life 2" remains a classic that continues to inspire both players and developers alike.

Half-Life: Deathmatch: Source is a multiplayer first-person shooter developed by Valve. It is a remake of the classic Half-Life deathmatch mode, utilizing the Source engine. The game combines the fast-paced action of traditional deathmatch with updated graphics and more fluid movement mechanics. While it successfully brings new life to the original concept, some mechanical issues and a niche player base prevent it from being as popular as its predecessors.

What Works Well?
🎮 Classic Deathmatch Gameplay
The core of Half-Life: Deathmatch is its tight, fast-paced combat. It stays true to the original deathmatch mode, offering classic weapons, high-speed action, and simple, enjoyable mechanics. The formula remains as fun today as it was when first introduced.

🌆 Updated Graphics with Source Engine
The move to the Source engine has significantly improved the visuals compared to the original. The lighting, textures, and models are much sharper, breathing new life into the iconic Half-Life universe. The environments feel more immersive, and physics interactions are more dynamic.

🔫 Familiar Weapon Set
Players have access to a variety of classic weapons from the Half-Life series, including the crowbar, shotgun, and crossbow, all of which perform as expected. Each weapon has its own strategic value, and they all function well within the confines of the deathmatch setting.

🛠️ Modding Support and Custom Servers
As with other Source engine games, Deathmatch: Source allows for a robust modding community. Players can easily find custom servers and user-created content, from new maps to modified gameplay modes, keeping the experience fresh.

What Could Be Better?
❌ Limited Popularity and Player Base
Despite its solid foundation, Half-Life: Deathmatch: Source suffers from a relatively small player base. As newer games in the genre continue to dominate, it can be difficult to find active matches, especially in more niche servers.

❌ Physics Can Feel Clunky
While the Source engine improved many aspects of the game, some of the physics—especially in terms of movement—can feel a little awkward compared to modern shooters. The transition to 3D space feels a bit more restrictive than anticipated, particularly when compared to the fluidity of more modern games.

❌ No Significant Gameplay Innovation
While the updated graphics and better physics are great, Deathmatch: Source doesn't introduce any major changes to the original formula. It feels more like a polished port rather than a revolutionary step forward for the genre. Players expecting something drastically new may be disappointed.

❌ Lack of Meaningful Progression
Like many classic deathmatch games, there’s a lack of meaningful progression or any form of unlockable content. While this keeps the focus on pure skill-based play, some players may miss the more modern systems that reward long-term engagement.

Conclusion
Half-Life: Deathmatch: Source is a solid multiplayer shooter for fans of the classic Half-Life experience. Its updated visuals and iconic weapons deliver the fun, high-speed action that fans love, but its small player base and lack of major innovation hold it back from achieving greater popularity. If you’re looking for nostalgic deathmatch action or enjoy modding, it’s a great choice, but don’t expect a revolutionary experience.

Counter-Strike: Source (CS: Source) is the definitive version of one of the most iconic tactical shooters ever created. Built on the Source engine, it brought stunning graphics, refined mechanics, and an immersive experience that kept players engaged for years. It improved upon its predecessor, Counter-Strike 1.6, and laid the foundation for future games in the series, including Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. Here's why CS: Source remains a perfect 10/10 for fans of competitive gaming.

Why It’s a Must-Play
🔫 Precise Gunplay
At the core of CS: Source is its tight and rewarding gun mechanics. Every weapon in the game feels unique, with its own recoil patterns and handling characteristics. This precision-driven combat is one of the key factors that makes CS: Source such a compelling competitive experience. From the M4A4's controlled spray to the AWP's one-shot kills, every engagement requires skill and accuracy.

🌍 Map Design & Tactical Depth
The iconic maps like Dust 2, Inferno, and Nuke are where the game shines brightest. Each map is meticulously designed to offer a balance of tactical positions, choke points, and strategic opportunities. Whether you're defending bomb sites or pushing through tight corridors, the map design fosters deep teamwork and careful planning.

💥 Gameplay Mechanics
CS: Source features smooth, fluid movement, making it easy to peek around corners, hold angles, and strafe while shooting. The buy system gives players the freedom to choose their preferred weapons and gear, while round-based gameplay forces teams to be efficient with their resources and execute well-planned strategies.

🎮 Vibrant Community & Modding Support
The modding community for CS: Source has been incredibly active, creating a wealth of custom content from maps to skins to even entirely new game modes. This extends the life of the game by offering nearly endless ways to enjoy the experience. The server browser lets players dive into unique community-run servers, making every session feel fresh and exciting.

🎨 Improved Visuals
Powered by the Source engine, CS: Source delivered a massive graphical leap from its predecessors, offering realistic lighting, better textures, and advanced physics. These improvements gave the game a more immersive and polished feel, while the physics engine introduced interactive objects and destructible environments, adding a layer of depth to gameplay.

What Makes It a 10/10
CS: Source isn’t just a game; it’s a tactical masterpiece that’s stood the test of time. Its emphasis on team coordination, strategy, and individual skill is unmatched. Whether playing with friends or random players, the experience fosters a strong sense of community and competition, making each match feel meaningful. The team-based objectives – like bomb planting/defusal – combined with tight, tactical combat is a dynamic experience that few shooters can replicate.

The longevity of CS: Source is a testament to how well it was designed. While newer titles in the series (like Counter-Strike: Global Offensive) have taken inspiration from it, the smoothness of the gameplay, iconic maps, and endless customization options keep it relevant in the competitive FPS scene.

If you’re a fan of shooters and haven’t experienced CS: Source, you’re missing out on one of the most influential and well-rounded tactical shooters ever made. It’s a game that offers both depth and accessibility, making it suitable for casual players, yet still offering enough challenge for the competitive elite. CS: Source is a timeless classic—pure, competitive, and still as enjoyable today as it was when it first released. | The switch to the Source engine brought improved graphics and physics, but the gameplay changed slightly. Fans of 1.6 were divided, but the game still stands as a solid classic shooter. | Çoğu oyuncu sevmez ama bana göre cs1.6 dan 2 gömlek üst bir oyundur

Half-Life: Source, released in 2004 by Valve, is an enhanced version of the original 1998 masterpiece, running on the Source engine. While it aimed to improve the visuals, physics, and water effects, it failed to live up to expectations, making it a divisive version among fans.

Despite still delivering the legendary Half-Life experience, this remaster feels more like a rushed port than a true upgrade.

What Works Well?
🧪 Same Brilliant Gameplay as Half-Life
At its core, Half-Life: Source is still Half-Life—one of the most influential FPS games ever made. The engaging story, immersive atmosphere, and smart enemy AI remain intact, making this version playable and enjoyable.

🌊 Improved Water Effects and Physics
The transition to the Source engine brings better physics (thanks to Havok) and improved water reflections, which make certain areas look more modern compared to the 1998 original.

🖥️ Smoother Performance and Native Support
Half-Life: Source runs natively on modern systems, avoiding the compatibility issues that can arise with the original GoldSrc version. Higher resolutions and widescreen support are also a plus.

The Problems with Half-Life: Source
❌ Barely Any Real Graphical Upgrade
Despite running on Source, most textures, models, and lighting effects remain unchanged from 1998. This makes it feel less like a true remaster and more like a basic port with minimal effort.

❌ Buggy AI and Broken Scripted Sequences
Some of Half-Life’s iconic scripted moments don’t work properly in Half-Life: Source, breaking immersion. Enemies and NPCs sometimes behave worse than in the original, which is unacceptable for an "improved" version.

❌ No High-Definition (HD) Model Pack
Unlike Half-Life’s official 1999 update, which introduced better character and weapon models, Half-Life: Source lacks these HD assets—making it feel graphically inferior to an older update of the game.

❌ Black Mesa Exists
If you want to experience Half-Life with Source engine upgrades, Black Mesa (a fan-made, Valve-approved remake) is a far superior alternative with fully reworked graphics, animations, and improved gameplay mechanics.

Conclusion
Half-Life: Source is not a bad way to play Half-Life, but it's also not the best. If you want the original experience, the GoldSrc version is more authentic. If you want a true Source engine remake, Black Mesa is the better choice.

There are few games that manage to transcend their medium, leaving a lasting impact on the players who experience them. Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines is one of those rare gems—an immersive, darkly compelling RPG that takes you deep into a world of nightmarish intrigue, complex morality, and unforgettable characters. Released in 2004, it may have been ahead of its time, but it has since become a beloved classic, and for good reason. This is a game that not only captures the spirit of its source material but builds a world so rich, so nuanced, that it feels alive.

A World of Shadows and Secrets
From the moment you step into the shoes of a freshly turned vampire, Bloodlines introduces you to a world that is both beautifully sinister and intricately detailed. Set in modern-day Los Angeles, the game weaves a dark tale of political intrigue, personal conflict, and supernatural terror. The rich lore of the Vampire: The Masquerade tabletop RPG is brought to life in an almost seamless way, with each faction of vampires—whether it's the stoic Ventrue, the cunning Malkavians, or the fiery Brujah—adding layers of complexity to the story. This is a world where nothing is ever simple, and where every decision you make carries weight.

The setting itself, the urban sprawl of LA, is a masterwork of gothic atmosphere. The game’s locations—be it the seedy alleyways of Santa Monica or the terrifying depths of the haunted asylum—are meticulously crafted, with a level of detail that makes every corner feel like it holds a secret. You’re not just moving through a city; you’re navigating a sprawling, living ecosystem of power struggles and hidden threats.

Immersive Role-Playing Like No Other
What truly sets Bloodlines apart from other RPGs is its depth of character interaction and role-playing opportunities. The game is all about choice—and not just in how you approach combat or quests, but in how you choose to live your life as a vampire. Will you uphold the delicate balance of the Masquerade, hiding your true nature from humanity, or will you embrace your monstrous side and sow chaos? These choices aren’t just for show; they impact the way you’re treated by the various factions, your relationships with other characters, and even the game’s ending. There are no easy answers here, and that’s what makes it so compelling.

The character creation system is robust, allowing you to craft a vampire that fits your playstyle. You can invest in a variety of abilities, from brutal physical combat to stealthy persuasion and hacking skills. The power of your clan also plays a significant role in how you approach different challenges, and the supernatural abilities you gain as a vampire offer a variety of ways to approach problems. Whether you want to manipulate minds, become a fearsome force in combat, or sneak past enemies unnoticed, Bloodlines gives you the freedom to build your vampire exactly how you envision them.

A Story That Binds You
But it’s not just the gameplay that shines—it’s the narrative. Bloodlines offers a gripping, multi-layered story that is filled with moral ambiguity, unforgettable characters, and moments of genuine emotional weight. Whether you're trying to navigate the political machinations of the vampire factions or diving into a personal quest that challenges your own morals, the plot is constantly shifting and evolving. The main story is full of twists and turns, but it’s the side stories—the personal journeys of the NPCs—that really elevate the game. These characters are deeply written and full of life, each with their own motivations, quirks, and tragic backstories.

The voice acting is phenomenal, bringing every character to life with nuances and emotions that make them feel real. Whether you’re talking to a wise old vampire or a desperate fledgling, the dialogue is always engaging and never feels forced. The writing, sharp and often darkly humorous, helps bring out the personality of every character you encounter, from the charming yet treacherous LaCroix to the lovable, eccentric hacker, Jeanette.

Combat and Gameplay Mechanics
The combat system in Bloodlines is a bit divisive, but it offers a unique approach to RPG combat. While the shooting mechanics can feel clunky at times, the game’s strength lies in its flexibility. You can choose to avoid combat altogether, relying on your social skills to navigate tense situations or solve problems through dialogue and subterfuge. But when the fighting does come, the visceral action makes you feel the power of being a vampire, whether you’re tearing through enemies with claws or using dark blood magic to overwhelm your foes.

The game also offers a range of side quests that are surprisingly rich in content, giving you more than just a diversion from the main story. Whether you’re helping a fellow vampire find their lost item or delving into a creepy mystery, these quests help flesh out the world and deepen your immersion.

A Timeless Classic
Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines is a game that continues to stand the test of time. Despite its technical issues at launch—many of which were patched over the years—the story, world-building, and complex characters remain as captivating as ever. This is a game that rewards patience, allowing you to sink hours into its rich narrative and immersive world. It’s a rare gem that doesn't just entertain, but challenges you, makes you think, and makes you feel the weight of every choice.

In a gaming landscape often dominated by shallow experiences, Bloodlines is a deep, meaningful RPG that still feels like a living, breathing world full of possibilities. It’s a game that hooks you with its dark allure and doesn’t let go. If you haven’t experienced Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines yet, you owe it to yourself to dive into this haunting, unforgettable adventure.

In short: an essential masterpiece, where darkness and storytelling converge into something truly special. | The most sheer aura per square-meter ever put into an rpg. Already craving for something with a similar feel but there really just isn't, shame the sequel seems to be going downhill. 

Btw if you love the setting as much as i did go check out some of the other World Of Darkness stuff (Mage is a personal fav) and delve into the lore, you're in for helluva good time. | О старый играх с культовым статусом говорить сложно, в особенности в той ситуации, когда в самом популярном онлайн-магазине в лице Стима продается едва играбельная версия сабжа, которую, по факту, рекомендовать не стоит, хотя бы по причине того, что в Гоге вам предложат купить то же самое, но с фанатским патчем (хоть и базовым) из коробки и раза в три дешевле (если учитывая скидки на текущий момент). Но окей, я буду соблюдать Маскарад вместе с остальными старперами тут, нарисую "синий" отзыв и скажу то, что говорят все: [u][b]"Таких игр сейчас не делают"[/b][/u].

Иронично, что дотянулся я до игры недавно: по факту, уже после знакомства с НРИ-оригиналом, я накатил базовый патч, проглотил эту вкусняшку за Тореадора, потом еще одну порцию с расширенным за Малкавиана, облизал ложечку и попросил добавки, и все потому, что соус из фанатской поддержки все делает едой, не иначе. И сижу с невыразимой тоской на физиономии, ведь "раньше было лучше".

Помимо технического состояния, поругать игру есть за что. Но есть одно "но": такую игру даже близко днем с огнем не сыщешь, особенно на крупнобюджетной сцене. Это просто шедеврище, с уютными небольшими локациями, уймой запоминающихся персонажей и квестов, необычной механикой развития персонажа и многими другими прелестями и, как ни банально, жирной, стекающей с экрана атмосферой. А музыка-то какая, дорогие каиниты! В клубе Asp Hole можно часами сидеть, слушая один и тот же трек Tiamat. Отдельная конфетка - общая глубина некоторых аспектов игры; так, выбор клана буквально может целиком поменять примерно все ощущение от процесса. Повторю уже знакомую многим рекомендацию: в первый раз играйте кем угодно, КРОМЕ Малка, чтобы во второй раз пойти именно за него. Под Малкавиана переписаны все диалоги в игре, но знаете, что самое классное? Это крайне редкий опыт выбора между "притворяться пришибленным" и "быть пришибленным". И это просто восхитительно.  

Игра - это здоровский трип в начало нулевых, когда мы сами были мелкотой, и наши родители старательно соблюдали свой Маскарад, чтобы не показывать нам мрачные элементы тогдашней жизни, из-за чего не самые спокойные и благополучные времена овеяны ностальгией; и вот, мы сами теперь взрослые, и теперь нам тоже придется придерживаться этого Маскарада - уже для наших младших, детей, племянников и прочих, чтобы и они вошли в свой взрослый возраст с теплыми воспоминаниями о прошлом... А мы будем запускать всякое офигенное старье и недовольно ворчать на современные игры.

P.s. Обязательный дисклеймер: ОТДЕЛЬНО ОТМЕЧУ - стимовская версия сломана целиком и полностью. Если вы все же решитесь брать ее тут [strike]Б-г вам судья[/strike] - готовьтесь идти в руководства за ссылками на патчи. А еще можете сверху навернуть перевод и русскую озвучку (довольно приличную, btw). | This game is absolutely amazing. The story is great, the voice acting is great, the dialogue is great, the atmosphere is great... Only the combat requires some getting used to and you can definitely not ignore combat especially towards the later half of the game. Overall this game is a timeless piece of art, and once you meet it on it's own terms you'll fall in love with it too. 
(still definitely get the unoffical patch though) | Trust me and download the unofficial patch before starting a save, it could save you hours of gameplay being lost like me.

Only negative thing I could say is that, obviously, the game's old as hell. So, it does need some help to run on modern systems. Game Name: The Witcher: Enhanced Edition Director's Cut
Reviews:
Este jogo é incrível, mas não é para todos, ele possui uma complexidade tática única, o que vai faz muita gente achar ele difícil quando na verdade se você usar a estratégia certa ele fica relativamente fácil.

[b]Jogue este o jogo se você:[/b]
[list]
[*] Gosta de Leitura.
[*] Gosta de RPG.
[*] Gosta de explorar.
[*] Gosta de Jogos com características táticas complexas.
[*] Gosta de jogos clássicos como os primeiros Dark Souls e Neverwinter Nights.
[*] Tem disposição para coletar e craftar itens.
[/list]

[b]Evite este jogo se:[/b]
[list]
[*] Não gosta de Leitura, (Há muita coisa para ler no jogo)
[*] Não gosta de RPG ou escolhas complexas.
[*] Não gosta de ficar perdendo tempo falando com todos npcs e entrando em todos os lugares.
[*] Gosta apenas de lutar metendo a espada nos inimigos sem frescuras como magia e alquimia.
[*] Não gosta de jogos datados ou com jogabilidade estranha.
[*] Não quer perder tempo coletando e craftando itens.
[/list]

[b]Alquimia[/b]

O uso de poções não é opcional, é OBRIGATÓRIO. Neste jogo você precisa coletar itens como plantas e partes de animais, comprar e ler formulas para poções e óleos, crafta-los e usar de acordo com o contexto, inimigo e sua estratégia. Essas informações custam caro no jogo, tanto em tempo conversando com npcs quanto em ouro para comprar as formulas. 

[b]Inimigos e Combates[/b]

A parte mais divertida para mim e mais odiada para outros. No jogo você possui uma espada de prata e uma de aço, além de 3 estilos de combate, você precisa usar a arma certa no estilo de combate certo contra o inimigo certo, e juntamente com isso combinar a magia e alquimia para explorar as fraquezas dos adversários, isso é fundamental especialmente nos chefes. 

Os pontos fracos dos monstros e chefes do jogo também não são de graça, você precisa comprar livros, e falar com npcs para descobri-los, o que você pode facilmente perder durante a progressão do game ou simplesmente ficar sem dinheiro para adquirir as informações, deixando o game mais difícil e menos rico em termos de lore. De posse da informação você precisa ficar consultado o codex do jogo para elaborar as estratégias de combate. 

As coisas não explicitas no codex, por exemplo, ele diz que o chefe do primeiro capitulo é pouco vulnerável a magia Aard, se você se deu o trabalho de aprender ou usar a magia Aard em combate sabe que ela tonteia os inimigos possibilitando que você os mate com um só golpe. 

De posse dessas duas informações você pode elaborar a estratégia de fortalecer o Aard para matar o chefe "super difícil" do capitulo 1 com apenas um golpe.  Mas cabe ao jogador chegar nesta conclusão e planejar com antecedência. Parece algo simples mas a maioria dos jogadores não o fazem pois jogam irrefletidamente. [b]The Witcher não vai te pegar pela mão. cabe a você pegar os insumos que o jogo te oferece para ter uma boa experiência[/b].

[b]História[/b]

A lore da série witcher dispensa comentários, só não posso deixar de mencionar que em diversos momentos o jogo tem coloca entre escolhas morais de fritar a cabeça. Você sempre se pega tentando entender qual a coisa certa até se dar conta que no jogo não existe isto de coisa certa, e que ninguém é inocente.

Uma coisa importante é que a história avança de forma inesperada, é normal coisas ficarem para trás na primeira jogada, sempre tenha isso em mente ao entrar em um lugar ou completar uma quest, as vezes o jogo avança e algumas quests não podem ser completadas, outras o jogador acaba deixando passar. Desta forma o jogo tem um valor alta para quem for re-jogar. | Après avoir fini le jeu en 63h, je ne peux que le recommander.

Certes, il n'est plus au goût du jour, mais n'oublions pas qu'il date de 2008 : 

-  la fluidité des mouvements n'est pas celle d'un jeu de 2019 
-  la réactivité peut parfois être légèrement ennuyante (dégainer 3 plombes après le début du combat) 

Et pour ceux/celles qui n'aiment pas faire des allers-retours pour une quête, qui n'aiment pas prendre le temps de dialoguer pour récolter un maximum d'informations, passer votre chemin ! Par ailleurs, c'est un RPG ... il faut bien s'y attendre.  

Cependant, il reste immersif et on se laisse prendre au jeu ... et puis ... toute trilogie ne commence-t-elle pas par le 1e épisode si l'on veut en comprendre l'histoire complète ?   

N'hésitez plus ...

Sans compter que 1,19€ pour 63h de jeu (soit 0.018€ / h) ...

Bunlar burada dursun..
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Yapmayın oğlum söylemeyin şöyle şeyler..

Genel anlamda internet ortamında açıkça ve rahatlıkla eleştiri yapacak bir düzeye gelmişken ayrıca bir çok şeye tek bir tıkla ulaşıp araştırma imkanınız varken kendi fikirlerinizi oluşturmayıp neden başkalarından duyduğunuz şeyleri savunuyor ve insanlara yanlış algılar hediye ediyorsunuz ?

Yapmayın..

"Gerekli laf söyleme kısmını geçtiğimi göre şimdi oyundan bahsedebiliriz"

Her şeyin başlangıcı olarak verilmese de karakteri tanımamız ve hikayeyi anlayabilmemiz için gerekli oyun olarak karşımıza çıkıyor Witcher 1.

Çok güzel bir senaryo hazırlanmış öncesi hakkında bir fikrimiz yok sonrası ise tamamen muamma ilerledikçe kendimize ve hikayeye dair ip uçları ediniyor ve bir şekilde kafamızda yaşananları şekillendirmeye başlıyoruz.

[spoiler]Oyunun en başında karşımıza çıkan çocuğun en sonunda karşımıza çıkacağını kim bilebilir ki ?[/spoiler]

Oyun sırasında çok fazla npc ile diyalog kurabiliyor ana karakterimiz adına seçim yapmamız gereken çok fazla sahne ile karşılaşıyoruz.

Yetenek ağacı ise gerçekten harika oynamak istediğiniz stile yatırım yaptıkça harika kombolar ve hızlandırmalar sunuyor.

Dövüş sistemi sanıldığının aksine birazcık refleks birazcık dikkatli oynamak mantığında ilerliyor yeterli upgrade'leri alırsanız karşınızdaki 10 kişiyi havada 5 takla atarak inanılmaz artist şekillerde kesebiliyorsunuz.

Görev mantığı ise harika tüm oyunlarında olduğu gibi hangisinin side hangisinin main quest olduğunu size veriyor ve en önemli kısmı o görevleri yapabilmek için sadece bulunduğunuz haritada değil başka haritalara gidip gelebiliyorsunuz.

"Emek veriyorsunuz"

Bu oyun için gerçekten emek veriyorsunuz eski olmasına rağmen tek bir anında bile beni sıkmayan başından saatlerce kalkmadığım bir oyun oldu Witcher benim için.

Her anında insanları tek tek tanımak hikayelerini dinlemek yeri geldiğinde sarhoş olup ağzınlarından laf almak yeri geldiğinde genel evdeki kızlara çiçek götürmek her anı ile gerçekten harika bir oyun Witcher 1.

Yaptığım seçimler sırasında gerçekten zorlandığım noktalar oldu ben olsam ne yapardım Gerald aslında ne yapar kısımlarında bazı seçim ekranlarında oturup düşünmüşlüğüm var ve her şeyin sonunda tamamen benim verdiğim kararlara göre şekillenmiş bir son çıktı karşıma.,

Peki oyunun grafikleri çok mu kötü ? Hayır kesinlikle değil
Peki oyunun combat sistemi çok mu saçma ya da çok mu zor ? Hayır aslında inanılmaz basit
Peki gerçekten hikayeyi anlamak için ilk oyunu oynamamız mı gerekiyor ? "EVET"

Neden bu kadar agresif cevaplar veriyorum ? şu yüzden..

Oyuna başladığım günün sabahında Discord da masum masum oyunu oynuyorken discordda ki arkadaşlarımızdan birisi yanıma geldi ve sırf Enis K. isimli youtuber'ın videosunu izlediği için abi o oyuna rework şart yaa gibisinden bir cümle kullandı..
Mikrofondan yumruk atabilmeyi gerçekten çok isterdim..

İlk oyunu oynamana gerek yok diğer oyunlarda hikayeyi anlayabiliyorsun diyen arkadaşlarım dostlarım..
İlk oyunda öldürüp öldürmemenin kararı sana bırakılmış karakterler diğer oyunda sırf senin yaptığın seçime göre karşına çıkabiliyorken..
3. Oyunda dahi diyaloğa gireceğimiz karakterlerin başlangıç hikayelerini ilk oyunda öğrenirken..
Firma oyunun hikayesinin temelini ilk oyunda yaptığını açıklamışken ne demek lan ilk oyunu oynama diğer oyunlarda anlaşılıyor ??

Düşünsene Matrix'i öneriyorsun arkadaşına ve diyorsun ki ilk film'i izleme adam işte Matrix oluyor..
Lan oluyor da o sırada yaşadıkları ne oluyor ? o etrafındaki insanlar nereden geliyor ? o herif Matrix olana kadar neler çekiyor ?

Oyun indirim döneminde ciklet parasına kadar düşüyorken lütfen alıp kendiniz tecrübe edin..
Yine beğenmezseniz ben hep buradayım. Oturur konuşur tartışırız.


Dikkat: " Bu incelemeyi okurken yorum ekranında bol bol devrik cümle, erken bitirilmiş diyaloglar ve açıklamalarda yumuşatılma hissedebilirsiniz. İnsanlara atar yapmamam gerektiğini kendime söyleyerek yazmış birisi olarak bu açıklamayıp da yapma gereksinimi duydum "

I had high hopes that this would be better then X3 Reunion. However while it has some neat new things like boarding partys and new ships and new story lines. It has a number of game breaking bugs and other random bugs as well.

Things i liked:
being able to buy and train marines to board enemy ships and take them over.
new ships for all races
bigger universe
9 different story line missions
better wing control
better settings for MK3 traders

Things that i hated:
the path finding AI is somehow worse in this game then the last, i cant count the number of times i lost ships or even my own ship going through a gate.
the Xenon M7........why lord give them an M7. O and it can show up in random space on patrols.
out of sector combat is even more screwy then before (see Xenon M7 one shoting M2s)
MK3 traders are even more like to die to random things (see Xenon M7)
a couple story line missions are riddled with game breaking bugs
random bugs having to due with things like npcs talking on coms, half the time i had no idea what was going on because of this

Over all while i had fun i could have had a lot more fun if the bugs were fixed.
Can not recommend. | X3 is one of those games where you need to spend about 20 hours or more just learning how everything works.  Controls are kinda all over the place, stuff can be pretty janky at times, and overall it's just a pretty old game which can give it that outdated feeling.

The playtime you see is just me trying to log in, only to discover that the system doesn't work on Steam. | 盗版都比这steam版好，steam版登不上ea在线服务，win10系统还老j8闪退 | [h1]Recenzja Spore po latach czyli ewolucja na sterydach[/h1]

[h1]Wstęp:[/h1]
Powrót do Spore miał dla mnie wartość sentymentalną. Często słyszałem opinie, że jest to wielki niewypał od EA, gra z ogromnie zmarnowanym potencjałem, która nie oferuje nawet połowy zawartości jaką obiecywali twórcy. Ja tam zawsze reagowałem zdziwieniem na takie komentarze, bardzo lubiłem w to grać za dzieciaka, była to jedna z moich ulubionych gier dlatego biłem się z myślami czy warto konfrontować nostalgiczne wspomnienia z dzieciństwa z prawdziwym stanem gry, ale  uznałem, że to pewien etap ewolucji. 

[h1]Rozgrywka - o co chodzi w tej grze?[/h1]
Ewolucja to przy okazji proces o którym opowiada Spore. Nasza przygoda zaczyna się miliardy lat temu - mała niewinna komórka powstała z przypadku jeszcze nie ma świadomości, że kiedyś podbije kosmos (albo i nie). W prostym jednokomorowym środowisku staramy się jakoś przetrwać, walczymy albo jemy roślinki jeśli zależy nam na byciu roślinożercą, ulepszamy komórkę, stajemy się coraz potężniejsi aż w końcu dochodzimy do punktu gdy możemy wyjść na ląd. Na lądzie robimy praktycznie to samo - walczymy, budujemy sojusze, rozwijamy swoją postać i dążymy do wygrania ewolucyjnego wyścigu. Gdy to już się uda to na naszej drodze stają inne plemiona, a potem cywilizacje. Gra zamienia się z typowej przygodówki w grę strategiczną / RTS, aż w końcu zwieńczeniem tej przygody jest totalna dominacja na planecie i podbój kosmosu.

[h1]Co nie wypaliło?[/h1]
Spore to nie tyle przerost formy nad treścią co obietnic nad treścią. Każda faza opiera się na tym samym przez co gra jest naprawdę powtarzalna, monotonna i pozbawiona głębszego sensu. Wracając do zapowiedzi miała być to produkcja, która zmieni rynek gier na zawsze - miała konkurować z takimi kolosami rynku jak The Sims czy World of Warcraft więc ambicje były naprawdę duże. Każda faza miała być rozbudowa jak osobna gra, ale tak naprawdę nie dostaliśmy nawet ułamka tego. Już wyjaśniam, o ile w fazie komórki wszystko jest dla nas względnie nowe, możemy być zaciekawieni tym światem i walką z innymi planktonami tak w fazie potwora robimy dokładnie to samo, ale na lądzie. Możemy próbować walczyć albo śpiewać i na tym się kończą mechaniki, nie ma dosłownie nic nowego. Nawet to w jaki sposób będziemy zmieniać naszego potwora - czy będzie duży czy mały, czy będzie miał 8 nóg czy dwie nie wpływa na to jak odbierają nas inne zwierzęta. Świat też jest pusty, zwierzęta zachowują się jak skończone piwniczaki i siedzą jedynie w swoich gniazdach. W fazie plemienia chodzi o to samo, ale z widokiem z góry. Możemy atakować inne plemiona albo im śpiewać żeby załatwić sprawę pokojem. W fazie cywilizacji sytuacja trochę się zmienia bo musimy rozsądnie zarządzać zasobami (gejzery), wojskami, a do ścieżki rozwoju dochodzi też gospodarka więc możemy wykupywać inne miasta, handlować z nimi bądź podobnie jak w poprzednich fazach ich atakować albo śpiewać. W fazie kosmosu też jest zauważalna ta powtarzalność chociaż z mojej perspektywy jest to najciekawsza faza z wszystkich. Możemy latać po planetach, wykonywać różne misje, handlować czy toczyć wojny, no opcji jest znacznie więcej choć dalej chodzi w sumie o to samo.

[h1]Viva La Electronic Arts czyli za co można lubić Spore?[/h1]
Spore to przede wszystkim gra, która daje nam ogromne możliwości jak chodzi o tzw piaskownice.  Możemy tworzyć nasze potwory na tysiące możliwości, ogranicza nas jedynie wyobraźnia - mogą być wysocy, niscy, grubi, chudzi, mieć 9 oczu czy kilka nóg, można stworzyć prawdziwe dziwadła albo dzieła sztuczki. To samo tyczy się fazy cywilizacji, która to wszystko rozwija i potęguje - podczas budowy domów mamy dziesiątki możliwości dodania różnych drzwi, okien, dachów, tak samo w przypadku pojazdów, możemy też wpływać na kolor czy objętość danych rzeczy, możemy je powiększać, zmniejszać, pogrubiać także jest to bardzo fajne. Podoba mi się też to, że wszystkie fazy w pewnym sensie się ze sobą łączą przez co świat jest bardzo otwarty i stanowiący jedność. Już w fazie potwora mogą nas nawiedzić statki gości z innych planet, a później w fazie cywilizacji na tej samej planecie współistnieją miasta jak i pozostałe wioski po fazie plemienia co daje ciekawy kontrast, że nie wszystkie wiochy były w stanie się rozwinąć technologicznie. W fazie plemienia widzimy też zwierzęta, które reprezentują nas własny gatunek, a które w przeciwieństwie do nas się nie rozwinęły - pytanie czemu? Na to gra już nam nie odpowiada. Sam gameplay też jest dość innowacyjny nawet jeśli twórcy nie wycisnęli z niego całego potencjału. Zwłaszcza w fazie kosmosu gdy latamy po wszechświecie, zwiedzamy różne cywilizacje, poznajemy różne gatunki, możemy w nimi wchodzić w interakcje, szlaki handlowe czy wojny, ale co najbardziej lubię możemy w dowolny sposób modyfikować planety. Niszczyć je, terraformowac, wpływać na ukształtowanie terenu, gra daje nam wiele możliwości nawet jeśli nie jest tak rozbudowana jak wskazywały by na to pierwsze zapowiedzi.

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]
Powrót do Spore oceniam dość pozytywnie. Co prawda nie jarałem się tą grą jak kiedyś, nie miałem klapek na oczach jak za dzieciaka gdy się grało we wszystko więc patrzyłem na rozgrywkę bardziej obiektywnie - pod kilkoma względami mnie rozczarowała, czułem niewykorzystany potencjał, ale dalej to dobra propozycja, zwłaszcza, że gra jest stosunkowo tania. 

[h1]Bonus dla czytających do końca - gry podobne do Spore:[/h1]
1. The Eternal Cylinder - taka faza potwora x No Man's Sky. Uciekamy przed wielkim walcem, który jest ciągnięty przez tajemniczego potwora i w międzyczasie rozwijamy swojego stworka, ewoluujemy i próbujemy przetrwać w tym surrealistycznym świecie.

2. Adapt - gra, która próbuje być jak faza potwora, ale skupia się tylko na tym więc może wyjść coś dobrego.

3. Elysian Eclilse - gra inspiruje się Spore i ma być czymś na wzór duchowego następcy Spore, też ma mieć pięć faz, ale z bardziej rozwiniętymi mechanikami i gameplayem. Już raz słyszałem takie obietnice więc pożyjemy, zobaczymy. | Spore is the best game i have ever played, pretty good graphics for 2008. If you are stuck in a loop of repetive games, spore is the game for you. AND each playthrough is never the same.

While this game has great nostagia and is super fun, the controls are so bad that I can<t in good conscience tell modern gamers to buy it. | Crash-tastic! 

My memory of this game, of playing it off a CD, is that you could read an entire comic book waiting for a new level to load. Unfortunately that's the part of the game that has been preserved here. Bugs galore, including having actions edge off screen and characters 'dropping' through buildings making them unmovable or un-engagable. What was fun about this game originally was the campy concept and bright colors. It doesn't look right now. The bright colors and comic book dashes and dots with this early animation style doesn't scream page-turning immersive world. It's like a cheap, superficial game you'd get on a cellphone. 

The missions can be painfully simplistic and there isn't a sense of team building or world building. Your reward is largely your own imagination as you earn enough to unlock 'sets' of abilities or skills. If you're someone who wants the nostalgia either from the original release or from the really, really old comics, this might scratch the itch. If you have even slightly high standards informed by modern games, you'll be disappointed. 

The idea that something this simplistic came out in the same era as the Halo games or even the early Civilization games is a little shocking to contemplate. The people who designed it loved Patriot City and some of the 1980's kind of super villain tropes. They had fun with this, clearly, I just don't think it aged well and given the depth of both missions and conceptual design of other early 2000's games I remain shocked it was ever reviewed and ranked so highly. 

I guess get it if it's on sale or you're really, really curious about what people did when they weren't playing Quake back in the day.

Game Name: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion® Game of the Year Edition
Reviews:
If you're new to this title:
Oblivion isn't a game that you play. Oblivion is a game that you conquer.
Yes, the graphics and mechanics haven't aged well. Yes, the dialogue is often hilariously unhinged. And yes, the game is ripe with bugs and quest breaking sequences that induce a paranoid amount of saving. But its' defects can also be broken in your favor. THAT realization is when the game grips you:
What can you get away with? What cheese tactics, what exploits, or what innocuous and obscure thing (like picking up and dropping a paintbrush from your inventory... this is not a joke) can you leverage to your adventure— and how far can you leverage it? And there's so much to be adventured: every nook and cranny or every dungeon, achieve and ace every quest, grind every attribute and skill to max, collect every unique item, and then, after a 100+ hours... lament that it's over.

Which brings us to those who are returning to this title:
You know as well as I that this game has near to no replay value. Everything Oblivion has to offer can be experienced in a single playthrough, and the narrative has little to no variation (nor any substantial dialogue or narrative choices for those hopping for more RP in their RPG like the CRPGs that predated it).

It can be a hell of a ride, but with a story you can only fully revel in once, as a fresh player.
Otherwise you're only left to recall the insatiable desire to see and do everything until the memory of your previous experience is restored, which quickly dulls the experience.
However, on a personal note, I will add: that one thing I recalled was that this was one of the few games that truly made me feel as though I were fighting an endless army of demons; running, jumping, and cutting through one Oblivion gate after another...
And I felt it still, even years after its' initial release.
May it make you feel such heartiness as well. | its a nightmare to make this game stable. but its SUPER modable so you can alter it in any way you want like a sandbox. i recommend your learn the modding tools they are easy and you can make a lot of fun stuff for roleplay etc. and despite the goofiness it can be an engaging story, deep lore and great questlines.
if you're unconfortable with the modding and fixing and all that nonsese, and you own skyrim special edition i suggest you buy it just so you can get skyblivion this year (LATE 2025).
its a remake of oblivion made by modders in the skyrim se engine (with unique updated assets/worldmap/EVERYTHING) and the full game will be required to isntall it | This is the best Elder Scrolls game to date, and the best value for your money on Steam in the category of first-person action RPGs. It is a sandbox environment that starts you out on the island that the main city is in, in the center of the map. Each city has a different architectural theme, and a house that you can purchase if you have enough gold and meet the other criteria. The interface is far better than both its predecessor, Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind, and its successor, Elder Scrolls IV: Skyrim. The character design is also superior to both, as they did away with character classes in Skyrim. The game world is more beautiful if you don't follow the main quest past delivering the item to the monk at the piory, because if you close the first oblivion gate then oblivion gates start popping up all over the map. There is plenty to explore without the main quest. | I should have played this ages ago. Much to my regret.
Sure, it's "old" now- but this version functions very well. 
The forerunner for many games we enjoy today. | Loved this elder scrolls, great main story, cool ending, the world is pretty okay but aged exceptionally well for a 2006 release. NPC's are sometimes pretty odd but certainly an iteration on their continuous polishing & improvement of their approach in the RPG genre, which is portrayed in Skyrim. A recommended playthrough, especially for the main story!

Saving the world? That's boring. Playing an evil lord and parodying the fantasy genre is much more fun.

In Overlord 2, you will try out the role of the new Dark Lord, with whom you will set out to plunder the land and spread evil. Mainly with the help of your chatty and tireless goblin minions.

From the cold glacial cave, your heavy steps will lead you through snowy gorges and along the way you will sow destruction and death around you. Then comes the tropical land of the annoying marijuana elves and their annoying dances. We will also go to the underworld to the dark land of the old, already defeated dark lord. And finally, we will go to massacre the land of our archenemy - the Roman Empire led by Emperor Solarius.
The game takes place in relatively large levels, which are visually very variable and offer constant enjoyment. Although it is a more or less linear experience, it at least gives a sense of freedom.

Overlord II is a successful sequel to the first game. Although there could be at least one new goblin class and more frequent saves. [b] 55% [/b] | Péssimo!!! Jogo com potencial mas tem partes q é tão chato q dá vontade de desligar essa m#*$@. Ah, foi o q fiz depois de sentir isso umas cinco vezes. Desnecessário game designer querer inventar outros "minigames" durante jogo ao invés de focar no básico. Acaba que é aí q falham feio. | Amazing game, a true classic. I still hold onto hope that a new one will be released one day. | This game is really fun, but I can't recommend it because the Battle Rock DLC was never released for PC, and without that DLC you can't max out your character.

I doubt that will ever change, but if it does I'll update my review. | Overlord 1 & Raising Hell DLC is absolutely better, which is a shame.

You could tell the Devs just didn't get to finish Overlord 2, especially at the end siege. Overlord 1 & Raising Hell DLC lasted me over 40+ hours, yet Overlord 2 wasn't even 20 hours.

Worth a single play through, but absolutely not something I see myself playing again.

Odd, Overlord Dark Legend came out the exact same day & year, yet scored better overall compared to Overlord 2 - will have to try that someday.

Remember when games were fun and didn't feel like a second job? I pull overlord out of archives every few years just to remind myself what gaming use to be. Is it perfect, no, does it run 100% stable, most of the time, does it have top of the line graphics, nope, is it fun, absolutely. | It sucks that this game was discontinued after the second game in the series because this game is funny as hell  but saddly sense EA own Codemasters they killed this franchise off too early another franchise ruined by EA No More Sheepies No More Minions but at least the game got ported to PC in a Complete version unlike OVerlord 2 Which is annoyingly missing its DLC T_T | very good game, highly recommend, minions are the best | Weltklasse das Game und Läuft auch auf Windows 11. Ich kenne es noch von der PS3 und da war es schon Geil. Ich kann es nur Empfehlen der Gerne mal den Bösen spielen möchte mit  Dunklem Humor und Coolen Sprüchen zum Totlachen. Sehr Bedien freundlich mit Maus und Controller. Ein Tolles Game | If you like the Pickmin Series and have a darker sense of humor, then this game is perfect for you.  A few mild RPG elements to round off the fantasy setting and a little more combat helps set this apart.  There are some audio problems and janky controls, but I never found them to be to annoying.

Muchos mods, pero con algunos mods es dificil pq tienes q jugar con una sola mano
 | The game also comes with a DLC, which includes the following items:

1. A Toxic Community: Mistakes are rarely forgiven. Unless you’re playing with friends, be prepared to face harsh criticism, often from younger players. The game’s multiplayer is largely populated by school-aged players who don’t hold back.


2. Disruptive Adults: It’s not just the kids causing chaos—some adults blast music through their microphones, assuming everyone else shares their taste. Spoiler: they don’t.


3. Frequent AFKs: Teamwork can fall apart when a teammate goes inactive, whether they’re brewing tea, taking a smoke break, or simply wandering off mid-game. And yes, it often happens right after you’ve generously used your first aid kit on them.


4. Team Abandonment: Lone wolves running off to the far corners of the map, only to be overwhelmed by infected, are a common sight. They’re quick to flood the chat with colorful language before rage-quitting the game.


5. Difficulty Disputes: Some players join games on "Expert" difficulty only to demand a downgrade. If their request is denied, they might sabotage the team before leaving the server entirely.


6. Vote Kicks: Occasionally, you’ll encounter players who inexplicably start a vote to kick you from the game. When you ask why? Crickets.



The Verdict: Despite the chaotic community, Left 4 Dead 2 remains a phenomenal experience. The graphics are a significant step up from the first game, the mechanics feel more polished, and there’s a greater variety of weapons and infected to enjoy. However, surviving the online experience without a calming remedy might be just as challenging as surviving the zombie apocalypse itself. | Крутая игра для игры с друзьями (которые в это не играют)! Есть редкие достижения, куча пушек и толпа зомби, которая будет медленно наступать на пятки и их съедать. В общем, весело, рекомендую. | [h1]写了800字的推荐文，手欠点了一下"否"全没了。不说了血压高了,头晕。[/h1]总之就是《关于一个萌新GMOD玩久了无聊直接去玩L4D1多人因太菜反复被僵尸虐而被队友抛弃伤心自责卸载游戏过半年好奇进L4D2知道玩单人熟悉官图及玩法过程中发现了能打MOD结果一发不可收拾地搜各种进阶攻略教程提升自己游戏体验和能力努力不坑队友可仍然很菜但是很感谢带萌新入坑的朋友们以及创意工坊的大佬们给这游戏第二次生命的事》 | Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2), released by Valve in 2009, is the gold standard for cooperative zombie shooters. Featuring intense survival gameplay, smart AI, and an incredible atmosphere, L4D2 delivers an unmatched multiplayer experience. With its fast-paced action, diverse weapons, and unpredictable enemy encounters, this game remains one of the most thrilling and replayable co-op shooters ever made.

Gameplay – Pure, Adrenaline-Fueled Action
L4D2 is all about co-op survival. You and three teammates must fight through hordes of the undead, navigating through various maps and completing objectives to reach safety. The key to survival? Teamwork, strategy, and adaptability.

The gunplay is tight and satisfying, with a wide selection of weapons including assault rifles, shotguns, SMGs, sniper rifles, and melee weapons like axes, katanas, and even frying pans! Every encounter feels dynamic, thanks to the AI Director, which adjusts the difficulty based on your team’s performance, ensuring no two playthroughs are ever the same.

Special Infected – Enemies That Keep You on Edge
Beyond the standard zombie horde, L4D2 introduces Special Infected that force players to work together:

Tank – A massive brute that can throw debris and crush survivors.
Witch – A terrifying enemy that, if startled, can instantly incapacitate a survivor.
Smoker – Uses a long tongue to drag players away from their team.
Hunter – A fast, agile infected that pounces on survivors and pins them down.
Boomer – Explodes in a shower of bile, attracting a massive horde.
Charger – Charges through groups, slamming a survivor into the ground.
Spitter – Creates pools of acid that deal heavy damage.
Each Special Infected forces different team strategies, making communication and positioning absolutely crucial.

Campaigns & Maps – A Horror Movie Experience
L4D2 features multiple campaigns, each set in diverse, apocalyptic locations across the southern U.S.:

Dead Center – A chaotic mall escape reminiscent of classic zombie films.
The Parish – A tense race across New Orleans to reach an evacuation zone.
Swamp Fever – A creepy, foggy swamp filled with infected dangers.
Hard Rain – A unique campaign featuring a devastating hurricane that changes the environment.
Dark Carnival – A fan-favorite, featuring a deadly amusement park with a thrilling rollercoaster finale.
Each campaign feels like a mini zombie movie, packed with cinematic set pieces, interactive environments, and intense finales.

Multiplayer & Game Modes – Endless Replayability
L4D2 offers several game modes that keep the action fresh:

Campaign Mode – Classic co-op survival through story-driven levels.
Versus Mode – One team plays as survivors, while the other controls the Special Infected.
Survival Mode – See how long you can last against endless waves of zombies.
Scavenge Mode – A competitive mode where teams race to collect fuel cans while being hunted.
Mutation Mode – Weekly game modifiers that add fun twists to gameplay.
Thanks to modding support and the Steam Workshop, the community has also created hundreds of custom maps, weapons, and campaigns, making L4D2’s replayability practically infinite.

Graphics & Sound – Immersive and Timeless
Even years after release, L4D2’s atmospheric lighting, detailed environments, and gruesome effects hold up well. Zombies react realistically to gunfire, and the sound design is masterful, with eerie background noises, terrifying growls from Special Infected, and intense musical cues that heighten the suspense.

The voice acting and character interactions bring the survivors to life, making them memorable and adding humor to the chaos.

Why Left 4 Dead 2 is a Must-Play
L4D2 is the perfect blend of action, horror, and co-op gameplay. Whether you’re playing with friends or AI teammates, the intense combat, unpredictable enemy encounters, and endless replayability make every match a thrilling adventure.

🔹 Final Rating: 10/10
Left 4 Dead 2 is a masterpiece of cooperative gaming. If you love zombies, action, and teamwork, this is an absolute must-play that still delivers endless fun and excitement after more than a decade.

Game Name: STAR WARS™ - The Force Unleashed™ Ultimate Sith Edition

With that being said, this game has not aged particularly well in it's current form. So be prepared for that, especially if you've played games like Jedi: Fallen Order & Jedi: Survivor.
