Game Name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition
Reviews:
entrei fiz o tutorial morri tres vezes no tutorial, finalizei o tutorial e fui pra uma vila ataquei sem querer uma vaca uma mulher começou a me seguir com uma faca, voltei pro save antes de atacar a vaca fui testar as teclas e apertei shift + z os aldeao veio tudo pra cima e morri fiquei 30 minutos procurando o botao de sair. melhor jogo q joguei ate agr
 | Играешь в Skyrim, думаешь, сейчас быстренько выполню квест, а потом вдруг оказываешься на другом конце карты, спасая какого-то дракона от крыс. В итоге забыл, зачем вообще пришёл в эту деревню. Местные жители, кажется, тоже в шоке — они ждут, что ты спасёшь мир, а ты пытаешься вспомнить, где оставил своего коня. И да, стрелы в коленях, кажется, стали новой модой. Если вам нравятся приключения, где можно забыть обо всём на свете и просто наслаждаться хаосом, то Skyrim — ваш идеальный выбор! | Играю в это творение с самого его выпуска на просторах интернета. Некогда меня посадил в нее брат, и это была лучшая рекомендация по играм, которую он мог мне когда-либо дать. Цифру, которую видят пользователи рядом с моей иконкой, это может, дай Бог, 1/10 часть всех проведенных часов за этой игрой. Да, когда выпускалась игра, мне было 9 лет, и я играла по своему незнанию и неумению с чит-кодами, тем не менее, освоившись с годами, поняла, что куда интереснее, когда имеешь риск, чем читы, которые ограничивали и делали тебя непобедимым. Да, всех фишек игры вдоль и поперек мне узнать по сей день не удалось, и я к этому не стремлюсь. 
Эта игра стоит того, чтобы вы ей уделили внимание, как минимум потому, что это огромный открытый мир с неимоверно широким выбором заданий. И, лично я, до сих пор не видела в гейминге игр, которые бы хоть чуть-чуть сравнивались с ней. Не спорю, опережая негативные возгласы, есть уйма других не менее проработанных хороших игр, но, по моему мнению, это не то. Skyrim тот самый прорывной проект 2011-го год, который до сих пор держит геймеров у экранов, так и вовлекая из года в год перепройти его заново.
Запуская игру, ты идешь туда уже далеко не ради графики, ибо, конечно, стоит признать, что для 2025-го года это уже не аргумент. Ты идешь ради неповторимого сюжета, который всего через пару игровых сессий так и просит подпевать бардам в таверне "Герой он бесстрашный, он непобедим...". Ведь герой, Довакин - это ты, человек неопределенной расы, который неведомым образом попадается на пересечении границы и оказывается тем, кто спасет весь мир. Причем игра дает возможность спасти Скайрим абсолютно разными способами: как будучи воином в драконьих доспехах с секирой Вутрад наперерез, так и крысой из Гильдии, тыркающей противников на х10 урона бритвой Мерунеса. Продвигаясь по разным сюжетным линиям, ты обретаешь многих верных сторонников (даже включая продажных наемников в тавернах, которые в последующем могут и отдаться Боэтии ради тебя). Некоторых из них имеется возможность брать в напарники, в зависимости от направленности твоего персонажа: нужен ли тебе лучник или  шут с кинжалом. Надоело рубить драконов, сражая их своим воинственным голосом? Пойдем, отыщем лук Ауриэля и будем жечь вампиров. Не хочешь? Пошли выпьем с незнакомцем в баре по кружке эля и узнаем, что тот даэдра гулянок. Хочешь тихой семейной жизни? Купи участок, построй особняк своей мечты и устройся там, может быть даже с мужем/женой и детьми. 
Устав от всех этих историй и геройств, ты можешь просто взобраться на холм под вечер с чистым небом и наблюдать за звездами. Звездные каскады - это не менее прекрасная причина прогуляться по просторам Скайрима и его окрестностям.
А для любителей мультиплеера создатели придумали онлайн версию, с которой вы можете также ознакомиться.
Но есть и свои "-" у сие произведения. Наиболее сущей проблемой стали для меня баги, когда я впервые зашла в официальную версию игры. Особенно по отношению к  компаньонам: передвижение в виде чистой модельки, исчезновение их частей тела, застревание в приседе, отставания от главного героя на половину карты и даже невозможность их выхода из локаций. В таких ситуациях спасают некоторые коды и частые сохранения, однако оставляет неприятный осадок. Тем не менее, это даже иногда забавляет и добавляет юмора в серые будни средневекового главного героя.
Даже спустя 13 лет после релиза, мне не надоели эти образы, байки, сюжетные повороты. Это как хорошее вино, с каждым годом только вкуснее. Смакуйте, друзья, а потом идите в не менее прекрасные проекты, как этот! | Sem sombra de dúvidas esse é o melhor RPG que já joguei, até dá pra jogar sem mods, mas não recomendo. Possuo atualmente 80 horas neste jogo incrível, metade delas apenas colocando mods e corrigindo para obter a perfeição

 10/10 pode comprar 15 pila é troco de pão. | He caminado por los valles helados de Skyrim, donde los vientos ululan como los lobos y las montañas tocan los cielos con sus picos nevados. Mi regreso a esta tierra fue tan inesperado como la caída de un dragón , y mi misión, encomendada por fuerzas invisibles, me llevó a cuestionar no solo mi destino, sino también el significado de la libertad.
Al principio, como nuestros ancestros sumerios balbucearon palabras en su lenguaje primigenio, yo también me encontré balbuceando entre decisiones que parecían dictadas por voces sin rostro. Dónde quedaba el libre albedrío del que tanto alardeamos. Al principio, odié este acometido impuesto por los escritores de mi destino en estos lares, pero poco a poco, entendí que mi periplo no era solo una línea invisible que seguir. Había un propósito más profundo, una razón que no podía ignorar.
Avanzar en esta tierra inhóspita no fue sencillo. Mi mazo dejó su huella en las carnes de muchos enemigos, y cada golpe arrancó no solo trozos de sus vidas, sino también fragmentos de mi tiempo. Vi los horrores de la guerra en Whiterun, sentí la frialdad de los glaciares en Hibernalia, y escuche los susurros de conspiraciones en la Hermandad Oscura. Cada paso que daba, cada batalla que libraba, me llevaba más cerca de una verdad que intentaba ignorar: las familias que formamos son lo que verdaderamente importa.
Recorrí los pasillos del Colegio de Bardos y canté canciones que no entendía. Me adentré en las cavernas del aquelarre de Namira, donde las sombras guardan secretos que ninguna luz puede revelar. Combatí junto a los Compañeros, los Ruiseñores y los Orcos tribales, cada una de estas familias con sus propios conflictos y códigos. Pero, por mucho que intentaran abrazarme como uno de los suyos, siempre sentía que algo faltaba. No eran mi verdadera familia.
Y entonces la vi. Con su canastita llena de flores marchitas y su sonrisa frágil, caminaba por los campos de batalla sin clamar por gloria ni riquezas. Todo lo que quería era un hogar, alguien a quien llamar “papá” o “mamá”. No buscaba los placeres mundanos que otros persiguen. En ella encontré algo que había olvidado en mi corazón endurecido por las guerras: la inocencia y el anhelo de pertenecer.
Decidí que la adoptaría y le daría lo que yo no tuve: un refugio seguro, un hogar donde pudiera soñar sin miedo. Pero para hacerlo necesitaba un lugar donde ella pudiera vivir. Ahorré cada moneda que gané en mis hazañas, vendí trofeos de guerra y trabajé incansablemente. Finalmente, conseguí una casa, un lugar al que ella podría llamar suyo. Pero la guerra estalló el día que iba a darle la noticia. Mis misiones chocaron y, en medio del caos, ella desapareció.
Busqué en todas partes, temiendo lo peor. Ningún pueblerino había ayudado a la niña que vendía flores para sobrevivir; ¿por qué lo harían ahora? Imagine su cuerpecito inerte bajo los escombros, olvidado por los débiles e inútiles druidas que no pudieron salvarla. Mis pasos eran pesados, no solo por los trofeos que llevaba, sino por el peso de mi corazón quebrado. La crueldad de esta vida no tiene límites, pero incluso en medio de la barbarie, recordé por qué empecé esta travesía. No podía rendirme.
Cuando finalmente la encontré, algo había cambiado. Ya no era la niña frágil que conocí. Tal vez era ella, o tal vez una sombra de lo que había sido. Pero adoptarla y verla sonreír nuevamente me hizo entender que nuestras acciones tienen un impacto que trasciende nuestro entendimiento. No era solo una niña sin hogar; era una oportunidad para redimir lo que quedaba de mi humanidad.
En un rincón perdido de la historia nórdica, se cuenta la leyenda de una niña huérfana que vagó sola durante años en los desiertos de hielo tras la muerte de su familia en una guerra clánica. Nadie la ayudó, nadie la quiso, hasta que un guerrero la encontró desmayada en la nieve. A pesar de su corazón endurecido por las batallas, el guerrero la llevó a su hogar y la crió como su propia hija. Con el tiempo, ella se convirtió en una gran sanadora, conocida no por las cicatrices que llevaba, sino por la paz que traía. ¿No es acaso esa la prueba de que incluso en los lugares más oscuros, hay esperanza?
Esta historia, aunque llena de tragedias y sangre, es un reflejo de nuestra propia realidad. Hoy, incluso, hay guerras que arrasan con las vidas de seres queridos. La humanidad, a lo largo de su historia, ha manchado sus manos con tinta roja, escondiendo sus crímenes bajo el velo de la victoria. Si me lees, te imploro: haz lo que puedas para Ayudar a alguien aunque sea una vez en tu vida, dándole palabras de ánimo, o un poco de comida o lo que tu corazón desee dar en ese momento, no por recompensa ni por honor, sino porque también podrías estar en sus zapatos, porque varias veces esos pensamientos rondan nuestra mente.
Me despido con un abrazo gélido, como los vientos de Skyrim, y un saludo cargado de las tragedias que he visto. Que mi historia sirva como un recordatorio de que incluso en los lugares más oscuros, la luz de la compasión puede brillar.

 | [h1]Классно но душно[/h1]
Первые 10 часов игра тебя радует, погружаешься, развиваешь бар, но как-только добираешься до русалидов начинается духота, миллион квестов для этих чертей, какие-то душные головоломки уровня третьего класса, в какой-то момент добавляется еще и симулятор фермера, когда ты задумываешься ну куда уже дальше, когда уже конец, добавляется еще и симулятор фермера водорослей, смешивания коктейлей и прочего, погружения и ловля рыбы перестают иметь смысл т.к денег слишком много, а сюжет искусственно затянут, если бы игра закончилась за 10-15 часов было бы идеально, но тут можно ковыряться все 30-40
Кривожoпaя боёвка с боссами отдельное раздражение, но игра всё равно довольно приятная и чилловая, хоть и по сути вводит тебя в заблуждение описанием. | Estupidamente incrível e a pura definição do que jogos são e deveriam ser nos dias de hoje.

Dave the Diver pode parecer repetitivo e sem conteúdo, mas é totalmente o contrário, toda vez que você pensa que não irá ter nada novo adiante, ele vai la e te entrega mais, bastante gameplay diferente durante o decorrer do jogo, cameos de outras franquias de jogos, referências e easter eggs magníficos.

Se você está a procura de um jogo que não seja caro e que entregue uma experiência completamente nova e empolgante, e também esteja cansado dessa geração genérica de AAAs, Dave the Diver foi feito pra você.

9,5/10 | Took a while for me to really get into it, but once I did, it was fantastic!

Pro's:
-Creativity
-It doesn't really get stale, because there is something new around every corner (a new game mechanic, a new area, a new part of the story)
-The humor
-it's fun to upgrade your restaurant, as well as your equipment. There is a good feeling of progression.
Because of that, things that are tricky at the start of the game, become much more doable, or even easy. And that's really great, because you feel that you've worked for it!
-The characters! Though it wouldn't have hurt if it had been a little bit less of a sausage fest. There are some female characters, but the main cast are male. Still, they were fun, memorable, and fit well into the story.
-The actual fishing! I loved coming across bigger, faster, stronger, more dangerous beasts of the sea, and besting them! It took a bit to really get the hang off, but once I did, it became so satisfying to dive every day and gather everything that I needed for the restaurant! Slowly unlocking and upgrading more dishes because I was able to catch different creatures. 
-Honestly, it just looks very nice! The colors are pleasant, the locations are pretty, the bosses are kinda cool, the character design is varied, I love that Dave is VERY much a plus size! He's just a lovable teddy bear. 


cons:
-There are some game mechanics that could have been left out? Especially at the end there are things that you need to keep up with that become more like a chore than something fun. But in my opinion, it's not terrible. You have the time, and it doesn't take that long, but still. It is a bit much to do everything.
-Dave in the water: Fantastic! Dave working in the restaurant.... incredibly slow. I know it's part of the game, but it is made worse when you have to poor drinks for customers.. Every time I had to pour a beer, or make a cocktail, I would dread it. And I had staff take over as quickly as I could.
-Some parts can be a little confusing at first, but once you get it, or get the hang of it, it's fine. It's mostly that there is a lot, and it can become overwhelming.


Would I recommend this game?
-To anyone that wants a semi-cozy (semi-stressful) gaming experience.
-If you like a roguelike, but would like a different take on it!
-You like fishies but arn't afraid to brutally shoot a harpoon into them (it's just a game. It's harsh but it's also comical. No actual fishies are harmed in you shooting a bunch of pixels. But people can be sensitive to stuff like this, and that's okay! Just keep this in mind before you buy!)
-You're ready to try something new!

So yes, in general I think this is a fantastic game! But it might not be for everyone (no game is) 
You can always watch some game play so you know what is ahead of you. If what you see seems fun, Go for it!!
If you are on the fence, I'd lean towards getting it anyway, because there is so much to this game, I'm sure there will be at least a few things that will positively surprise you if you are willing to put in the time! | Wonderful cute and fun game that has so much content to offer, great music, great visuals and art and tons of fun catching all the fish.

5 bucks for this was so worth it. Some of the puzzles are truly challenging and it will test your ability to problem solve. Really really enjoyed playing this with friends. Would absolutely recommend for a quick cheap late night game that clearly had love and effort put in!!!!!


EDIT: JUST BECAUSE YOU FELT THE PUZZLES WERE TOO HARD, THAT DOES NOT WARRANT A NEGATIVE REVIEW. YOUR INTELLECT SHOULD NOT AFFECT THE DEVELOPERS IMAGE! | I only leave reviews when a game is either really good or really bad - this is one of the best games I've ever played!

I feel many of the negative reviews are unfair. They seem to be split mainly into the 3 camps below,

1) They don't have the intellect to solve these puzzles: These puzzle are not like the puzzles in games like 'The Room' where you need only randomly click things until something happens or where the solution is screaming at you in the face. The puzzles in this game are PROPER puzzles and VERY cleverly designed. You actually have to engage your brain, so expect to be stuck thinking about a puzzle for a while, and you will probably need to write notes to solve some. Reviews that say the puzzles don't follow logical rules or require brute force are talking TOTAL rubbish. I got through all puzzles using logic alone and did not require the optional hints. This game reminds me of the Sherlock Holmes quote "You see, but you do not observe" - all the clues you need are given to you in the form of various letters left around the house and you need to CAREFULLY read each one.

2) They don't have the patience: this is not a game that you can leave your brain at the door after a hard days work. This is a game you play if you're in desperate need of some intellectual stimulation and challenge.

3) It's not a co-op game: this is probably true. I played it solo, but I noticed that much of the time the puzzles need to be completed in a linear order.

I suspect this is a niche game for those who find other puzzle games too simple, and for that reason this game may struggle to gain mass appeal. However I hope this developer does really well and continues to make QUALITY puzzle games like this.

P.S. There IS an inventory option for carrying the puzzle pieces - hit Tab. | This game was an absolute treat. Extremely unique, creative, and polished puzzles that took real thought BUT were fair. Unlike many puzzle games they don't just hand you the answer, but they aren't obscure unsolvable puzzles either. The game is well made and loaded to the brim with puzzles. Sure it's not goofy and cartoony like others in the genre, but if you're up for a real challenge, I can only say I was impressed with each new puzzle we faced. Great job creators!

Also, even though the puzzles were challenging, it was a ton of fun talking them through with a friend in multiplayer. Honestly one of the best entries in the genre and truly rewarding to complete. | Greatly enjoyed this puzzle/escape adventure! This is my first download from 0 Deer Soft and I'm excited to purchase the rest of their collection! | While some of the puzzles were interesting, it doesn't make effective use of the medium or in having two players. Many of the puzzles essentially feel like brute force or logic reduction puzzles, and while presented in a cool way, with some cool things, it just doesn't really feel like it should be a video game.

Also all of the notes people kept leaving one another were very passive-aggressive.

This game really shines now after the massive overhaul update. They fixed a lot of the crafting pains and added a huge story line. The expanded features for followers, new equipment and more specially crafted story worlds all help with the immersion and gameplay value. | I won't lie, this game is working on finding itself. That being said, this game IS WORKING on finding itself. I have watched this game change and evolve a lot. It has it's ups and its downs. It still has many things it can improve on, but it has already gone through great lengths to improve many. That to me is a huge pro. The developers are passionate about this. It shows. I'll be honest, I'm absolutely bias, the game just does something for me personally. In it's current state I find myself knocking out large projects then taking a break. That being said, it is one game I consistently come back to and when I do come back I realize I've missed playing it. I would love to see this game at it's full potential. Why Nightingale rocks in my book though, is because it brings me back to the days of Star Wars Galaxies, where you had vast maps to explore and look for materials to gather and tinker with. But B is made at a different station. Then B actually needs F+R. Oh my god, it is so tedious. Some of the game mechanics are wonky. Like if you want to just walk over a small rock, nope - cant, have to do a dumb jump and climb animation.

This game really disappointed me and I found the more I played it, the more frustrated and bored I got. | This is a beautiful game - it is visually stunning. The gameplay has a perfect balance - you need to farm for resources; but, it is not an endless repetitive grind. Constructing items and shelters is quick in comparison to many other survival like games. This is by far the best game/survival game I may have ever played - best survival game for certain and survival games are my jam. This (I would consider) to be a must buy, a must play, a must experience to partake in.

Really enjoyable exploration and discovery game, with very light survival elements. 
(If you are looking for "hardcore" survival, this may not be the game for you- higher difficulties are indeed more difficult, but the survival elements remain the same, with only your Oxygen, Thirst, and Hunger elements running down faster.)

It's a beautiful world, but it is a bit buggy. You have to enjoy exploiting bugs like falling through terrain and being able to see underneath- and finding things that may have been harder to see up top. (I love finding cracks in invisible walls and seeing if I can get off-map or travel below the world). If you are intolerant of even minor bugs and visual glitches- well. this one ain't for you, because it has     a fair number. Very small dev team (2 people I think?) so they are likely only focusing on game-breaking bugs when they are found.

This is really more of a base-building/exploration/discovery game, not really what I consider "true survival". 

I will say I have enjoyed it far more than I expected to, with almost 107 hours into it at the time of this review. And I expect to put a good number of hours into it after this, to get all achievements, and then start a new game in the DLC world. 

If you are looking for "perfect"- this game may not be for you. If you are looking for an engaging grind fest creating a world from scratch and watching it blossom and grow (and you are tolerant of funny bugs that sometimes can be exploited)- this may be for you, Story isn't a focus, but it is there if you want to discover all of the hidden bases and messages of those who came before but did not survive... story is there, and is pretty good once you start piecing it together.

A hidden gem, that is a little rough around the edges, I guess? | Неожиданно уютная игра, которая смогла несколько раз удивить за 10 часов!
Классный выживач в космическом сеттинге с ненавязчивым сюжетом.
Графика проста, но сделано всё с любовью. Ничего не раздражает.
Играть приятно и интересно. | You are alone on a dead planet, and your mission is to terraform it. At first, survival is your only concern—gathering resources, setting up oxygen generators, and making sure you don’t run out of water. But as you progress, the real magic begins.

Exploring wrecked ships is one of the best parts of the game. Every abandoned structure feels like a treasure hunt, filled with valuable loot that helps speed up your progress. The world is vast, and every expedition brings new discoveries.

Even when playing solo, it’s an amazing experience. The game is incredibly immersive, especially as you watch the planet slowly transform from a barren wasteland into a thriving ecosystem. I took my time and ended up building an eco park, a museum, farms, and even bridges to connect different areas—it’s not just about survival, but also creativity.

Genres: Adventure, Casual, Indie, Free To Play
Reviews: Mostly positive at the time of this review. I liked it.

This game can be summarized in one word: Unpolished

I really want to love this game however in its current state it really is unloveable. If you plan to buy this just be aware that you'll "only" get a few hundred hours of fun out of this game as opposed to Paradox usual thousand. And this will not change for a long (at the time of writing this, presumably a few years of) time.

Every nation feels and mostly plays the same and its unpolished state applies to both game mechanics AND [nation]flavour.

If you want to know how you'll play 90% of games if you want to do decently well it will look like this: 1. Pick a great power, 2. liberalize, 3. build an economic based on a construction bubble (Iron, steel, tools) and 4. repeat.

Minor nations are even less playable because by the time you fixed your nation the game is already or close to over.

Im gonna list every Problem I have with this game just do demonstrate the unpolished state of the game however be aware this is by far not every problem the game has to offer:

1. The Warfare system is boring, now theres a lot of criticism for the warfare system by the community however this is one of the features that is in my opinion the least in need of fixing. While it is very oversimplified (You basically draw a frontline and then either attack or defend). I think all this game needs are polishing features like frontlines splitting in 2 causing you to have a hole in your line and causing you to be instantly overrun. Military Research actually affecting your units instead of changing your production method (the Ultra Historical mods fix this). And adding a stockpile for equipment so your military factories stay productive in peace time. Plus making your attack orders actually be followed would go a long way.

2. The game runs super slow by the time you reach 1890 [depending on your PC, +/- ~10 years]. This is especially annoying because it means you get cut off from a lot of cool action. It essentially means you'll rarely see your fruits of labor pay off. Want to play Germany and establish colonies? By the time you've unified Germany and have done all the important other things the game is already slowing down. Want to play as a socialist country? By the time you're ready to become socialist your game is so slow that waiting for laws to pass is no longer fun but just annoying. Want to be Japan? By the time you implemented the right laws the game is too slow to start Japans historic rapid industrialization. Want to play as an American trade empire? By the time you unified America you'll at best have time to get the South Americas into your sphere of influence.

3. The economy system sucks. Want to build an economy as any Great power? Heres how, 1. build iron/coal mines and logging camps, make tools, repeat. 2. Unlock Steel, steel needs iron and coal, iron needs tools, make more tools using steel. 3. Unlock Dynamite, make sulfur mine, make fertilizer factory. Dynamite needs fertilizers which you make with sulfur, then you use the dynamite production method to get more resources out of mines.... resources like sulfur. And that's basically it, now go Laisez Fairre so your capitalists invest in some other stuff so you can larp the semblance of a diverse economy.

3b. Trading sucks. Hoi4 has a more interesting trade mechanic/balance then this game. Every game devolves into an Autarky Simulator. Don't have enough of something? What can you do? You have to build it yourself. Basically no shortage except engines and other rare goods can be fixed using trade. Want to larp an imperialist power that dumps massive amounts of cheap goods into a country causing local competitors to go bankrupt forcing the country to economically rely on you? Tough luck, you cant.[This is a game about colonialism and trading by the way]

4. The politics of this game are super boring and lame, if you want to be decently successful you have 2 options: Capitalist Liberalism to focus on a game with a lot of GDP or Communism to see that standard of living go up. There is no incentive to play anything else. Monarchism and other Authoritarian ways to play only compensate you with "Authority" which are points you can use to implement decree's that buff you in a selected state in a bunch of different ways however quite frankly, its useless. And while its obvious that playing as a Theocratic Ethnostate will have little benefits, there is absolutely no reason other then larp to pick them.  Theres no specific unique buff, no odd situational event, nothing. They could have went with something like Monarchies uniting the populace causing less Radicals from political movements or Ethnostates/Theocracies giving less radicals from Standard of Living for the Primary culture but more for oppressed cultures but they chose nothing and hence you are always forced to pick the same old boring policies.

5. The game lacks utter immersion. Despite this game being set in unarguably one of the most important and most rapid changing times of humanity you, the player, feel nothing about it. Are you an industrial great power? Are you a small, non industrial tribe? Are you an oppressed puppet/colony? It "feels" the same. The game lacks utter immersion, while even hoi4 tries to immerse you in its setting with news events like the olympic games, the Hindenburg, etc. no such thing is going on in vicky, add this with the already distant experience from the Global Strategy approach and you're in for a dissapointment. Very very rarely do you feel like you're in these turbulent times. Events that are supposed to immerse you rarely work to do that. The only events that do make me feel immersed are that of nihilism, positivism and communism. However 2 of these rarely fire. And it is just as bad for nation specific immersion. As Prussia/Germany, you'll never feel like you're uniting people that want to be united, you just start 3 wars, get an event and annex lands. Or as Japan, you do not get experiences that make you feel like your world was basically turned upside down when the Europeans [yes Europeans because America will not even reach you] open up your country. There is a massive missed chance of adding visual novel'esque events [or news events like hoi4 does] that immerse you. Imagine how great it would be, you play as Japan and suddenly you're forced to open up. And while you change your laws you keep getting pop ups about people/interest groups describing their perspective of a changing Japan. You could see how displeased the Samurai's are getting with each event, how they feel about losing their privileges while for the Peasantry you feel their sweeping optimism as  they went from the bottom of the hierarchy to a respected group. Ultimately this is a huge missed potential that is also surprisingly not alot talked about in the community.

heres a lot more to say and criticize but I've reached my steam word limit... yeah that one sentence sums up the vicky 3 experience.

All in all this game just quite frankly sucks due to a lack of polish. Usually mod's fix this in other games but it is to severe in this game to fix. You need different major mods for every single aspect. I personally run the entire 5 or so Ultra Historical mods to fix research, combat and the lack of a historical ai. The better politics mod to make politics slightly less repetitive (they still are). Various Quality of life UI mods, performance improving mods, Event and Flavour mods. And always 1 Flavour mod for the nation Im planning to play.

And this won't be fixed within one update or a dlc, this will take a lot which is why I don't recommend it. If they keep the progress up, in 2 years I'd say this game enters a "releasable bare bones" state. As it is, you get a few hundred hours out of playing different nations and getting familiar with the game mechanics until you realize its all the same.

While this game certainly has potential, and I can imagine it being a lot of fun in multiplayer, I would not recommend this game in its current state if you intend on playing it single player.

It seems like this game is balanced around having four people running around doing tasks because playing alone means you simply do not have time to engage with many of the mechanics. Even with just seating for 12 and with 3 of the NPC assistants, just pouring drinks and making alcohol occupies most of my time. I don’t have time to grow my own crops, much less foraging/hunting, doing deliveries or any of the questlines.
The core of the game is customers will sit down at a table, and you will go up to them and take their order. You will then have to gather the necessary ingredients and prepare whatever they ordered before bringing it to them. Once they are done, they will leave their dirty dishes at the table which you will then collect and wash. On top of this you will have to sweep your tavern, fix machines when they break, refill your dishwashers with water and kick out drunk customers. This is a lot, and it does not take many customers to completely overwhelm you. 

Now the game lets you automate some of it, you can buy helpers that can preform a limited set of tasks. Cleaners will sweep for you and bring dirty dishes to the dishwasher. Then there are waiters which will take orders and deliver food and drink. While this is definitely helpful and allows you to serve more guests by yourself, you can only have 16 items on hand by default and you cannot increase this number until you are level 11 (several hours), meaning you cannot leave for very long without running out of food. These helpers are also very expensive at 1800 coins. For reference, most early game food only gives you a profit of 10-20 coins and the mid late game stuff is like 50. At level 8 you will unlock the automatic washing machine which removes the washing minigame you have to play, but that is the extent of the automation. 
If you want to do hunting, gathering or farming which is necessary to make more complex recipes that yield more money, you will need to close your tavern. However, the increase in profit does not make up for the lost sales, so you are better off just sticking to the core loop.

With just one more player you can easily have one player managing the tavern while the other gathers supplies which would massively increase your profit margins, and with even more players you would have even more options, so I can see it being a lot of fun, but in single player its really difficult to get stuff done. 

While I hope this game continues to be updated into something great, this game is supposedly a full release. However it definitely feels like early access. The upper area of your tavern is inaccessible and there is not a tone of content here. They have done a few updates, but there is no roadmap and it is unclear how much they plan to do.

 | Ale and Tavern has a cool idea with running a fantasy tavern with friends, but falls short in most areas. The best part is definitely the inn itself - hanging out with friends and pretending to be innkeepers can be a lot of fun, especially if you get into the role-playing side of things.

But man, the combat and quests are rough. Fighting feels sluggish with bad lag even when you're the host, and the weapons just feel weak and boring. There's barely any weapon choice, no real armour system, and levelling up your character feels super basic.

The quests are probably the biggest letdown - they're just boring old 'go kill X number of monsters' tasks that feel like they're from some ancient MMO. What's worse is that sometimes the monsters you need to kill don't even spawn, so you end up running around for ages looking for creatures that aren't even there.

The final boss pretty much sums up the game's problems - I just jumped on a wall where it couldn't reach me, and the whole fight was full of bugs anyway.

While running the tavern with friends can be a good time, especially if you're into role-playing, this one good feature can't make up for everything else that's wrong with the game. Right now, it feels like it needed way more work before release. Only buy this if you're really interested in the tavern part and have friends to play with - just don't expect much from the adventure side. | Довольно неплохая кооперативная игра на пару вечеров.

A monumental game in my gaming career, Half-Life 2 was that defining experience that made me realise I was in for something next level. For the first time i picked it up on The Orange Box in 2008, and from the moment I booted it up, I knew I was in for a wild ride. It wasn’t just a game—it was an event. The environments were absolutely massive, the atmosphere was unreal, and the soundtrack? Edgy as hell. Every moment felt like a cinematic journey.

In Half-Life 2, you play as Gordon Freeman, arguably one of the most reluctant action heroes in gaming. You awaken from stasis, burdened with the trauma of the previous game, and are immediately thrust into action as the figurehead of an uprising. This isn’t a simple revolution—it’s a battle against a multiversal alien threat, shrouded in dystopian themes and orchestrated by secretive organizations manipulating events behind the scenes.

Set in a world dominated by the Combine, an alien regime that combines interdimensional authoritarianism with advanced technology, you must navigate a planet under their control. Armed with little more than a crowbar and your signature nonverbalism, Gordon becomes the key figure in the resistance. As you progress, you'll engage in intense combat, solve puzzles, explore diverse environments, and uncover the unsettling truth that nothing in this world is as it seems.

And let’s talk about The G-Man—a mysterious, interdimensional CIA glowman who pops up like a bad dream and probably controls the entire charade like a cosmic puppeteer. Is he good? Is he bad? Is he just playing the long game? Who knows, but he’s definitely got his hand in everything, watching Gordon like a hawk, pulling strings like an invisible god. 

You’d think it’s just a sci-fi conspiracy, but after a while, you start questioning if anyone really knows what the hell is going on. Does G-Man even have a purpose, or is he just a cosmic observer who gets his kicks out of watching a man with a crowbar take on the end of the world?

The game’s narrative feels like a giant puzzle, and each step forward opens up even more questions, all while you’re tearing through enemy lines, trying to get answers. And the best part? It’s not all about combat—there are puzzles to solve, mysteries to uncover, and a sense of isolation that keeps you on edge, constantly wondering who or what will show up next. The pacing is incredible, making you feel like you’re a tiny piece of something far larger, with consequences that span across dimensions.

Now when the episodes are combines (haha) The user experience is smooth and now it is even moddable! 5/5 | 之前20周年更新开发者评论模式后我又打了一遍，阀是怎样做到的，让我反复爱上它们的游戏。在游戏里跟开发者评论一起探索是我最喜欢的事，我喜欢看游戏开发历程和小故事，实在是让人大开眼界。
为什么这个滑梯不能上去，这个跷跷板是可以玩的，原来这里也有小巧思，这里的电线是视觉引导物，怎样保持一个休闲和紧张的平衡，能在游戏里亲自上手跟看GDC或者工具箱是完全不一样的体验，我会贪婪地希望每一个我喜欢的游戏都添加开发者评论。 | "Half-Life 2" is one of the most influential and groundbreaking first-person shooters ever made. Released in 2004 by Valve, it redefined what players could expect from a video game in terms of both storytelling and gameplay. The game’s narrative is immersive, unfolding without traditional cutscenes, which allows the player to feel like they are truly part of the story. The protagonist, Gordon Freeman, is a silent hero who navigates through a dystopian world filled with alien invaders and oppressive human forces. This unique approach to storytelling pulls the player into the game’s world, making every action feel meaningful.

The physics engine in "Half-Life 2" was revolutionary for its time. The way objects interact with the environment feels natural and intuitive, and it became a major part of the gameplay. From solving puzzles using physics to creatively using the environment as a weapon, it was an innovation that influenced many games that followed. The gravity gun, which allows players to manipulate objects in real-time, is still one of the most memorable and fun weapons in gaming history.

The level design in "Half-Life 2" is another standout feature. The game introduces players to varied environments, from the dark, industrial city of City 17 to the eerie, remote marshlands. Each location feels carefully crafted, with attention to detail that makes the world feel alive. The pacing is also masterful, alternating between moments of intense combat and slower, atmospheric sequences that allow the player to soak in the environment and story.

The AI in "Half-Life 2" was also ahead of its time. Enemies behave intelligently, using cover, working together, and reacting to the player’s actions in a way that makes combat more dynamic and challenging. The enemy variety, from the terrifying Combine soldiers to the creepy headcrabs, keeps the gameplay fresh and engaging. The interactions with NPCs and the world around you help build a sense of tension and immersion, keeping you on edge throughout the experience.

The game's soundtrack, composed by Kelly Bailey, perfectly complements the atmosphere, using subtle but effective music to enhance both the action and the quieter moments. The sound design is top-notch, with ambient sounds adding to the immersion, whether you're in a busy city street or exploring a deserted warehouse.

Ultimately, "Half-Life 2" is a masterpiece that still holds up to this day. Its innovative gameplay, storytelling, and technical achievements make it a game that set a new standard for the industry. It’s a game that’s not just fun to play, but one that’s easy to appreciate for the way it shaped the future of video games. Even though it’s been years since its release, "Half-Life 2" remains a classic that continues to inspire both players and developers alike.

Half-Life: Deathmatch: Source is a multiplayer first-person shooter developed by Valve. It is a remake of the classic Half-Life deathmatch mode, utilizing the Source engine. The game combines the fast-paced action of traditional deathmatch with updated graphics and more fluid movement mechanics. While it successfully brings new life to the original concept, some mechanical issues and a niche player base prevent it from being as popular as its predecessors.

What Works Well?
🎮 Classic Deathmatch Gameplay
The core of Half-Life: Deathmatch is its tight, fast-paced combat. It stays true to the original deathmatch mode, offering classic weapons, high-speed action, and simple, enjoyable mechanics. The formula remains as fun today as it was when first introduced.

🌆 Updated Graphics with Source Engine
The move to the Source engine has significantly improved the visuals compared to the original. The lighting, textures, and models are much sharper, breathing new life into the iconic Half-Life universe. The environments feel more immersive, and physics interactions are more dynamic.

🔫 Familiar Weapon Set
Players have access to a variety of classic weapons from the Half-Life series, including the crowbar, shotgun, and crossbow, all of which perform as expected. Each weapon has its own strategic value, and they all function well within the confines of the deathmatch setting.

🛠️ Modding Support and Custom Servers
As with other Source engine games, Deathmatch: Source allows for a robust modding community. Players can easily find custom servers and user-created content, from new maps to modified gameplay modes, keeping the experience fresh.

What Could Be Better?
❌ Limited Popularity and Player Base
Despite its solid foundation, Half-Life: Deathmatch: Source suffers from a relatively small player base. As newer games in the genre continue to dominate, it can be difficult to find active matches, especially in more niche servers.

❌ Physics Can Feel Clunky
While the Source engine improved many aspects of the game, some of the physics—especially in terms of movement—can feel a little awkward compared to modern shooters. The transition to 3D space feels a bit more restrictive than anticipated, particularly when compared to the fluidity of more modern games.

❌ No Significant Gameplay Innovation
While the updated graphics and better physics are great, Deathmatch: Source doesn't introduce any major changes to the original formula. It feels more like a polished port rather than a revolutionary step forward for the genre. Players expecting something drastically new may be disappointed.

❌ Lack of Meaningful Progression
Like many classic deathmatch games, there’s a lack of meaningful progression or any form of unlockable content. While this keeps the focus on pure skill-based play, some players may miss the more modern systems that reward long-term engagement.

Conclusion
Half-Life: Deathmatch: Source is a solid multiplayer shooter for fans of the classic Half-Life experience. Its updated visuals and iconic weapons deliver the fun, high-speed action that fans love, but its small player base and lack of major innovation hold it back from achieving greater popularity. If you’re looking for nostalgic deathmatch action or enjoy modding, it’s a great choice, but don’t expect a revolutionary experience.

Don't have too much expectations of the story, though, it's not necessarily bad but I don't think you'll find anything new or inspiring. | A hidden gem

Definitely worth trying out if you appreciate good level design or the Dishonored games, as it's very clear that foundations of that started in this game | Игра моего детства! It surprisingly holds up great even now. The story itself is fairly basic, but there's fun world building and a whole lot of really unique characters. The animation is very solid and not stiff like one would expect from that era. Each mind you get to explore has a personal style themed to it and they explore wildly different ideas. Even some fun way of trying out your new powers with the scavenger hunt.

The only negative I have would be the mechanical side, movement and actions can feel clunky and not always working properly. And the audio quality not being fully consistent with some voice lines.

It will be interesting to see the improvements made in Psychonauts 2. You can really feel that this game was made with love and dedication, it oozes charm. | çok eğlenceli sıra dışı bir yapım TR yama da kurdum akıp gidiyor , çünkü az ingilizce yetmiyor oyun için kısmi platform oyunu ama hikayesi esprileri gayet ayarında yapılmış tavsiye ederim | Funny, quirky adventure.
Although the later stages might be annoying, the level designs are really fascinating.
This game has been on my backlog for almost 8 years; finally, I played it from beginning to end. | Psychonauts is a great game that has some of the best writing in the Video Game history BUT time also hasn't been very kind to this game in terms of control and combat.

Firstly, the games story, writing, voice acting, etc is all top notch and it has some of the best environmental storytelling out there (with exception to the sequel). Raz (the main protagonist) is a fantastic character and the voice job by Horvits is top notch. 

Graphically this game doesn't hold up too well and it's not for the art style. While the Art Style can definitely be divisive personally I think it's fine. It's later polished up and I think looks way better in the sequel but here it's fine if not a bit ugly at times. However the art style mixed with original xbox graphics and low resolution cut-scenes can make parts of the game just look bad and dated.

The real part that makes this game not be a masterpiece is the combat and to a lesser extent the movement. The combat is clunky and tough to get the hang of (another thing fixed in the sequel). The movement is fine but the Levitation ability is completely overpowered which while fun completely negates a lot of the platforming challenge.

The games world and main hub (whispering rock psychic summer camp) is charming and fun to explore but the first levels or minds can feel very tutorialized making the start of the game one of the weakest if you're not fully exploring the hub. The game really picks up halfway when the story pivots to its main objective (not to spoil anything) and takes you away from the camp to really go into the best minds in the game. Sadly the final level is a mess. It's not this super insane challenging level it got over time but it's way tougher than the rest of the game and the bad and clunky combat makes it a frustrating chore.

Overall you play the original Psychonauts for the incredible story, fun word, and cleaver writing and not the combat/platforming. If you do pick this up (which I recommend if you're interested) be prepare to endure some dated gameplay to get to the parts that made this game a cult classic.

8/10 - Infinite | Fantastic game. Contains somewhat dated jokes but that's a time capsule of the era if anything. Varied levels, enjoyable dialogue with various characters. I recommend playing this, and it goes on dirt cheap sales as well. So wishlist it if anything :)

Prey is an old fps that can still be played today (2025). The story is interesting and involves an alien abduction.  There are several very original (organic) "guns" found as the story develops. The gameplay is very linear where you have to go through several sections to progress. There are several easily solvable puzzle throughout the game. The enemy encounters are fairly easy even though died several times. You respawn on the spot you died after a short mini game. You carry a lighter but there is very little use of dark areas.
A solid fps worth one playthrough.

[b][i] Doom is eternal. [/i][/b] | [h1][b]ANÁLISIS DE [i]DOOM + DOOM II[/i]:[/b][/H1]

Pack renovado por Nightdive Studios de los dos primeros Doom, con un montón de mejoras y añadidos para disfrutarlo mejor que nunca. 

Como ya sabréis la mayoría, Doom supuso una auténtica revolución en el mundo de los videojuegos al ser uno de los más influyentes juegos de disparos en primera persona  de la historia, siendo prácticamente el origen de la popularidad del género; por su apartado gráfico revolucionario con sus texturas detalladas y especialmente su entorno 3D con una inmersión nunca vista hasta la fecha; por su modo multijugador que permitía jugar a través de LAN, lo cual fue todo un avance en el mundillo de los videojuegos; y también por el variado diseño de la gran cantidad de niveles laberínticos de los que disponía, llenos de secretos.

A pesar de que Doom salió en 1993, acabo de pasármelo completándolo al 100% y he de decir de que a pesar del paso del tiempo y de que como es lógico a nivel gráfico se ha quedado completamente desfasado, sigue siendo uno de los juegos más adictivos y frenéticos que puedes encontrar en la actualidad.

Este pack incluye: Doom I, Doom II, TNT: Evilution, The Plutonia Experiment, Master Levels for Doom II, No rest for the Living, Sigil y Legacy of Rust, un nuevo episodio totalmente exclusivo. Esto nos asegura una cantidad enorme de horas de juego, más si queremos encontrar los secretos de los niveles o conseguir el 100% de logros disponibles. 

Además de todo este contenido, tiene mejoras en cuando al apartado gráfico, gracias al motor gráfico KEX que permite una mejor renderización, pudiendo usar resoluciones de hasta 4K y 120FPS, además de mejoras en cuanto a texturas y efectos. 

Se ha remasterizado la banda sonora, pudiendo elegir entre la versión MIDI o la nueva versión IDKFA de Andrew Hulshult (podéis disfrutarla en Spotify: [url=https://open.spotify.com/intl-es/album/2YqpDPPwqaKCoSBe36hVAe?si=eD-MuFIXSVuMkAjg1y8aCA]Banda sonora IDKFA de DOOM + DOOM II por Andrew Hulshult en Spotify[/url]. Es una auténtica maravilla el trabajo realizado, aunque como pega hay que decir también que se echa en falta que hicieran lo mismo con la BSO de TNT: Evilution o Sigil por ejemplo, que no están remasterizadas.

Sobre la nueva expansión exclusiva llamada Legacy of Rust, realizada en colaboración entre id Software, Nightdive Studios y MachineGames, incluye 16 nuevos mapas divididos en dos secciones: The Vulcan Abyss y Counterfeit Eden, añadiendo además nuevos enemigos y armas. 

A modo de resumen, mi lista de pros y contras:

[H1][b]PROS:[/b][/H1]

- 2 de los mejores FPS de todos los tiempos, que cambiaron la historia de los videojuegos para siempre

- Que hayan incluido las mejoras totalmente gratis para los que ya teníamos los clásicos en la biblioteca

- Que hayan remasterizado toda la banda sonora de Doom y Doom 2

- Es la mejor forma de disfrutar de estos clásicos

- La enorme variedad de enemigos

- La variedad de armas disponibles

- Que hayan incluido todas las expansiones

- Las mejoras para seleccionar el arma

- Compatibilidad total con mandos (para quien quiera jugarlo así, aunque con ratón + teclado es mucho mejor en mi opinión)

- Montones de horas de juego aseguradas si quieres completar el 100% de logros

- La nueva campaña Legacy of Rust, con nuevos enemigos y armas

- La ingente cantidad de secretos repartidos por los niveles

- Muy rejugable

- Los controles mejorados

- Traducido al español

- Tan divertido y frenético como antaño

- El gore

- La ingente cantidad de enemigos en pantalla al mismo tiempo

- Que tenga la opción de quicksave / quickload

- Tiene una gran cantidad de logros Steam

- Tiene sistema de guardado de la partida en la nube Steam Cloud

[H1][b]CONTRAS:[/b][/H1]

- Se echan en falta más opciones de configuración y mejoras gráficas, como el filtrado de las texturas. Solo da la opción de jugarlo con la estética retro con las texturas pixeladas, habiendo ya muchos mods que lo superan a nivel visual

- Que no se pueda mirar libremente con el ratón como ocurre como otros juegos similares remasterizados de la de la época, como Duke Nukem 3D o Blood

- Que no se pueda saltar ni agacharse, siempre fue de lo poco que no me gustó en su día de Doom y es algo que ha envejecido mal

- Es muy fácil perderse en los niveles
 
- Que no se haya remasterizado la música de TNT: Evilution ni la de Sigil entre otros

- He sufrido muchas salidas al escritorio, es bastante inestable. Hace falta pulirlo algo más

[H1]Conclusión:[/h1]
------------------------
IMPRESCINDIBLE. Doom es historia de los videojuegos, todo amante de la acción y de los FPS debe tenerlo en su biblioteca sí o sí, lo jugaras o no en su día. Una auténtica obra maestra que ha sido cuidada con mucho mimo por parte de Nightdive Studios en este pack.

Si mi análisis te ha gustado o te ha servido de ayuda, agradecería que dejaras un voto positivo para que pueda llegar a más gente. También se agradecen los premios. ¡Gracias por leerme! No dudéis en dejar vuestros comentarios o dudas, responderé lo antes posible.

1993年12.10日DOOM1  秘籍代码 
iddqd  上帝模式
idkfa  给予全部物品
idfa  给予全部物品（除了钥匙）
idmypos  显示位置坐标
idspispopd  穿模模式（穿墙，可以整个地图随便跑。穿墙看隐藏房间等）
idbeholda  电子区域地图（自动地图秘籍代码第一次使用效果类似）
iddt  自动地图全开（第一次使用，显示未开发区域。第二次用全部显示，静止或移动敌人包括弹药护甲物品均以绿色三角显示。第三次使用，将自动地图恢复正常。）
idbeholdv  无敌（大约29秒的无敌时间。只是不掉血，画面呈现出颜色反转似的黑白色）
idbeholds  狂暴
idbeholdi  部分隐身
idbeholdr  防辐射服（可以无伤下绿辐射水）
idbeholdl  光线强化目镜（黑的地方全部光亮且能看见，过段时间失效）
idchoppers  给予电锯

[h2]理不尽忍耐パズルゲー[/h2]
同色のピースを３つそろえると消えて色に応じたマナが溜まる。そのマナをためて自分を有利にする呪文を唱えたり、相手を攻撃して敵を倒すCPU対戦型パズルゲーム。
RPG形式でストーリーが進んで行ってそこは全然かまわないし楽しかったけどとにかくゲーム性が理不尽。
他のレビューでも散見されるけど、[u]とにかくCPU側に都合が良すぎる落ちコンとピースの発生の連続。[/u]
こちらが何かを消せばそのせいでまた相手に都合の良いパズルピースが発生してそれを消される。
たったの３ターンでこちらは水のマナ9に対して相手は4属性のマナが20超えとかざらに発生する。
相手のインチキ落ちコンが発生する度に思わず「ハイハイすごいね～強いね～」と乾いた笑いが出る。
こんな方法でしかゲームバランスを調整できないのかと失笑してしまう。
自分はストーリーが気になったから長時間プレイしましたが、その実情は理不尽コンボが発生する度にイラついて起動したまま放置してネットサーフィンしたりしていたので、実際のプレイ時間は1/4以下だと思います。ゲーム性はハッキリ言って良くない。ひたすら忍耐の連続。
１０回殴られて顔に3回唾を吐きかけられても１回のビンタで許してあげる事の出来る人におすすめ。 | Stat-Farming?
-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--=-=-=-=-

  Ok this is a fairly controversial issue on the message boards.  
Stat-farming is when the player gets alot of gold and spends it on stat 
points in the temple so he/she can max his/her stats. This method usually 
relies on using seiged towns to produce money and the player may spend hours
going from town to town getting money to spend on stats. Stat-farming also 
requires the player to not spend any stat points before he/she does it, why?
Because the more points you have in the skill, the more it costs to add 
points to it. So what YOU should do is save all your level up points until 
your done stat-farming then spend them on on what you would like to upgrade 
once you finish your stat-farming session. Heres what I think,I stat farm 
for about 1 and a half hours on a playthrough, I get as much money as I can
in that amount of time using a specific money route and spend 50 points 
worth on fire and the rest on the other masteries just to balance things 
alot a little better. Why 50 points on fire? Because the max limit for stat
points is 255 points and you recieve 196 from just level-up points.50+196
(because you should spend every level-up point on fire) is 246 giving you 
about 10 points of room away from the point cap of 255. I have this 
"giveway" room because if you exceed 255 points than your mastery goes back 
down to zero. The extra room is for quests that give fire points 
automatically that weay you dont screw yourself over :).



			   ***How and When to Stat Farm***

  So you want to stat farm, huh? I'm warning you that after you do it the 
game becomes a real pushover in terms of difficulty. If you are still 
willing to I will tell you how to stat farm effectively. 

When to Stat Farm: Personally I do it beofre Dugog because I believe he is 
the hardest boss to fight in the game. I stat farm before him so that I can 
beat him easily as opposed to trying 20 times to kill him while i'm weak.

How to Stat Farm: OK, some people use the "Stolen Catapult" quest which 
gives myou a fair amount of gold for completeing it by I seige cities and 
accept tribute. The cities I seige are Enmouth, Galia and Drakenburg. After 
these cities are seiged I use a route that goes like this: 

1. Start at Skellheim(between Drakenburg and Galia) on the 1st or 4th.
2. Go to Galia.
3. Go to Bartonia.
4. Then Enmouth.
5. Then Elenia(between Enmouth and Bartonia).
6. Go back to Enmouth
7. All the way back down to Drakenburg 
8. Go to Skellheim.
9. Then back to Drakenburg.
10 Then to Skellheim and your back where you started except 2700(something 
like that) gold richer.
11. Spend it at the temple on Fire and other masteries. | THE match-3 RPG. Give it a shot!

Game Name: The Witcher: Enhanced Edition Director's Cut
Reviews:
Este jogo é incrível, mas não é para todos, ele possui uma complexidade tática única, o que vai faz muita gente achar ele difícil quando na verdade se você usar a estratégia certa ele fica relativamente fácil.

[b]Jogue este o jogo se você:[/b]
[list]
[*] Gosta de Leitura.
[*] Gosta de RPG.
[*] Gosta de explorar.
[*] Gosta de Jogos com características táticas complexas.
[*] Gosta de jogos clássicos como os primeiros Dark Souls e Neverwinter Nights.
[*] Tem disposição para coletar e craftar itens.
[/list]

[b]Evite este jogo se:[/b]
[list]
[*] Não gosta de Leitura, (Há muita coisa para ler no jogo)
[*] Não gosta de RPG ou escolhas complexas.
[*] Não gosta de ficar perdendo tempo falando com todos npcs e entrando em todos os lugares.
[*] Gosta apenas de lutar metendo a espada nos inimigos sem frescuras como magia e alquimia.
[*] Não gosta de jogos datados ou com jogabilidade estranha.
[*] Não quer perder tempo coletando e craftando itens.
[/list]

[b]Alquimia[/b]

O uso de poções não é opcional, é OBRIGATÓRIO. Neste jogo você precisa coletar itens como plantas e partes de animais, comprar e ler formulas para poções e óleos, crafta-los e usar de acordo com o contexto, inimigo e sua estratégia. Essas informações custam caro no jogo, tanto em tempo conversando com npcs quanto em ouro para comprar as formulas. 

[b]Inimigos e Combates[/b]

A parte mais divertida para mim e mais odiada para outros. No jogo você possui uma espada de prata e uma de aço, além de 3 estilos de combate, você precisa usar a arma certa no estilo de combate certo contra o inimigo certo, e juntamente com isso combinar a magia e alquimia para explorar as fraquezas dos adversários, isso é fundamental especialmente nos chefes. 

Os pontos fracos dos monstros e chefes do jogo também não são de graça, você precisa comprar livros, e falar com npcs para descobri-los, o que você pode facilmente perder durante a progressão do game ou simplesmente ficar sem dinheiro para adquirir as informações, deixando o game mais difícil e menos rico em termos de lore. De posse da informação você precisa ficar consultado o codex do jogo para elaborar as estratégias de combate. 

As coisas não explicitas no codex, por exemplo, ele diz que o chefe do primeiro capitulo é pouco vulnerável a magia Aard, se você se deu o trabalho de aprender ou usar a magia Aard em combate sabe que ela tonteia os inimigos possibilitando que você os mate com um só golpe. 

De posse dessas duas informações você pode elaborar a estratégia de fortalecer o Aard para matar o chefe "super difícil" do capitulo 1 com apenas um golpe.  Mas cabe ao jogador chegar nesta conclusão e planejar com antecedência. Parece algo simples mas a maioria dos jogadores não o fazem pois jogam irrefletidamente. [b]The Witcher não vai te pegar pela mão. cabe a você pegar os insumos que o jogo te oferece para ter uma boa experiência[/b].

[b]História[/b]

A lore da série witcher dispensa comentários, só não posso deixar de mencionar que em diversos momentos o jogo tem coloca entre escolhas morais de fritar a cabeça. Você sempre se pega tentando entender qual a coisa certa até se dar conta que no jogo não existe isto de coisa certa, e que ninguém é inocente.

Uma coisa importante é que a história avança de forma inesperada, é normal coisas ficarem para trás na primeira jogada, sempre tenha isso em mente ao entrar em um lugar ou completar uma quest, as vezes o jogo avança e algumas quests não podem ser completadas, outras o jogador acaba deixando passar. Desta forma o jogo tem um valor alta para quem for re-jogar. | Après avoir fini le jeu en 63h, je ne peux que le recommander.

Certes, il n'est plus au goût du jour, mais n'oublions pas qu'il date de 2008 : 

-  la fluidité des mouvements n'est pas celle d'un jeu de 2019 
-  la réactivité peut parfois être légèrement ennuyante (dégainer 3 plombes après le début du combat) 

Et pour ceux/celles qui n'aiment pas faire des allers-retours pour une quête, qui n'aiment pas prendre le temps de dialoguer pour récolter un maximum d'informations, passer votre chemin ! Par ailleurs, c'est un RPG ... il faut bien s'y attendre.  

Cependant, il reste immersif et on se laisse prendre au jeu ... et puis ... toute trilogie ne commence-t-elle pas par le 1e épisode si l'on veut en comprendre l'histoire complète ?   

N'hésitez plus ...

Sans compter que 1,19€ pour 63h de jeu (soit 0.018€ / h) ... 

Bon, allez ... GO pour "The Witcher 2" !!! | The Witcher 3で初めてこのゲームタイトルを知りました。
３は本当に楽しませてもらい、物語をもっと深く知りたかったので
今回The Witcher 1の購入に踏み切りました。

安かったのもあり動いたらラッキー程度の感覚でしたが、なんとこのゲーム、windows10で動きます。
wikiにある日本語化MODもまだ生きているので驚きの連続でした。

windows10で動作するのかどうかが気がかりで、パーッと調べても答えが出てこなかったので、
このレビューが皆様の役に立つことを願っております。

ちなみにThe Witcher 2も、windows10で動作します。

Genel anlamda internet ortamında açıkça ve rahatlıkla eleştiri yapacak bir düzeye gelmişken ayrıca bir çok şeye tek bir tıkla ulaşıp araştırma imkanınız varken kendi fikirlerinizi oluşturmayıp neden başkalarından duyduğunuz şeyleri savunuyor ve insanlara yanlış algılar hediye ediyorsunuz ?

Yapmayın..

"Gerekli laf söyleme kısmını geçtiğimi göre şimdi oyundan bahsedebiliriz"

Her şeyin başlangıcı olarak verilmese de karakteri tanımamız ve hikayeyi anlayabilmemiz için gerekli oyun olarak karşımıza çıkıyor Witcher 1.

Çok güzel bir senaryo hazırlanmış öncesi hakkında bir fikrimiz yok sonrası ise tamamen muamma ilerledikçe kendimize ve hikayeye dair ip uçları ediniyor ve bir şekilde kafamızda yaşananları şekillendirmeye başlıyoruz.

[spoiler]Oyunun en başında karşımıza çıkan çocuğun en sonunda karşımıza çıkacağını kim bilebilir ki ?[/spoiler]

Oyun sırasında çok fazla npc ile diyalog kurabiliyor ana karakterimiz adına seçim yapmamız gereken çok fazla sahne ile karşılaşıyoruz.

Yetenek ağacı ise gerçekten harika oynamak istediğiniz stile yatırım yaptıkça harika kombolar ve hızlandırmalar sunuyor.

Dövüş sistemi sanıldığının aksine birazcık refleks birazcık dikkatli oynamak mantığında ilerliyor yeterli upgrade'leri alırsanız karşınızdaki 10 kişiyi havada 5 takla atarak inanılmaz artist şekillerde kesebiliyorsunuz.

Görev mantığı ise harika tüm oyunlarında olduğu gibi hangisinin side hangisinin main quest olduğunu size veriyor ve en önemli kısmı o görevleri yapabilmek için sadece bulunduğunuz haritada değil başka haritalara gidip gelebiliyorsunuz.

"Emek veriyorsunuz"

Bu oyun için gerçekten emek veriyorsunuz eski olmasına rağmen tek bir anında bile beni sıkmayan başından saatlerce kalkmadığım bir oyun oldu Witcher benim için.

Her anında insanları tek tek tanımak hikayelerini dinlemek yeri geldiğinde sarhoş olup ağzınlarından laf almak yeri geldiğinde genel evdeki kızlara çiçek götürmek her anı ile gerçekten harika bir oyun Witcher 1.

Yaptığım seçimler sırasında gerçekten zorlandığım noktalar oldu ben olsam ne yapardım Gerald aslında ne yapar kısımlarında bazı seçim ekranlarında oturup düşünmüşlüğüm var ve her şeyin sonunda tamamen benim verdiğim kararlara göre şekillenmiş bir son çıktı karşıma.,

Oyun beni tatmin etti mi ? Fazlasıyla..
Oyundan keyif aldım mı ? İnanılmaz derece..
Peki oyunun grafikleri çok mu kötü ? Hayır kesinlikle değil
Peki oyunun combat sistemi çok mu saçma ya da çok mu zor ? Hayır aslında inanılmaz basit
Peki gerçekten hikayeyi anlamak için ilk oyunu oynamamız mı gerekiyor ? "EVET"

Neden bu kadar agresif cevaplar veriyorum ? şu yüzden..

Oyuna başladığım günün sabahında Discord da masum masum oyunu oynuyorken discordda ki arkadaşlarımızdan birisi yanıma geldi ve sırf Enis K. isimli youtuber'ın videosunu izlediği için abi o oyuna rework şart yaa gibisinden bir cümle kullandı..
Mikrofondan yumruk atabilmeyi gerçekten çok isterdim..

İlk oyunu oynamana gerek yok diğer oyunlarda hikayeyi anlayabiliyorsun diyen arkadaşlarım dostlarım..
İlk oyunda öldürüp öldürmemenin kararı sana bırakılmış karakterler diğer oyunda sırf senin yaptığın seçime göre karşına çıkabiliyorken..
3. Oyunda dahi diyaloğa gireceğimiz karakterlerin başlangıç hikayelerini ilk oyunda öğrenirken..
Firma oyunun hikayesinin temelini ilk oyunda yaptığını açıklamışken ne demek lan ilk oyunu oynama diğer oyunlarda anlaşılıyor ??

Düşünsene Matrix'i öneriyorsun arkadaşına ve diyorsun ki ilk film'i izleme adam işte Matrix oluyor..
Lan oluyor da o sırada yaşadıkları ne oluyor ? o etrafındaki insanlar nereden geliyor ? o herif Matrix olana kadar neler çekiyor ?

Oyun indirim döneminde ciklet parasına kadar düşüyorken lütfen alıp kendiniz tecrübe edin..
Yine beğenmezseniz ben hep buradayım. Oturur konuşur tartışırız.


Dikkat: " Bu incelemeyi okurken yorum ekranında bol bol devrik cümle, erken bitirilmiş diyaloglar ve açıklamalarda yumuşatılma hissedebilirsiniz. İnsanlara atar yapmamam gerektiğini kendime söyleyerek yazmış birisi olarak bu açıklamayıp da yapma gereksinimi duydum " 

Teşekkürler.

I decided to play this first-person beat 'em up again with my brother, [i]years[/i] after having experienced it via Xbox Live.  And it's a great experience still, holding up far better for me than the likes of [i]Braid[/i] and [i]Limbo[/i].  That's strange, since 2D was and is easier to make [i]immediately[/i] playable on a smaller dev budget.  Now, there [i]is[/i] a little jank in this, as you would expect to find in a [b]3D indie game[/b] made before there was even a real 2D indie boom -- but not nearly as much as I feared.  The wild [b]bio-punk[/b] style comes through as strong as ever without RTX/SSAO/8K textures/DLSS and whatever all the rest of the game-delaying, budget-bloating nonsense is -- and I found myself getting sucked right back in to the wacky world of Zenozoik after knocking about an even jankier and much less interesting reality for a decade-plus.

Such jank as you might experience is all baked into the game engine, primarily in the slight sense of [i]delay[/i] and the queuing you get with the melee inputs.  Ghat's main fisty combo, for instance, is set off by [b]holding[/b] the button down until it is complete, with the other button for hard attacks.  It's polished enough that you can definitely [i]get good[/i] at it, but sometimes the delay will make you feel like a madman flailing with rage when you're in the thick of a big battle.  It kind of works in a [i]thematic[/i] sense, really, when you consider the savage world you're in.  Some people complain about the gun combat too, but I think it works well enough; Ghat and his big extended family mostly fight with feet and fists, and since these biopunk guns, all made of bone, stone, and sinew, take work to reload and aim, [i]of course[/i] they might feel a trifle more awkward than those in a legit FPS.  I know it sounds like trying to wallpaper flaws with an imagined [b]meta-connection[/b] between story and gameplay, but it's seriously fine and feels good when you're actually playing and soaking up all the vibes.

Back in the 2009 of its original release, a lot of people played this because there weren't a lot of options -- it just so happened to be a very good, very memorable game despite the widespread attention it incidentally received.  Nowadays, it will appeal more to the PC indie crowd I think.  It's short, engrossing, and costs as much as a sachet of corn nuts when it's on sale, so why not throw it on the ol' wishlist? | Un clasico, quizas hoy no impresione mucho, pero en el contexto de este juego es super innovador, creativo y original. Trine - первая игра в серии с одноименным названием. Жанр игры называется 2.5д, потому что все объекты в приницпе 3д, но при этом угол обзора дается только через бок, но это не мешает игре быть веселой и занимательной. Каждая игра выходит в промежуток в 4 года, кроме 3 частей игры, о которой я напишу позже.

Геймплей: мы играем за трех персонажей сразу и просто переключаемся между ними, чтобы сражаться или решать головоломки. Персонажи: Рыцарь Понтий, Воровка Зоя и Волшебник Амадей. Эти трое были зачарованы магическим артефактом под названием Trine, и теперь игроку предстоит разузнать что это за артефакт и как перестать быть связанным с персонажами.

Кооператив: в игре присутствует кооп режим, который я не пробовал, но людям, которым нравятся играть в одиночку, проходить игру будет удобно.

 | The game also comes with a DLC, which includes the following items:

1. A Toxic Community: Mistakes are rarely forgiven. Unless you’re playing with friends, be prepared to face harsh criticism, often from younger players. The game’s multiplayer is largely populated by school-aged players who don’t hold back.


2. Disruptive Adults: It’s not just the kids causing chaos—some adults blast music through their microphones, assuming everyone else shares their taste. Spoiler: they don’t.


3. Frequent AFKs: Teamwork can fall apart when a teammate goes inactive, whether they’re brewing tea, taking a smoke break, or simply wandering off mid-game. And yes, it often happens right after you’ve generously used your first aid kit on them.


4. Team Abandonment: Lone wolves running off to the far corners of the map, only to be overwhelmed by infected, are a common sight. They’re quick to flood the chat with colorful language before rage-quitting the game.


5. Difficulty Disputes: Some players join games on "Expert" difficulty only to demand a downgrade. If their request is denied, they might sabotage the team before leaving the server entirely.


6. Vote Kicks: Occasionally, you’ll encounter players who inexplicably start a vote to kick you from the game. When you ask why? Crickets.



The Verdict: Despite the chaotic community, Left 4 Dead 2 remains a phenomenal experience. The graphics are a significant step up from the first game, the mechanics feel more polished, and there’s a greater variety of weapons and infected to enjoy. However, surviving the online experience without a calming remedy might be just as challenging as surviving the zombie apocalypse itself. | Крутая игра для игры с друзьями (которые в это не играют)! В общем, весело, рекомендую. | [h1]写了800字的推荐文，手欠点了一下"否"全没了。不说了血压高了,头晕。[/h1]总之就是《关于一个萌新GMOD玩久了无聊直接去玩L4D1多人因太菜反复被僵尸虐而被队友抛弃伤心自责卸载游戏过半年好奇进L4D2知道玩单人熟悉官图及玩法过程中发现了能打MOD结果一发不可收拾地搜各种进阶攻略教程提升自己游戏体验和能力努力不坑队友可仍然很菜但是很感谢带萌新入坑的朋友们以及创意工坊的大佬们给这游戏第二次生命的事》 | Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2), released by Valve in 2009, is the gold standard for cooperative zombie shooters. Featuring intense survival gameplay, smart AI, and an incredible atmosphere, L4D2 delivers an unmatched multiplayer experience. With its fast-paced action, diverse weapons, and unpredictable enemy encounters, this game remains one of the most thrilling and replayable co-op shooters ever made.

Gameplay – Pure, Adrenaline-Fueled Action
L4D2 is all about co-op survival. You and three teammates must fight through hordes of the undead, navigating through various maps and completing objectives to reach safety. The key to survival? Teamwork, strategy, and adaptability.

The gunplay is tight and satisfying, with a wide selection of weapons including assault rifles, shotguns, SMGs, sniper rifles, and melee weapons like axes, katanas, and even frying pans! Every encounter feels dynamic, thanks to the AI Director, which adjusts the difficulty based on your team’s performance, ensuring no two playthroughs are ever the same.

Special Infected – Enemies That Keep You on Edge
Beyond the standard zombie horde, L4D2 introduces Special Infected that force players to work together:

Tank – A massive brute that can throw debris and crush survivors.
Witch – A terrifying enemy that, if startled, can instantly incapacitate a survivor.
Smoker – Uses a long tongue to drag players away from their team.
Hunter – A fast, agile infected that pounces on survivors and pins them down.
Boomer – Explodes in a shower of bile, attracting a massive horde.
Charger – Charges through groups, slamming a survivor into the ground.
Spitter – Creates pools of acid that deal heavy damage.
Each Special Infected forces different team strategies, making communication and positioning absolutely crucial.

Campaigns & Maps – A Horror Movie Experience
L4D2 features multiple campaigns, each set in diverse, apocalyptic locations across the southern U.S.:

Dead Center – A chaotic mall escape reminiscent of classic zombie films.
The Parish – A tense race across New Orleans to reach an evacuation zone.
Swamp Fever – A creepy, foggy swamp filled with infected dangers.
Hard Rain – A unique campaign featuring a devastating hurricane that changes the environment.
Dark Carnival – A fan-favorite, featuring a deadly amusement park with a thrilling rollercoaster finale.
Each campaign feels like a mini zombie movie, packed with cinematic set pieces, interactive environments, and intense finales.

Multiplayer & Game Modes – Endless Replayability
L4D2 offers several game modes that keep the action fresh:

Campaign Mode – Classic co-op survival through story-driven levels.
Versus Mode – One team plays as survivors, while the other controls the Special Infected.
Survival Mode – See how long you can last against endless waves of zombies.
Scavenge Mode – A competitive mode where teams race to collect fuel cans while being hunted.
Mutation Mode – Weekly game modifiers that add fun twists to gameplay.
Thanks to modding support and the Steam Workshop, the community has also created hundreds of custom maps, weapons, and campaigns, making L4D2’s replayability practically infinite.

Graphics & Sound – Immersive and Timeless
Even years after release, L4D2’s atmospheric lighting, detailed environments, and gruesome effects hold up well. Zombies react realistically to gunfire, and the sound design is masterful, with eerie background noises, terrifying growls from Special Infected, and intense musical cues that heighten the suspense.

The voice acting and character interactions bring the survivors to life, making them memorable and adding humor to the chaos.

Why Left 4 Dead 2 is a Must-Play
L4D2 is the perfect blend of action, horror, and co-op gameplay. Whether you’re playing with friends or AI teammates, the intense combat, unpredictable enemy encounters, and endless replayability make every match a thrilling adventure.

🔹 Final Rating: 10/10
Left 4 Dead 2 is a masterpiece of cooperative gaming. If you love zombies, action, and teamwork, this is an absolute must-play that still delivers endless fun and excitement after more than a decade.

Shame to give this game a negative review, as its otherwise a solid 8/10. But frequent, basically unfixable, crashing on modern systems has left this older title basically unplayable. Supposedly the GOG version is more stable, but that has sadly never come over to Steam. Valve ought to make it a priority to either fix or remove from the store games that don't work. 

What this game is, though, is Warhammer: Total War-Bretonnia edition. You play as King Arthur in a Total War style campaign pitting you against your fellow Englishmen, Romans, and a whole host of monsters and baddies from English lore. Like in any classic Total War game you manage settlements and armies on the main strategy map, as well as event & decision chains which is where the 'roleplaying' aspect comes in. In battles, you control your force, wield powerful magics, try not to get blasted by the games very powerful archers, and fight your way to victory. The game nails the feel of a TW campaign, and the inclusion of both strong story elements, powerful monsters & characters, plus magic gave the game a very unique feel vs. Medieval or Napoleon, which were contemporaries of this game. One wonders if when WH1 was in development if CA took a hard look at this game, because I see a lot of that game's DNA in this. 

Beyond technical issues, though, the game always sort of lacked something. Battles were small, units are often below 50 entities. Archers are OP, so much so that there is an option in the menu to nerf them! And magics seemed to either be nukes, or do nothing, and so also never quite felt right. And of course, the whole game lacked the polish that WH1 and sequels have. It was good-but-not-great looking even at the time, and a lot has aged badly since then. But past that, this game was a winner back in the day and could be again today. IF you can get it running. I have had to give this a thumbs down simply because in my most recent play attempts I crashed repeatedly crossing the ford in the tutorial. Apparently a common problem area. The 4gb patch and the alternate launcher and EXE all have failed to resolve my troubles, so here we are. Another classic game on Steam, still up for sale, no longer working on modern systems. | -геймдизайн. глючный сплав текстового квеста и тотал вора с туповатым ИИ.
~сюжет. король Артур, на нас напали! мифология мелкобритов.
~графика. староватое. | Leider gibt es einen rolltime error der es erfordet nach fast jeder schlacht neu zu laden! Schade ansonsten ein super spiel für strategie, rollenspiel und welteroberer!

This game is old, and it shows but it is slightly better than it appears. I nearly gave up due the poor control but with changing the camera behind the character, it was playable. The game initially bombed out at the start, but changing the config as suggested by others made it work for me. 

I even said I was having fun when I got to bash up the bully - three times! Voice acting is great even though the speech was a bit slow than ideal. The initial positive impression soon turned negative however. I got frustrated with the unwieldy UI - for example, in the cauldron mission where you need to cool boiling cauldrons, you will have to open up the Inventory and click on the quest item to cool. The inventory screen would not stay open and cauldrons exploded as I tried to keep having to open up the screen and mouse-click the item. You cannot create a short-cut to the quest item,  but why not? The second issue is that enemies are damage-sponge even at the easy level - which makes the game excessively long although not necessarily hard. 

With some refinements, this game could have been great, but it is currently something I couldn't recommend for modern audiences. Save your money and play something else. | 小时候在路边摊买的盘。。 | Ностальгия школьных времён. | Mi juego favorito de la infancia | .
