[b]Ich habe soeben "Metro: Last Light" das erste Mal abgeschlossen. Moment, was war das Letzte? Richtig gelesen, mit dem Spiel habe ich auf jeden Fall noch nicht abgeschlossen. Für alle die mit dem Titel überhaupt nichts anzufangen wissen: Es basiert auf dem fiktionalen, postapokalyptischen Metro-2033-Universum des russischen Autors Dmitri Alexejewitsch Gluchowski. Wie schon im vorangegangenen Teil "Metro 2033" schlüpft man in die Rolle von Artjom, einem Bewohner der "Metro". Viel mehr möchte ich eigentlich gar nicht vorweg nehmen, denn man kann sich getrost von der Geschichte einsaugen lassen. Es gibt jedoch, wie bei jedem Spiel das mir persönlich gefällt, auch Skeptiker und Zweifler. 

[b]Für wen ist "Metro: Last Light" eher nichts?[/b]

[i]1) Für Leute, die keine postapokalyptische Stimmung mögen.[/i]
Das ganze Metro-Universum beschäftigt sich mit den Menschen nach einem Atomkrieg, die sich ein Leben in dem Moskauer U-Bahn-System aufgebaut hat. Das ist nicht für jeden etwas. Es gibt Mutanten, wenig Freude und mit der Zeit wirklich beklemmende Momente. Die Stationen, quasi Knotenpunkte und Städte im Untergrund, wirken jedoch wirklich belebt, überall hört man Gespräche (oft mir russischem Akzent) und Musik bzw. sieht den Alltag der Bewohner. Die Umgebung wirkt stets mit Liebe zum Detail gestaltet, es gibt auch beispielsweise nicht (wie bei so vielen anderen Spielen *hust skyrim hust tomb raider hust*) einfach überall Feuerstellen, bei denen man sich fragt, wie sie da hin kamen. Insgesamt spinnt sich eine wirklich dichte Atmosphäre aus Angst und Trauer, aber auch Überlebenswillen zusammen - das schaffen so wirklich wenige Spiele!

[i]2) Für Menschen, die keinen Wert auf Handlung legen und nur durchrennen möchten. [/i]
Wer Metro spielt, sollte Zeit mitbringen. Es ist kein Game für nur mal eine halbe Stunde. Hier werden Geschichten erzählt. Ich habe mich selbst wirklich oft dabei ertappt, einfach nur neben Personen zu stehen und ihren Unterhaltungen zuzuhören. Gelegentlich erhält man so auch nützliche Informationen und kleine Nebenquests. 
Nicht zu vergessen sind die politischen Lager der Faschisten und Kommunisten, welche maßgeblich in der Haupthandlung eine Rolle spielen, die wirklich bedrohlich wirkende Grundstimmung, die brutalen Vorgehensweisen der Extremen und die schonungslose Gewalt. Metro: Last Light zeigt mitunter wirklich Dinge, die man vielleicht nicht sehen möchte und kann so auch als kleines Mahnmal in der Spielelandschaft stehen. Man muss darüber nachdenken und reflektiert spielen, wer von einem Abschnitt zum nächsten rennt, wird nicht viel "mitnehmen".

[i]3) Für Singleplayer-Hasser.[/i]
Capture-the-Flag in U-Bahn-Schächten? Nein danke. Ich bin wirklich froh, dass 4A Games und Deep Silver konsequent einen reinen Singleplayer-Titel produziert haben. Ja, es soll noch ein Multiplayer-Part in DLC-Form nachgeliefert werden, aber bei der Geschichte stand ein Glück das Einzelspieler-Erlebnis im Vordergrund. Wer nur Kämpfe gegen andere Personen will, kann sich also Last Light klemmen und getrost zu anderen Genre-Vertretern greifen.

[i]4) Für "Hobby-Rambos".[/i]
Wie so oft steht man bei Metro vor der Wahl: Ja man kann alles niedermetzeln, durchrennen und pure Zerstörungswut walten lassen. Es wird bloß wie so oft wirklich schnell langweilig. Ein Glück hat man noch andere Möglichkeiten: Ich habe in alter Sam-Fisher-Manier meine Schleichskills ausgepackt, Lampen ausgeschossen (oder natürlich herausgedreht...), Gegner abgelenkt und... ach man es ist oft so verdammt schwer! Leider haben bei mir in echt stets einige Personen das Zeitliche segnen "müssen". Es ist jedoch auch anders möglich (und verändert sogar maßgeblich das Ende) und wie gesagt: Mein nächster Durchgang kommt demnächst, schließlich will ich da noch ein Achievement haben!:

[i]5) Für Charakter-Skiller und Hoch-Levler.[/i]
Nope, hier ist man verkehrt. Keine Skilltrees, kein "Level Up". Das ist aber wirklich gut so, es würde einfach die Stimmung kaputt machen.

[i]6) Für Leute, die keine Shooter mögen.[/i]
An sich hätte ich gedacht, dass man es nicht genauer erläutern müsste, aber man kann wie gesagt Last Light spielen, ohne Leute (bis auf ein paar Ausnahmen) töten zu müssen. Ebenfalls ist es möglich, Gegner durch  einen Hinterhalt zu betäuben oder zur Not Wurfmesser zu verwenden. Konflikte mit Schusswaffengebrauch lassen sich dennoch nicht ausnahmslos vermeiden, spätestens die NPCs werden darauf nämlich keine Rücksicht nehmen.
Übrigens: Es gibt vergleichsweise wenige Waffen, aber die vorhandenen spielen sich alle wirklich unterschiedlich - auch meiner Meinung nach ganz anders als bei einem Battlefield oder Call of Duty.

[i]7) Für Leute, die gerne Screenshots machen.[/i]
Naja.. okay der Punkt stimmt einfach gar nicht. Das Problem ist nur, dass Metro einfach von einem Foto-Moment zum nächsten eilt. Die Entwickler haben mit der Welt wirklich ganze Arbeit geleistet, was zur Folge hatte, dass ich die ganze Zeit herumging und Screenshots machte. | 這遊戲是我之前貼吧被ROLL中的一個禮物，無聊下載下來玩兒玩兒。
聽說這遊戲很燒顯卡  我電腦780M顯卡開最高效除了在營救俄羅斯基友那一章的一段劇情噸卡了下 其他都很流暢
故事設定在被核戰摧毀的世界中，原本以為這是一款純突突突變種怪物的 玩兒下來才發現還包含還有很棒的潛入劇情
遊戲充斥著著人與人之間背叛 殘暴 冷酷的一面
畫面一直比較陰暗 所以讓人覺得略壓抑 不過畫面的精細讓人能夠感受到開發商的誠意 
有人說这游戏恐怖 但是我覺得完全不呢 噁心是有點兒但不覺得恐怖 
BTW 我喜歡用噴子爆怪物的頭 嘻嘻~~ | [b]Metro: Last Light is a light that burns twice as bright but does not burns half as long[/b]
 
	4 years ago, Ukraine based developer [i]4A Games[/i] released [i]Metro 2033[/i], pleasantly surprising many gamers and critics with the richly eloquent and immersive ambience of the [i]Metro[/i] experience. While the game was far from perfect, the community nonetheless basked in the distinct Russian flavour of the setting, characters, and outlook represented in its post-apocalyptic world, passionately adapted from [i]Dmitry Glukhovsky’s[/i] novel of the same title.

	In [i]Metro[/i], the metaphorical strife of humanity against its darker, self-destructive nature were often presented in true, unyielding gritty terms. Depictions of huddled humanity striving against the desolation of the new world, not for survival but for the basic sense of normality and security were disturbingly overlaid with images of violent fanaticism and unforgiving death. Death by the creatures of the new world and by left and right winged fanatics.

	As a highly cinematic game, based on a series of novels, [i]Metro: Last Light's[/i] meat is in the story. Almost the entirety of my commendation for this franchise originates from the story-driven experience, so discussing the way in which the story is told seems like the most appropriate place to start. The game prioritizes on the human experience as the lead method of story telling, making it a unique and enriching experience. From the very beginning in which the series’ protagonist, Artyom, awakens to his call to adventure, it is abundantly clear that an intricate level of attention has been dedicated to detail that could only hope to be achieved by a group of developers with a genuine love for their subject matter. Extremely excessive yet altogether human interactions, like the ability to play your musical instruments, or turn off the room lights before moving out, build a sense of empathy by allowing the player to project very normal impulses onto the first person perspective. Every time you find yourself in a surviving human settlement, there are a myriad of opportunity to take a break from the violent chaos of the unforgiving new world and listen to the personal stories and woes of the Metro survivors; All told in richly voiced and detailed animated discussions. These little things add depth and immersion to [i]Metro: Last Light[/i], all the while giving an insight of the life in the Metro. Even when you are out on your own traversing the wastelands, the bulk of the game’s survival mechanics are built around an immersive sense of physicality. For example, players will need to manually replace their gas mask filters, charging their kinetic powered torch light by using a pump and wipe dirt and mud from their visor.

	The rich and detailed story is well accompanied by the breathtaking beauty of the game's graphics engine and art. The level of gaming design provides an ultra-realistic environment gives the player the added advantage of situational awareness. For example, tracking enemy numbers and movement by merely observing the shadows cast on the walls. Players will be able to traverse the underground Metro stations, both surviving human settlements and settlements which did not survive an attack by the creatures of the new world. Players will also be able to witness the quaint, post-apocalyptic beauty of the nuclear wasteland of what once was Moscow, the Red Square and Saint Basil's Cathedral.

	The gameplay is fairly straight forward and linear. The linearity of the game is well executed as it stays focussed on the story and tasks at hand, not deviating too much from the imperative nature of Artyom's mission. However, the game does allow room for exploration and rewards you for doing so. Such rewards include ammo, gas mask filters, and even new weapons. The combat system is very interesting because you are given a choice in play style. One way to play it is like a typical modern shooter with guns blazing. A ton of arsenal is still at your disposal. From the pre-apocalypse Kalashnikov rifles, to Metro engineered shotguns and submachine guns. The game also allows weapons customization like adding silencers, laser sights and weapons optics. However, it should be noted that ammo is very scarce in the Metro, so tactical approaches to any combat situations are a must, adding another level of realism into the game. Another way to play it is by sticking to the shadows like a ghost as you pass through enemy settlements. This is the way I recommend playing the game because it will grant you more instances to stop and listen to the characters' stories and gain further insights to life in the Metro. It will grant you a heightened sense of satisfaction and accomplishment at the end of your journey, should you choose to play it this way. However, there will be instances where you cannot sneak past the enemies, but this is where it gets interesting, because you are given to choice to either slit the enemy's throat or just knock him out. Do you think there is already enough death and suffering in the Metro? Or do you think the wicked should be cleansed from the new world? The choice is entirely up to the player.

	[i]Metro: Last Light[/i] possesses a wealth of passion for its subject matter that is promising for the future of [i]4A Games[/i]. Playing it is like reading a book, written in the first person, where the author uses incredible and poetic descriptive language for every little thing that the protagonist encounters. In a world that is filled with misery and death, it is up to the player to decide if Artyom should add more misery and death to the world, or to salvage the last remnants of good in the wreckage of humanity. [i]Metro: Last Light[/i] does not want players to just enjoy the combat (or stealth), but also to learn something, to feel something out of it. What you ask? I think it wants us to question the human condition and ponder about the value and meaning of our lives before we inevitably succumb to our destructive nature. | Хорошая игра с хорошей графикой и интересным сюжетом. Конец игры полностью зависит от ваших действий в игре и рассчитывается из совокупности плохих и хороших поступков. Прошел оба раза, посмотрел обе концовке, советую всем пройти.

A good game with good graphics and interesting story. The end game is totally dependent on your actions in the game, and is calculated from the set of good and bad actions. Passed both times, looked both end, advise everyone to play. | Metro Last Light is often overlooked but it’s definitely one of the best games of the year.
 
Set in a post-apocalyptic Moscow which was destroyed by nuclear war. A small handful of the population managed to seek shelter in the subway tunnels beneath the city. Twenty years have passed, the world has become inhabited with mutants and the surviving population has broken up into various factions.
 
Featuring a strong narrative and great pacing, Metro will keep you immersed the entire time. The story is told through eyes of a ranger named Artyom and not through irritating and pacing-breaking cutscenes like a lot of other games. Journal entries can also be found and Artyom serves as a narrator who often talks about the events unfolding around him.
 
It’s the direct sequel to Metro 2033 but playing the first title isn’t required to enjoying the game.
 
Metro Last Light tries to do a bit of everything, it’s primarily a first person shooter but it incorporates stealth elements very well. It also feels like a survival horror at points and can be quite tense when you venture out onto the irradiated surface with a gas mask. The audio is great and the screams of mutants in the distance will always keep you on the edge of your seat. There is a fairly large variety of enemies which are all hideous, unique and well done.
 
The atmosphere is amazing, same with the graphics. It’s worth noting that a somewhat powerful computer is required to running Metro Last Light. I was able to run the game at 1920 x 1080 on Very High at around 70FPS average with an Intel i5 3470K Processor, 16gbs of RAM, and an Nvidia GTX 560TI. I have heard that the game does have some issues with certain ATI cards though which can be fixed by turning off Physx in the settings.
 
Metro Last Light also has multiple endings and plenty of re-playability. It may appear linear early on but it quickly branches out later allowing plenty of room for exploration.
 
For a more detailed review, here’s a video my friend and fellow reviewer Trent uploaded:
 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsPrciV5i2U
 
Metro Last Light also managed to make our Top 35 List for the best games of the generation. If you’re interested in seeing how it measures up, check out:
 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=196432004

[code]
[h3] [code]Grafik[/code][/h3]
Auf den ersten Blick wirkt Reus unglaublich charmant.

Und das ändert sich auch während des Spielens nicht.
Ausser, dass man sich hin und wieder dabei ertaptt, sich zu wünschen, dass noch mehr Animationen und Wuselfaktoren ihren Weg ins Spiel finden würden.

Hier noch ein Hühnchen mehr, dort ein Fischerbötchen, vielleicht noch ein paar Wettereffekte, Tag & Nachtwechsel, Godrays, Lensflares, ...

Aber für so ein niederländisches Indie-Studio mit nur wenig Manpower (gerade mal 4 Leute) ist das schon sehr stark.
Man sieht eigentlich schon schön auf einen Blick woran es bei der jeweiligen Siedlung/ Stadt so hapert ... oder wo es gut läuft.

Wie bei "DIE SIEDLER" oder "ANNO" - nur das hier eben riesige Teams dahinter stecken, die ganz andere Effekte reinballern konnten.

Die dreh- und zoombaren Planeten in echter 3D wie bei Populous 3 wäre natürlich auch schick.
Aber auch die 2D Ansicht ist ... naja, wie erwähnt: charmant.

Irgendwie liebenswert und kindgerecht 🤗

[/code]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3420187024

[code]
[h3][code] Sound[/code][/h3]
Hast Du mal "DORFROMANTIK gespielt?"

Ein schön unaufdringlicher Soundteppich aus eingängiger Musik und Naturgerüschen.

Hätte man sich vielleicht sogar früher auf CD geholt zur Entspannungsförderung.

Hier erinnert es dann doch an Populous 1 und 2 oder auch Siedler 1 und 2.
Da ist die Geräuschkulisse ähnlich unaufgeregt und lenkt nicht vom Geschehen ab.

Mit grausen denke ich noch an das permanent-penetrante "WIR MÜSSEN HÜTTEN BAUEN" aus Black & White 1, was mich irgendwann dermaßen aggressiv machte, dass ich meiner Kreatur befahl alle Dorfbewohner zu fressen und zu zerstampfen.

Hüttenproblem erledigt.

Das wird hier nicht passieren 😁
[/code]

[code]
[h3][code] Gameplay und Steuerung[/code][/h3]
Um was geht es denn nun?

Ist das so eine Art:
- Populous?
- Black & White?
- Dungeon Keeper?
- Dust?

Nope.
Alle diese oberen Spiele sind wahre Götter unter den - nun- Göttersimulationen.

Auch wenn man hier Titanen steuert, die eigene Fähigkeiten haben:
- Löcher graben und Wasser fluten
- Berge anheben und Wüsten schaffen
- Wälder und Sümpfe aus dem Boden zaubern
- Tiere, Pflanzen, Fische, Mineralien, etc. erschaffen
- bestehende Landstücke und Fauna/Flora verbessern, aufleveln...
wird nie eine Göttersimulation alá Populous daraus,

Es gibt quasi keine gegnerischen Entitäten.

Du bist ein Planet und versuchst das Beste aus Dir zu machen.
Das Beste besteht in diesem Fall darin weit fortschrittliche Dörfer und Städte gedeihen zu lassen, die sich nicht gegenseitig an die Gurgel gehen!

Dazu ist Deine gesamte Oberfläche in Parzellen eingeteilt.

Und je nachdem welche Parzelle neben welcher anderen:
- platziert und
- gehegt und
- gebufft und
- generfed und
- entwickelt
wird entstehen andere Synergie- und Kupplungseffekte.

Symbiosen genannt.

Im Grunde wie ein gutes Kartendeck-Legespiel.

Manchmal musste ich schmunzelnd an YU GI OH denken.
Erst spiele ich diese Karte und wenn ich diese andere daneben packe, werte ich die erste auf und wenn ich dann noch diese eine dritte dazu werfe, ändert sich der Effekt auf die beiden anderen und sie werden noch mächtiger.

Wenn die Dörfer und Städte wachsen dann stellen sie Botschafter ab, die Du auf Deine Titanen packst und die dann noch weitere Fähigkeiten freischalten.
Dann kannst Du beispielsweise aus "normalen" Tieren "exotische Tiere" machen, die dann nicht nur Nahrung, sondern auch Reichtum bringen, usw.

Also bitte KEIN Populous erwarten!
[/code]

Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch Punch | [h2]Sinopsis[/h2]
Gunpoint es un juego de puzzles y plataformas, pero con un enfoque más pausado, donde prima la estrategia y el sigilo. Somos Richard Conway, un espía freelance (autónomo) que por casualidad es grabado por las cámaras de seguridad en la escena de un crimen, el asesinato de Selena Delgado. La jefa de esta mujer, Melanie Rooke, se pone en contacto con nosotros para pedirnos que recuperemos la grabación donde aparece el asesino real de su empleada y amiga Selena, chantajeándonos con que de lo contrario, la policía pensará que nosotros somos el asesino. De este modo deberemos infiltrarnos en distintas instalaciones bien vigiladas para hackear diversos dispositivos y obtener información sensible. Sin embargo, poco a poco iremos adentrándonos en una red de conspiraciones mucho más profunda de lo que cabría esperar, donde se ven implicadas las grandes empresas armamentísticas del país y la policía. Por ello, diferentes personajes contactarán con nosotros para reclamar nuestros servicios o pedirnos ayuda con diversos problemas personales, siendo nuestro principal objetivo desenmascarar al verdadero asesino de Selena.

[h2]Jugabilidad / Apartado técnico[/h2]
Gunpoint nos ofrece diferentes misiones de dificultad y complejidad creciente, donde el principal objetivo suele ser colarse en instalaciones fuertemente vigiladas para hackear algún ordenador, robar objetos clave o escuchar conversaciones privadas. Para ello, nuestro espía podrá hacer uso de una gran variedad de gadgets y dispositivos de alta tecnología que harán su labor de infiltración mucho más sencilla. Por un lado, contamos con los pantalones Bullfrog, los cuales nos permiten saltar grandes distancias, noquear a nuestros enemigos o caer desde alturas sorprendentemente altas. Por otro, iremos adquiriendo nuevos aparatos que harán nuestra vida más sencilla, siendo el Crosslink el más importante. Este dispositivo introduce las mecánicas de puzzle al juego, permitiéndonos ver la instalación eléctrica del edificio y “recablear” diferentes aparatos a voluntad, como interruptores, puertas, cámaras de seguridad, lámparas, etc. En cada misión deberemos hacer uso de estas mecánicas para completar las distintas misiones que nos ofrezcan, tratando de cumplir con ciertos parámetros de sigilo, violencia, tiempo, etc., y siendo recompensados económicamente por nuestros servicios para así, hacernos con nueva tecnología.

[h2]Valoración[/h2]
Gunpoint es un juego de puzzles realmente bueno, que sabe introducir las mecánicas de acción y sigilo de una forma muy interesante. Su jugabilidad es muy dinámica, ya que primero nos obliga a observar y pensar tranquilamente cómo vamos a llevar a cabo la misión, decidiendo que aparatos recablear, qué puertas debemos tomar, la ruta de vigilancia que siguen nuestros enemigos, etc., para luego llevar nuestro plan a la acción de forma rápida y limpia, sin ser vistos ni morir en el intento. La forma de abordar cada misión puede ser diferente y creativa, dejando cierto poder de decisión al jugador para tomar distintas rutas o usar diferentes aparatos. Además, también podremos elegir entre varias opciones de diálogo con nuestros clientes, pudiendo modificar el resultado final de la historia. En resumen, un gran juego de puzzles que recomiendo probar y que ofrece entre 6-7 horas de entretenimiento.
Lo salvaría de un incendio! 👨‍🚒👍🔥

Unepic me ha parecido un juegazo. Nada más empezar te evocará a Castlevania Symphony Of The Night, la gran obra de Konami. El mapeado es muy grande, con conexiones entre diferentes zonas y puedes utilizar muchas armas, equipamiento, hechizos, pócimas y conjuros, nada que envidiar a los mejores metroidvania con tintes roleros. 

Los final bosses son marca de la casa unepicfran, imaginativos y duros hasta que encuentras su punto débil, que en ciertas ocasiones no es nada evidente.

Si perteneces a una generación "entrada en años", comprobarás además las típicas referencias de Fran Téllez de Meneses al cine y cultura pop de los 80 y 90.

Este programador español me parece un fenómeno, toda vez que ha programado también Ghost 1.0, Minighost, Unmetal y Pampas & Selene. De momento, a falta de jugar el último, Uepic es mi favorito si me tengo que quedar con un único título de la factoría de unepcifran. | Офигенно! Просто нереально круто! Автор жжёт! I rate it 6/10
It's above average as a game, it's good, it's enjoyable, it's interesting.
Though the context will be might and magic series games.
Take notes on things you find, you'll likely be looking for them later in game.

The good:
*It's a might and magic game, it's designed similarly and acts like it too (it was rebooted, so forget the old lore).
*Gear and abilities make a significant difference.
*The fights are neither too easy nor impossibly hard, I didn't manage to screw myself over or have a useless character.
*Very good variety of enemies, enemy group / faction theme and designs, decent amount of unique enemies.
*Visually the game looks good, the enemies look good, some areas and dungeons look really good and you have a good variety of regions to explore and each will have their own unique designs.
*Decent amount of quests and their variety was good.

The bad:
*Grid based game made it slower to travel, you can't ravel across or over things, they made vegetation and such into walls, and you'll be travelling a lot, pair that with backtracking and looking for things will make it a drag.
*Limited or no ability to move across the map fast or instantly.
*Enemy behavior is clunky, they approach you and then start rotating before they finally face you and fight you.
*Some enemies have absurd and cheap skills and you can do nothing about it.
*Some dungeons are very, very small making their monsters and dungeon design so rare and unexplored.
*Some dungeons cannot be fully explored unless you have a specific character class as its locked behind a class promotion quest.
*The main quest lines story is a bit weak, you can see how problems are happening and how everything gets serious, but the antagonist that supposedly made this happen doesn't seem intimidating or threatening, he feels out of place and doesn't fit the behind the scenes actions, the antagonist knew about your actions and could have won very easily but simply didn't and this isn't explored at all.

If they'd remove the grid and let you simply walk as you pleased and also allow you to fly right through places you've already explored, it'd be an 8/10 | Its old but it plays well and is still miles better than what this genre has produced in the last ten years. | Who loves might and magic series, know that this is one of the best games ever. | Nie ma co się oszukiwać do tej gry trzeba się przekonać. Szczerze na początku się od niej odbiłem i tylko miłość do starych MM przekonała mnie do powrotu do niej i nie żałuję w dzisiejszych czasach jest to naprawdę unikatowe doświadczenie i po prostu gra sprawia frajdę. | 这种类型的游戏太少了

[h1]目前遇到过的问题及解决方案[/h1]

运行环境：Windows 10 家庭版 22H2

[h2]首次启动闪退[/h2]
打开设备管理器，展开“声音、视频和游戏控制器”，选中以 “NVIDIA” 开头的设备，单击右键，选择 “卸载设备”，点击 “卸载”，若该区域存在以 “Steam Streaming” 开头的设备，也请一并卸载，现在应该可以正常进入游戏了。

此方法来自：[u][url=youtube.com/watch?v=bHeOyfn1x5s] ROCKSMITH 2014 [PC] NOT LAUNCHING - FAST AND EASY FIX! [/url][/u]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]画面过度缩放[/h2]
打开游戏根目录，找到 “Rocksmith2014.exe”，单击右键，选择 “属性”，在“兼容性”选项卡下，点击 “更改高 DPI 设置”，勾选 “替代高 DPI 缩放行为”，“缩放执行” 选为 “应用程序”，点击确定，再点击 “属性” 窗口右下角的 “应用”，现在游戏应该能以正常比例显示了。

此方法来自：[u][url=steamcommunity.com/app/221680/discussions/1/3377158861989980420/] screen is super zoomed in [/url][/u]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]使用 ASIO[/h2]
请参阅 RS ASIO 中文文档：[u][url=github.com/mdias/rs_asio/blob/master/README_CN.md] RS ASIO [/url][/u]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]福克斯特声卡设置[/h2]
打开 Scarlett Solo 4th Gen Device Settings ，将 “Sample Rate” 设为 48000 ，“Buffer Size” 设为 96 ，打开 Windows 的声音控制面板，在“录制”选项卡下选中 “Focusrite USB Audio” ，确保已将其设为默认设备，然后点击窗口右下方的“属性”，在“高级”选项卡下，确保“默认格式”已设为“24位，48000 HZ (录音室音质)” （我这里默认是“2通道，24位，48000 HZ (录音室音质)”）。

此方法来自： [u][url=reddit.com/r/rocksmith/comments/1hve1lv/i_found_the_solution_for_my_focusrite_scarlett/] I FOUND THE SOLUTION FOR MY FOCUSRITE SCARLETT SOLO 4TH GEN, NOW I CAN PLAY THE GAME  [/url][/u]

I bought into this game long after it's Kickstarter had concluded. Based on what I saw, it looked promising. I played a little bit of the beta, and liked where it was going, but now it appears to have stopped going anywhere. I made a mistake, one that I'll learn from in this new age of crowd funded Indie games, but I'll get to that in a moment.

First, I don't think was a scam, even if I do think continuing to sell it might be. I think the developers actually did have every intention of fully developing this product, you can see that by the work that went into the product as it exists. But, the developers made a mistake themselves early on that more or less doomed the project.

My mistake was not checking the history of the game, seeing how it was funded, and what that looked like. Turns out it was a crowd funded game, and upon further investigation they appear to have not ask for nearly enough cash to keep the project going. That is only my opinion, but the stated goals are fairly ambitious for $35K in funding.

I'm sad it didn't come to fruition and wish the developers the best in their future endeavors. Because, I imagine that this was even more disappointing to them than it was to the supporters. | Это ужасно, боевки просто нет, сражение между замерзшими буратинами, таковым назвать, язык не поворачивается. Графика так себе, Сюжет... Где сюжет ? А, это вы называете сюжетом... Тогда мне Вас жаль)). Не берите - деньги то вы еще заработаете, а вот нерную систему уже не спасти)). | Probably one of the worst game I have ever played.
High retail price of 30$ (the real price should be 5-8$) and buggy, it looks like an uncompleted work.

What I hate most about this game is that devs lied upon release promizing features which were never there. This is false advertizing, I hope this things will be punishable one day.

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY! | Отрицательный отзыв в первую очередь потому, что игру забросили. У нас до сих пор длится ивент с Рождества 2014, а последняя новость у нас связана с набором кандидатов для теста обновления, которого так и не последовало. Рабочая ли игра? Да, вполне. Есть пара мелких багов, не слишком существенных, но не в этом суть. В Legends of Aethereus просто нечем заняться.

Нас высаживают в некоем городке, который мы должны, наверное, от чего-то спасти. Мне местный "сюжет" особо не запомнился, извините. Отсюда можно либо отправиться выполнять цепочку миссий, либо на арену. Есть один торговец и один мастер, у которого можно собрать экипировку на заказ. В общем, ничего такого особенного.
Все миссии, которые я пока видел, были про "пойди туда и вырежи пачку бандитов". Была одна про защиту каравана от набегающих волн монстров. Кажется, на ней и остановился, т.к. одному ну очень тяжко. На арене нужно продержаться 16, кажется, волн. После каждой волны предлагают забрать награду и выйти или остаться на следующую и получить прибавку к опыту. Поскольку состав противников никогда не меняется, можно примерно рассчитывать свои силы.
Сперва про то, что лично мне интересно, ок?

Боевая система строится на парировании или быстром уклонении от атак. Далеко не Dark Souls, но вполне себе весело. Урон оружия делится на два типа: прямой урон и "шоковый", отвечающий за возможность сбить врага с ног. Фактически каждый удар колотушки с мощным "шоковым" уроном будет разбрасывать мобов как котят. То же самое относится к игроку. Если все защитные свойства брони сосредоточить на прямом уроне и не заботиться о защите от сбивания с ног, в какой-то момент персонажа будут отправлять в нокаут каждую секунду. Смертельно. Элементального урона, как такового, нет. В оружие можно вставить цветной камешек, который будет вызывать определенные магические эффекты при каждом ударе.

Про ролевую систему. Здесь придумали очень хитрую вещь: у персонажа есть три пары параметров. Допустим, Ловкость и Сила. Ловкость отвечает за сопротивление шоковому урону и скорость перезарядки оружия дальнего боя. Сила дает больше урона в рукопашной и повашет запас выносливости. Как бы персонажу нужны бонусы от двух параметров, но максимум в эту пару умений можно вложить 100 очков. Нельзя быть одновременно Ловким и Сильным. Нужно сразу же определиться с тактикой: герой будет стрелком или мечником, будет больше полагаться на оружие или на абилки. Классов две штуки: условные маги и условные воины. Почему "условные"? По сути, они различаются только набором скиллов. И тем, и другим для активации умений требуются запас "маны". Ограничений по экипировке нет. Тут, опять же, все на усмотрение игрока.

Теперь к сути проблемы.
В кампании игра свою боевку не раскрывает вообще. Локации в игре красивые, но особо к дракам не располагают. Типичная карта Этериуса - это длинная лесная дорожка, на которой примерно через каждые две-три минуты бега стоит по паре врагов. Да, лес охуенненький, вот грибочки, вот цветочки, вот ягодки, ходи да собирай.... правда, я сюда немного за другим пришел, понимаете? Другое дело - арена. Маленькая карта, куча злых-презлых гоблинов, практически безостановочное рубилово. Но, черт, нельзя же все сводить только к посиделкам в колизее. Режима там всего три: нормальная сложность, дикая сложность и новогодний ивент, где враги оставляют после себя кучу трофеев (сложность колеблется от "изи" до "еб вашу мать, как так-то"). 
В общем, мы либо делаем скучные квесты, либо задротим на арене. Смысла в таких приключениях я особого не вижу.

В общем, еще раз: тут у нас есть неплохая боевка и хорошая ролевая система, которым негде развернуться на просторах сюжетной кампании. Есть арена, но сама по себе арена за такие деньги нахуй не нужна. Онлайн нулевой. Крайне не советую покупать. Извиняюсь перед всеми, кого сам агитировал купить.

НЕ ПОДДЕРЖИВАЕТ ОБЛАЧНЫЕ СОХРАНЕНИЯ. Снес игру - потерял всех персонажей. | I purchased this because I enjoy RPGs and adventure games in general, and this seemed to have both of those elements. Unfortunately, the final impression was pretty underwhelming. Legends of Aethereus isn't a bad game, but it's not that good either. For me, this title fell into the mediocre category pretty quickly.

Pros:

I loved the environments. While not too highly detailed, they were well fleshed out and large. I especially enjoyed the forest areas with all of the greenery and lush vegetation.

The character growth features a nice system where there are six main attributes sectioned into three pairs and displayed on progression bars. Each attribute has a complementary one on the bar that prevents you from maxing out every stat. For example: filling up the strength/agility bar with points in strength prevents your character from being agile. It's a nice system that allows for specialization instead of overpowered characters.

The skill trees are also quite large and feature a lot of skills to obtain and expand upon.

Cons:

While the environments were well-made, the character and costume models, unfortunately, were not. Character textures are flat and dull with the characters themselves not being pretty lifeless. I suppose it's just a gripe of mine, but I would've expected a bit more detail on the character models considering how much better the environments look.

The fighting engine is quite simple. The game's website boasts of a physics-based fighting system, but so far in my playthrough, combat just boiled down to dodging to the side and swinging  your weapon (I've only played a melee character, so ranged attacks might be different). Enemies aren't that bright, either. They'll detect you and then just perform one attack the majority of the time.

Regarding enemies, there are some areas where they spawn indefinitely. It can get pretty frustrating when attempting to pick up a quest item or some loot and enemies keep on coming. Most of the time, there isn't a musical change that signals an attack, so you can get surprised from time to time. It's not that big of an issue, but I get the impression that unlimited waves of enemies were used to create tension, but they instead end up being a point of frustration.

Quests are extremely simple. So far, everything I've experienced has basically been: go to a certain place, fight some enemies, get an item or wait out an attack, then return and collect your reward.

Crafting is also simple with few different armor models. Most of the armor looks the same with maybe an extra texture or armor piece added. Though I've only seen the Tier I armor and weapons and tiers II and III may have more different kinds.

All in all, I wanted to like Legends of Aethereus as it seemed like a good entry in the adventure-RPG genre, but it turned out to be quite underwhelming. It's good if you want something quick to do, but at this point, that's about it. Perhaps the developer is working on more content and updating the gameplay engines somewhat, but until that happens, I would say to hold off on it.

A text-based adventure-style survival horror management game where you are the one running this monkey farm!

PROS
+ Cheap and compact
+ Generally fair but unforgiving difficulty
+ Minimalistic yet effective sound design
+ Clever, immersive TTRPG-inspired interface
+ Infinite replayability thanks randomly-generated playthroughs
+ Built-in editor to create your own custom survivours and adventures
+ Highly-engaging, if not downright addictive gameplay that perfectly encapsulates the tone and atmosphere of George A. Romero's "Day of the Dead"

CONS
- Only one save slot
- Five survivour limit
- Only three game modes
- Occasional Fallout 1-level interface jank
- "Zafehouse Diaries", not a particularly inspired title
- Half-baked relationship mechanic that feels very contrived at times
- Limited micromanagement options (e.g. no way to assign equipment to a specific character)
 | No matter what you do, your people will fight with each other. Really its more like dysfunctional relationship simulator.

For solo play, the game is monotonous (well, whatever), I recommend it only for playing together.

[td]Experiencia cooperativa intensa y adictiva. Los jugadores pueden planificar y ejecutar robos en equipo, con múltiples enfoques para cada misión. La variedad de armas, habilidades y equipos permite personalizar el estilo de juego. La dificultad escalable ofrece un desafío constante.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Historia[/td]
[td]La narrativa es secundaria, centrándose más en la acción y la estrategia. Sin embargo, los personajes y diálogos tienen un encanto único que añade personalidad al juego. Los eventos y actualizaciones han expandido el lore y la conexión entre los robos.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Música[/td]
[td]Banda sonora dinámica que se adapta a la intensidad de las situaciones. Las pistas electrónicas y de rock aumentan la adrenalina durante los enfrentamientos con la policía. La música es un elemento clave para mantener el ritmo y la tensión durante los robos.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Contenido Adicional[/td]
[td]El juego ha recibido numerosas actualizaciones y DLCs que añaden nuevos robos, armas, personajes y modos de juego. La comunidad activa y los eventos regulares mantienen el juego fresco y emocionante.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Conclusión[/td]
[td]PAYDAY 2 es un juego cooperativo extremadamente divertido y desafiante. Con una jugabilidad sólida, una gran variedad de contenido y una comunidad activa, ofrece horas de entretenimiento. Aunque los gráficos y la narrativa no son su punto fuerte, la experiencia de robo en equipo es incomparable.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

It's like Barony but significantly worse in every way | Be careful with the fire staves | i like that you can pet the dog by the campfire

Despite the nice looks and initial fun exploring this mysterious dungeon might be the game turns absurdly oppressive towards the end and you'll likely give up when all the hours spent grinding turn into hours wasted.
Even on explore mode the difficulty is sadistic even when you know what you're doing (or should be doing). Had to give up on level 16 when the key to he next level was nowhere to be found. After wasting my plentiful resources entirely searching every room for that key I've had enough. Could be a bug too, I'll never find out.

Below is a game that is nice to look at, sounds great, but is miserable to play for the vast majority of people. If this doesn't scare you off... maybe it's for you. Try at your own risk. | L'ambiance est folle, les musiques sont vraiment propre.
Le système de mort est un peu frustrant mais pas aussi gênant que les gens disent.

Le jeu est pas si dur si tu prend ton temps.
Faut y jouer, c'est criminelle qu'il a si peu de review | most boring game i've ever played and i played many. no story, red enemies with geometry shape, no tutorial or any explanation, unnecesarry bonfires, low vision, wandering pointlessly.

i usually respect developers but not this one. honestly what is this sh.t ? did i pay for  it? i have to check.

... those insta kill spikes, ... that long ridiculous intro. ... that starting from the beginning all the time. who s idea was this game???

you know what i'll give this game one more chance but i expect nothing. | Wow what a game. Below is the most flawed masterpiece I've ever seen. I've never seen a game so committed to it's own core values (some may say to its detriment) and unique vision.

Below is a very bizarre cross between Knowledge-based games and Survival Horror weirdly enough. The game might seem difficult and unfair at first but once you understand the game mechanics underneath everything, it flows so well. Although at a certain point, preparing for a run takes around 30 minutes, which really raise the stakes and gives you lots of adrenaline, but it does kill the pacing of the game. 

Yes the game is brutal, at time tedious and can be obtuse. but the things that it does well it does it so insanely well that I am just in awe of the game design, art, insane soundtrack, sound design (omg the sound design is just top notch), and storytelling.

Most of the most difficult and frustrating parts of my playthrough were because I was not understanding a core mechanic of the game and once it clicked, it just feels so good.

My main criticism is actually how to finish the game. I do think that the way you are suppose to finish the game is telegraphed poorly and it feels unnecessarily obtuse especially after already proving that you can surmount all of the game's challenges. I had to use a guide to actually finish the game, although to be fair I was almost there, but without it I would've been wondering around for hours.

So yeah, if you are not turned off by this game in the first hour or two, absolutely give this a fair shake because this has become one of my favorite games. | You could study this game to better understand what "game feel" is. They nail that on every front. You could also study this to know what overstaying your welcome means and how NOT to make your game a chore instead of fun and rewarding. They didn't balance well enough in this area and as a result, that aspect overshadowed the positives. I wanted to love this game but it asks too much of you. If they cut the game length in half at very least it wouldn't be so bad. There is a glitch on the elevators where if you hold A (or something) you die for no reason. I looked up a speedrun since I couldn't waste any more time on this game and boy am I glad that I didn't see it through. The ending is not rewarding in the slightest, nor is it interesting enough to be worth the wait.

The best (modern) dungeon crawler I've played by far. It's insanely polished for this genre. There's a huge amount of enemies and environments, the music and ambience is perfect, it's challenging but not too hard (except for the final boss). There's a dungeon editor and a workshop with custom campaigns. I really struggle to find criticisms. I had to look up a couple puzzles that seemed somewhat obtuse. Also I felt a bit overwhelmed in the mid game trying to figure out where to go, what to do, in what order and not missing anything. Ultimately I would say it's a very good game and definitely worth a shot if you like RPGs. | C'est mon meilleur jeu de dungeon crawler rétro avec de multiples énigmes tout au long de l'aventure. Le niveau des énigmes est assez élevé et on tourne en rond assez longtemps avant de trouver la solution. Le style est assez proche de Eye of the Beholder basé sur D&D pour les presque cinquantenaires qui auraient connu ce jeu. Le jeu commence à vieillir mais une bonne énigme ne se démode jamais ! | Great game. Would play LoG 3 if it would existed | Lo acabo de terminar y me ha encantado.

Si el primero me gustó mucho, recordando de nuevo los viejos tiempos,  juegos de rol como Bloodwych, Dungeon Master o Eye of the Beholder de ese estilo, mazmorreo clásico, gestión de 4 personajes, inventario, armas, magias, esta segunda parte es mucho más, zonas abiertas, más magias, más armas, aunque esta segunda parte es conservadora, pero no necesitaba cambiar, porque es un juego buenísimo para los que nos gustan  de este tipo

Hay muchósimos secretos y zonas por explorar, posibilidad de crear tu grupo desde cero a tu gusto, la música es alucinante, y los gráficos no están nada mal.

Lo recomiendo tanto este como su primera parte.

Por cierto hay una traducción a Español para el juego, para el que le interese. | 퍼즐비중이 너무 높다보니 전투의 재미가 떨어진다.
퍼즐 좋아하시면 추천 한다지만 과연 퍼즐때문에 1인칭 던전크롤러를 할까??

Its a vibe of its own. Not sure how I never found this before. Loads of things you can do. Just gotta look for it a bit sometimes. You can play solo with bots, friends, or strangers. Claim enemy ships, cloak ships, etc. The more I play, the more i want to play. | It feels odd to say it this way since Pulsar came first, but if you like Bridge Crew, Void Crew or any of the many other cooperative space ship crew games, then you should definitely give Pulsar a go as it's an absolute blast to play with a good group of friends :) | Don't be fooled by the low end graphics, this game is an absolute blast!
 | Fantastic space sandbox. There are tons of mechanics and systems to learn and tinker with!
-play with 4 people online via lobby browser, or singleplayer with 4 bots.
-bots priority sets can be extensively customized to automate their behavior to very specific scenarios.
-tons of ships and components (weapons, shields, hulls, processors, upgrades)
-can do missions but is largely unguided sandbox. can pirate, scrap, bounty hunt, respond to distress calls, etc.
-each role has a lot of systems to it, fun to start with the basics, and fun to learn to micro-manage in-depth.
-space-ship based combat, ground-based combat with small arms.
-with so many systems, there's such a wide array of ways to take down the enemy! you can enter a sector cloaked and run viruses to steal their money unawares. Or, you can come in guns blazing. Or, you can take a boarding party to the enemy ship and steal it. Or, you can teleport over to the enemy ship and overload their reactor core. Or, you can cloak into a system with multiple enemies, run a backdoor virus to their strongest ship and sneak in, kill the crew aboard, turn the enemy flagship against it's allies in a surprise attack. The possibilities are endless and i think you'll really love this game! | Das Einzelspielerszenario ist geprägt von langen Flugzeiten, unfairen Kämpfen. Es gibt einige Aufgaben, die sich dann wiederholen. Das / Die Handbücher sind umfangreich und überholt. Dieses Spiel würde ich niemandem empfehlen.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Racing, Simulation, Strategy

Reviews:
Я наиграл в данную игру почти что 1497 часов.И пока останавливался на этом не собираюсь.Ну а пока скажу свое мнение об этой игре.
--------------------------------------
Плюсы
--------------------------------------
1.Полная свобода действий. В этой игре огромные территории по которым можно бегать,стрелять и прятаться,но скорее всего стрелять будут по вам. Здесь 3 острова.Два из которых Алтис и Таноа. Они имеют в себе сотни квадратных километров ландшафта.Есть и милиторизированный остров Стратис.И скоро 22 июня будет введен новый остров - Малден. И такие свободные территории не могут не радовать.Открытый мир как никак. Проделана работа не только на суши,но и под водой. Можно изучить подводный мир. Разве это не круто?
2.Разнообразие.Если вам надоели режимы на подобие захвата флага,или царь горы.То не беда! Арма насчитывает сотни интересных модов. На любой вкус.Тут и выживание(Exile,Epoch,Breaking Point) и Playeruknown Battle Royale.И чего тут нет. И именно в арме появился Батл рояль. А уже после это перешло в battlegrounds.
3.Редактор.Создавай и твори все что душе захочешь. Делай миссии,свои острова,города. Для него есть отдельный язык программирования. Разве это есть в других играх?
4.Графика.Как настройки не крути не увидишь жути.
5.Симулятор. Это не шутер,это симуляция боевых действий.А это значит что она единственная в своем роде.
6.Есть и другие плюсы,но о них вы узнаете купив игру :)
7.Arma Tools великолепная вещь благодаря которой можно делать свои карты,модели и моды. Лучшее что я видел из бесплатного.
--------------------------------------
Минусы
--------------------------------------
1.Дополнения. Без них арсенал оружия очень скуден.Но если вам не важна техника то купите два дополнения. Apex,Marksmen.Они добавляют орудие.И остров.
2.Оптимизация. Ее нет.И это не секрет.
3.Не для всех.
--------------------------------------
Итог
--------------------------------------
Советую купить,хотя бы просто попробовать себя в другом мире. Понравилось мнение? Нажми на да. Тебе легко , мне приятно. Игру по скидкам стоит брать!! | 1,700+ hours in, and I still can't tell if I'm playing a military simulator or a "how to get lost in the forest for 3 hours" simulator.

You don’t play Arma 3—you survive it.

The Good:
✔️ Massive open-world sandbox: Want to fight in realistic military ops? Done. Want to roleplay as a taxi driver in a war zone? Also possible.
✔️ Unlimited player-driven chaos: One moment, you're in a perfect tactical formation. The next, someone accidentally presses "G" instead of "F" and throws a grenade inside the truck.
✔️ Unrivaled realism: Bullets don’t just "hit" you—they ruin your day. You trip, bleed, limp, and require medical attention because some guy in your squad thought suppressing fire meant suppressing your own team.
✔️ Insanely detailed mods: If Bohemia Interactive didn’t make it, some genius modder did. From sci-fi battles to zombie survival, there’s something for everyone (except your FPS, which will suffer).

The "Learning Experience":
⚠️ Flight School (Arma edition): If you think flying a jet is easy, Arma 3 will correct your delusions within 15 seconds of takeoff.
⚠️ Driving Physics™: If you see a slight bump in the terrain, your vehicle is about to perform an Olympic-level gymnastics routine.
⚠️ The AI experience: Enemies will spot you from 800 meters away through thick fog but somehow can’t hear your squadmate yelling in the middle of an ambush.

Final Verdict:
Would I recommend Arma 3? Absolutely. Will it test your patience, friendships, and ability to follow orders? Without a doubt. It's not just a game—it's a military simulation, survival horror, and comedy experience rolled into one. If you want intense, tactical gameplay mixed with pure absurdity, Arma 3 is your new home.

10/10 – Would spend another 1,700 hours getting lost, blown up, and yelled at over the radio. | -llego al area designada de la operación
-voy junto a mis queridos compañeros al area de combate
-eliminamos varios insurgentes
-uno que otro sale herido pero nada grave
-vamos camino a la extraccion
-mi amigo muere por fuego de una ametralladora
-elimino al insurgente que mato a mi amigo
-tristesa | Arma 3 é um simulador militar tático que oferece uma experiência de jogo extremamente realista e detalhada. Com vastos cenários, um arsenal impressionante e um sistema de combate complexo, o jogo proporciona horas de imersão para os fãs do gênero.

O Lado Positivo
Realismo: Arma 3 se destaca pela sua busca incessante por realismo. Desde a simulação balística até os sistemas de ferimentos, o jogo oferece uma experiência de combate tática e exigente.
Liberdade: O jogo oferece uma grande liberdade para o jogador, permitindo a criação de missões personalizadas e a exploração de vastos cenários.
Modabilidade: A comunidade de Arma 3 é conhecida por criar mods incríveis, expandindo ainda mais o conteúdo e as possibilidades do jogo.
Multiplayer: O modo multiplayer é um dos pontos fortes de Arma 3, com servidores dedicados a diversos tipos de missões e operações cooperativas.
O Lado Negativo
Curva de aprendizado: A complexidade de Arma 3 pode ser um obstáculo para novos jogadores, exigindo um tempo considerável para dominar os controles e mecânicas.
Otimização: Em alguns momentos, o jogo pode apresentar problemas de desempenho, especialmente em cenários com muitos jogadores ou elementos visuais.
Conteúdo single-player: Embora a campanha seja boa, alguns jogadores podem achar o conteúdo single-player limitado em comparação com as possibilidades do multiplayer.
Conclusão
Arma 3 é um jogo que exige dedicação e paciência, mas recompensa os jogadores com uma experiência única e imersiva. Se você busca um simulador militar realista e está disposto a investir tempo para aprender suas mecânicas, Arma 3 é uma excelente opção. No entanto, se você procura um jogo mais casual ou com uma campanha mais extensa, pode ser interessante explorar outras opções.

Em resumo, Arma 3 é um jogo que:

Excela em: Realismo, liberdade, modabilidade e multiplayer.
Pode ser desafiador devido a: Curva de aprendizado, otimização e conteúdo single-player limitado.
Para quem é indicado:

Fãs de simuladores militares;
Jogadores que buscam uma experiência realista e tática;
Aqueles que apreciam a liberdade de criar e personalizar suas próprias missões.
Gostaria de saber mais sobre algum aspecto específico de Arma 3? Posso fornecer informações sobre as expansões, os modos de jogo mais populares, ou até mesmo dicas para iniciantes. | в целом интересно зашли с другом в компанию и даже сделали пару киллов было круто, правда радость длилась пока мы не встретили первый бтр который любезно отправил нас главное меню

This game is amazing for people who can't get Cities:Skylines 2. The only things I don't like about this game is the lack of garbage treatment. There is only a garbage landfill and a garbage incineration plant. When you have a lot of citizens producing a lot of trash it is very hard to stop it from happening since the garbage landfills barely do anything, and when it happens for too long more abandoned buildings will show up which are really annoying to bulldoze. 
      
     People who like to be the leader and take charge, like me, would enjoy playing Cities:Skylines 2. I really enjoy the fact that whenever your bored you can just start a new world and flood your city with poo.
     
     You can do everything from creating road plans to raising taxes, laying down pipe to terraforming an entire mountain surrounding your city. This game is definitely for those aspiring to be an engineer but don't want the complexity of it.
     
      The first time I bought Cities:Skylines 1 i was so eager and I was talking about it for days because I watch RealCivilEngineer play Cities:Skylines, and I was just immediately captivated by the possibilities of what my city can become. This game is definitely for the people who are creative and want to express the creativity in the form of building your own city.
    
      All in all Cities:Skylines 1 is a great game for beginners learning to be a engineer but for people who want better graphics, mechanics, building, and plays on windows, definitely go for Cities:Skylines 2.

      If the devs happening to be reading this, please make Cities:Skylines 2 available to play on Mac. It was very frustrating buying Cities:Skylines 2 the realizing that it was for windows only, and the pain I felt realizing that I couldn't play it and waiting for it to be refunded. But at least I have Cities:Skylines 1 I can play with less features and worse graphics even though I want to be an Engineer. Sorry for my sob story but this is my way of venting so deal with it. | Great game, terrible amount of DLCs. Still better than Cities Skylines 2, Mods are carrying hard. | After 532 hours of meticulously laying roads, zoning districts, and perfecting public transit routes, I can safely say that Cities: Skylines is a city-building masterpiece that deserves every second of your time. The level of detail and control you have over the growth and management of your city is both addicting and rewarding. Each decision from budget allocations to traffic flow is crucial to maintaining a thriving metropolis that feels genuinely alive. The base game already offers an extensive toolkit, but the robust modding community truly takes things to the next level with endless possibilities for customization. If you love city builders or simulation games, Cities: Skylines is absolutely worth playing. My 532 hours in-game and counting should speak for themselves. | 童年的幻想在这一刻能以另一种形式实现，梦中的摩天大厦和交通系统都能真真切切的展现在虚拟的城市里，这就足够了 | крутая игра,строил город 5 часов ,построил нефтяную промышленность,в итоге все снесло ураганом нахуй 10 пробок из 10

Это было отвратительно. Даже не знаю с чего начать. Я сильно удивился, когда узнал, что эта игра вышла аж на два года позже Dishonored, хотя хуже она во всём. И на протяжении всего текста, я буду их активно сравнивать, потому что эти игры находятся в одной весовой категории.

Начну с сюжета. Как работает трёхактная структура, авторы не ипут. Сперва была тётка, тётка упала, тётка пропала, прошёл год. Для чего мы её ищем? Что на с ней связывает? Что нас связывает с теми, кого мы спасаем и зачем мы вообще сражаемся против правительства? По приколу, по рофлу. Нет совершенно никакого пояснения, что меня, как героя связывает с людьми вокруг. Мы играем за вора, а по ощущениям за ходячую волчью цитату, которая что-то периодически говорит, чтобы просто сказать. В его словах кроме пафоса нет никакой интересной информации. Все глюки на протяжении игры, голубое свечение и пафос – просто жалкая попытка скопировать формулу Dishonored, где было всё то же самое, но лучше. В истории есть завязка, нам ясно дают понять, что героя предали, герой мстит, герой пытается восстановить справедливость. Единственное, что у Dishonored вышло хуже – это молчаливый гг, но уж лучше Корво, который ни слова не говорит, чем звиздящий без толку Гарретт. Есть какой-то фоновый сюжет с протестантами, заражёнными, про которых вообще ничего не ясно, потому что тебе это не демонстрируют, а только выкидывают как факт. Я не хочу читать ваши тонны записок, раскрывайте сюжет через диалоги, а не через писанину, это не визуальная новелла, чтобы я тратил здесь ещё часы на чтение. Концовка – вершина бреда в этой игре.

Геймплей. Чтобы обезвредить ловушки или куда-то попасть, нужно скопить валюту и купить соответствующий предмет, который нас туда пустит. Вы правда надеялись на реиграбильность своей игры? Проходить целую главу, чтобы посмотреть на секретку? Нет, спасибо, это не та игра, где я действительно хочу тратить время, чтобы пробегать её ради очередного артефакта, который ни на что не влияет. В Dishonored ты мог без каких-либо способностей проходить игру, они просто давали вариативность в выборе действий, здесь же предметы – необходимость, которую мне навязывают. Интересный элемент метроидвании в игре, которая ей не является. Следовательно – это рудимент. Очистить локацию от врагов можно легко. Прячешься в шкаф, шумишь, приходит непись, ты на него выпрыгиваешь, шумишь, оглушаешь и пока к тебе идёт следующая жертва – быстро прячешься в шкаф. Всё, пожалуйста, лока чистая. И зачем вообще делить игру на подлакации и раскидывать по ним нпс? Вы хотите, чтобы я вслепую искал допконтент, как в соулслайках? Или вы просто ради прикола сделали столько переходов, потому что было лень делать всё остальное?

Графика выглядит как в конце нулевых, а не как в начале десятых. Spider-Man: Shattered Dimensions на уровнях с Науром выглядит и то сочнее, хотя игра вышла в 2010.

POE2 终局倦怠以后打开这个在库躺了很久的游戏，即后悔也庆幸，后悔怎么没有早点玩这么好的 ARPG，庆幸在这款游戏多年更新后在现在接近完美的形态开始玩，而且今年还有新的扩展包。
如果说 POE2 将来可能成为最好的 ARPG，恐怖黎明现在就是最好的 ARPG。ARPG 新手可以无脑入，DLC 也全买，有 DLC 才是完整游戏。而对于 ARPG 老兵，恐怖黎明有什么特别的？

它从头到尾都尊重你的时间。

现在的赛季制 ARPG 游戏，重心都放在了终局，而低级的剧情阶段不过是走过场，好像是为了尝到终局的甜而必须吃的苦（POE2 有改进但还不够）。恐怖黎明不是。从游戏的最开始，ARPG 的两样核心，build 和 farm 就在成型了。

Build 是寻找最优解，是谜题和选择，恐怖黎明更快更多地把谜题摆在玩家面前：
- 技能点升一级不是给 1 点而是 3 点
- 镶嵌物从 5 级开始就很重要，而不像其他游戏因为需要打孔是后期内容，这里不需要打孔
- 星座相当于 POE 中的被动技能树，但有意义的大点更靠前，这些会赋予主动技能触发特效，是 Build 的基石，而在很前期就能体验到
- 加技能等级的装备和套装在前期就开始掉落，可以完全按照得到的装备来进行开荒 Build

Farm 赋予了玩家游玩的意义，POE2 和 D4 前期不会有任何 Farm，因为没有意义，前期装备非常弱，很快就要被替换。这也是这些游戏前期与后期游玩体验的割裂的原因之一，而恐怖黎明通过很多巧妙而统一的设计，让前期的 Farm 更有意义：
- 精妙的数值设计，一件 50 级的装备和终局的装备，在面板上看是两倍的数值而不是十倍或百倍，开荒期的装备保质期更长
- 一些怪物有特定掉落，这些掉落非常适合于某些 Build，甚至在终局是最好的装备
- 装备槽位多，总共 14 个，比起 D4 这些多出了护肩和勋章等部位，这意味着掉落提升角色的可能性更大
- 慷慨的掉率，独特的史诗装备和传奇装备相当于其他游戏的暗金和套装，掉得更早更多，DLC 更是提供了新的掉落途径
- 势力声望系统，Farm 至少会推进声望，而声望奖励非常优越，一方面可以直接买很好的开荒装备，另一方面终局总是需要买声望给的增辐，所以前期的 Farm 也为终局做了准备

恐怖黎明还有太多优秀之处，如手工设计的地图，塞满了奖励驱动，或是 Build 的丰富性，或是数值上的精妙，也不需要一一提及，能做好前期的 Build 和 Farm 就值得每一个 ARPG 老兵的时间。
这也不是说恐怖黎明在终局的 Build 和 Farm 就不出彩，只是我刚通第一个难度全 DLC，还没打到终局，没什么可说的。
总之推荐给每一个人，这游戏里每一秒都是值得的，在 ARPG 里很少见。 | Great ARPG with the most free choice in skill tree combinations I have seen, combine trees and you can build pretty much whatever you want. Lots of unique items to specialise things even further. No seasonal slop, no "always online" garbage. There is so much build potential I keep coming back again and again. There's even secret stuff for you to find.

My only gripe is after playing so many hours, I wish I had a little more bank space to store things. 

Looking forward to the coming Asterkarn expansion. | 好玩  耐玩  BD搭配绿装很有挖掘潜力   
1000多个小时打不过板条箱  啧
闪电和虚化的减抗星座 触发之后的形式不友好  因为很喜欢雷电德鲁伊  这个星座一直被我诟病
才发现玩了这么久居然没给评价

还有这新dlc2023年就有消息了  2025年了 居然还没玩上 | Falo com convicção: este é o melhor ARPG isométrico da atualidade - que não está na categoria de "jogo como serviço" — caso contrário, Path of Exile 1 e 2 seriam ótimos concorrentes . Nem mesmo a Blizzard conseguiu entregar um ARPG à altura desde os clássicos Diablo 1 e 2. Dentre os vários pontos de destaque de Grim Dawn, eu consigo citar os seguintes:
- O sistema de combinação de classes é bem diferente, você tem ali (considerando as DLC's) 9 classes base, e podendo realizar a combinação com mais uma classe, você tem a possibilidade de criar até 44 classes;
- Habilidades e poderes trazem peso e fluidez ao combate, fazendo com que cada encontro seja satisfatório.
- A atmosfera sombria, aliada a uma narrativa rica e bem construída, me manteve engajado e curioso sobre o desfecho da história.
- Conteúdo de Endgame: Repleto de desafios, dungeons, facções e atividades para explorar, garantindo horas de diversão mesmo após finalizar a campanha principal.
- Suporte a Mods: A possibilidade de mods amplia ainda mais a rejogabilidade, permitindo aos fãs personalizar e expandir o jogo ao infinito.
- A trilha sonora ambiente é excelente e contribui muito para a atmosfera sombria do jogo, lembrando o estilo marcante de Diablo 2. 
- Já a temática se destaca por fugir do convencional entre os ARPGs, que geralmente exploram criaturas mitológicas, demônios e fantasia medieval. Grim Dawn aposta em uma ambientação inspirada na era vitoriana, com inimigos interdimensionais devastando a humanidade — é uma premissa inusitada, mas que traz uma originalidade bem-vinda. 

Não posso deixar de elogiar o cuidado da Crate Entertainment com este jogo: sem monetização abusiva, passes ou qualquer outra prática predatória, e ainda assim eles continuam atualizando o título mesmo após 8 anos de seu lançamento.

Recomendo. | Отличный диаблоид с нотками Dark Fantasy, мир разнообразен на локации: полянки, леса, болота, подземелья и все по классике жанра, в ней приятная ламповая хоть и немного контрастная графика, она хорошо сбалансирована как для казуального игрока так и для мазохиста, и я считаю он лучший на рынке в своем ценовом сегменте. (на скидках стоит в районе доллара) 
Grim Dawn может спокойно конкурировать с гигантами в виде Diablo IV и Path Of Exile 2.

Oh man, I had put off playing this game for years despite it being part of my Steam library for a long time.  I expected to like the opening act and get frustrated by difficulty or strange choices by the designers.  I was ready for disappointment, but it never came.  Instead, I think Hyper Light Drifter may be the best recent game, that is meant to resemble a classic game, that I have ever played.  Of course there's the art-style, but this game is drawing from so many classics with its almost complete absence of dialog and subtle story telling as well as that feeling of almost being completely unsure of where it is you are supposed to go and do.  Then there's the difficulty and the very Zelda-like system of upgrades and power-ups.  It attempts what so many other games have but really gets it right.

Most of the gameplay is top down (ish) with the player hacking, slashing, shooting, and dashing their way across various well-worn video game settings - ice, dessert, swamp, and mountain.  Of course, you collect the equivalent of gems that unlock your path toward a final confrontation, and there are many non-essential secrets and hidden collectibles to find for the eager explorer.  Some light Metroidvania elements also come into play as you'll backtrack a bit once you collect enough doodahs to open those previously inaccessible areas.

Simply put - I loved it.  I wanted my sessions to last longer, and I couldn't wait to jump back in.  It is one of those that I (already) wish I could play again for the first time without knowing anything.  Exceptional experience and an easy 5 out of 5. | A bit of a reluctant thumbs up from me. The Game is beautiful - the visuals, the music, the atmosphere. All A+. Controls generally feel responsive and good. Some clunkiness with platforming around ledges, but I can forgive that. I found the textless storytelling in this game to be a breath of fresh air. (although I see why some would dislike this.) This game toes the line of being a Metroidvania. Although, It technically isn't because you can beat the game without a single upgrade. The first few hours were wonderful. Traversing the open world to find and clear dungeons until I could defeat a boss and get an upgrade. However, I soon found myself not knowing where to go next. Surely I must have missed a dungeon somewhere? I started back tracking and was able to find a couple I missed - but not them all. There are 4 more sections of the game that are all like this. In each zone, I conquered the obvious dungeons, but then found myself scratching my head and backtracking to find the next dungeon or node. Running around for dozens of minutes, in areas I already experienced, trying to find out where to go next. Frustration began to set in. The fact that the dungeons can be explored and found in various orders meant looking for a guide or walkthrough online and figuring out what I missed would be a chore in itself. That's where I ultimately gave up with this game - it just wasn't worth it. An amazing game - hindered by its own design and vague map. If Metroidvania's are your jam, I'd absolutely recommend Hyper Light Drifter. For others, I am a bit more cautious about recommending it. | Pek sevemedim ya. Her firsatta indie oyun klasiklerinden sayildigi icin hayalimde daha cilali ve eglenceli olacagini dusunmustum. Sanirim 2016’dan beri bu oyuna benzer fazla turevi cikti ve sanirim daha iyilerini oynamis bulunuyorum.

-haritada gizemleri kesfetmek uyduruk, gorsel ipuclari vs zayif. Kesif hissi de hos degil.
-Soulslike gibi bir zorluk, ben daha zeldamsi bi zorluk beklemistim. chill oynanacak oyun degil. Kimse bu oyunu zorluguyla ovmuyordu, hani hollow knight gibi bir seye girdigimi bilmiyordum diyelim.
-Fazla kriptik ve gereksiz zorlastirilmis hissettiriyor. Ozellikle navigasyon konulari asiri sikici. | It's excellent in a very unique way, good for a play-through. Unforgettable. | I've played it on other console, but this game is so important to me, we can't do enough credit with only text, this game is beautiful and without a doubt my favourite above all games.

Thank you so much heart machine, this define for me what a good game should be.
