Оценка: 8/10 
кстати игра бесплатная если зарегестрироватся и скачать ее с LEGO.com | NOTE: This is a lengthy, detailed review so if you don't want to read the whole thing then I recommend skipping down to the Tips and Tricks section at the end of this review.  For just a few minutes of your time, there are some tips there that will save you a lot of time and effort if you're new to the game. 

INTRODUCTION: Long time gamer here. I've played many MMOs over the years. Normally I'd pass on a Lego MMO but since my 9 year old son is such a huge Lego fan, I picked up a couple of the "Awesome Packs" for both of us to play. I imagine some of you reading this will be parents such as myself so I'll tailor part of my review to help you make a more informed decision. 

GAMEPLAY: Lego Minifigures Online is a solid game for kids or Lego fanatics but if you're a hardcore/serious gamer I'd certainly look elsewhere. I'd classify it as a MMO-lite or a MMO for beginners/kids. You'll find many of the aspects of a typical MMO here but they are presented in a much simpler manner. For example, you'll get a couple combat skills to work with and no more than that. As you level up you can increase the power of your character via a skill tree but you'll be limited to 2 different choices at each branch. There are instances/dungeons, some of which contain multiple bosses but most of them are fairly straight forward, basically just a matter of sticking and moving at the right time. 

MINIFIGURES: There are currently close to 70 minifigures in the game and they're fun to collect but just bear in mind that all minifigures were not created equal. Personally, I find some of them to be subpar but there are few that really shine in the right situation. Out of the 40 or so minifigures my son and I have unlocked at the moment, some my most favorite/powerful characters are piggy guy, wizard, forest maiden, cyclops, and the knight . There are 3 different types of charcters , strikers (offensive, often glass cannon types), defenders (defensive but can still dish out decent damage), and builders (useful for building legos quickly).  I generally find the defenders to be the most well rounded of the bunch. 

GRAPHICS: They do the job I guess. With the graphics maxed out they're passable but far from noteworthy. By comparison, I find the graphics in Lego Minifigures to be inferior to the other single player Lego games available.

PROGRESSION IN THIS GAME: Make no mistake about it, this game really puts pressure on players to spend cash on in-game purchases in order to progress.  Many of the game's levels are locked until you unlock a certain number of minifigures. You can grind out certain minifigures for free but it will take some time/repetitive grinding. It's far quicker and easier to just buy minifigure packs from the in game store. In addition, the game uses diamonds for currency and to level up characters. Personally, I struggle just to make enough diamonds to level up my characters in game. I can't imagine trying to grind addional diamonds to purchase minifigure packs. 

PURCHASE ADVICE: As of the date of this review, the free version of this game is not available on Steam. If you're on the fence about sinking money into this game, I'd recommend downloading it for free from their website, Just do a seach on "Lego Minifigures Online" and the first search entry should be the official web site. 

TO PARENTS: I don't see a recommended age on this game but personally, I think the ideal age is 10+ if your child will be playing without your regular supervision. Anyone younger than that playing solo will likely struggle with what they're supposed to be doing and will have serious issues trying to progress in this game. If you plan to play with your kids then of course it's a moot point since you can just guide them along yourself. As previously discussed, you can play this game entirely free but you'll likely have a difficult time progressing without sinking at least a little cash into the game. If the idea of paying a monthly subscription or buying additional minifigures bothers you, you may consider checking out some of the fantastic single player/co-op Lego games available on Steam if you haven't already. One last thing, this game does have in-game text chat but it's filtered and constantly monitored to prevent profanity/misconduct so my hats off to the developers for including that feature for a game such as this one. 

OVERALL RATING: For what it is, I give it a 7 out of 10. My son and I have had some fun times with it already but realistically I don't expect to be playing it long term.  I have no regrets dropping the $50 for 2 "Awesome Packs" and may subscribe further into the future if there is enough quality content to keep us busy.

TIPS AND TRICKS: This game isn't overly complex but the in-game tutorial leaves a little to be desired. Here are some things I picked up along the way that made life a lot easier. 

1) You can do instances/dungeons over and over to unlock character pieces. When you first click on an instance, it'll let you know which character pieces can potentially drop from that instance. Once you get a head, body and legs for the same character, you can use a baseplate to combine them and unlock a new minifigure. Instances/dungeons are on timers so once you clear them you'll likely have to wait several hours before you can clear them again. Fortunately, there are numerous dungeons so it's not much of a problem unless you're gaming for long periods at a time. 

2) There are waypoints that you unlock as you progress though a zone. Once unlocked, you can open up the world map and teleport to any of these waypoints. It makes things easier and quicker when you're re-running instances over and over to unlock minifigure pieces. Simply teleport to the waypoint closest to the instance you're trying to run and save yourself some time and hassle. 

3) Instances have symbols next to them on the world map, such as leaves or moons. Those symbols correspond with the element type that will be the most powerful in that insance. So, if you see an instance with a leaf, then ideally you'll want to use characters with leaf on their character descpription in order to have an easier time in that insance. You can still make it though the instances with characters of a different element type; it's just more challenging. If you've played Skylanders, it's similar in that aspect. 

4) Switching between your characters is the key to effective combat. It's far better to switch to another character when you're low on health, than to die and not have that character available again until the revive timer resets. It's also worth mentioning that you can also use a character's special ability and then quickly switch to the next character. This is borderline OP when using the piggy guy minifigure. His AOE dot special power will continue to tick after you land it so I use his special mud pit ability and then move on to the next character. I can then do additional damage that will  simultaneously stack with the piggy guy's dot. 

5) When choosing your character's name, you'll choose 3 words from a pre-set selection of words. The 2nd word you choose will be the name that others see you as in game. So if I go with Tough Paladin Knight, others will see me as Paladin in game. 

6) If you're serious about buying characters, I would recommend buying series 12 Lego Minifigure packs at your local department/toy store. Each minifigure will have an online code that you can use in-game. So if you get a wizard lego figure out of the pack, you'll get a corresponding code to unlock the wizard in game. I bought a bunch of these and received double bang for my buck, my son got the actual physical lego minifigures to play with in real life and we were also able to use the codes to unlock the characters in game. One caveat, series 12 is the ONLY series of minifigures you can do this on. The earlier series do NOT have the codes. 

Thanks for reading, hope this review helps! | Alright, so, my previous review was basically just a jab at the chat, but I suppose it'd be a good idea to give a full review.

Let me preface this by saying that my playtime is 100% real. This is only because I met some very good online friends through this game who I can only chat with in the game, due to restrictions placed on them by their parents or other random stuff. Only about 20 hours of my playtime was me actually PLAYING the game, the rest of it has been built up over a long time of chatting with those friends on a daily basis.

Now, onto the review!
___________________________________________________________________________________

Let's start off with the most important part of the game: the gameplay itself. 

The gameplay is actually rather fun at the start, you run through worlds created entirely of LEGO, destroying enemy minifigures. After completing certain tasks (primarily dungeons) you will receive minifigure parts. Its actually rather fun to collect the parts.

The game also has "Stars" which you get for destroying enemy minifigures, completing dungeons, and other random stuff. You can use these stars to upgrade minifigures to make them stronger.

Once you've completed the main worlds, something called "Lost Creations" will open up. You access it through Dino world, which is the final main world in the game. In Lost Creations, you go through timed levels, doing your best to get through each level without dying. If you go solo, you probably won't get very far (a good estimate would be Level 8). If you go with a team (up to four players can be in one team), you will get much further. Once you've died, you'll get loot based on how far you got, the loot being exclusive minifigure parts only available in Lost Creations.

However, Lost Creations gets boring quickly: its just the same thing over and over again. If you want to collect all the minifigures, you'll need to do some SERIOUS grinding. There's also an "achievement" system, which will award you with achievements for doing certain tasks with each minifigure you collect. Unfortunately, it gets boring fast, and takes FOREVER if you want to get "glows" which are obtained for completing every achievement for a certain minifigure.

There are some other gameplay elements that I wouldn't consider significant that I didn't mention in this section, because I don't find them worth mentioning.
___________________________________________________________________________________

So, all in all, gameplay wasn't too bad, just gets repetitive after a while. But now, its time to get into the worst part of the game: the chat.

Alright, first of all, as with previous LEGO MMOs, at the start, you have to choose a name for yourself. You do this by combining three words, of which there is a list to choose from. I chose "The Jolly Pancake" because... why not? Some friends' names include "Brave Jade Ace", "Fast Merry Gator", "Sergeant Comet Titan", and "Neo Cyber Titan". So, you get the picture. I find that this is a perfectly fine system, as this is a LEGO game and it has to be kid friendly. We can't have people going around naming themselves "screwyou". However, this system encounters a major flaw with the way the names are shown in-game.

If you want to see the full name for anybody, you have to go to the "Recent" tab, which basically shows people recently in the area, or your "Friends" tab. Keep in mind you can't add friends without clicking on their name and friending them in the "Recent" tab. Unfortunately, this is the only place you'll see someone's full username. But in chat and above their minifigure in game, you'll only see the middle word of their name (in my case, Jolly).

This is absolutely STUPID, because if someone else was chatting in the same world as me, and they were named something like "Brave Jolly Titan", there would literally be NO WAY for someone to tell the difference between the things Brave Jolly Titan is saying and the things I (The Jolly Pancake) am saying, because, despite us being COMPLETELY different users, the middle part of our names' is Jolly, so its like we're the same person.

Not only that, but the chat filter is absolutely AWFUL!

As previously mentioned, this is a LEGO game, so it needs to be kid friendly, so a chat filter was put in to catch swear words, which I don't think is a problem.

Unfortunately, it doesn't JUST block swear words, it blocks HUNDREDS UPON HUNDREDS of words that any sane person would consider COMPLETELY harmless!

So, all the basic swear words or swear-related words are all blocked, which is certainly acceptable. Most common names are also blocked, which, to me is also acceptable, don't want young kids giving out their names online, after all. However, every single NUMBER (except for "one") is blocked. Two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, and so on, they're ALL BLOCKED. I'm guessing this is to prevent people giving out their age, but, eh, I find numbers being blocked stupid. Its ESPECIALLY stupid when your game has a "level" system, where you gain XP for killing enemies, and you can level up and become stronger (up to Level 30). You cannot chat about your level (hey, buddy! guess what? I got to level sixteen! :D), which just makes no sense.

The community HAS created bypasses for this; one, too, tree, for, hive, sick, heaven, ate, fine, then. This also makes blocking the numbers absolutely stupid and simple making chat more of a hassle for players.

Also, ANY word can be bypassed using this method: If you wanted to say "pathetic" you could say "PATH End To I Cake", then say "read capitals." This happens DAILY on this game, and it makes the filter even MORE useless.

Hey, do you remember when I mentioned some friends in the game? Two of my examples were "Fast Merry Gator" and "Neo Cyber Titan". These names were chosen with the system I explained earlier, where there are three lists of words that you can choose from to assemble a username. "Gator" appears on one of the lists (proven by a user having the name "Fast Merry Gator) and "Cyber" also appears on a list (proven by a user having the name "Neo Cyber Titan"). But guess what? Both "Cyber" and "Gator" are caught by the filter. First of all, it makes NO SENSE as to how these words shouldn't be allowed to be said. How are Cyber and Gator BAD WORDS?!?! It just makes NO SENSE. It makes even LESS SENSE when you can have part of your name be "Gator" or "Cyber." Its even WORSE in Neo Cyber Titan's case, because he shows up as "Cyber" to everyone. He literally shows up to everyone as a word they cannot say in chat because of the filter. WHY?!??!
___________________________________________________________________________________

So, now that I've talked about gameplay and ranted about chat, I suppose there are a few random things left to say.

First of all, I think Funcom has completely abandoned this game. They don't patch or update it (unless a new series of minifigures is out), and they don't make any announcements on progress (probably because there is none). On LEGO.com, there are Message Boards where LEGO fans can chat about LEGO. There are several subforums, one of which is a subforum for this very game. There were two people who worked for Funcom (tomium and sezmra) who posted in this subforum, answering questions and such, but as of recently, they've just completely disappeared.

Something I just don't understand is why LEGO had Funcom make this game. Funcom creates primarily mature games, NOT kid-friendly games. I just don't understand why Funcom was chosen to make this game. Why not the people who are making LEGO Worlds? The people making LEGO Worlds are doing a freaking FANTASTIC job. That game has so much potential and is a LOT of fun. 

Well, that's the end of the review. As far as gameplay goes, not too bad. I'd say its worth it at sale price of $15. Just don't buy it if you plan on chatting a lot.

Game Name: Batman: Arkham Asylum Game of the Year Edition
Reviews:
Batman: Arkham Asylum was a pretty good experience except for the same boss schemes. Also this game has such a good PC port that I didn't even do a game configuration before going into the game. | Дивна річ ця пам’ять. У моїх спогадах, Психлікарня відповідала на 85% тому, що я побачив під час цього перепроходження, але враження та емоції були геть інші. Так вийшло, що перше знайомство відбулося з Arkham City, бо на той момент якраз була куплена нова відеокарта, а друг казав, що ця гра виглядає неймовірно й дуже вибаглива. Тож нереально приємно провівши час, десь за рік взявся за Asylum і по відчуттям, це було наче після Темного лицаря дивитися Бетмен: Початок. І те, і те – гарні фільмі, і те, і те – круті ігри, але коли вже побачив щось краще в тому ж усесвіті зі своїми правилами й механіками, початкові варіанти сприймаються звісно ж слабше. Проте, на момент написання рецензії, це відчуття недорозвинених ідей чи аспектів не повернулося, тому ще в першу ігрову сесію завершив проєкт на 33%, провівши з двома хвилинними перервами 7 годин.

Сюжет простий і зрозумілий, подиву викликати не має, хіба що в людей, які не знають хто такий Брюс Вейн. Починається все з того, що Джокер без проблем віддається в руки Бетмену й вони прямують у лікарню. Уже всередині закладу протагоніста не полишає думка, що це якийсь підступний план – звісно ж так і є. Поганець виривається на свободу й випускає різних суперзлочинців та хуліганів, які мають якомога довше затримувати Темного лицаря, щоб його супротивник міг утілювати свій підступний задум. Звісно ж під час проходження ми зустрінемо фан-сервіс… вибачте, усім знайомих ворогів – Страхопудала, Бейна, Плюща тощо. Я радий, що це відбулося, проте до них майже відсутнє якесь сценарне підведення (окрім Бейна, хіба що): вони виникають на нашому шляху й хочуть надавати кажану по вухах. Якщо перемішати їх місцями, зміни будуть незначні, а для загального бачення картини взагалі відсутні. Фінал теж доволі посередній, а порівнювати з Arkham City взагалі не варто – там у мене відвисла щелепа, а тут непоганий мордобій і все: відчуття наче це кінець сезону, а далі буде наступний.

Стосовно мордобою. Я не цікавився чи це оригінальна ідея, чи десь підгледіли, але саме в серії Arkham я вперше побачив цю систему вибивання всього лaйнa із супротивників. Першу серію ударів Бетмен робить звичайні, а на кожний наступний удар нокаутує ворога на короткий проміжок часу, а гравцю треба лише вчасно тиснути удар, щоб протагоніст з певною анімацією сам підлітав до найближчої пики в напрямку камери – виглядає досі бомбезно й спроби повторити так і не перевершили Rocksteady Studios. Є ухилення в сторону чи через когось, але повністю відсутній блок, тому для вдалого перехоплення атаки треба в таймінг тиснути контрудар – інакше комбо буде збито, а наш герой отримає шкоду. Може на словах це якась 2-3-кнопочна боївка (що так і є, хе-хе), але на практиці купа поганців може швидко обламати кажану крильця, не кажучи вже про те, як круто виглядає битва без пропущених ударів. До речі, на високій складності, яку я вибрав, над головою хуліганів відсутній індикатор, тому треба самому уважно дивитися хто коли б’є.

Щодо іншого ігрового процесу, то це метроїдванія без необхідності в примусовому порядку йти в попередні локації та потрапляти в раніше закриті зони через відсутність певних ґаджетів. Окрім декодера, для якого Бетмен використав спеціальну картку, трохи дивно спостерігати за тим, як він свої ж інструменти не носить із собою, а бере тільки в певний момент. Деякі, як от подвійний бетаранг, можна отримати лише в меню прокачки. За різні дії, знаходження секретів, набивання великих комбо видають досвід, який підвищує рівень. За кожний можна вибрати будь-яке одне відкрите покращення: асортимент невеликий, це або посилення фізичних ударів і збільшення здоров’я, чи просто розширення можливостей вищезгаданих ґаджетів, що загалом не є необхідним по сюжету, а слугує задля колекціонування.

Так, ніхто нікого не змушує кудись там іти, але ж самому хочеться, і це великий плюс. Територія лікарні невелика, але в різних закутках і не дуже знаходяться аудіозаписи сеансів з місцевими пацієнтами, що складає певне враження про їхній характер чи хід думок. На локаціях можна знайти купу щелеп Джокера, які направляють гравця на основний шлях: їх знищення дає досвід і відкриває загадки Ріддлера (я його буду так звати, бо український варіант – Загадник – мені якось не до вподоби). Окрім цього, він розкидав фігурки знаків питання, більшість з яких потребує саме прокачаних ґаджетів. Звісно ж не обійшлося без загадок: у більшості кімнат треба знайти щось, що є відповіддю на них. Для цього необхідно використати унікальну механіку детектива: Бетмен починає бачити все навколо в рентгені з підсвідкою об’єктів та інформацією щодо оточення; якщо затиснути клавішу, то відбувається аналіз, а при влучному наведенні – загадка відмічається як розгадана. Усього їх 240, тому вистачить усім. У нагороду відкриються спеціальні випробування та моделі персонажів у головному меню.

Повертаючись до вражень. У ті часи я грав як є, головне, щоб був текстовий переклад, а якщо в меню не можна було змінити озвучення, то я не шукав способів зробити це інакше. Але, Asylum була після City, тому мені не вистачало тих самих голосів. А на озвучення трьох головних ролей тут узяли найкращих – голоси з мультсеріалу 1992-1995 рр, які не тільки для мене є ідеальними для своїх персонажів – Кевін Конрой у ролі Бетмена, Марк Гемміл у ролі Джокера, Арілін Соркін у ролі Гарлі Квінн. Ніякий Крістіан Бейл, Гіт Леджер, Марґо Роббі їм не рівня. Комісара Ґордона озвучує Том Кейн, який теж професіонал, але трохи не той Джим, якого голосом грав Боб Гейстінгз, проте й роль тут невелика. Відчутним мінусом є сама якість цих реплік: на тлі чіткого саундтреку, фрази звучать так, наче звук стиснено заради економії місця; гадаю десь на студії лежать оригінали, але їх ми ніколи не почуємо, якщо не випустять раптовий ремастер, як це сталося з Quake II, де нам надали можливість грати з lossless-треками.

Щодо технологічної частини, то тут усе складно. З однієї сторони гра 2009 року, тому очікувати щось не варто, але з іншої, того ж року вийшла Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, що тоді було просто «вау». Ще можна згадати м’ясну Prototype, Assassin's Creed II з деталізованим оточенням, Left 4 Dead 2 з гарними анімаціями облич, Red Faction: Guerrilla з проривною фізикою. Загалом, Бетмен погано зберігся: текстури страшнуваті, персонажі просто відкривають рот з мертвим виразом обличчя, модельки якісь трохи широкі й непропорційні, купа дверей з підвантаженням, пререндерені ролики низької якості, загальне відчуття низької частоти кадрів через анімації руху, зроблені з низьким fps, шрифти субтитрів не масштабуються після Full HD тощо. Тому рекомендую [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1159691355/][b]цей посібник[/b][/url]. 

У моєму профілі можна подивитися скріншоти як виглядатиме. Я встановлював Asylum Reborn, який іде одразу з оновленим лаунчером; AsylumHD та Asylum 4K. Що це дає? Текстури на всіх поверхнях і моделях матимуть якісний оновлений вигляд та разом з катсценами будуть у 4k. Покращений запускач дасть змогу без проблем вибрати будь-яку роздільну здатність і надасть доступ до недоступних у стандартній версії параметрів, включно з тими, які активують моди. Вбудована технологія NVIDIA PhysX працюватиме належним чином і в повну силу, що не тільки надасть фізичну модель кожному папірцю в частих стосах, але й усі цеглини чи інші предмети взіємодіятимуть з моделями: особливо круто на вулиці ходити й розкидувати листя на підлозі. Єдине місце, де всі ці покращення можуть навантажити систему, це сутичка зі Страхопудалом, де на екрані сотні маленьких об’єктів, що лікується сучасним залізом або середніми налаштуваннями PhysX.

Якщо подобається Бетмен чи якась інша гра серії Arkham – рекомендую зіграти, тим паче є гарний [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1914493673/][b]українізатор[/b][/url]. Якщо ні, то я не знаю навіщо фанат Kingdome Come читає цю рецензію. | It is a great beginning to the Arkhamverse. I loved it when I first played it on the console, and it still holds up all these years later. It's a shame that the same can't be said about Rocksteady | До цього часу не грав в жодну частину Batman. Навіть жодного ролику чи огляду не бачив.  Гра мене здивувала своєю простотою та якістю. Навіть зараз ця гра виглядає достойно. 
Світ створений в темних тонах, все в стилі DC. Легкий та зрозумілий сюжет. Доволі велика, умовно, відкрита карта. Бо в деякі місця можливо дістатися пройшовши по сюжету і отримавши нові гаджети.  
Якісно озвучені герої. Відчувається їхнє безумство та психологічний розлад.  Їхній біографічний опис повністю втілений в гру їхніми діями.  Намальовані вони також прикольно. Особливо Джокер у фінальному файті. Я прям кайфанув від його вигляду.
І так...!!!м  Самий мед, сама насолода в грі - це бойова механіка. Ти ніби створюєш музичний твір набираючи більше комбо в такт натиснутими клавішами. Кожен бій можна виграти по різному. Любиш прямий контакти - то в перед, головне вирубити першим того хто із зброєю. А можна діяти, як справжній хижак. Полювати на кожного окремо. Так круто спостерігати за панікою тих ворогів, що залишаються живими. Їхнє серцебиття частішає, уважність стає меншою і як наслідок - неминучий, тихий нокаут.
Цю гру варто спробувати тому хто в неї не грав. І можна зіграти між сесіями нинішнього конвеєрного ігро-світу. Однозначно рекомендую! | great linear cinematic game. the art direction is beautiful and the claustrophobic disturbing atmosphere of the asylum is great. plot is intriguing as it sets in a narrow period between a clearly long, filled past and questions of what could come after it.  interactive storytelling is professional as i felt like the game knew what i would think and where i would go as an impulse, numerous times. combat is fluent and enjoyable. batman's body shape is goofy af. definitely recommend it and the games came after it, the quality just gets better like a snowball with each game of the series.

Game Name: Batman: Arkham City - Game of the Year Edition
Reviews:
Almost 13 years later, I finally played this game—and my only regret is not playing it sooner! Batman: Arkham City GOTY was an incredible experience, a true gem among superhero open-world action games. I had high expectations going in, and to my surprise, the game not only met but exceeded them (aside from a few small annoyances).

Story & Characters – A Masterclass in Superhero Narrative
The story is phenomenal, with Batman trying to save Arkham City from major threats like Hugo Strange and, most notably, Joker, who easily takes the crown as the best antagonist in the entire Arkham series. Mark Hamill delivers an outstanding performance as the Clown Prince of Crime, making every second of his voice acting an absolute treat. Joker constantly keeps the player on edge with his unpredictable nature, and his dynamic with Harley Quinn makes for an even greater threat to Gotham.

A quick side note: Harley Quinn’s Revenge DLC is a must-play. It perfectly captures Harley’s character as seen in Arkham Asylum, something that was unfortunately lost in Arkham Knight, Origins, and the disastrous Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League, where she was reduced to being loud, annoying, and dumb just for the sake of being dumb.

Heroes & Their Roles
Batman is portrayed exceptionally well. Several moments force him to make tough choices—saving multiple lives at the cost of one, particularly in situations involving Talia and Joker. I do wish Alfred had a bigger role, but I still appreciated his presence, guiding Bruce and helping him navigate the moral dilemmas and stopping Protocol 10.

Kevin Conroy delivers an outstanding performance, with some truly great lines, and his brilliance especially shines during Batman’s face-off with Penguin and Joker. In my opinion, he is the only true Batman, and his iconic voice will be deeply missed. Rest easy, legend.

Robin’s cameo felt underwhelming, and I really wish he had been a playable character instead of Catwoman, who, while a great character, took up more spotlight than necessary. That said, I didn’t mind her missions being interwoven with Batman’s story since they created suspenseful cliffhangers, making me even more eager to see what happened next. My only complaint is that her final mission takes place after the game’s ending credits, at a point where I no longer cared as much about her story an plot that was mostly finished. It felt forced and sluggish to complete. Also, her climbing mechanics are frustrating and extremely unsatisfying.

Gameplay & Atmosphere
The combat system is greatly improved, adding much more depth to fights. Enemies now have new weapons, shields, and minibosses wielding hammers and other heavy weapons. Titans also make a return, and they are incredibly satisfying to defeat. These additions make battles feel more dynamic and force players to think more strategically rather than just button-mashing through encounters.

The ending is pure cinema. The soundtrack throughout the entire game is phenomenal, but it really hits hard at the conclusion. Without spoiling anything, I was left in an abyss of thought, wondering: What’s next for Batman? I wanted to see more, to understand what was going through Bruce’s mind at that moment. The depth and foreshadowing in this game are incredible.

The only thing that felt slightly lacking compared to Arkham Asylum was the atmosphere. While Arkham City is a fantastic open world, it didn’t quite capture the same eerie, claustrophobic tension that made the first game so special (not like it had to).

Minor Issues & Logical Gaps
One of the strangest moments was the Mr. Freeze boss fight. While it was mechanically creative, it felt somewhat forced, as if the game just needed to include a boss battle. Story-wise, it didn’t make much sense—Batman would have helped Freeze’s wife regardless, given everything that had happened before (rescuing Freeze’s suit, saving him from Penguin, etc.).

Another oddity was the Hush side mission (Identity Thief). Somehow, Hush manages to escape Arkham City by trapping Batman in an apartment for, like, a minute. I refuse to believe that the same Batman who stops an entire city’s crime in one night just casually lets Hush walk free after a 60-second inconvenience. He even says, “I’ll hunt him down tomorrow,” yet it takes him nine months (canonically) to catch him in another game. 😂

Final Thoughts – Should You Play It?
Despite these minor flaws, I absolutely loved playing Arkham City, and it’s a game I will always appreciate and recommend—to you, the reader, and to anyone who enjoys superhero games and action-packed combat.

For me, Arkham Asylum is still my favorite due to its unforgettable atmosphere and the fact that it was my first Batman game. However, don’t let that stop you from playing this one—Arkham City is a massive, innovative upgrade over the first game and remains one of the best superhero stories ever told in gaming.

Buy it on sale if you can, but even at full price, it’s worth every penny for the sheer amount of content you get. | Arkham City — это Arkham Asylum, помноженная на десять. С Женщиной-Кошкой. Еще один знатный повод не высыпаться в течение нескольких ночей, распечатать огромный постер супергероя в черной мантии, повесить его в своей личной комнате и не стесняться высокомерных смешков «типа уже повзрослевших» сверстников, включая девушек. Ведь самое главное для нас то, что Бэтмен по-прежнему очень крут и востребован. Большое вам за это спасибо, Rocksteady! | [h3][b]Did you know Batman AC is already remastered? By fans. Again.[/b][/h3]
[quote][b] Rating: 9/10 [/b][/quote]
This is a direct sequel to Arkham Asylum so I highly recommend you to play in sequence. This game underwent significant improvement over the previous title. As the name suggest, the game is set in Arkham City and features a full open world, with few side missions.

Occasionally I faced issues where multiple people would start talking and you would be unable to hear any of them. It's unlikely they will fix this. Other than that, its fantastic game and kind of unbelievable they achieved this level of graphics in 2012 in a open world environment. Only make sure to use LSFG program to achieve higher FPS.

You get to play as 2 characters - Batman and Catwomen. Even as Robin in its DLC, don't forget to play that expansion.

Rocksteady had added so many improvements such as much more fluent combat, new gadgets, a minimal city that we freely glide, and new side missions that include villains like Bane, Deadshot, and Zsasz etc. However, when I see Joker as a main villain, I’ve really felt like I’m going to puke. Because we already experienced Joker in Arkham Asylum and I’m bored as hell. Eventually, as flawed as it is, Batman Arkham City is the best Arkham game and everyone should experience this work of art. | Как и любой отличный сиквел развивает идеи оригинала и улучшает их, делая больше и лучше. А Сити считается самой гармоничной и грамотно сделанной, что и по геймлею, то и с точки зрения сюжета

Best Batman game ever!

Story was interesting and fun.
Combat and mechanics were so good.

 | Even after a decade of release, this game still better than most of latest single player games. From story to action, stealth and side mission, the Arkham series is worth every penny you spent on it. | It's the weaker of the 3 Batman Arkham games made by Rocksteady. But It's still pretty good.
Improvements over the other 2 games are the graphics mostly, it's kinda surprising it uses UE3 and manages to look this good and finally after so many years and some patches it runs flawlessly (performance wise), just make sure to install it on your ssd/nvme and not a mechanical drive. And the second improvement that is most noticeable over the other 2 is the melee combat, its way more refined and feels more fluid than previous 2, city was almost at the same level but with the extra quick gadget moves and some other stuff this one feels better. 

Sadly, story wise its a downgrade over the other 2 that are made by the same studio, and the worst part out of this is they locked the final cutscene under 100% completion, meaning you gotta do the stupid riddler challenges and trophies if you want to watch the cutscene, if you don't feel like it just play until you have done most of the stuff and side content and just watch that cutscene on youtube, you'll probably save 10h~.

The game focuses way more than AC in open world activities and on top of riddler stuff, they added bases, mines and other activities besides the stories from other villains and lots of them require you to use the car, the car doesn't handle as well as most people would expect, its serviceable, the combat is more fun than the racing challenges or traveling with it.

The DLCs aren't bad but they feel less polished, batgirl dlc has some random crashes, harley, nightwing, robin and red hood dlcs are pretty short and last catwoman dlc is short but it has a fundamental design flaw in the last battle, they designed it so badly you need to avoid using whatever you have learned playing the game and not counter, use special moves, gadgets or anything other than spamming attack as quickly as you can, otherwise the floor traps will get you, i've seen plenty of people with problems in that last fight in the dlc and that's what worked for me, do not even bother with counter attacks.

Overall the game is ok, if i was reviewing it on release date or close to it i wouldn't recommend it, but since plenty of time has passed, most people will be able to run it smoothly and base game bugs have been ironed out. Grab it when it's on sale for cheap around major sales and enjoy the last entry of the Arkham series. | Graphics- Great
Gameplay- Amazing
Story- Great

年轻而又愤怒的姥爷，抱着一腔热血开启自己的义警之路。Boss战系列最佳，又爽又好看，剧情满分。虽然有点小bug，但是不影响游玩，总体来说瑕不掩瑜，推荐入手。 | Its good game with all great combat and the deathstroke fight was goat for me | Second Arkham game I've played (Asylum being the first), still City and Knight to go eventually. Good game overall, I liked the storyline and its open-worldness. The first battle of the whole game (with KC) was so so buggy for me, I'd lose sound and he would disappear completely, but the rest of the game played completely fine?.. Otherwise I'd recommend if you're looking to go through the series. | [h3][b]Play this first, before Asylum & City.[/b][/h3]
[quote][b] Rating: 9/10 [/b][/quote]
Game starts with a banger intro, hooked me right away.

Story takes place before Arkham Asylum, so I highly recommend you to play in chronological order and not release order. I feel this game is little underrated (ignoring bugs). Combat feels so much better now. Graphics is stunning as always, just lower the in-game brightness for natural batman dark tone and you will have a blast, especially if you love cinematic story.

They added more enemy bosses, which I felt the previous games didn't focus enough on. But it's not all roses and butterflies. Game is definitely still buggy, with few prominent ones like inconsistent grappling hook, simultaneous double batman voices, ground takedown not working, etc. In fact, a game breaking glitch in the DLC made me restore old save from steam to proceed!

[b]While the issue isn't going to be fixed anytime soon, the game in itself is good. I had a fantastic time.[/b] | O conceito do jogo é extremamente interessante, mas talvez pelo fato de ter sido produzido por um estúdio que não é a Rocksteady, foi mal aproveitado em certos quesitos. Arkham Origins bebe muito da fórmula de Arkham City, é melhor vê-lo como uma DLC do que como um jogo a parte, mas traz elementos que o fazem se destacar. As boss fights são um grande exemplo disso, mas um dos aspectos que mais me cativam são as cutscenes e a história. A forma como o jogo antecipa eventos futuros da série Arkham é muito emocionante pra quem já jogou os outros jogos

Gosto especialmente da maneira como o jogo retrata o Bruce mais jovem e inexperiente, cometendo erros como esquecer de amarrar o Choque e aprendendo a interrogar criminosos. A relação dele com Alfred ganha mais profundidade, e vemos o início de sua parceria com Gordon e sua icônica rivalidade com o Coringa.

Em termos de gameplay, não há muitas inovações, exceto pelas luvas de choque que não são lá grande coisa e um maior foco nas investigações, que são absurdamente superior nesse jogo. A CENA DO LACEY TOWERS É CINEMA.

No entanto, o jogo não está isento de falhas. Metade do mapa é uma cópia de Arkham City, e o sistema de planejamento do jogo é lento até mesmo sendo comparado com o City. O maior desperdício foi o com Slade. A luta contra ele é a melhor do jogo, mas acontece cedo demais na minha opinião. O marketing vendeu nos trailers esse embate como um dos grandes momentos do jogo, e, embora seja espetacular, posicioná-lo tão cedo na história acabou estragando o que prometeu.

Outra coisa que irrita é o fato de metade dos colecionáveis foram um ctrl c ctrl v com skin diferente, os troféus foram substituídos por um pacote de dados (Por mais que seja muito legal colocar como último coletável do charada o troféu que aparece futuramente na saga). Outros colecionáveis e missões sofrem do mesmo problema, o TITAN do Arkham City foi transformado em substância química que tão separadas em 6 pelo mapa e você precisa explodir, igual no jogo anterior.

Apesar de ser um bom vilão e eu gostar da participação dele, o Coringa foi introduzido de mal gosto na minha opinião, seria melhor ter ele como uma DLC do que na história principal, o Máscara Negra seria muito superior como vilão e também daria mais foco aos outros personagens como o Deadshot e a Shiva. Se o jogo não tivesse cortado tanto conteúdo bom pra incluir um multiplayer medíocre, esse jogo seria facilmente top 1 da franquia. 

Mesmo com as críticas, esse é um dos meus jogos favoritos, vale a pena jogar sim.

Game Name: Batman™: Arkham Origins Blackgate - Deluxe Edition
Reviews:
Скучная и однообразная. Решил все таки купить (несмотря на отзывы) я не думал что всё на столько плохо. Если не хотите испортить своё впечатление об франшизе Бэтмена, лучше не играйте. | La prison de Blackgate a été prise d’assaut par les hordes de criminels qui la contrôlent désormais. Seul Batman peut rétablir l’ordre à l’intérieur. Il ne sait pas que la prison cache un obscur secret bien plus complexe qu’une simple guerre de gangs…

Spin-off de la lignée des jeux Batman Arkham, cet épisode vous propose un tour dans Blackgate, en gardant l’ambiance qui a fait recette par trois fois. Mêmes bruitages, même style graphique, musiques dans la même veine, mêmes commandes. Le gameplay a toutefois une différence de taille : tout est en 2D, avec parfois quelques tours avec la profondeur. L’intrigue est présentée en VOST sous forme de bande dessinée « comic », ce qui donne un cachet supplémentaire à ce jeu. Et il vous faudra faire preuve d’astuce pour retrouver votre chemin dans cette prison, et éliminer les plus grands criminels qui s’y bousculent.

Sans être un grand chef-d’œuvre indispensable, ce jeu est un petit plaisir à apprécier à sa juste valeur. | Хорошая залипалка, один из лучших платформеров который действительно включает воображение от реализма а не кубиковости-платформенности происходящего, но последний бой в техническом плане конечно сильно подпортил впечатление от игры, отсутствие большего количества телепортов между корпусами тоже минус, но в целом повторюсь, игра залипательна и как фоновый актив очень даже хороша. | Allah sizin bin belanızı versin

It belongs to the metroidvania genre, and it is doing ok at it.

[b]Thank you for taking the time to read and think about this review.[/b]
[hr][/hr] | [h1]The Game[/h1]
A game that should only be played once. A game that discovers the problem of a normal human mind. A game that reflects our real world.

[h1]The Story[/h1]
The story this game tells is of guilt, sorrow and loss. This story can only be felt by interacting with it. This story can not be told by any other media. 

[h1]The Unsatisfactory Ending[/h1]
The ending if this game is so unsatisfactory that it pulls you out of itself to let you think about your own life. I play games to unwind and relax, to forget my own problems and struggles but this game just reflected that back to me. The thing from which I tried to run away was thrown back at me. There was no happy end to this story, yet it makes you feel at ease after completing. 

[h1]Final Thought[/h1]
Firewatch tells a story that has never been and will never be told by any other media. The story which connects our real lives to the lives of Henry and Delilah. The guilt felt by Ned is felt by the player. This game is too complex or rather I should say that the human mind is too complex to describe in words. | Довольно атмосферное приключение на один раз с хорошей историей и музыкой. Единственное, что раздражало, так это использование анимаций при спуске с любого уступа. | Para quienes no saben que es, Firewatch es un Walking simulator que dura unas 4 horas de mundo abierto donde seremos un vigilante contra incendios y que tiene un gran enfasis en la narrativa y la inmersión. Más que un juego es una experiencia como puede serlo un pelicula.

Lo mejor del juego es sin duda la narrativa, la atmosfera y los personajes, el doblaje (en ingles) es muy muy bueno, los personajes se sienten muy naturales, reales y organicos. En cuanto a la trama, considero que esta muy bien llevada y es muy interesante durante gran parte del juego, quizás lo unico pólemico, es el final, que o bien te gusta y quizas incluso te haga replantearte cosas o quizás te deje un poco frio. En mi caso el final me ha dejado un poco frio, pero considero que el recorrido hasta llegar ahi ha sido muy muy bueno.

Lo peor del juego: las mecanicas de movimiento y salto no estan nada pulidas, el personaje tiene a veces a quedarse trabado y a tener fallos en algunas animaciones, aunque no es grave, en un juego donde la inmersion es tan importante le quita puntos y te puede sacar un poco de la experiencia.

En conclusión: Lo recomiendo? Si, si te gustan los walking simulators y buscas una muy buena experiencia narrativa, Firewatch te la va a dar. Si nunca has jugado a un walking simulator pero te gusta disfrutar de una buena historia, tambien lo recomiendo siempre y cuando vengas con la mentalidad de que estas disfrutando de una experiencia narrativa y no de un juego al uso. | [h1][b][i] UNA BREVE PERO HERMOSA EXPERIENCIA [/i][/b][/h1]

Firewatch era otro de los tantos juegos que tenia pendiente y que me arrepiento un poco el haber tardado en darle una oportunidad, ya que en la pocas horas que tiene de duración, podremos disfrutar de una hermosa experiencia jugable tanto en lo visual como en lo bien lograda que esta su narrativa y desarrollo de personajes, aunque con un gameplay bastante simple, hace de este juego uno de los más entrañables que he disfrutado recientemente.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3412209318

Pese a que es un juego bastante simple y sin muchas mecánicas, ya que es básicamente un walking simulator, pero pese a esto es un juego que se disfruta en todo momento. Todo esto porque a primera vista se puede apreciar la mejor carta de presentación de Firewatch, ese estilo gráfico tan precioso y la ambientación tan bien conseguida. Durante las horas que dura la aventura, nos encontraremos explorando los rincones de ese precioso bosque y ríos montañosos tan bien diseñados y sobretodo, el gran trabajo en la iluminación que presentan cada uno de los rincones de su mapa. No solo la parte gráfica logra esta gran sensación, el apartado sonoro también esta tan bien trabajado con esos sonidos ambientales que iremos apreciando , haciendo de la exploración de este juego algo hermoso, haciendo que aveces no avance en la historia y que me hubiera gustado que la misma durara un poco más.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3412732211

Por otra parte su historia, pero sobretodo su narrativa, me parecieron de lo más particular e interesante. Desde el inicio nos dan un contexto general sobre el presente de nuestro protagonista y el porque acabo en el trabajo de guardaparques, lo que a partir de ahí nos lleva a entablar un curiosa relación con la supervisora del lugar. En ese momento la historia se desarrolla por medio de conversaciones cortas en diferentes situaciones o por cosas que podremos ir encontrando por el mapa, y donde podremos ver mejor la personalidad y desarrollo de ambos personajes, en especial la de nuestro protagonista, el cual afectado por su pasado, intenta sobrellevar una nueva vida. A la par de los personajes, también esta su historia, muy interesante y que esconde un misterio, el cual termina siendo el eje principal de la trama, con varias partes llenas de suspenso e intriga, y que nos tocara el trabajo de investigar. Aunque quizás la duración no daba para más la duración, esos saltos de tiempo que da en algunos momentos nunca me terminan de gustar y tal vez así hubiéramos obtenido algo más de duración.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3413322149

[h1][b] [u] PROS:[/u] [/b][/h1]

[list]

[*]Su precioso estilo gráfico, con una iluminación tan bien trabajada, y su ambientación tan bien realizada, con esos bellos bosques y ríos, hace de este uno de los juegos más entrañables que disfrutado en mucho tiempo.
[*]Me encanto su narrativa y personajes, muy bien trabajados y con un desarrollo, donde iremos conociendo más a cada uno de los protagonistas y el misterio en el que se ven envueltos.

[/list]

[h1][b] [u] CONTRAS:[/u] [/b][/h1]

[list]

[*]De lo poco malo que puedo encontrarle es que no me terminan de gustar esos saltos de tiempo que da la historia, y aunque la misma no daba para tanto, si que la sentí un poco corta.

[/list]

Firewatch es un juego totalmente recomendado, que a muchos les gustara y que se puede completar en una tarde, pero que pese a lo corto que es, todo lo bueno que ofrece lo compensa por completo y aplaudir el gran trabajo, y cariño que le han puesto sus desarrolladores. 
Aunque ahora son parte de Valve y no han vuelto a pronunciar nada de su próximo juego, tengo la esperanza de que en algún momento inesperado sean capaces de lanzarlo y así volver a vivir una experiencia similar.

No strategy, no risk, no interest.

I wanted to like this game.  I really tried, but in the end, it was a disappointment.  If you want a D&D-style game, buy Pillars of Eternity -- it's superior to Sword Coast Legend in every way.

First, SCL is not really D&D, the mechanics are all wrong.  First, all abilities are cooldown-based.  Additionally, the cool downs are so long, that only in the very longest of battles (of which I have had less than 5), you can use your abilities only once.  This means that a wizard will launch all of his most powerful spells at the beginning of the battle, and then has to sit out the rest of fight, throwing cantrips from long range.  There is no strategy, and no skill in preparing particular spells.  

Worse yet, your enemies don't follow the D&D mechanics like your characters do.  While your characters deal damage and have HP in accordance (roughly) with D&D rules, your enemies have MASSIVE hitpoints, and do little damage.  This means that after your wizard launches all his spells at the beginning of combat, your enemies are hardly damaged at all.  Every battle, therefore, becomes a war of attrition.  Your melee fighters line up and slowly, ever so slowly, beat down the enemies' massive hitpoints.  Every battle is a sure victory provided you have enough potions or healing spells to keep your people on their feet.  No strategy, no tactics, no risk, and no interest.

Third, there is so much magical loot none of it feels special.  Kill a goblin?  Magical loot.  Find a treasure chest sitting randomly in the middle of the forest?  Magical loot.  Break open a barrel on the side of the road in the Luskan slums? Magical loot.  It's too much.

Fourth, your party members are useful in combat only.  In Pillars of Eternity, one of the best things about the game were the text-based cutaways where you solved problems using your entire party's skills or attributes.  Here, only your main character's attributes matter for solving problems.  Here's one mind-numblingly aggravating example:  I needed to open a vine-covered trap door.  My character, a wizard, has low strength and failed to pull the vines off.  My party member, a fighter with massive strength, could not be used to pull the vines.  Additionally, despite knowing spells like fireball and disintigration, my wizard was not given the option to use those skills to remove the vines.

Fifth, you have very few abilities.  A wizard does not have access to any spell he finds.  Instead, he gets certain skill trees, each one of which has no more than 4 or 5 spells.  As you level up, you simply unlock a new tier of the same spell that does slightly more damage.  For instance, at 5th level you can get fireball.  At your next level, you get fireball 2, which does slightly more damage.  It is followed by fireball 3.  All the spells work this way.  Consequently, you will have, at most, about 15 unique spells.

Finally, the main plot is not particularly interesting, the characters don't captivate, and the sidequests are obnoxious.  SCL's biggest failure is its mechanics, but a close second is its failure to pull you into the D&D universe and keep you interested.

In sum, although I am a huge fan of D&D and CRPGs, I could not bring myself to like this game.  Again, if you want a good D&D-style CRPG, buy Pillars of Eternity.  There is nothing this game offers that Pillars doesn't do better. | Ich habe dieses Spiel lediglich wegen der Kampagne gekauft und wurde nicht entäuscht. Das sich das Spiel nicht zu 100% an D&D Regeln hält ist sogar ein Vorteil, da es  deutlich mehr Individualität bietet. Ich kann zwar einen Zauberer in eine schweren Rüstung  stecken aber Sinn macht dies durch die vielen vergebenen Fähigkeitspunkte nicht wirklich. Außerdem passt es natürlich überhaupt nicht zum Zauberer. Falls jemand aber einen Kampfmagier spielen möchte, so hat er dazu die Gelegenheit. Auch die Abklingzeit  finde ich angenehmer zu spielen als das ursprüngliche Löschen u. Vorbereiten der einzelnen Zauber.  Die mächtigen Zauber kann man sowieso meist nur 1x im Kampf nutzen. Die Story ist spannend und sie findet  durchgehend in den Vorgotten Realms Gebieten statt. Die Gebiete sind schön gezeichnet. Die Kämpfe machen Spass und sind sowohl rein manuell zu bedienen, als auch falls gewünscht mit einer guten automatischen KI versehen.  Eine Sammeltruhe für Messies ist inzwischen am Lagerplatz vorhanden.  Die Kampagne dauert bei mir inzwischen 50 Std. mit allen Nebenquests der verschiedenen Charaktere und ich bin noch nicht am Ende. Unverständlich ist und bleibt die Begrenzung auf nur einen einzigen Speicherplatz. Die Kameraführung wurde inzwischen etwas verbessert, indem man mit der Maus am Rand scrollen kann.  Mir gefälllt das Spiel auf jeden Fall bisher besser als Pillars of Eternity.  Wenn ich mir hier die negativen Wertungen ansehe, dann ist schon auffällig, dass sehr viele nach wenigen Stunden, also nachdem sie noch nicht einmal das Startgebiet abgeschlossen haben können, ein Spiel bewerten, welches sie nie wirklich gespielt haben. Und wenn hier noch einige von Hack- und Slay Spiel sprechen, dann muss man sich wirklich fragen ob  diese Psychose inzwischen einen ansteckenden Verlauf genommen hat.
Mein Fazit: Eine tolle Kampagne, fordernde Kämpfe ( zumindest manuell auf normal gespielt), präsentes D&D Setting in den Vorgotten Realms( wenn auch nicht ganz regelgetreu). Ordentlicher Umfang, durchgehend interessante Story.
Für mich ein Rollenspiel- Highligt des Jahres . | "Наши ожидания - это наши проблемы." Обзор скромного фаната серии игр по D&D,для таких же фанатов.

Когда я покупал предзаказ за полторы тысячи, ожидал улучшенный NN2 (Newerwinter Nights).

Грубо говоря я надеялся на это: 

Глубокий,удивляющий игрока нелинейный сюжет,с реализованной реиграбельностью
Более,менее атмосферную (не Ведьмака,но хотя бы как в POE) графическую составляющую (вспомните допустим,шикарнейший,хоть и устарелый сейчас графон и дизайн уровней в дополнении к NN2 - Mask of Betrayer)
Кучу разнообразных скиллов,классов,расс и возможность сделать неожиданный мультикласс c редкой расой и подрасой.
Более удобным,или хоть таким же как в NN2 управлением и менюшками.
Тактической боевой системой,которую можно понять и использовать множество тактик,в зависимости от соперника (как было и в BG и NN и POE и DOS.) 

Так вот.Забудьте. Этого всего вы в этой игре НЕ НАЙДЕТЕ.Максимум - настолько урезанно реализованное слабое подобие,что мне даже не за деньги стало жалко (Хотя сумма за это просто огромная, за эти деньги можно купить NN2 + POE или все части Ведьмака,или добавить рублей 500 и взять любую дорогую игру типа GTA5 или Fallout.) а просто за потраченное время.Я же теперь к ней психологически привязан,должен хотя бы раз пройти поскольку такую сумму отдал.
  
Я мог бы долгоооооо перечислять все минусы и косяки,которые я нашел..И дело даже не в багах (их тут не особо много)
а в провальном геймдизайнерском и концепт-документе,за который руки оторвать и в **** засунуть по самые помидоры мало будет.

Итог = 58 % положительных отзывов,как следствие провально установленных приорететов при разработке игры.Обьясняю популярно: глупо делать CRPG по великой D&D "упрощая", убирать "ненужные классы и расы" писать непроходимо тупой,напичканный штампами и повторами из других игр по D&D сюжет,который заставляет фейспалмить при почти всех диалогах и даже событиях,которые легко предсказуемы и вызывают рвотные позывы.И самое главное: делать настолько неинтересную боевую систему,с крохотным количеством реально полезных скиллов и ооооогромным откатом (фэйл которого уже все признали,и не попинал разрабов только ленивый).Про эргономику менюшек вообще молчу.В NN она была более-менее тухлая, но здесь умудрились сделать еще тухлее (как это возможно????)

Однозначно не рекомендую к покупке.Надежды что допилят,и в патчах пофиксят - нет.Это тот случай,когда надо переделывать всю игру с самого начала.

Для только начинающих играть в игры по D&D рекомендую вышеупомянутые игры типа Pillars of Eternity (хоть она и не D&D,но на тех же принципах), Newerwinter Nights2 и Baldurs Gate (хотя вначале сложновато,и кривовато,зато после них вам ни одна RPG сложной не покажется,и будете отлично ориентироваться в Фаэруне)  


Этот обзор отражает исключительно мое субьективное мнение,сформированное на основании 8 часов игры в режиме кампании, и может не совпадать с обьективными причинно-следственными связями.Обзор написан через несколько дней после релиза, актуален на это время. | Before I start this review I just want to say I am reviewing this as a video game, not a d&d game. So if you re looking for an in depth review on how well this translates in a D&D context I am sorry, I don't have much for ya. Now to begin!

This game is actually a very good game, it is simply mauled by some bad choices that will probably annoy you over time such as

- Non skippable cutscenes and dialogue.
- Having to listen to that non skippable dialogue over and over if you lose to a boss.
- Not all skill trees are available from the beginning.
- One or two side quests in the game can glitch and become uncompleteable.
- Your games are open to public by default and if you don't notice that a player can jump in while you are getting an xp reward and block your character from getting it.
- Leveling takes a very long time so If you don't use a character for a while there is a good chance they aren't catching back up for the rest of the game.
- Companion ai will sometimes neglect some of their skills and this can be exceptionally frustrating when its the healer.
- All abilities in the game have fairly long cooldowns, normally a minute or higher

However, despite these flaws, I really found this to be a gem of a game (just save often). In my opinion this plays like a much more refined and less clunky dragon age origins. It does a lot of great things other similar games just don't do as well, such as

- Giving you a ton of abilities and skills that are all unique and interesting.
- Giving you several options on how to use your classes ( I have a dual wielding tank that works!)
- Avoiding boring fetch quests!
- Making each quest feel meaningful.
- Giving you options for how to complete quests (ponying up some coin to save time in some cases)
- Making most characters in the game world feel unique and alive.
- Making all encounters challenging enough to possibly kill you if you mess up, but not so hard they are enfuriating.
- Making gold a resource that is valuable instead of something that is in endless supply.

This truly is a great game that does a ton of stuff well and is just an all around great party based rpg. However I can certainly see how some of the negatives can have people pulling their hair out. If you have any sort of patience then I highly recommend it. You can't beat it, especially for $20. 

90% of the negative reviews are people complaining this isn't D&D, so if you are looking for the most hardcore D&D experience then maybe skip this one (and play it on a board, no offense guys, but c'mon).

Another 5% are people complaining this isn't a $40 game and this hasn't been $40 bucks for a while so another moot point. 

If you are just looking for a solid game, weigh my points above, and if the negatives don't sound like they will drive you insane, pick this up. | Абсолютно не оправдал ожидания. Никак не передает атмосферу игр Forgotten Realms. Отвратительная постановка диалогов и сюжетных сцен. Даже карту не сделали интерактивной, ей до ужаса неудобно пользоваться. Данное ограничение было бы понятно, если бы на карте экран тоже мог продвигаться только на ограниченном пространстве.
Все персонажи очень поверхностныею В сравнении с другии аналогичными играми, они выглядят просто стандартными балванчиками, подкинутыми в игру для галочки. Глубокого сюжета нет.
Fica bem chato depois de um tempo

Game Name: Dr. Langeskov, The Tiger, and The Terribly Cursed Emerald: A Whirlwind Heist
Reviews:
[b]“I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.” ― Jerome K. Jerome[/b]

Coming from the designer behind [i]The Stanley Parable[/i] and a young developer team, this free little game with a needlessly long name carries a similar pattern of blatant absurdity. Due to the ridiculous amount of probable effort that I'd have to put while writing the whole completion of the title each time, I'll be referring to the game simply as [i]Dr.Langeskov[/i] for the remainder of this review. Now that is settled, let me try doing this properly.

Following the example of [i]The Stanley Parable[/i], it is somewhat hard to write a review to a game that would be better played without knowing anything about it. So, if you'd like to enjoy the full experience, I'd highly recommend to stop reading and give it a try to see it for yourself. Since it already is a freeware, you won't have anything to lose rather than 15 minutes of your time.

Still here? Well then. You've asked for it. Since we've already downloaded the game, we must have intended to actually play it, right? There is one little problem though. As the game starts, we are very apologetically informed that they are unable to let us play since it is a single player game and there is already one person playing it. Apparently we have to wait for the other player to finish the game before trying it ourselves. But since the studio conditions are a bit below excellent - nope, of course there are no safety hazards! What is it you are thinking? - There is a shortage of employees in the whole place due to a recent strike. We are informed that it would all go quite swiftly if we were to help them simulate the game for the player inside. Reluctantly agreeing, we start following - or try to follow, at least - directions of the young director with a mousy voice and a British accent, who dreads that our every single action might end in a catastrophy.

As you can see, this short, 15 minute adventure is a complete parody of a developmental concept. There is no actual game here. Like that the cake was a lie, the game itself is a lie. The whole thing is a smart and somewhat enjoyable conceptual experiment that could invoke some appreciation. Certainly not a masterpiece - and not in the claim of being so anyway - and the humor isn't exceptional, but [i]Dr. Lengeskov[/i] presents you a distraction and a smirk on your face for 15 minutes: a task well done. It might be noteworthy to mention that the expected gameplay is somewhat linear contrary to [i]The Stanley Parable[/i], carrying only one possible ending. The idea is to enjoy the environment, the concept and the reactions you are having around. Very much like any joke.

Throughout your playthrough, you might want to investigate the environment, since there are items around to collect for achievements. Achievements themselves are a bit buggy though. I recommend not using the steam overlay or sending the game to tray since it may block achievements from unlocking. If all else fails, verify cache and they should trigger the next time you are meeting their conditions.

Go ahead. I know that you are already curious. It is not the wittiest kid on the block, but it is here and it is free with certain creative value. Enjoy!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games! | [b]Внимание! Обзор может содержать скучные предупреждения, а также, исходя из общей продолжительности игры, спойлеры, посему воздержитесь от чтения, если обзор вызывает у вас скуку.[/b]

Компьютерные игры, как и любая форма искусства, способны вызвать самые разные эмоции у геймера. Порой чувства бывают диаметрально противоположны, к примеру, большинство мультиплеерных забав способны вызывать одновременно, как любовь, так и ненависть, обзоры на туже «Doty 2» яркий тому пример. И подобно живописи или художественной литературе, игры способны влиять на наше мировоззрение и отношение к жизни. Конечно же, не всё. Конечно же, таких игр даже не большинство, но они встречаются. Порой же, разработчики позволяют себе такую вольность, как «ломание четвертой стены» и где герои/антигерои игры обращаются непосредственно к геймеру. Как правило, это делается в шутливой форме, как это было в «Wither 3» или происходящее вовсе превращается в шутку – «Postal 2», но порой бывают и серьезные беседы, дающие пищу для ума. Одной из таких игр была «Stanley Parable», о которой многие слышали, но не все видели. Что ж, наш сегодняшний гость позволит исправить сие досадное упущение, ведь вышел он из-под руки тех же ребят, что отвечали за «Стэнли», но при этом игра распространяется на бесплатной основе и таким образом каждый сможет приобщится к прекрасному, ну или ужасному, как повезет.

Итак, вы - компьютерная программа. Нет, конечно же, к вам будут обращаться напрямую, как к личности, но суть заключается в том, что вы программа, которая так и норовит дать сбой - потыкать в выключатель, на котором написано большими красными буквами "Не нажимать". Подергать закрытые двери, постучать в них ногами и недовольно надуться на неведомого кукловода, который вас туда не пускает. Ну а еще надо обязательно проверить, что можно использовать, а что нельзя, расстроив при этом своего неведомого кукловода, который не наделил нас даже банальнейшей возможностью прыгать, что уж говорить о большем?

Казалось бы, что же в этом особенного? Ведь на Steam'е имеется куча игр, которые так или иначе издеваются над геймером. Что в этой игре такого особенного? А дело тут в том, что всё было подано в шутливой форме, причем столь грамотно, что улыбка не раз и не два посетит лицо. Во всяком случае, меня эта игра заставила улыбаться, за вас все же не поручусь. Она не может похвастаться достаточно большой продолжительностью, а потому проходится куда раньше, чем начинает надоедать. Ну а еще тут есть достижения, которые кажутся легкими, но спешу предупредить - разработчики и этот момент смогли обыграть, оттого так просто вы достижения не получите. Необходимо отключить оверлей в игре и тогда и только тогда можно рассчитывать на заветные ачивменты.

6 из 10 притаившихся тигров | Dr. Langeskov, The Tiger, and The Terribly Cursed Emerald: A Whirlwind Heist is a short free game.

Game Name: The Fall of the Dungeon Guardians - Enhanced Edition
Reviews: I don't like the real time, fast based combat. Tile based games like this are normally turn based and tactical, carefully choosing between a wide range of attacks and abilities. It just doesn't fit well.

A well made and impressive interpretation of the classic Fighting Fantasy books of the same name, Challenging but rewarding all the same a high recommendation for fans of D&D and classic games of this type

ELEX is one of those rare games that manages to deliver a great experience despite its clunky mechanics and unpolished aspects. While it stumbles in areas like combat, skill design, and it has some dubious story choices, it excels in world-building, character development, and delivering a unique sense of exploration. 

1.  Story, World-Building, and Exploration
One of ELEX's strongest qualities lies in its world and characters rather than its central story. The overarching plot isn't particularly interesting and may not pull you in, but the lore, setting, and characters more than make up for it.
The companions are unique and interesting, each with their quirks and complexities that make them stand out. For example, traveling with Arx is absolutely hilarious as his grumpy personality and comments during conversations and exploration are really out of pocket but come out in a natural and fitting way. Even the NPCs are layered and feel authentic, though many are unapologetically self-serving, but it is fitting as it is a reflection of the apocalyptic world they inhabit.
Unlike many open-world games, ELEX avoids the pitfall of creating a vast, empty and boring map. Locations are varied and distinct, making exploration feel rewarding and natural. The game also encourages and rewards curiosity by hiding supplies, lore-filled notes, or valuable gear in locations off the beaten path. This isn’t a game where you’re mindlessly checking off icons on a map; instead, you’re going to genuinely enjoy exploring each house, factory or dome you come across.
The game’s three factions are another highlight. They’re all radically different, and you’ll probably find reasons to both love and hate them. They’re well fleshed out and I found all of them to provide interesting skills and equipment that shine in their own way. My only complaint here is that the faction choice doesn’t make that much of an impact story-wise besides some extra quests for that specific faction.
 
2. The Gameplay
ELEX doesn’t hold your hand, and this tough-love approach to gameplay is both a strength and a weakness, depending on who you might ask. Personally, I enjoyed it. You begin the game as a weak character, with even basic enemies posing a serious threat to your survival. This difficulty encourages approaches you might’ve not considered in other RPGs. You’ll find yourself using the environment to your advantage, you’ll bait enemies into traps or lure them toward NPCs for help. At times, you might even find yourself running for survival. It’s a tough start, but it makes getting stronger feel so much more rewarding.

3. The Combat
The best word to describe combat: jank. You’ll be dealing with a lot of issues such as:
•	Enemies hitting you from absurd ranges or weird angles.
•	Fighting on slopes (good luck landing a hit on uneven ground).
•	Controls being unresponsive, one frequent example is when you’re drinking a potion and suddenly you can’t turn around, being stuck in an awkward strafing animation.
Ranged combat is better,  but it doesn’t redeem the overall experience. It’s not unplayable, but it’s definitely the weakest part of the game.

4. The Skill System and the UI
The skill system could’ve been so much better. Outside of faction-specific skills, most of the trees are just boring stat boosts or generic utility like lockpicking or skinning animals. It feels like a missed opportunity to add more interesting gameplay choices.
The UI also leaves much to be desired. It’s bland and feels like minimal effort was put into it. Managing menus is a pain, and the trading screen, in particular, is chaotic, lumping most items together into a disorganized mess with the exception of weapons and armors.
 
5. The Cold System
Instead of the usual Good vs. Evil morality system, ELEX uses a Cold System, which measures how emotional or detached your character is. In theory, it sounds cool but it’s kind of a mess. You’re going to be forced to pick options you don’t agree with just to balance your “Cold” level, because it affects outcomes later in the game. It feels forced and takes away from the roleplaying experience.

TLDR
ELEX is janky, clunky, and downright frustrating at times but that’s part of its charm. The world-building, exploration, and characters are great, and even though the game has its flaws, it’s still a pretty nice experience.
 | Боевая система? Проклято.

In the end I actually enjoyed the game, but there are definitely bugs. Several times I managed to fall out into the environment outside of the game, or the inability to get up after sleeping and had to laod the game.

Even if they somehow manage to "release" this game, I wouldn't recommend it. The servers will be dead, and the fanbase that enjoyed it early on is mostly long gone.
