Shadow of War is arguably the best Lord of the Rings game ever made if you want to feel like a god-like, unstoppable, bad ass, half ranger, half wraith, mind controlling, head chopping killing machine that also commands armies to conquer giant settlements all over middle earth. This game plays so unbelievably smooth and pushes the unique nemesis system to its brink. Visually stunning, a more than serviceable story, insanely satisfying and flashy combat similar to that of the Arkham games (I would say perfected freeflow combat) and faithful to Tolkein loreT, this game is a GEM and is another example of taking what made the first one so amazing and dialing that up to whole nother level. Its a shame that there is no news of another badass adventure in Middle Earth coming from Monolith Soft with the Nemesis system as any LOTR fan would undoubtedly be excited for that. Can be a little overwhelming at the start with how much power this game gives you at your fingertips but if you stick with it, it can get hard to put down. | 游戏很好玩，折扣力度也很大，可惜所需空间太大了，我的前女友下载三四次都没能玩上，她当时很喜欢这个游戏，觉得统御兽人很酷，后来我一直买新的游戏，却忘了这款尘封一年多的游戏，今天偶尔看到，当年的感情也历历在目。游戏是好的，感情也是好的，游戏没错，她也没错，只是时机不巧，我们都不够成熟。 | 制作人的离世给这款游戏带来了很多遗憾：草草结尾的剧情，没人修复的bug，全是修改的线上，甚至原本可能会做出来的精灵与矮人的玩法系统也看不到了。 游戏重复度很高，但若只当成兽人宝可梦来玩的话还是很好玩的，看到自己辛苦培养的苗子在竞技场乱杀，成就感还是很足的。 | Shadow of war siendo la continuacion de mordor ha mejorado en su jugabilidad, graficos y tematica de juego siendo mas disfrutable al momento de jugar, con los ataques a las fortalezas enemigas quizas algo que no es su fuerte es su seguridad por que muchas personas modificaron sus orcos con h@cks provocando que sean casi imposibles de vencer si eres malo jugando por supuesto, mi consejo para vencer ese tipo de orcos es siempre ir de punto en punto uno a uno, acabarlos todos en el ataque hasta que tus 6 orcos tiren a cada uno de ellos y los domines con la habilidad a distancia para facilitar dicha tarea, otra modalidad implementada fue definir la dificultad de campaña que es un acierto para los que les dificultaba ganar en shador of mordor y ayudar hacer mas desafiante a los expertos de dicho juego, yo lo recomiento por que tiene una historia fascinante de inicio a fin provocando que sea imposibel de tener en tu biblioteca de steam nwn | The nemesis system is great, it creates a unique and non repetitive experience doing a good job to diversify the enemies'  abilities making you to change your tactics. Also very  fun :)

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Early Access
Reviews:
Valheim has become a cherished part of our family time since its release, and we often find ourselves diving into new adventures during the holidays. Each of my three boys brings a unique flair to our gameplay: one loves to explore the seas with our trusty boats, another dives headfirst into danger, pushing us to gather resources in the most perilous biomes, while the youngest shines as our master base builder. We all contribute to the game in our own ways, but it’s clear to see each of our preferences. For me, Valheim truly checks all the boxes for an engaging and immersive experience. | 傻逼体力条，傻逼传送门禁止传矿，傻逼地形，傻逼斜坡滑步，傻逼怪物索敌追出去两里地。傻逼设计师，尼玛的你玩了吗。 | Отличный симулятор смерти. 
Каждый раз себе обещаешь, что удалишь эту игру, а потом ревешь в подушку и бежишь за лутом.
10 катапультированых друзей из 10 | 어떤 두 남자가 발헤임 플레이 하는걸 보고 관심이 생겼다.
이 무슨 파상풍 걸릴 것 같은 게임이지 싶었지만 착각했다.
듀오로 시작한지 150시간째, 왜 몬스터를 마주할 때마다 한 남자가 그렇게 지맨이를 찾았나 싶다.
누군가와 함께 할 게임이 필요하십니까?
발헤임으로 오십시오. | I love Valheim, it is a great game up to the plains biome. The main appeal is that it is a hard but not a frustrating game. The newest biomes, Mistlands and Ashlands have changed that. The main focus of those biomes seems to be frustration. 
Mistlands is hard to traverse, there is sheer cliffs everywhere. The devs somewhat had to admit that by adding a potion that makes jumping easier. And in the Ashlands enemies spawn at constant rates, you never have the feeling that you accomplish something. In addition, it is hard to navigate with the ship. There is a massive ring of stones around the Ashlands, so you literarily must ship out of the biome, go to the lateral point and then back in. You cannot go horizontally with the ship. And I don't understand why that is. You must use a massive ship that is slow and tedious to manouver and then you must move around places where the ship can barely fit. So, in essence the main focus to make a survival game that is not frustrating was thrown out and the main mechanics of the new biomes is to make core mechanics like moving around and exploration more tedious.

The Longing is a delightfully lonely experience, with your only company being a quiet timid creature simply named "The Shade." 
The moment you finish the intro, a timer appears at the top of the screen, counting down 400 real time days. Time passes even when the game is closed, or your device is powered off. 
From there, it's just you, a sprawling cave system, and a lonely little shadow who just wants to find some sort of comfort in their solitary life.

Pros: 
-Lovely hand drawn scenery
-Incredibly simple, yet pleasing, controls.
-Occasional comments from the Shade that just make you want to give the lil fella a hug
-A massive 'detox' from the widespread high adrenaline, constant input games that have become commonplace.
-Hidden treasures that appeal to those with a goblin hoarding instinct

Cons(?):
-I found the music to annoying, but you can toggle it (as well as atmospheric lighting and sound effects) very easily
-It can be occasionally frustrating just how incredibly slow the Shade walks, especially when you travel across a vast tunnel, only to find you've already been there, it's a dead end, and you must walk all the way back. (But as long as you save the "memory" of signifigant places like your home, you can simply click the location and wait for the lil fella to automatically walk the distance)
-The lack of explanation before beginning a time consuming task makes it so you never know if the time spend (whether it be minutes, hours, or even days) will be worth waiting for. (On the flip side, it makes it that much more rewarding when you *do* discover something special)

Conclusion:
If you're one to pursue high adrenaline, stress inducing games with fast paced gameplay, this is not the game for you.
Then again, perhaps it's just the game you need to re-discover the art of slowing things down, finding joy in the simple things, and empathize with the lonely. | 400 дней шароёбимся по пещерам в поисках контента. Рекомендую.

Хорошая игра, жаль короткая. | like an anti-game. really cool concept and execution. excited for the next 396 days | The artwork is amazing as well as the story. I quickly became invested in Shade's well-being and love checking in on him daily. This is definitely worth a try if you're looking for something casual and cozy. This is meant to be played at a much slower pace. | A game with no rules that moves along pretty slowly until you figure out you can save locations and just send your little player there.  I really enjoyed playing the game.  The ending was a little weird for me but it was over then.  It is really a puzzle game because there are no rules, very few clues, and basically just discovery and guessing.

A great 2D Zelda-like marred by being too souls-like.

I know some people really enjoy souls-like games, I do not, and Death’s Door is the perfect reason why.  Everything else about it, makes it a game I should love, a very 2D Zelda like game. The problem with Death’s Door is even when you take the time to go on the side quests to improve you character to hopefully give you an edge in later battles it never really makes a difference,  You never really feel like your character has gotten more powerful, battles are just a matter of ‘get good’ and slogging it out,  In short, my game time becomes work, and that is not why I play games.

I would have wanted a map, especially when coming back to the game after a bit. Also the combat in my opinion could have been more fun, not bad by any means but also not great. | nicely done metroidvania and that`s it. A bit inconvenient for me because I don't have a joystick, which may make the gameplay more comfortable, I guess | Great art direction, interesting world. The gameplay is fluid, but a bit shallow, not much incentive to use anything beyond dodge and attack, but still fun which is what matters. | Очень милая и трогательная игруха)  Незамысловатая и в меру простая. Неплохой саундтрек и чудоковатые персонажи. 
Не ждите особых откровений.  На пару вечеров. И лучше в портативе лёжа на диване) Творение дядюшки Гейба идеально подойдёт)

Непогано зроблений менеджмент-симулятор університету магії. Є цікаво виконані деталі, але не вистачає глибини та різноманітності щоби з цього вийшла повноцінна "пісочниця", якими є найкращі представники жанру. Добре спрацьовує тільки як кампанія з відносно коротких місій, де університет треба відбудувати з нуля 7 разів з накопиченням певних загальних бонусів.

Є певне replay value, з задоволенням пройшов кампанію двічі щоб зібрати всі ачівки. Можна було б і ще пограти, але не бачу більше якоїсь цікавої мети, просто розбудова сама по собі до мети не дотягує, це не Dwarf Fortress і не RimWorld. Мануальні режими є, але вони не такі цікаві.

З мінусів ще - час від часу крашиться або сама гра, або вона крашить Стім, після чого той починає безкінечно відкриватися і крашитися повторно доки не закрити гру.

7/10. | There's fun to be had here but it's weighed down by a build system that is almost entirely RNG-based.

You collect gold, plus mana in each of several categories (obtained by your students studying that subject). When you get enough of a category you can draw a card for an item or new room of that category - you're presented with three options and pick one. These options are entirely RNG-based.

What that means is that you may go into a map thinking you want to try an Arcane and Nature school and then just never draw the requisite cards to get it going. Or, you may know you need more dormitories for your students but the game just never gives you the card. You can't really plan the school out because you really have no idea what the game is going to let you build with the bizarre luck-of-the-draw system.

On the plus side, there's a lot of charm in the graphics and the game does a great job with the "feel" of magic. The classrooms are cool and your kids can get items like devil's horns, staves, regalia, etc. It really does feel like a magic school.

It's just such an odd choice from the developers to make the build system completely based on dice rolls. | I love this game, the main campaign is perfect, there is some replay ability, if you like experimenting, I do. Definitely recommend, my only gripe is that I selfishly want more.

At a certain point i started playing endless, but I wish there was more story, unless I'm missing something, I wish there was a secret to uncover or the dungeons just available or for quests to keep coming. In endless mode it hits a lull, I'd like for there to be more action, maybe the factions go to war or something, see what happens if you and the certain groups are friends. See students join different factions and maybe that gives you influence during encounters because your student runs a specific department for that faction. I think fleshing out a little more story based details would make endless actually go on for a lot longer before hitting a lull. | 好玩但是很卡真的很卡，慎玩 | Great theme and art style. Rules become very clear after playing one level and it really fun gameplay loop.

It's apparently made with Unity by two brothers, which might explain the constant performance issues. You can experience everything from lags, FPS drops, stutters and micro-freezes to random crashes in a single session. My laptop is somehow able to handle heavier AAA titles. Lovely game, though. | Le jeu est un style de Zelda like mais bien buggé. Je ne m'y serai pas arrêté là mais je ne peux pas avancer dans la quête principal car les balles vertes n'ouvrent pas le verrou du donjon et sur une quête secondaire le boss n’apparaît pas.... Dommage, j'étais quand même motivé .... | Неоднократно за время прохождения появлялась мысль, что стоит написать отрицательный обзор, уж очень, [i]о-о-очень[/i] много у игры проблем. Но, думаю, это было бы нечестно, ведь всё же я прошёл игру до конца и какое-то удовольствие получил. Есть то, чем игра может затянуть. Но сначала о плохом.

Графика со своеобразной стилизацией, в целом приятная, однако иногда глаз цепляют вещи, которые можно обозначить одним словом — халтура. Особенно это касается последних локаций. И ладно, есть проблема серьёзнее. В некоторых битвах эффекты такие "красочные", что могут в прямом смысле вызвать приступ у эпилептика.
В игре открытый мир, но он в значительной мере пустой. Да, то тут, то там можно или сундук найти, или событие, за прохождение которого дают опыт и награды, или вход в подземелье, но куда чаще встречаются полупустые ландшафты с мобами и/или некоторым количеством ресурсов, которые часто скучкованны очень неестественно. Мир не чувствуется слишком большим, каждая местность ощущается в достаточной мере уникальной, а некоторые виды так и вовсе можно найти очень даже красивыми, но наполнение мира просто слишком неравномерное, образующее много пустот, в которых хотелось бы что-то исследовать, что-то интересное найти, а нечего. Казалось бы, и опциональные квесты есть, чтобы мир наполнить хоть какой-то ерундой, но их недостаточно.
Бóльшую часть прохождения у меня было стойкое ощущение, что сюжет здесь для галочки. "Рыцарь спасает девушку в беде, а заодно и весь мир", классический троп, который отлично вписывается в мир игры, и какое-то детальное повествование или драма тут в общем-то и не нужны. В некоторых квестах детали лора раскрываются, но я ничего не запомнил, настолько это не важно. А потом появляется драма. Мелодрама даже. Но она не дожимает до конца, не выходит. В первую очередь потому, что она может оказаться неожиданной, в зависимости от отношения игрока. Во-вторых, большинство персонажей имеют уровень проработки и раскрытия личности примерно как в какой-нибудь ММОРПГ, и управляемый персонаж, кажется, тоже из этого жанра прилетел: у героя вроде есть предыстория, но он пустой, абсолютно. Что-то говорит иногда в диалогах, но ни его характер, ни его чувства не понятны, за исключением совсем уж примитивных и очевидных вещей, без которых невозможно было бы историю сдвинуть с места. Отыгрывать роль или сопереживать невозможно, нечему. Ну а в-третьих, в финале накладываются и другие проблемы игры.
Прокачка слишком быстрая. Самые тяжёлые моменты для меня были в первый час игры. Дальше персонаж всё сильнее, сильнее... Потом, где-то на 30 уровне, по одному из основных квестов нужно было взорвать камень с помощью синей бомбы, которую я ещё не нашёл. Я пошёл по другой цепочке квестов, в другую локацию, исследовал, проходил там сюжет... Вернулся к тому камню как только нашёл бомбу: на 61 уровне в сете легендарной экипировки 50 уровня 🤣 И нет, я не выфармливал что-то нарочно. Тут либо надо стараться не исследовать мир вообще и не проходить события, чтобы было мало опыта и ресурсов, и ничего не крафтить, либо вы играете так, как вроде и задумано (приключение в открытом мире всё-таки), но очень быстро становитесь слишком сильным. Я дальше не встретил достойного сопротивления до конца игры, и даже последний босс разочаровал: не только быстро он убивается на 92 уровне всё в той же экипировке 50 уровня, но и интересных механик, как у других боссов, у него нет, и локация там чуть ли не самая убогая по степени проработки.
Ну а самое разочаровывающее в игре — баги. Больше всего вымораживает один баг. Выбрали желаемый вариант ответа в диалоге? Очень высока вероятность, что засчитается другой, абсолютно случайно, неоднократно приходилось одни и те же диалоги проматывать раз за разом, в надежде, что в этот раз сработает нужный вариант ответа и я таким образом возьму квест. Есть и другие баги, объективно весомые, но всё же незначительные по сравнению с описанным.

И я мог бы ещё о различных мелочах поговорить, но в итоге вопрос: а почему я, как и другие игроки, всё же прошёл игру до конца, чем зацепило-то? А, думаю, в базовых вещах игра удачная. Боёвка достаточно эффектная, хоть и простая (очень простая на высоких уровнях, я уже упомянул выше из-за чего). Графика с приятной стилизацией, дающая подходящую атмосферу. Ох, а как музыка эту атмосферу дополняет! Вот уж к музыке у меня претензий нет. Мир "дырявый", но всё же в нём есть что исследовать и чем эстетически наслаждаться. Квесты не переутомляют. А сюжет... В конце всё равно хэппи энд, как и ожидалось, просто перед этим не совсем удачно попытались соплей навернуть, но это можно проигнорировать.
Может появиться искушение ждать чего-то очень необычного от игры, но посмотрите ещё раз на ценник и трейлер. Это неплохая (именно неплохая, не более) инди-игра на несколько вечеров в одиночестве на расслабоне (челленджей в игре практически нет).
Эх, а вот если бы всё довели до ума и отполировали...

There used to be a time when a game would be released in it's 1.0 foundational state, and it was fundamentally considered [i]complete[/i]. It meant that all the gameplay and story elements were in place, and any ancillary content could be added in at a future date. 
This could include extra story elements, items, dungeons, expansions, patches, and DLC etc.

Apparently, not anymore.

I waited for years to see Last Epoch exit early access and finally hit that glorious 1.0 release.
I even waited another year for the game to have all the creases ironed out.

So, I purchased the game, and was having a decent time. 
...that is, until the main quest storyline just 'stopped'.
Now to be clear, I don't mean it [i]concluded[/i]. I mean, it just 'stops' half-way through the story, and then you're left to go do mindless end-game farming. 
I genuinely thought my game was bugged and that the main quest wasn't showing. But a bit of research had me find out that the devs didn't think to complete the most basic element of a game - the story, before a 1.0 launch.

And what's worse, is that people just defend this type of practise?

Imagine if I sold you a book, but left the back half completely blank, and I told you "I'll write the rest some time in the future. Not really sure when though"
Not a sequel, but I'll finish the first book at some indeterminate time in the future.
Nebulous much?

Or imagine you sit down at a restaurant, and the waiter brings you only half of your meal, and says "We only made the first half - even though you paid for all of it. We'll eventually cook you the second half, at some point. Just not today. But you can have dessert! We have loads of dessert!"
Ludicrous. And yet, that's the standard that is being accepted more and more nowadays.

Sure, Last Epoch has some great elements to it. Genuinely.
Character building is cool. Loot filters in the game are top-notch. Visuals can be great.
But presentation means little when the foundational product is incomplete - [b]at full price[/b].

Ridiculous. 
Truthfully, I feel cheated. And looking at the 2025 road-map, where story content will be added 'some time later', I realise I should've just waited until the far off future when the game price will have likely dropped. 
Cheaper price for an 'actual' finished product.

This just feels like a lazy rush-to-market strategy, and I'd refund if I could, however it took me way more than the allotted refund time to know that the story would just 'cut off'. Which seems scummy.

Also, apparently even one of the game devs thinks you're being too unreasonable in expecting a 1.0 full release of a game to be, y'know, [i]'fully completed'[/i]. As he said that the 1.0 distinction of the game is "Fairly Arbitrary".
I call major bs on that one. 
You don't get to redefine what "Full Release" means, just to account for your lack of complete content. 

Furthermore, the endgame content, while nice in theory, honestly just boils down to this:

- Click a big floaty island in space.
- Now click on a smaller floaty island in space and fight a bunch of enemies.
- Do 10-20 more of these smaller floaty islands - with the same grinding of enemies.
- Now you've unlocked a boss fight.
- Fight said boss
- Click another big floaty island in space and repeat.

It's boring, and in no way a good placeholder for a completed and memorable story.

If the game was completed, I would've looked back on the game and thought "Yeah wow. That was a nice experience. Not [i]the best I've ever played[/i], but nice. And that's worth a recommend."

As it stands, I think you should stay away from the game for another year (or possibly two) - as of this review date, and reassess the state of the game at that time.

Until then, don't perpetuate crappy business standards - or they'll become normalised and you'll be the only one paying for it. | 离线模式要联网玩，联机体验极差，未入手的建议先看看视频和评测观望。 | The game isn't fun. This is a combination of skills that feel unimpactful, low monster density, overall slow game pace, low difficulty, and an endgame that encourages you to just rush through to the objective as fast as you can rather than kill anything, among other reasons.

Most of the praise around this game will be about "potential" rather than what's actually there. If you've played or followed this game since the beta you should know that the developers have done absolutely nothing to demonstrate they can ever deliver on this potential. What's actually implemented is very bare-bones, often buggy, and not fun/interesting. Will the game be good eventually? Maybe, but unlikely. And should you spend money on a game that isn't good right now? Absolutely not.

There are great ARPGs out there, this isn't one of them. | Very funnnnnn. This game was a good arpg with nice class and skill. The Skill tree node is very good and fun to make build with. The game itself is casual, not hard to gear up or level up, newbie friendly and easy to use filter. It was more casual than poe but not too casual like d3, grind end game gear need min max crafting which make it not too boring. 10/10 | 无语了，这主线剧情也太长了，而且不做还不行，谁玩这类游戏是冲着剧情来的？学下暗黑3多好，这剧情跑图太折磨

Game Name: Sacred Fire: A Role Playing Game
Reviews:
Wow. This game achieved what a lot of visual novels can't. Giving you a sense of agency and decision over the story while feeling challenging in a way that moves the story forward.
I've seen 3 "endings" (the final act is not out yet) and I'm hooked. :) I can't wait to see the rest and start new playthroughs. I love how the game gives you tools to tell it what your character wants and feels towards NPCs so that the story weaves itself accordingly.
Incredibly smart narrative design and story-telling.

10/10 | This is honestly incredible and I'm glad I gave this project money. I want to see more of this and more games like this. I completed chapter one and then unfortunately had to go to bed, but I'm excited to get to the next chapter and to see what's to come next.

I do want to say, I wish there were more hair styles to choose from. | I have played this game through multiple times and it is one of my favorite story/choice based games. The setting is unique and it has a great visual art style. Its clear that the dev has put love and care into the game which is what the gaming industry needs. Well worth the price as I have put over 60 hours into it with no regrets.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Early Access
Reviews:
A mix of Dark Messiah's combat and Arx's world building and interactivity.
Maps can feel a little convoluted at times and a bit empty, but overall a good time. | Impressive for a single indie guy to produce. It reminds me of old school crawlers like Daggerfall. Good job. Here is hoping there are a LOT of new areas in the release,and maybe some DLC later on. Good Luck,nice work.
 | It's fun. A modern Arx Fatalis-like. A sim game where you don't do anything well to start with. 

It has a dark souls/bioshock corpse run system for reasons entirely unclear to me. When you die you'll respawn at the last shrine you rested at if the shrine is in the same area. If there is no shrine or you haven't found one then you just have to load a save... 

Dear devs: Why did you do this? You do realize you implemented a save/load system right? Dark souls does the bloodstain thing because of its 'hardcore' constant saving design. When you die you can just reload in this like any normal game. You have innovated a way to make a normal saving system somehow worse. Ultimately it doesn't matter because you can just manually save/load, but it's still baffling. Probably left over from a much earlier design. | I had fun with it. Wish there was a little more content, as it was for me, only good for 13.5hrs. | First off, I played the demo.

I loved it, even with it flaws I found.

Tho many of those flaws was already fix, after I bought the game and played the current content. (Which is alot bigger and better then the old content of the demo).
The demo only has 1 map, the current game has 2 vast maps, with around 4x mini dungeon within these maps. It had puzzles, secrets and other problem solving, done is a very fun way.

I would discribe this game as a if Elder scrolls Daggerfall & Arx fatalis had a baby. =)

A quick sum of what I loved:
The magic system
The cooking system
The repair system
The wolrd/lore was intressting enough for me wanting to know more.
The core exploration feeling/need, even if most is underground in caves/castles/forts.
The enemies was intressting as well, even tho from what I could understand. The enemies "wastelanders", are just "normal" humans. But I always saw them as goblins/orcs. Might be the "curse" of the wasteland maby?

Beyond that, all enemies was fun to find and fight. Tho I mainly played the game as a pure caster build.
Which I can say few things I didnt like:

Player knowledge about the system itself, can sometimes be a bit poor sometimes. Some is understandable, it gives you a chance to learn by doing.

But with a rpg with limited skill points/attribute points, I am kind of player who plan out a build from lvl 1. So I want to know the core of what each skill/attribute do and do not.
Attributes for me as a mage was easy to understand, but for me it was the skills that created a little unnecessary confusion.

As the three magic skills is: Divine, Aura and Cosmic, but noting in their description mentions much needed info. As for all these three skills, if reached skill 10 your character will start regen mana on its own. That regen will only grow stronger the close to max of 20. Likewise if you have 2x max magic skills the regen will be even stronger. 

Likewise, spells will also change into more powerfull versions the higher your skill is in that school. (Tho it is not fully not implemented yet with all spells) As I belive not all spells are ofc in the game yet.

I could add more of what I liked and disliked, but I find this be a good enough "review" for the moment at least ^^

runs well on steamdeck with ge-proton.

this game is basically wing commander privateer remake in the best way possible.

 | I jumped into this after like a 100 hour FreeSpace series binge and after remapping the controls I instantly felt home. I have not played the original first game yet so that is why I think it is not as horrible as the reviews make it out to be but there are definitely some weak points. Here are my points below in no particular order.

What I liked: 

- difficulty without all the aim assist was decent enough when it comes to pure 1v1 dogfights
- unique visual style
- amazing soundtrack
- cool main character
- runs well
- nice mini games in the bar, I spent quite a few hours with just playing pool and dice poker
- flipping off enemies and trash talking through comms
- you can have your own station
- companions

What I disliked:

- the star systems are too big to the point they do not make sense, you can skip travel but even with that I felt it was tedious to go through several systems
- barely anything to do, missions seem varied at first but there are a lot of repeat offenders with barely anything different yet being labelled as something else
- nothing visually unique about the star systems, like if you played Freelancer and saw a mostly red background you knew you were in Bretoina, there is none of that here, the last system you go to is exactly like the first one you start in
- your own station is heavily underutilized, the game does not really go out of its way to tell you this is even a thing
- enemies sort of scale with you defeating the sense of progression, I was able to farm credits for end game gear in the starting system and meet end game enemies
-companions have some side missions but there is not much point and most of them are useless if you call them to help you
- main story felt like it just ended randomly without properly resolving the root of the conflict
- absolutely abysmal way for missions to trigger into their next phase, I could do 10 system jumps without triggering anything, sometimes I got it after just going near a station
- the fastest ships are exclusive to the enemies

Очень ждал выхода этой игры, но тогда у меня не было компьютера. Чуть позже появился компьютер, да денег на данный шедевр не было (я очень хотел играть, поэтому прошёл не лицензионную версию). И вот дошли мои руки до этой игры. Всем рекомендую в неё сыграть, но не забудьте перед этим поиграть в первую часть, а то, вы не поймёте некоторые моменты. | Местами слишком простенькая игра. Как в плане геймплея, так и сюжета. Играть вдвоём прикольно, однако необходимость проходить побочные задания для продвижения дальше по сюжету, чтобы не отлететь с нескольких ударов, удручает. Может зайти тем, кому нравится подобное и кто не будет иметь каких-либо высоких ожиданий | Es maravilloso, perfecto, relajante, re jugable, si dices que el juego es fácil es porque no exploraste!, ideal para jugar con un amigo o pareja, muy divertido, misiones secundarias cómicas, y lleno de secretos! | 好可爱，和堂弟玩得很开心。有不爽的地方但是能玩。太可爱了，我原谅一切！
武器普普通通不算特别有趣，每个武器都大差不差的。（玩法基本上挨一下就死）武器道具获得的方式也不多，不打支线能体验到的东西很少（一把武器从头用到尾）。支线枯燥，但是剧情还蛮可爱的。地图上一些升级装备的点没有传送也没有标记，很麻烦，钱也不多，不够换武器玩的，勉强够升级。（主要是没标记，找升级的地点很麻烦）传送点的设置有创意但是太麻烦而且不明确，地图上没个标，弟弟气呼呼地从水上噔噔瞪跑过去了。 | Simplesmente perfeito, pega todos os elementos que já eram bom no primeiro jogo e melhora em tudo! Game Name: Alaloth: Champions of The Four Kingdoms
Reviews:
"Beautiful but Flawed non Co-op: A D&D-Inspired Journey"

Alaloth boasts stunning visuals with incredibly detailed and animated models, truly capturing the essence of a classic tabletop RPG. The combat system is engaging and rewarding, and the developers consistently deliver updates and new content, showing a commendable level of passion.

However, the map travel can feel somewhat tedious, although it's consistent with the genre. My biggest disappointment lies in the "Shared/Split Screen Co-op" tagged. Instead of cooperative play, it's a PvP mode, which is significantly different from what was initially implied or suggested. This is a major letdown for those who were expecting a cooperative experience.

Overall: Alaloth has a lot to offer with its captivating visuals and engaging combat. However, the misleading information regarding the "co-op" mode, which is actually a PvP mode, significantly detracts from the overall experience, especially for those who were drawn to the game specifically for that feature.

Pros:

Stunning visuals and detailed character models
Engaging combat system
Dedicated developers with regular updates
Strong D&D-inspired atmosphere
Cons:

Tedious map travel
"Co-op" mode is actually a PvP mode, not cooperative play
Misleading advertising regarding "co-op" as a feature

Recommendation:

If you're looking for a visually impressive and combat-focused RPG with a strong D&D vibe, Alaloth might still be worth a look. However, be aware that the "co-op" mode is actually PvP, and proceed with caution if you were expecting a cooperative rpg experience. | Great game, I'm loving every minute playing it.

Pros:
- Engaging combat mechanics: weak and strong attacks, dodge, parry/block and up to six special abilities and/or spells. More than enough to keep it interesting
- Big world to explore with every location being unique and handrafted
- Lots of different and unique loot
- Locations have perfect size. You can usually complete any dungeon (Fighting Area) in 5-10 mins and then decide to go to another one or to play with your kids.

Con:
- Early game is hard. You need gear, more levels and possibly companions to comfortably clear dungeons. Later it gets easier. | Pues me está pareciendo un juegazo, como los de antes, sin ayudas...solo en un mundo cruel, despiadado e injusto. 

El combate es gloria, por fin salir airoso tiene tanta importancia tus estadísticas como tú habilidad, un 10 aquí.

Los gráficos , no son top, pero cumplen sobradamente, pero artísticamente están genial, que en estos juegos importa esto más. 

Lo recomiendo a todo amante de los juegos de fútbol. | I like the idea of the game but I don't like the game.

Combat is really floaty, I don't feel much like I'm really interacting with the enemies. They did try to put in a compelling combat system but it makes no sense when the enemy AI is so basic. The enemies literally just swarm you and swing the same attack as soon as they can. It feels like a game from 30 years ago in that regard.

The KB + M controls are horrendous.

Cities are dull and lifeless. 

The game is purposefully archaic which sucks what little fun there was away. | It's OK/Good. 

Inspired by a few of my favourites and a cool art style. The only problem really is that the stamina system is very arbitrary and doesn't really work well as a balancing feature. It takes away from the combat if anything and makes it a little unsatisfying (especially early game). The durability system also falls into this camp too but I think it works for the style of campaign. 

On the other hand the combat is generally satisfying (stamina aside) story seems cool, world maps and arenas are cool, enemy design is cool (again a downside of the stamina system  here is that I don't appreciate the enemies as much because you're fighting the stamina system half the time, rather than focusing on enemies). Game runs well, isn't cluttered on MnK and seems to be receiving updates and content patches which is cool. 

Hoping it gets better as I go along and I'd suggest giving it a try.
fun

De longe um dos jogos com o sistema mais complexo que já joguei, não é nada amigável para novatos na franquia, tutorial é praticamente inexistente, algumas mecânicas são similares a outros jogos de mesmo gênero aí da pra levar, mas não recomendaria este aqui ser o primeiro RPG a se jogar. O jogo é complicado do início ao fim, porém a imersão é muito boa, possui um plot interessante, personagens bem escritos que participam ativamente da sua jornada. É um jogo tático baseado em RPG de mesa e sua progressão é toda feita em escolhas e rolagens de dados, e sobre as escolhas, são bem impactantes e possuam consequências reais no desenrolar da história. Elas são baseadas no sistema clássico de tendências em RPG, ou seja, além de você poder ser bom, mau ou neutro, existem escolhas mais específicas como Lawful Good, Chaotic Good, Lawful Evil, etc. quanto mais escolhas boas ou ruins você faz, isso desbloqueia diálogos com interações diferentes.

Logo de início o jogo já te pede pra criar seu personagem em uma ficha enorme de algumas páginas com muita coisa pra escolher, da pra ficar perdido ali. São dezenas de classes, as possibilidades de builds são imensas, da pra misturar classes, tem centenas de habilidades, magias e efeitos diferentes. Infinidade de itens e armas e tudo mais que se espera em um RPG deste tipo.

O combate é tempo real com pausas, porém da pra colocar em turnos e jogar de forma praticamente idêntica a jogos como Baldur's Gate 3. Sendo bem sincero o modo em tempo real é ruim, as batalhas viram uma bagunça, você precisa pausar o tempo todo senão fica difícil coordenar os personagens e aí vai tomar infinitos debuffs roubadíssimos e vai morrer sem ver nada, por isso recomendo jogar em turno mesmo. Ao longo do game existem encontros aleatórios no mapa, contra bandidos e inimigos mais fracos e repetidos, neste caso é tranquilo de fazer em tempo real pois normalmente são batalhas bem mais fáceis e rápidas.

Pathfinder Kingmaker é um jogo indie e o primeiro do estúdio, então muita coisa é mais limitada, mas algumas delas me incomodaram bastante, como por exemplo a câmera que não gira, a navegação do jogo é através de um mapa onde você escolhe um destino e entra na área, por conta disso exploração é muito fraca, estas áreas normalmente são bem pequenas. A iluminação do jogo é muito ruim, o seu personagem emana uma luz ao redor dele e todo o resto é escuro, é uma fog que é presente até durante o dia, me incomodou bastante.

Dentro do jogo tem um minigame de gerenciamento de reinos, onde você simula a evolução do seu reino, afinal um dos plots do jogo é você evoluir desde um mercenário até virar um Barão e se tornar Rei daquela região. Você cria e evolui sua cidade, conquista territórios, coloca seus companions para serem seus conselheiros e ministros e delega missões a eles, é basicamente um simulador de cidade medieval. É um sistema legal, em diversos momentos viciei legal em ficar gerenciando as cidades. Porém o time-lapse disto acelera o jogo e te força a executar algumas missões e te coloca tempo pra resolver, isso também é um pouco frustrante..

Pra finalizar, a otimização do jogo também deixa a desejar, alguns mapas tem quedas de frames, e por ser um jogo que não tão recente deveria rodar bem melhor, mas não chega a atrapalhar a experiência. 

É um game extremamente complexo, mas pra quem busca uma aventura que simule a experiência de se jogar um RPG de mesa tá aí uma opção bem fiel. | I wish this game wasn't impossible to play with non-perfect builds on normal mode. Really wanted to like it but the encounters are FUCKED | If you have played the tabletop, dive in and enjoy. If not, know there is a lot to learn and its not friendly to those who don't know at least some of the game's setting, weapons, feats, or magic types. | 好玩又耐玩的游戏。

构筑种类丰富，一步一步变强的体验很好。100多职业任选，装备同样眼花缭乱看不过来。但是引导不如二代，专长没写前置与升级项。

剧情很好，‘时不时会回忆一些深刻剧情。队友剧情也很真实，能看到现实中自己或别人的影子，感慨良多。

即时制清图，回合制打精英以上战斗。我一周目纯回合制打了130h，之后周目有经验了就快了50h就能速杀。

选项很多，一周目非常容易漏道具和支线剧情，然后多周目选不一样的选项真是不一样的体验，有很多不起眼的选择会影响后期剧情发展。真是阵营九宫格的对话选择，让我有种新维加斯的感觉，现代游戏少有这么细节。 | combat drags, story lags. its great in the middle portion but once your party gets going its basically a bunch of chores until the main quest kicks in. the story is great at the beginning and middle and then gets boring. trying to drag myself through the last section of the game right now. i love the characters.

J'ai trouvé le jeu ennuyant trop d'information donné des le début je pensais que ça aurais été plus intéressant. | Tej gry nie da się przejść. Zapowiadała się dość ciekawie, choć na początku zasypuje gracza niepotrzebnie dużą ilością informacji i mechanik. DeathTrash is a quintessential "Forever Early Access" title. The store page and product description may suggest that a final release or version of this game is in development, with an expected release of "sometime". I believe the store page, as of this review, suggests 2025 as a release date.

I bought this title very shortly after its entrance to Early Access, under recommendations of a critic who generally matches my interests.

I have spent the intervening three and a half years with a license to a build that has undergone few, if any notable changes. It has been a foundational memory in my purchasing habits since, and I now rarely engage with early access titles.

I had a total of about five hours of unique content on my first playthrough, which was about the amount of content I saw two years later, in 2023. I am increasingly concerned with Crafting Legends' ability to ship this product. As a small team of two individuals, I question whether a product of this size and ambition was ever reasonable within the projected timeframes and budget.

I do not recommend Death Trash as an Early Access product. I do not think what is currently available is worth twenty dollars, and I am not confident that the price, nor content will change. Should this product see a final build, I will return to the game to edit and re-write my review. | Not quite Abandonware, but even after 4 years it's not leaving Early Access any time soon. All updates are small & cosmetic. Frequent stretches of radio silence. There's a great core to this game, and it would be an easy recommend if it were finished...or updating on time...or offered for under $9.00. But they're still asking $20 (unless it's on sale, at which point it's "only" $16) for an unfinished and almost-abandoned game. True disappointment. | This game could be really, really great. It is a shame that because the team is so small, the amount of work is just too staggering to complete in a reasonable amount of time before people inevitably begin to move on. And for that to happen to a game like this, a game with THIS much potential....really sucks. | It is essentially abandonware at this point. They seem to push an update (without new content) after Steam marks them over a year without updating in EA. This game is turning into another example of "Reasons to Avoid EA games." | It's not a long game. It's in early access, and development has been quite slow, but the quality of what it is is very good.

I love the fighting mechanics. It's very well executed and requires some skill to get good at it, and it's very satisfying once you pull it off successfully.
The story and the worldbuilding is excellent. I'm guessing this is why it takes so long time.

It has so much potential. Even though it's unfinished, I think it's worth getting into it now, but know you should know what you're getting into.
It also works great on the steam deck.

[h1]Among Us[/h1]

[quote][i]Всем привет. Автор не несет ответственности за причиненный вред своими обзорами. Любое сходство с другими обзорами случайно. Данный обзор является лишь мнением автора и вы можете всегда оставаться при своем мнении! Спасибо за понимание и приятной игры![/i][/quote]

[h1]Описание:[/h1]
[i][b]Among Us[/b] — это многопользовательская онлайн-игра. Игра быстро завоевала популярность благодаря своей увлекательной механике и возможности взаимодействия с другими игроками.[/i]

[b]Сюжет и атмосфера:[/b]
[i]Сюжет игры Among Us начинается с возвращения межзвездного космического корабля домой после опасного путешествия. Часть команды заражена инопланетными мозговыми паразитами, которые превращают их в саботажников с жаждой убийства.

Мирные космонавты должны выполнять задания для восстановления работоспособности корабля и выявлять предателей, чтобы избавиться от них. Саботажники же стремятся убить мирных игроков и саботировать системы корабля, оставаясь при этом незамеченными.

Игра сочетает элементы психологического триллера, где напряжение и подозрения постоянно нарастают, а ключевые обсуждения и разоблачения происходят на общих собраниях команды.[/i]

[b]Геймплей:[/b]
[i]Основная цель игры — выполнять задания или саботажи, а также выявлять и устранять предателей среди членов экипажа. Игроки делятся на две команды: члены экипажа и предатели. Члены экипажа должны выполнять задания, чтобы выиграть, в то время как предатели должны убивать других игроков и саботировать объекты, оставаясь при этом незамеченными.

Игровой процесс динамичен и требует от игроков постоянного взаимодействия и обсуждения. Задания разнообразны и требуют от игроков координации и логики. Саботажи могут значительно повлиять на ход игры, создавая дополнительные возможности для предателей.[/i]

[b]Графика и звук:[/b]
[i]Among Us отличается яркой и мультяшной графикой, которая привлекает внимание и создает дружелюбную атмосферу. Анимации плавные, а визуальные эффекты подчеркивают ключевые моменты игры. Звуковое сопровождение также на высоте: музыка и звуковые эффекты добавляют динамики и напряжения в ключевые моменты игры.[/i]

[b]Мультиплеер и взаимодействие:[/b]
[i]Одним из главных достоинств Among Us является возможность играть с друзьями и случайными игроками со всего мира. Игра поддерживает до 15 игроков на одной карте, что делает каждую сессию уникальной и насыщенной событиями. Голосовой чат позволяет игрокам обсуждать свои подозрения и координировать действия, что добавляет элемент социального взаимодействия.[/i]

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
[i][list]
[*] [b]Простой и увлекательный геймплей:[/b] Легкость в освоении, быстрое запоминание управления. Динамичный и разнообразный игровой процесс.

[*] [b]Рандомный сюжет и неожиданные повороты:[/b] Каждая игра уникальна благодаря случайному подбору заданий и событий. Неожиданные повороты поддерживают интерес и интригу.

[*] [b]Социальное взаимодействие и живое общение:[/b] Возможность играть с друзьями и случайными игроками со всего мира. Голосовой чат для координации действий и обсуждения подозрений

[*] [b]Яркая и привлекательная графика:[/b] Мультяшный стиль, который создает дружелюбную атмосферу. Плавные анимации и визуальные эффекты.

[*] [b]Достижения:[/b] Присутствует получения достижений.
[/list][/i]

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
[i][list]
[*] [b]Проблемы с серверами и технические ошибки:[/b] Иногда возникают лаги и ошибки соединения. Возможны проблемы с онлайн-сервисами.

[*] [b]Наличие читеров:[/b] Некоторые игроки используют нечестные приемы, что может испортить впечатление от игры.

[*] [b]Мелкие баги и недочеты:[/b] Иногда встречаются недоработанные элементы и баги, хотя разработчики активно их исправляют.

[*] [b]Токсичное поведение игроков:[/b] Возможны случаи агрессивного или неспортивного поведения, что может негативно повлиять на игровой процесс.

[*] [b]Ограниченные задачи и локации:[/b] Хотя игра предлагает разнообразие, некоторые игроки могут почувствовать однообразие после множества игр.

[*] [b]Коллекционные предметы:[/b] Отсутствуют обои, смайлики, карточки из которых можно скрафтить значки
[/list][/i]

[h1]Заключение:[/h1]
[i]“Among Us” — это увлекательная и динамичная игра, которая предлагает уникальный опыт благодаря своей механике и взаимодействию с другими игроками. Она идеально подходит для проведения времени с друзьями и обеспечивает множество часов увлекательного геймплея. Если вы ищете игру, которая сочетает в себе элементы стратегии, социального взаимодействия и неожиданных поворотов, Among Us станет отличным выбором.[/i]

[h1]Итоговая оценка:[/h1]
[h3]8/10 - Хорошо[/h3]

[h1]Внимание![/h1]
[i]Хотите поддержать меня? Тогда проходите по ссылке на мои другие обзоры "[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/laykan/recommended/]ссылка[/url]". Также буду очень рад любой поддержки с вашей стороны. Всем добра, удачи и приятной игры! ^_^[/i] | по факту игра для детей но там одна игра где все доверяют одному человеку а под конец он оказывается предателем это absolute cimena | 优化是没有的，备受辱骂是没有悔改的，外挂是一大堆的，创新是没有的，被抄了是不管的，真想不到这游戏是怎么活下来的 | [b]Among Us took the gaming world by storm, proving that sometimes, the simplest games create the most unforgettable moments. Whether you're completing tasks like a diligent crewmate or plotting deception as an imposter, this game is all about strategy, teamwork, and betrayal.

The gameplay is easy to understand but leads to intense, hilarious, and sometimes frustrating interactions. One moment, you're quietly fixing wires, and the next, you're passionately defending yourself in an emergency meeting after being falsely accused. The mix of deduction and deception makes every round unpredictable and fun.

What makes Among Us special is the social experience. It thrives on communication (and miscommunication), whether you're playing with friends or random players. The joy of convincing others to vote someone off, only to realize they were innocent, creates endless entertainment.

Visually, it's simple and colorful, with cute character designs that contrast the brutal reality of getting ejected into space. The sound design, from the satisfying task completion beeps to the ominous kill animations, adds to the tension.

While Among Us is at its best with a group of friends, public lobbies can be hit-or-miss, depending on how people play. The game has also evolved with new roles, maps, and customization options, keeping things fresh for long-time players.

In conclusion, Among Us is a fantastic party game that blends strategy and chaos in the best way possible. It’s proof that great multiplayer experiences don’t need complex mechanics—just a solid concept and the right group of people. If you love games that test friendships and create hilarious memories, this one’s a must-play![/b] |
