Really excited about the idea of a co-op RPG in the Elder Scrolls vein.
Feels like a good foundation has been laid for what  could be a great game.
Overall feels and plays fairly smooth.
Combat is a bit clunky and buggy. (Arrows didn't seem to do any dmg) but overall I like the feel and concept.
Music and sounds were actually not bad.
Animations are weird at times. (turning in 3rd person especially bothered me. Legs look like jello.)
In 3rd person the crosshairs are off. Combat is def easier in 1st person right now.
Can auto aim with auto target feature. Good or bad decide for yourself.
Graphics are not bad. Looks better than Morrowind imo not quite skyrim though. Actually looks better on medium right now. Ultra makes everything look blurry.
I weighed whether to refund or not simply because I don't have tons of money to spend on games and have to be selective but all in all I believe they have the potential for something really good here. | I usually never leave reviews on games. But this is such an ambitious game made by 2 people only. So almost for that reason alone it deserves a positive review. However, should you buy this game? If you want something polished, smooth and without bugs, then you should definitely not buy this game. It has a fair amount bugs, bad animations, and auditory issues.

With all that being said, the game delivers on it's intended purpose almost flawlessly. You can generate a level (Island or dungeon) design it completely as you wish and i don't even want to go into detail, about how in debt you can go with everything. NPC behavior, quests, factions, world building, what areas of the map have what sounds or music, light sources.  (Probably) Everything that exists in a engine for making games exists within this games editor. I haven't found something i haven't been able to do yet. And the best part about all this? You can continuously expand you world, you can keep making new levels and link them together by using something called portals. 

It's amazing how they have simplified everything it takes to make your own game. But again all this is nowhere near done, but the idea behind this game is incredible and for 2 people to make all this on their own is enough for me to want to support it. This game is clearly a passion project and i am excited to see the future of it. especially with modding support. | !!!PLEASE READ!!!

Super promising game, really hope they invest more time into it. Right now in its current state it's not worth the money. Once more updates come out with more polishing and actual questing, I will come back to this review.

The things that need to be fixed/ addressed:

1) walk speed. If you're not sprinting, you might as well be standing still. 
2) polishing. There's a TON of polishing this game needs to just about everything aside from the landscapes.
3) combat is lackluster and a lot of the weapons don't deal any kind of damage.
4) finally, the content. There isn't anything to do in the game really at the moment, and the one quest you can find doesn't allow the quest to be tracked and there is no way to figure out where the quest is on the map. There aren't very many chests or friendly NPC's, and there isn't a town with a vendor that I found. 

Like I said, very promising, but in its current state is just... meh. | Is it a Spaghetti Code Early Access nightmare?

Heck yes. 

Were the Developers honest about this from the start and told people only to buy it if they really believe in the future of the product? 
Damn right they did.

Did I buy it anyway?

Yes...because I love Spaghetti and any game that wants to give me the old school feel of Morrowind while being brought into the "current year" deserves my support. 

If it does for you is your choice...all I can say is: It has the potential to become great even if right now it is a borked tech demo at best. | The updates keep making the game better and better. I think with time, this can become a real gem. I hope to see continued progress as there's still some kinks that need fixing and a lot of bugs, but the game really has a lot of promising features and the start of an Elder Scrolls esque world.

Во-первых, хочу выразить признательность и респект товарищу Казакову, который взял и сделал Гедонию. Просто вот так. Почти один. Это круто. Очень надеюсь на вторую часть, которая станет куда лучше.

По самой игре: хоть и ставлю рекомендацию, но это проект очень для своих, с большущим количеством огрехов. Я до сих пор выношусь с тайминга атак, прокачки (которая в то же время и большой плюс игры), а точнее с её странного баланса. Кроме этого графика полигонов, достаточно пустынные локи, большое ощущение "ворот", когда вам нужно ещё подкачаться прежде чем идти в локу, достаточно небольшой сюжет, который просто типичен, он есть, он на 3+, крайне скомкан. 

Поэтому советую три раза подумать, но за те деньги - это прекрасное развлечение на пару вечеров, которое во-первых позволило почувствовать ролевую свободу (что в прокачке, что в деятельности, что в квестах), во-вторых поддержать хорошего человека в хорошем деле, особенно перед выходом второй части, в-третьих почувствовать старые игры местами, есть там какой-то дух то ли готики, то ли чего-то такого. 
Предметно скажу (авось дойдет отзыв) о том, что КРАЙНЕ хочется увидеть в следующей части, дабы Гедония была конфеткой, во-вторых предметно указать на главные минусы игры:
1) Боевка, а именно тайминги и анимации. Это жестоко, это больно. Это как первый дарк соулс, здесь каждое действие достаточно длительное, непрерываемое и ПОЛНОСТЬЮ станит ГГ, хоть это и должно компенсироваться тем, что вы станите большинством атак и способностей, но вы точно получите в бубен от соседнего врага. Кроме того, атаки врагов из-за кривых анимаций и тайминга самого нанесения урона да и маленького окна блока не щитом становится болезненным и неинтуитивным. Чтобы его поймать, нужно долго приручаться. На самом деле с билдом некроманта-воина, под конец, особенно на боссах, перестал использовать ближний бой, как люди чистым ближним проходят того же мага без дикого перекача перед локацией - я в душе не чаю. Очень надеюсь, что будет более внятная и очевидная боевая часть с понятными анимациями и возможностью движения гг во время боя, иначе это очень больно и костыльно. 
2) Прокачка. Это прелесть и бич игры. С одной стороны - великое и реально крутое разнообразие создать можно очень много кого, сочетать разные типы кача (как и говорил, играл воином-некром), что НЕВЕРОЯТНО КРУТО (про всякий крафт-шмафт и строительство домов вообще молчу, красота). Но у этого есть большой подводный камень: баланс этого кача. Некоторые способности кажутся (особенно пассивные) невероятно муссорные, другие невероятно сильные, например, в защите повышение ХП суммарно на сотку при уроне в СОТНИ на 30 уровнях (а те 100 вы получите ой как не сразу) выглядят крайне странно, в то же время магия, которая порой уничтожает все и качается очень прогрессивно и скоро, очень сильно на это влияют. В купе с кривой боевкой, где ближний бой достаточно пыточный, игра сильно подталкивает к дальнему бою и крипам. Либо я ошибаюсь в том, что можно нормально миксовать ветки навыков, что тоже не гут, но звучит бредово, потому что очков прокачки будет больше чем на одну ветку (даже в 35 уровне вы возьмете 2 ветки полностью). 
3) Озвучка. Мне не сильно резала глаза графика (да я слепой может быть, но тру геймеру все равно), а вот звук да. Такое ощущение, что вообще не было работы с источниками звука на сценах, поэтому когда появился в игре дракон, я чуть не оглох. Ну и забавные робовойсы мейн квеста, да :)
4) Заполненность мира. Тут вопрос не в графике, но хотелось бы видеть мир чуть более... наполненным что ли. Поработать с кистями, насадить кустов, каких-то локаций красивых, чтобы вся игра не выглядела как плато сковородки, у игры есть потенциал на красивость. Заметьте, речь снова не про графоний и текстуры. 
5) Квесты и сюжет. Хоть в них и есть свое очарование, но вот мейн квест уж очень в конце скомкан. Некоторые квесты угарны в своей логике, когда просят опять цветы собрать) Не хватает Эпика, как в квестах фракции да и основном тоже. Игре пошло бы на пользу быть на более высоких щах относительно ГГ, как я думаю. Ну и в принципе подтянуть сюжетную составляющую, потому что честно (хоть и не всю игру полностью прошел), но прям запоминающихся квестов не нашел, но они были не плохи. 

Резюме. Гедония - это огромная работа. Титаническая. В ней есть всё везде и сразу, а главное - это работает. Игра особо не баговалась, все механики доведены до рабочего состояния, но как будто бы не логического финала. Видно, что это проба пера, первая курсовая, которая заслуживает только похвалы и пожеланий на будущее. Очень надеюсь на улучшения во второй части, которую жду всем сердцем, а команде желаю удачи. Покупать же советую хотя бы по скидке, даже если не откроете - я верю, что эти люди заслуживают продолжать дальше, развиваться и т.п. | Genuinely great game IMO. It does a fantastic job of providing you a very free approach to the open world without leaving you completely directionless. I am particularly a fan of games that give you a lot of ways to customize your build, and this game has that in spades, more-so than most. 

It is clearly no AAA game; but it's one of the better RPGs that I've seen come out in recent memory. | Surprisingly fun openworld rpg. Theres jank, but the exploration is a lot of fun. | It's like a bad weak beta for wow classic, but very unfinished.  It's total malarky. If it gets better somehow, after the first six hours of play, then I'll change my review, but come on.  Half my abilities don't even work, its been out for two years. It feels like a sequal to Quest64. The motions are just slow, except for a few enemy attacks with no telescoping. The ability trees are old WoW adjacent, and pleasant to imagine going through them, but for all the things I've tried, I'm only able to get firebolt to semi-effetively do anything. The ray permanently bugs out and its like the only other low level elemental ability.

It has heart, but no followup, for how much it costs, for how much it promises. A tiny percentage of the game looks as pretty as the video, but that is Not gameplay, and Not the norm. There ARE pretty things here and there, there's soul in some of the flowers or the sky, but there's so many things in between not finished for being out for years.

It's as though the devs weren't allowed to fix or improve the game after release. Like all the money just got siphoned off into a stakeholders meeting. The A.I. dialogue is so sad and boring. The U.I. interface is clunkier than many games pre-2000.

I would be proud of this game if it came out of a college thesis. There are some good things, but there's so much wrong. | Um jogo com bastante potencia e que jogando em amigos deve ser divertido, ma jogando sozinho ele se encaixa mais naquela lista de jogos para jogar quando não tem nada para jogar, isso não é algo ruim, mas mostra que o jogo tem muito a melhorar.

A very well-written game. I hope anyone that enjoys stories where you get to make some tough decisions gives this game a try. The game has the same vibe as a TellTale game, but with the difference being there is a clear GOOD and BAD ending to this game. 

Checklist:

Music: Really good. BGM is easy to listen to, and the welsh/celtic rock song for the credits and main menu is very fun to listen to. 

Character design: Pretty good for pixels. I could tell the difference between almost every npc, and the character splash art at the end of the end felt very modern. 

Aesthetic: I really enjoy the style. It's very clean pixel art. It's not common to see games in this style so it was a refreshing take on art and game design. 

Accessibility: You need to be someone who enjoys reading a lot of text, as a large majority of the game is comprised of reading character dialogue. There is no voice overs, just some mumbled gibberish. 

Game difficulty: Pretty easy. The first few weeks seem like there are some tough choices, but you learn pretty quick to listen to the petitioner speaking to your King character about their plight and needs. Depending on how they sound when they ask for help, you can tell right away if you should actually give them aid, or call them out on their bull crap. 

Multiple playthroughs: Kinda. This game is only best played by doing two routes. Good route, or bad route. There isn't multiple endings aside from doing things the ethically right way, or the morally corrupt way. 

Price Point: I was gifted the game, so I don't know how expensive it is in the store. But if it's anything under $25 USD, then it's a pretty fair price point. I would still recommend buying it at a sale price though, for the sole fact that the game is REALLY short. You'll do an entire play through in about 6 hours. Maybe less if you're not too worried about your choices and the impact of your choices. 

Cons:
There's only one thing that really bugged me during the entire game. There is a pretty clear situation that pops up pretty early on that you (the player) probably would never agree to do. However, the situation is written into the story and isn't actually a choice the player can make. Long story short, I didn't enjoy being locked out of a choice that I would never have made myself, but unfortunately, it's just part of the story. One of those times where what the player expects from a Kingdom Management Sim RPG and what the narrator (or game dev) intended don't really align. I don't see the game devs as bad people for this forced choice, but at the end of the day, I still I wish I could've completely avoided the literal main plot of the game. 

Overall: The game is great. Definitely consider picking it up if you like a gripping story. It's a bit TOO short, so it might be a good idea to pick it up when it goes on sale. | Um excelente jogo de pixel art onde você irá perceber que nem sempre ser um rei é fácil, ter que lidar problemas do reino, todo o jogo político para conseguir vantagens com seus aliados que buscam também favores para sim, e também o apelo emocional que ele faz você se conectar com os personagens e sentir as perdas, mesmo sendo um jogo leve e com gráficos não avançados, em questão de narrativa, ele é sensacional, valeu cada centavo, um ótimo jogo | não compre, todos os arrependimentos que você tem por ter feito más escolhas na sua vida miserável não se compara ao que você vai sentir com esse jogo | Yes, Your Grace is a very well writen game where you act as a king, and with all the responsabilities coming with it. The game greets you with attaching characters and hilarious scenes, and unless you are an heartless jerk, it WILL make you high on feelium at some point.

This being said, the gameplay is simple and repetitive, not focused on action so it may not be for everyone as it's primarly a narrative game. As long as you enjoy text narratives and can take the time to appreciate pixel art, you are good to go.

It would add that this game have a good balance in its art style with pretty nice soundtracks and nice looking pixel art (which let room for imaginating the details). | O gerenciamento de recursos é relativamente fácil e simples, mas a história e a atmosfera do jogo é muito boa, as escolhas não interferem muito na progressão em si, mas você tem que decidir com base na sua régua moral e isso pra mim é o ponto mais divertido do jogo, vale muito a pena!

I'm not a souls like fan but this was an incredible journey from start to finish. Tons of ways to replay the game as well with different weapons, optional bosses, rune builds, and more. Also the NG+ was a nice surprise once I completed the game. | It's pretty damn good! I like the worldbuilding, story, characters, and even the gameplay (somewhat). I wouldn't mind seeing a lot more of Talamhel. My only gripe is that I cannot control the camera to look around at the amazing world around me better. | The game is so good, I played like 50 hours in 3 days, utterly neglecting sleep or daily chores.
All negative reviews regarding floaty combat are old reviews. The devs cleaned it up and it is quite crisp.
You will visit different biomes, which are quite large in the endgame, meet good written characters, craft your weapons, customize your armor and fight well designed bosses with recognizable attack patterns.
Ng+ is not just a hard mode, but adds new attack patterns to bosses, new combat mechanics to enemies and adds more enemies. Felt really good to play.
Such a beautiful game. | Macht richtig Spaß und ganz so schwer wie ein Dark Souls ist es für einen Soulsnoob wie mich nicht.
Mir gefällt der Grafikstil und es gibt überall was zu entdecken. Das Crafting ist relativ simpel gehalten aber macht auch Laune.
Mal sehen was die nächsten Stunden noch so bringen, bisher aber Top vor allem für den Preis! | Loving the game so far (25 hr) seems like far off from the end story wise.  I have been enjoying the difficulty (you can get way overpowered for an area) and exploration.  Right off I was having trouble with some monsters and had to come back to the area later.  Enjoying the little bits of world and character stories as you explore.  I have a tendency to wander off the main story line if I see something in the distance to explore.   The maps are creative and the combat is pretty good.  

Biggest annoyance I have are some camera issues where the ceiling area does not completely fade out when you are under or close to something.  At one point it interfered some with a bit of platforming/jumping (non critical) to get an chest.   

Couple area's where to get a chest (non critical) there is some platform jumping to do.  Not the games strong suit and I find these a bit difficult myself to do. 

Overall a very good game in my opinion.  Will update when I beat it.

The best things about "Curse..." is that you can master it and has no BS mechanics that will kill you. If you died, it's on you. 

The worst thing is that it is bothersome. 

Somewhere in the middle of the game you will become spammed with spongy enemies. Full of HP with armors that are easy but time consuming to dispose. 

Moreover darkness mechanic is bothersome w/o adding any meaningful layer to the game. 

Also RNG is strong in this one. Which again - os bothersome considering that most of weapons is on "meh" or worse side.  Some goes for traits etc. 

So yeah, most of your runs you will end up with things that aren fun to use, takes time and you will start getting hurt because you tried to cut corners so you dont have to play it for so long... And this. This exactly what makes it thumbs down game. | A great little roguelite, deceivingly simple, incredibly addictive, and fairly challenging.

The combat system is pretty tight, easy to learn but challenging to master. I wish there were a few more weapons to add more variety, but there's already quite a few to choose from, depending on your playstyle and what you're comfortable with.

Admittedly, once you reach the hard mode things start getting a little too challenging fast, and there's no further upgrades to help you push through. You just need to "Git Gud". But if my only real criticism of the game is that its challenge mode is a little too challenging, I think it's pretty safe to say I would recommend it wholeheatedly. | Esse jogo é muito bom, porém tem alguns pontos que irritam bastante até você se acostumar, como o alcance dos golpes dos inimigos ou como o parry desse jogo é uma merda. | Имбушечка без изысков. Особо не понимаю зачем такая большая метапрогрессия рун, если самые удобные открываются в первые 50 минут игры. Некоторые эффекты проклятий раздражают в негативном смысле - вспышки перделки всякие заставляют щуриться, игра то тёмная. Атмосферка в игре тягомотная, всё однообразное и за первые 3 часа прошел почти половину пирамиды. Сложность каждого этажа резко возрастает и сложность эта не от количества мобов как оно обычно бывает... В целом приятная игра, от нее быстро устаешь но и возвращаться в нее хочется | El juego es realmente interesante. No tiene muchas cosas novedosas pero si junta muchas cosas que fueron efectivas en otros juegos y arma una buena alternativa.
Aun no lo termine, pero parece ser un juego de duración media, que como mucho puede llevarte un mes para terminarlo completo.
Así y todo, teniendo en cuenta el precio y el contenido, es una alternativa mas que recomendable.

I still want to like this game. It's not that it could have been so much more, it's not that the 4x and combat elements are still too disconnected. It's quite simply that the actual gameplay is not fun. 
The case study that prompted me to write this review:
I'm playing a greedy game where I'm the only civ on my relatively large continent. I pick England and build Strongholds in various strategic locations. I own the whole continent and have lots of tech and buildings but a fairly small army - just enough to strongly defend a single attack point. I begin building ships to explore the world. I finally encounter another civ, then another. The world congress begins almost immediately. One of the civs demands 2000 gold from me. I naturally refuse. They push the issue to congress. I don't have an embassy yet, so I can't do anything about that, but fine. They won't be able to break into my continent. They pillage one of my two harbors. This gives them enough warscore to enforce peace, get the 2000 gold plus another 2400 gold for war reparations. I'm in bankruptcy. I work my way out of it. They demand 2000 gold again and now I can't refuse because my people don't want war.
What is the gameplay here? Pillaging a single district is enough to instantly end a war and enforce demands strong enough to cripple the enemy until you can immediately send more demands and declare war again? The war didn't even last long enough for me to attempt to fight it. I wouldn't mind if they enforced demands after they had landed a force and begun sieging my cities or thoroughly pillaged my entire coastline, but it was one single district. Honestly most games seem to end with one stupid mistake or lucky break, which is already not that fun, but you throw mechanics like that in and it just isn't worth trying anymore. | 慎玩。解决了文明系列的大部分问题，参考了文明系列的0项优点。 | I love this game. That Civ 7 is copying a lot of the mechanics that made this game different should tell you everything you need to know. | 人类议会做的什么玩意？会议让你割让领土，拒绝就开战然后就给你30支持度，关键你看不见人家，你打不着人家。每回合降支持度，拖到回合结束强制失败，直接把首都割给ai。你这是什么设计? | 4天前: 就算这游戏再烂, -85%也不是不能接受
今天: -100%都不行, 屎一样的体验.放到4x分类里面脏了隔壁文明, 放到shit分类下面反倒恰如其分.幽默的战斗机制+基本等于没有的经济发展系统直接毁了游戏体验.

Интересная игра про душевные переживания, буллинг в школе маленькой девочки,за которую нам предстоит пройти ее сознание,победить свои страхи,которые она рисует(противники в игре) и успокоить огромного гиганта,все подробности рассказывать не буду, но игра стоит своих денег и времени, про саму механику игры, обычный карточный рогалик,не добавить не убавить. | I really love this game and hope that one day the developers will fix the minor bugs that still occur during the passage. The fact is that the game is difficult, and even a little inconsistency will easily piss you off. For example, a shield usually protects against traps, but not from a trap that removes all the cards from your hand. But why?! Or thunder usually works on all opponents of the same type, and this rule works on all hydra except red ones. But why?! Or usually, before exiting a level, you can play useless cards like sadness and thus get rid of them. But not when you exit the treasure room level. The game just freezes. These and some other mistakes still spoil this wonderful game, which, thanks to its visual style and simple but touching story, never gets old. | Cute little roguelike, impressively made by a single developer. The gameplay is simple to pick up, and the visuals and sound design are easy on the eyes and ears.

The game attempts to tackle the theme of depression, but its approach is more akin to a sledgehammer than subtlety, which ironically made me laugh out loud. In a strange way, I enjoyed that too, so all's well.

Definitely worth checking out for its charm and effort.

This game does space combat right. I just wish it met the scope of games like Elite Dangerous and No Mans Sky. Alas, unlike the mentioned games, the limited scope of Everspace 2 is done very right. Lots of ways to design your ship. Combat is smooth. The UI is simple and effective. The devs clearly understood the value of an interface that is well polished and doesn't interfere with your game experience. | Everspace 2 hooked me from the moment I set foot in it's completely hand-crafted universe. It brought every bit of Sci Fi nostalgia from the days of arcades you'd visit with your friends and the incredible stories films were telling at those times. It's got class, it's got cheese, it's got charm, it's got comedy, it's got larger-than-life characters, it's got emotions that emerge deep within both hearts and circuits.

The depth of the game comes from both the story and, as a looter-shooter, the customisation options pulled from a huge pool of weapons, components, and ship types, as well as the vast expanses of various hand-crafted areas strewn about the multiple star systems you'll visit (and re-visit at your leisure) during the campaign.

This game is meant to be experienced, so for those who love a story and the vast array of hidden secrets and story-beats to uncover, this game is definitely for you. For those who expect a beyond hard-core RPG Looter-Shooter experience (including end-game) where min-maxing is the goal, this game has some restrictions that would circumvent your expectations (example, legendary gear is restricted to only 3 at at time [four is possible through a special unlock]).

Keep in mind Rock Fish Games came from developing the highly acclaimed Galaxy on Fire (GoF) series from the old iPod Touch and original iPhone days, and this game keeps the same feel (controlling a 3rd person ship on the screen with loading zones, inventory management, and arcade-style space combat, albeit with as much depth as could possibly be crammed into the genre), so temper your expectations. If you loved the GoF games then this is an absolute win and pure evolution for modern day game development and hardware.

Final Notes:
- Don't buy if you expect or want this in VR, it's never happening.
- Don't buy if you expect fully unlocked min-maxing with all obtainable gear (lots of RNG and other restrictions).
- Don't buy if you can't handle wonderfully written but cheesy dialogue.
- Don't buy if you expect a fully open-world where you don't have to follow the story (because you do).
- DO BUY if you have nostalgia for the good old days of Sci Fi arcade gaming.
- DO BUY if you love solving puzzles.
- DO BUY if you love a phenomenal story in a rich hand-crafted universe.
- DO BUY if you love sarcastic AI that comments on your every choice.

If you LOVED the film The Fifth Element, this is basically how this game feels the entire time. Bombastic, ridiculous, fun-loving, ass-kicking, over-the-top with ancient mystical wonders hidden within the stars just begging to be encountered. | Very grindy. XP scaling is off. Enemy levels are very high and no way to get to their level fast enough. | This game has almost everything it needs to be great.

Unfortunately, it is brought down by THE - truly THE - WORST combat hud/interface I have ever seen in any game of its genre.

Two absolutely inexcusable, unforgivable and frankly impossible to understand fuckups by people who clearly have no idea what the fuck they were doing:
1) no radar or equivalent in a space/air combat game -- an insult to the intelligence of anyone who enjoys either genre; you have absolutely no idea where your enemies are relative to you in space except to look at arrows in your hud that give you relative directions -- these could have been fine except
2) the aforementioned arrows do not have any distance indicators - so when you're in the middle of a tense dogfight you cannot tell if the next arrow you choose to chase is an enemy right on your tail or literally on the opposite end of the map. There is NO indication at all - you just have to pick one, hope for the best, and turn until you realize you chose right or you get obliterated because you turned a full 180 to realize the enemy is just a patrol ship or three a half dozen km away.
3) Not only do the arrows not tell you how far the enemy is, they also don't tell you their size, relative power, danger rating, actual level - NOTHING. There is no way to prioritize or make any tactical decisions.

I tried to give the game the benefit of the doubt or think "maybe this is something they fix with equipment later on".
They don't.

This alone is enough to make me want to Thanos their leadership team.
The rest of the game doesn't warrant much discussion.

Characters are weakly written and cookie-cutter. The game doesn't seem to have decided if it wants to present a grim, happy-go-lucky, or otherwise story pace and tone and it seems to jump around to whatever mood struck the writer when they made each quest. Combat has some fun aspects but ship maneuverability and mechanics are way behind better alternatives like Chorus. Every planet/etc has some ships going around but none of them really feel alive -- you will always find outlaw ships patrolling wherever you go - they announce themselves clearly and outright even with security ships prevalent in the area brazenly. Sometimes you will get randomly attacked by a non-outlaw ship  - and if you fight back then you get ganked by the entire security force of the system because self-defense is so 21st century. The game tries to shoehorn a trading mechanic that somewhat adds a bit of an alternative to economy-grinding but is weirdly inconsistent about pricing and never really feels like it's actually helping as much as you'd think.

I would have given this game the benefit of the doubt thinking "surely they'll realize this is stupid and do better soon, maybe they just need time" but they just announced dlc and the issues I highlight have been going on since launch.

I cannot forgive and will not excuse it any longer.

Don't buy this game. | I played a lot of Freelancer. A LOT. Not just the story for a dozen of times but also multiplayer and on modded Roleplaying servers.

Finally this game can let me go of the old abandoned sofware. It is a true 5 Star Action RPG in Space with enough to explore and endless things to do. It never gets boring.

This game brings me so much joy. I love that you are allowed to adjust the settings to your liking to make the game easier and more enjoyable to match your personal play style. Tbf I did not change much, just set stamina to unlimited. It's so pretty, so peaceful... the right balance between challenging and relaxing. And I have hardly ever been so happy and excited about finding loot in a game. You find these little carts and abandoned camps and you have to really look for what's lying around and because the game is so grindy (especially at the beginning) when you find a bronze tool you are like "HOLY SHIT THAT'S SO COOL".  As you watch your village grow and change through the seasons suddenly ingame years have passed and time flies by as you're having fun.... 
I also think the gameplay is pretty balanced at this stage in terms of game progression. Sure, it still is a grindy game but the progress and milestones do feel rewarding and I like that you can still unlock things realtively late into the game. I hope the developers will keep adding content as there are loads of things I'd like to see in this game in the future. 
Also - this is a small thing, I guess - but I'd still love to see it: Please let me play a woman in the SP campaign too. And then whatever kid pops out can be my legacy :D I love that you can play a woman in the COOP mode - please let me be one in SP, too. | The game isn't that bad, but it's core mechanic, namely settlement management, is just barely there. It's all about micromanagement and cannot be played in any other way. Practically speaking, the micromanagement IS the core mechanic. It's entirely impossible to make the village fully self-sustained, and if anyone would claim "But I have my village self-sustained" I would ask: "for how many years?"
Because in the best case, if you played this game in Excel, accurately balancing production, and your only interaction with the village would be selling final products and paying taxes, the village would still eventually starve on intermediate resource or overfill your storage with them. So you HAVE to fine tune pretty much everything again every time there's a new villager or someone raise their skill, or mood is changed, because everything will throw out your balance out of the window.
And because there's no tools to regulate the local economy whatsoever, all you can do is micromanage your settlement all the time, throw villagers from one place to another, change production rate in vain hope you get it right, buy whatever you're missing, sell excesses. You're not developing your colony, you're getting more things to micro-manage and keeping it on manual life support.
That's the core mechanic of the game, as interesting as that.

Now, if developers would read this, few things that they absolutely have to implement:

* Production limits. That's absolute must have. Imagine a landlord in real life seeing his smith making 1000th axe, while there's no sickles because all resources goes to axes, and farmers are loafing around in autumn and everyone is starving. And all the landlord could do is ask his smith nicely to produce less axes and more sickles. Just so that all resources would now go to sickle production and none to pickaxes, so now miners can't get copper and smith and farmers and miners are loafing around, and whole village is starving. What SHOULD happen is the landlord getting a biggest trunk there is and piking that smith on it and telling the next smith to make only one or two axes or sickles or pickaxes or whatever ONLY WHEN THERE'S NO LEFT.

* Seasonal workers. Those farmers do nothing for the whole year except two-four days - to sew and to harvest. Yeah, there's carrot and wheat that can be sown in winter or autumn, but this still does not add up and generally you don't sew fields just to keep your farmers busy, you do it to maximize overall productivity of the village when it's necessary. You might not need that many carrots. So what should have is an option to reassign farmers to other workplaces, so they can make things during winter or summer, instead of spitting in the sky.

* Overhaul of production system in general. Just do it like in literally every other colony management game. Throw out that abomination of +/- % of production and replace it with orders. So the use scenario is following: player opens the building, adds a production assignment and selects assignment completion options: "make n", "make until n", "make forever". The same with seasons, so assignments change with seasons. Or, alternatively, add seasons to assignment options, like "make until n when it's winter"

* Finally, and optionally, and instead of seasonal workers, a new labor system, where buildings optionally might have specifically assigned workers, but otherwise anyone can do the job, as long as there's one. For some buildings, like smithy, job assignment might be compulsory, but for others, like farms or barns - no, as they should not require skilled labor. | Après plus de 170 heures de jeu, je me décide enfin à donner mon avis sur Medieval Dynasty.
Dans l'ensemble, j'aime beaucoup le concept, que ce soit au niveau de la gestion du village et des habitants, de la période où se déroule l'histoire (Moyen-âge), des quêtes que l'on doit accomplir et du gameplay en monde ouvert.
Je trouve que les graphismes sont très réussis, que la carte est assez vaste et très sympa à explorer (Particulièrement pour la chasse et les endroits plus insolites) et que l'histoire principale avec les quêtes secondaires sont intéressantes (Même si j'aurais aimé avoir plus de missions diversifiés, c'est parfois répétitif sur le long terme...). 

Il faut savoir que je n'ai pas joué en coop mais uniquement en mode solo, effectivement, je pense que jusqu'à 4 joueurs ça doit être encore plus sympa et drôle, même si j'apprécie déjà y jouer seule pour le côté "Chill" lors de l'exploration de la map et pour la gestion de mon village. 

De plus, je trouve que Medieval Dynasty est très addictif, je ne vois pas le temps passé quand j'y joue et j'ai dû mal à décrocher, surtout quand je me lance dans la construction de nouveaux bâtiments (Que ce soit pour le travail ou les habitations) ou dans l'amélioration du village en général, il y a toujours de nouvelles choses à débloquer et à découvrir petit à petit, c'est très prenant ! 

Par contre, il faut savoir que le début du jeu peut sembler long, on démarre l'histoire en mode survie en partant de 0, le temps de parvenir à créer un petit village avec une dizaine d'habitants à son actif prends en moyenne 3 à 5 années et pour arriver à débloquer le statut de "ville" avec tous les bâtiments, il faut compter plus de 10 années en moyenne, donc il faut savoir faire preuve de patience ! 
Mais une fois qu'on parvient à maîtriser la gestion de notre village et qu'on développe de nombreuses ressources, le jeu devient vraiment intéressant ! 

Les tâches que l'on effectue pendant les premières heures sont très répétitives (Chasser pour notre survie et collecter un maximum de viandes, vendre nous-même les ressources essentielles, etc...) mais celles-ci finissent par aboutir au fil des années qui s'écoulent dans le jeu et nos efforts sont récompensés par la suite ;) ! 
De plus, je trouve que l'univers est très immersif, les musiques sont belles et accompagnent parfaitement l'époque où se déroule l'histoire du jeu ! 
Je sais que des mises à jour sont effectués régulièrement, ce que j'apprécie beaucoup de la part des développeurs, j'espère que de nouvelles quêtes seront disponibles dans l'avenir ainsi qu'une amélioration de la carte avec de nouvelles villes et lieux à découvrir ! 

Concernant la jouabilité, il arrive quelques fois qu'il y ait des bugs sur le jeu, notamment au niveau des PNJ qui sont assis dans le vide en plein milieu du village, allonger sur le sol ou encore qui restent figés sur place... Ce n'est pas très gênant mais pas du tout réaliste pour le coup... ! 
J'ai aussi eu des bugs lors de la chasse sur certains animaux, notamment avec les bisons où il m'était impossible de récupérer la viande mais ce n'est arrivé que très rarement, rien de grave en soi ! 

Au niveau de la difficulté du jeu, j'avais pour ma part du mal au début (Notamment lors des rencontres avec les bandits et pour la chasse avec les bisons, les ours et les loups...) mais après plusieurs heures, je m'y suis habituée et j'ai eu les armes et l'équipement nécessaire pour y arriver sans difficulté, je trouve même que maintenant, c'est devenu trop simple ! 

On a également la possibilité de jouer sur deux parties/cartes différentes : La Vallée, en incarnant Racimir au départ et Oxbow, en personnalisant nous-même notre personnage principal au commencement de l'histoire. 
Personnellement, j'ai joué aux deux parties qui ont le même concept/but principal, c'est à dire la gestion du village, la survie et les quêtes, etc.. mais pour le moment, j'ai plus joué sur celle avec l'histoire de Racimir et ses descendants que sur la seconde qui se passe à Oxbow, j'ai donc hâte de la continuer davantage ! 

Je recommande donc Medieval Dynasty sans hésiter (A prendre pendant les soldes car le prix reste assez élevé...), pour toutes les personnes qui recherchent un jeu de simulation/survie se déroulant au Moyen-âge sur un monde ouvert !  Vous ne le regretterez pas :) ! | over 700 hours. i love this game. the developers have been great. first person village building, town management, hunting, farming, bandit fighting. It's a slow game (it is a dynasty game). There are many customization options to speed up things if you want. i wish all games were as well thought out as this one. | Love this game.  It has easy game play dynamics to learn.  I play solo and totally enjoy being returned to a time long ago.  If building a village, surrounded with detailed scenery, unique music, some quests, with a few bandits to spice things up, then I would give this game a try.

It's frustrating when you invest in a game that has tons of potential, then watch it die with no updates... Only to see the developer announcing their next project which is a sequel to the unfinished one you've been waiting to be completed.  Why would we pay for a Dungeons of Edera 2 when you never finished the first one.  Pass on this and pass on the next one too. | extrem repetitiv u einige mechaniken sind unausgegoren. habe es wirklich versucht, aber jetzt ist schluss. teil zwei kommt mir nicht ins haus, gab bessere hack and slays. | People should stop crying that its not finished still a great game hevnt played in a long time but was dope and for such a small price like i mean relax fs and people saying there not gonna buy the second one ha i bet you will if you liked the first one | DA

This is actually pains me to write it but I actually waited a monstrous sale to buy this one, it was not money issue, but I thought if fooled myself, I could avoid playing and remain my beautiful memories for previous titles intact. 
However dreaded day came in, a 90% discount and a bottle of vodka with few hours of free time to waste.

My first reaction was "what the hell happened to this title?" Game felt fundamentally different than the original titles. 

This is a game where you can sense the ambition of devs with graphic push and voice acting, yet all they did discarded every single accomplishment and charm point it's former titles had. 

Former titles were highly stylised with innovative ideas, breathtaking adventure and incredible soundtracks I still listen to this day. Yet it seems in 17 years, everything could change for worse. 

This one however... Was a generic and soulless implement where even controlling your character is so clunky that it felt like a chore of its own. | Heya folks, I've finally beaten the game and I wanted to add a short review for the game.

If I were to give this game a rating, it'd probably be a 6.8/10. It can be a bit janky in places, like horse movement, the voice acting is so-so (A lot of it felt half-hearted and like the actors weren't really interested), and the overall writing is so-so as well. The game's combat system is relatively simplistic, and since you lose units a lot, you have to backtrack to unit sellers frequently, which makes things kinda repetitive. 

Despite its drawbacks, I still found the game relatively fun, but I did find that the game is a lot more fun if you use invincibility (I used WeMod), because it alleviates a lot of the issues I had with the game.

So, I'd probably give this a mixed review if I was able to, but I gave it a recommendation because I did enjoy it in the end. The game ends on a major cliffhanger though, and I'm not sure if there will be a sequel to the game, so that's another thing to consider. | Its very surprising and unique game, better than a lot of AAA titles, brilliant. Only one bad thing is optimalization (I have FPS drops when loading a new scene, avg FPS is 50-60, playing on GTX1060, i5 3570k, install on SSD).

Why I love this game?
1) In first 5 minutes this game makes me laught by intelligent humour (little bit of medieval parody) and aroused curiosity.
2) I never heard or play other King's bounty series :) and I dont like top-down RPG strategies.
3) I want only casual small RPG with story rich for relax, without 1000 spells and huge inventory.
4) I love the visual, castles, beautiful winter, nature, characters, faces, even my horse.
5) A lot of clever dialogues with czech subtitles :) The story is best, really interesting, like fairytale movie.
6) very smooth and easy control with gamepad.

RESULT: Anyone who want funny and interesting RPG fantasy story + easy playing - no huge inventory nor large openworld = this game is fantastic.

Only similar games (with same feeling) to King's Bounty II I've played are Marvel's Midnight Suns and Zenith. | Also ich dachte es wäre ein RPG Abenteuer,richtiger Kampf mit der Charaktere. Катарсис , писал Аристотель, должно дарить произведение искусства. Особенно, когда оно заставляет сопереживать, грустить, радоваться... Вот этого создателям игры удалось добиться, кинематографистам многим поучиться нужно. Классная атмосфера игры, основанная на потрясающем произведении В.Тихова, эдаком литературном осмыслении быличек и страшилок северных регионов России, - просто до головы затягивает и погружает в мир русского Севера начала 20 века. С удовольствием сопереживал Василисе на ее пути, с огромным наслаждением читал былички (а читать их обязательно - в них подсказки игроку на будущие вопросы и испытания), слушал песни. А боевая карточная система заговоров прям добавила глубины. Разобрался с ней , правда, не сразу, а как дошло, то играть стало просто в наслаждение. В общем, эта игра огромный труд , сделанный с любовью к русскому фольклору и истории. Браво, разработчики!!! | Tbh, game is quiet good in the start - the lore and the premise is perfect but i do feel like the story is TOO long.  The momentum it built went down the drain as tasks became too repetitive. Sad though as the game is promising. | Хороша игра!
Очень хорошая озвучка, песни
Тексты все интересные

Сначала решала где можно игрой в карты, но наскучило и, чтоб не забросить, стала пропускать сражения. Очень хорошо что есть такая возможность! 
Если захотите проходить, то чтобы посмотреть все концовки, можете до срыва первой печати накопить 100 греха или около того. Тогда последнего действия вам вполне хватит чтобы рассмотреть другие варианты). Ну, кроме еще одного, но там прям всю игру жестить надо | Very lovely game with great atmosphere. You can really feel the nature of people from the time od 19th century of Russia.

A lot of mythology and folkloric stuff around.

Love it! But some puzzles can be challenging. | Black Book is an excellent game that's lead by its story.
Do not mistakenly think it's a "rogue-alike card battler" because of the tags on Steam; it's not so basic like that, it's not Slay the Spire.
This is a story-driven RPG, where combat takes the form of a "card battler" using the titular Black Book's pages to order to cast spells (offensive and defensive).
It's story-first, voice-acted, and has you making your way through the countryside to your objectives' locations, where you can choose to bee-line there or explore side locales. Being a card battler is simply how combat is played in this game. The combat is well-designed, taking cues from Slay the Spire with providing you the info on what the enemy is going to do on their next turn as well as most of your spells being attacks or putting up protective shields on you or your ally (your choice).

Because the story & everything are rooted in Slavic mythology, there may be times when you're asked something and given a choice between several words you don't know. You can look them up online real quick, but fear not as these situations give you no penalty for being wrong and only a bonus of XP if you choose correctly - smart.


The DLC looks for be more like Slay the Spire as a "rogue-alike card battler" but IMHO that's reductive and misses out entirely on the point of Black Book: the story.

Amazing lil game.  Please make placing spell troops easier, i just lost on the final because my troops wouldn't place when i needed them (just kept flickering to X even in green area because the hills make it really hard to place spell troops), also an extra slow mode would be nice, cant really focus on whats going on while spamming cards at normal speed.

At the start i thought it was worse than the first, now i think its twice as good. How do you make a game twice as good as a 10/10 game ? It's not even finished... | Hades 2 em acesso antecipado consegue ser melhor e mais completo, não só do que Hades 1, mas também do que 90% dos jogos vazios e "sem alma" lançados pela grande industria dos games atualmente.
É incrível como a Supergiant Games com uma equipe relativamente pequena se dedica ao máximo em cada mínimo detalhe dos jogos. 
Aos fãs do jogo, recomendo que assistam ao documentário "Hades: Developing Hell" disponível no Youtube, que mostra a jornada de desenvolvimento de Hades 1. | Baller game. Super fun gameplay. The story is good - much more meaningful if you've played the first one but it's great even if you haven't. Very difficult but definitely something you can improve on with experience. love the mechanics with the boons too. | 本来刚出的时候还是蛮期待的，第一时间通关了克洛诺斯，那时候还是蛮好玩的。
但经过几轮更新，游戏出现了很多很严重的问题，导致我的游戏体验非常的糟糕，感觉没得到什么好的体验反而浪费了很多时间，所以把我认为不好玩的地方列举如下：

1：大量关于Ω（蓄力）技能和魔法的祝福，对于喜欢纯物理攻击的人来说，
这些新要素非常的难上手，尤其是在一个满屏幕都是怪一不小心就暴毙的动作游戏，蓄力的性价比太低，魔法更是难以上手，这种情况下应该给予玩家选择的权利，而不是死板的把主人公定位为一个女巫强制玩家使用巫术。

2：不！要！妄！图！往！动！作！游！戏！里！加！MMO！游！戏！的！走！位！机！制！
主要体现在新boss普罗米修斯上，打到一定阶段普罗米修斯会让他的鹰会把场地分成3块进行乱序的放火，玩家需要记住鹰的标识，配合鹰在放火时进行走位，如果走不对会被秒杀。这是典型的mmo走位机制。

很多动作游戏开发商在做不出什么新玩法之后，总是妄图把mmo这种慢节奏的走位机制强行加进快节奏的动作游戏里，这不是创新，这是徒增玩家的负担。要是整不出新活来就别整。【没有创新】比【游戏变粪】哪个对游戏造成的伤害更大奉劝制作组掂量掂量。

本来就是boss技能满天飞，场地上还有火限制走位，boss的鹰还在AOE，谁还有时间记忆你那套广播体操还陪你玩？
人们玩动作游戏是为了打击感和爽快感，不是来被“教育”被“训练”的。
大家要“玩”游戏而不是被游戏玩！

3：要搞懂“难度”和“不讲理（粪）”的区别！
首先是到了后期，主人公的强化明显追不上新内容的难度了。
卡牌的强化和数量根本就不够你在地表世界跑那么远。尤其是到了普罗米修斯面前，有的玩家已经注意力涣散了，注意力很难集中，输了回家还发现根本没有什么东西可以升级，只能怪自己“菜”。还得被地表那嘴臭boss骂，体验能好？

前半段冥界的克洛诺斯虽然有些走位机制的端倪，但还算比较容易，给反应的时间也是足够的，而且相对好打，但地上部分就尤其的无聊且又臭又长。体感上大概有冥界的1.5倍，但增益却往往距离挑战普罗米修斯差很远。
把每一段远征都做的又臭又长那不叫“可玩性高”。建议在奥林匹斯酒神那里设置一个中继点给玩家做休整和存档，地表的部分实在是太长了。

目前来说想说的就这么多了，期待后期的更新吧，下次我再打开游戏的时候如果没有改善的话我差不多也该放弃了。
 | 承诺年初更新言而无信，到了二月中旬仍无音讯，四个月没有一点儿新内容，没有不给差评的理由吧。

Unforgiving, surprisingly deep, flawed but beautiful old school strategy.  I can’t seem to get enough of it. | Das ist einfach das beste 4X-Spiel des bekannten Universums. | oldie sandbox game with a lot of variation | OG fun | que de plaisir ds ma jeunesse
