I've come across a few bugs specifically in dialogue. So in all other aspects the game is great, but dialogue is mediocore. (Static noise when speaking, facial movements aren't accurate) But I like it :D | Horizon Zero Dawn
Basit bir ön söz ile anlatmak gerekirse bu oyun etkileyici ve güzel ama aynı zamanda bir sabır testi. "Bu oyunu neden oynuyorum ki?" dedirtecek kadar gıcık olduğum anlar oldu. Bu nedenle incelememde oyunun hem güçlü hem de sinir bozucu yanlarına değineceğim. 

Hikaye
İnsanlığın yıkımından sonra robotlarla dolu bir dünyada geçen post-apokaliptik bir macera sunuyor. Ana karakterimiz Aloy'un geçmişi, robotların varoluş sebebi ve insanlığın bu noktaya nasıl geldiği gibi sorular oyunun temelini oluşturuyor. Hikaye kağıt üzerinde etkileyici; derinlemesine incelendiğinde gerçekten iyi düşünülmüş ve katmanlı bir anlatım sunuyor. Ancak sorun şu ki, oyunu oynarken bu hikaye yeterince derinden hissettirilemiyor. Bu, beni hikayenin içine çekemedi ve çoğu zaman olayların akışını bir dış gözlemci gibi izlemek zorunda kaldım. Hikayenin potansiyeli var ama sunum şekli bu potansiyeli tam anlamıyla parlatamıyor. Bunun tamamen benim düşüncem olduğunu belirteyim.

Görsellik ve Atmosfer
Oyunun en büyük artılarından biri görselliği. Muhteşem manzaralar, nefes kesen atmosfer ve detaylı tasarımlar, oyunu görsel bir şölen haline getiriyor. Ancak bu tür post-apokaliptik evrenler günümüzde artık o kadar sık kullanılıyor ki, Horizon evreni bana biraz yavan hissettirdi 2025 yılı için. Çıktığı dönem oynasaydım aynı yorumu yapar mıydım bilemiyorum. Oyunun görsel yönü tartışılmaz bir başarıya sahip olsa da, tema açısından "daha önce gördüklerimizden çok farklı değil" diyebilirim. Yine de bunlar benim düşüncelerim, bu tür evrenlere meraklı olanlar için üst seviye bir deneyim olabilir.

Aloy
Ana karakterimiz Aloy, hem hikaye açısından hem de kişilik olarak iyi işlenmiş bir karakter. Güçlü, bağımsız ve akıllı bir karakter görmek her zaman keyif vericidir. Ancak Aloy ile duygusal bir bağ kurmak benim için çok zor oldu. Belki de karakterin biraz mesafeli bir yapıya sahip olmasından kaynaklanmıştır. Oyunda geçirdiğim saatler boyunca onunla empati kurmak yerine, oyun bitene kadar sıradan bir karakter olarak ona dışarıdan bakmaya devam ettim.

Harita
Harita devasa, evet ama bu genişlik çoğu zaman bir nimet değil, bir külfet gibi hissettirdi. Keşfedilecek pek çok şey var, ancak haritanın tasarımı bu keşif hissini yorucu bir hale getiriyor. Bazı bölgelerdeki yollar ve ulaşım şekli, adeta bir sabır testi gibiydi. Geniş bir harita her zaman iyi bir harita değildir.

Binek
Binek kullanımı hiç akıcı hissettirmiyordu. Binek için pozitif bir görüş sunmak benim için imkansız.

Savaşlar
Oyunun düşman çeşitliliği ikiye ayrılıyor: robotlarla savaşlar ve insanlarla savaşlar. Robot düşmanların çeşitliliği ve onlarla çatışması genellikle keyifliydi. Her robotun zayıf noktalarını tespit edip buna göre taktik geliştirmek, oyuncuya stratejik bir tatmin sağlıyor. Ancan insan düşmanlarla savaşmak aşırı sade ve basit bir deneyim sunuyor. Genel olarak düşmanların yapay zekası pek iyi değildi, kısaca idare eder diyebilirim.

Bazı yerlerde aniden aşırı kalabalık düşman grupları etrafımızı sarıp nefes aldırmıyorlardı. Bu bazen sinir bozucu olabiliyor. Eğer o an orada bir şey yapmanız gerekiyorsa biraz eziyetli yoldan yapmak durumunda kalabilirsiniz. Özellikle aksiyon anında kamera açısı beni biraz yıprattı. 

Bazı savaş bölümleri gerçekten eğlenceliydi ve iyi bir denge kurulduğunda  oyun keyif verebildi.

Platform ve Tırmanış
Tırmanma ve platform bölümleri, oyunun aksiyon ve keşif unsurlarına hoş bir çeşitlilik katıyor. Ancak bu mekanikleri ne çok başarılı ne de çok kötü; tek kelimeyle "ortalama". Tırmanış sırasında bazı animasyonlar ve kontroller biraz hantal hissettirse de genel olarak bu kısımlar sıkmadan ilerliyor.

Başarımlar
Oyunu tam anlamıyla bitirip tüm başarımları toplamak isteyenler için güzel bir haber var: Başarımlar oldukça kolay. Ancak kötü haber şu ki, bu başarımları toplamak ciddi zaman istiyor. Eğer bu tür şeylere meraklıysanız, oyuna başlamadan önce bir rehbere göz atmak işinizi kolaylaştırabilir. 

Sonuç
Horizon Zero Dawn benim için tam anlamıyla bir çelişki oldu. Bir yandan güzel anlar yaşattı, diğer yandan sinirlerimi hoplattı. Tavsiye etmekte tereddüt ediyorum çünkü bu oyun herkese hitap etmeyebilir. Ama eğer bu tür bir dünyada geçen maceralara meraklıysanız, indirim döneminde şans verebilirsiniz.

Son olarak, bu oyunu tek bir kelimeyle özetlemem gerekseydi, "gıcık" derdim. | Beautiful.

It really impressed me right from the start. 
Very well done graphics.
The attention to detail is high, both regarding the map and the opponents/friends.
The interactions are also beautiful.
The story is very interesting, the game difficulties allow you to enjoy the story to the fullest.

Advised. | Great game. Fittingly big open world to explore with awesome combat system. | Horizon Zero Dawn, oyuncuları muhteşem bir açık dünya ile buluşturan Guerrilla Games'in başyapıtlarından biri. İlginç hikayesi, sürükleyici oynanışı ve görsel şöleniyle hem RPG severleri hem de aksiyon tutkunlarını kendine hayran bırakan bu oyun, PlayStation'dan sonra PC platformuna da gelerek daha geniş bir kitleye ulaştı.

Muhteşem Bir Açık Dünya
Oyunun geçtiği post-apokaliptik dünya, doğanın makinelerle harmanlandığı büyüleyici bir atmosfer sunuyor. Buzlu dağ zirveleri, yemyeşil ormanlar ve kuru çöller arasında gezinirken her bölgenin kendine özgü bir güzelliği olduğunu fark ediyorsunuz. Guerilla Games’in Decima motoruyla ortaya koyduğu detaylı grafikler ve ışıklandırmalar, bu dünyayı keşfetmeyi başlı başına bir zevk haline getiriyor.

Derin ve Duygusal Hikaye
Aloy’un hikayesi, sadece bir kahramanlık destanı olmaktan çok daha fazlası. Kimliğini ve geçmişini keşfetme yolculuğu, hem duygusal hem de merak uyandırıcı. Oyunun ana görevleri ve yan hikayeleri, oyuncuyu sürekli olarak yeni sırlar keşfetmeye teşvik ediyor. Özellikle oyunun finali, etkileyici bir duygusal yoğunluk sunuyor.

Akıcı ve Tatmin Edici Oynanış
Horizon Zero Dawn, etkileyici bir dövüş sistemiyle oyunculara benzersiz bir deneyim yaşatıyor. Aloy'un kullandığı yay, mızrak ve çeşitli tuzaklar, düşmanlarla mücadelede farklı stratejiler geliştirmenizi sağlıyor. Robot dinazorlarla yapılan savaşlar, hem zekanızı hem de reflekslerinizi test eden dinamik çatışmalarla dolu.

Çarpıcı Müzikler ve Seslendirme
Oyunun müzikleri, atmosferi mükemmel bir şekilde tamamlıyor. Özellikle ana tema müziği, oyunun duygusal yoğunluğunu çok iyi yansıtıyor. Ayrıca Aloy’un seslendirmesi, karakterin güçlü ve aynı zamanda duyarlı doğasını başarıyla ortaya koyuyor.

Sonuç
Horizon Zero Dawn, güçlü hikayesi, muhteşem grafikleri ve etkileyici oynanışı ile oyun dünyasında unutulmaz bir yer edinmeyi başarıyor. Eğer hala bu destansı yolculuğa çıkmadıysanız, Aloy’un macerasına katılmak için daha fazla beklemeyin.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Early Access
Reviews: Game is abandoned.   It was just a cash grab as best I can tell.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Early Access
Reviews:
Studio abandoned the game since 4 years ago. Now they release news every few months to lure in naive new buyers. It has been on chapter 0 since release and the devs moved on to a new project.

For what it's worth, the game is actually spectacular. There's very little content though, you'll have explored every detail after 1-2 weeks. It's a good buy if it ever goes on 80-90% discount. | Don't buy. Soon to be a dead game. I was very excited about it, but with how things are going in their company... well...  It's all GEOVER lads, gg | Abandoned project. Do NOT buy it if you expect any updates... | If you enjoy novel, artistic experience, I think this is a must buy.  There is no other game like Book of Travels. This is meditation and being present and mindful condensed into video game form, with an unbelievably dense and immersive world and a breathtaking artstyle. 

The studio recently laid everyone off, and a lot of reviews are saying this is why you shouldn't buy it. I'd like to raise the contrary point of that is why you should buy the game and try it now while you still can. Who knows how long the servers will remain up and this gem of gaming history may be lost forever. 

I sincerely hope the devs release a single player version, as there is so much this game has to offer and a lot of players have never experienced. | I'm deeply troubled and sad about this game.  It has sooooo much potential and the developers really haven't done anything wrong.  It's romantic to travel along and locate other adventurers without any such group making system at all.  Just a large world of solo travelers who might bump into eachother.

Great game and story. Well worth the time. The difficulty lies in managing your food/shelter/coin. Just like in the olden days if you get stuck you can go on the message boards and find clues to help you advance. 

Yes, you have to read. 
You can do it. 
I believe in you. 
 | I LOVE this game

It's soundtrack is just perfect, it's the right levels of crunch that you'd expect from 8-bit vibes, with just the right hint of nature in each track. Honestly It haunts my dreams.

The art is perfectly distant like everyone in the game is. It's sharp and precise just like a Roadwarden needs to be. It's just so perfect.

The gameplay plays like a choose your own adventure story book. There isn't really a tutorial, from the moment you start you're on the clock (if you play normal mode). It basically points at things in the UI and wishes you luck. You get to decide your characters Morals and Backstory based on questions asked to you by NPCs throughout the game, it's an incredibly interesting way to build a character. I really just love this game.

3 classes, 3 different time limit modes. It almost encourages you to play through it 3 times. If it's any help I've done 2. One as just the brute strength Warrior, and one as a wise pious scholar. My first play through was something like 28 hours (I played on the free roam mode and just explored everything), my second was just about 8 hours (40 day limit). Both times was an amazing experience, I HIGHLY suggest this game. | Tolles Spiel in einem Art Pen & Paper Stil mit schönen Zeichnungen und viel Text. Leider nur auf Englisch zu lesen. Falls also jemand eine deutsche Sprachausgabe möchte, ist er hier leider falsch dran. Für alle mit guten Englischkenntnissen aber kein Problem. Bin gespannt was noch so alles passiert!

PS: Super Spiel fürs SteamDeck, auch wenn die Steuerung leider nicht gut funktioniert, weil sie nur für Maus und Tastatur läuft! | i can't believe i've not written a review yet - i'll come back to write something more substantial later, but this game touched me quite a lot. the survival elements were excellent to me, difficult enough as suits the setting. the writing, story, themes and atmosphere are impeccable to me. certain interactions caught me off-guard, in a good way, and i remember several story beats that floored me to the point of grinning at the screen. if this seems at all interesting to you, i highly recommend checking it out. 

it does a great job earning the grimness and melancholy it likes to claim of the in-game profession; you genuinely feel as if you're constantly juggling your own survival, your personal ambitions, the will of your employer, and the imagined or explicit desires of the many people you have to interact with. money is always tight, your health is never full enough, your magic wanes too quickly... do you buy a weapon to defend yourself with, or an outfit that might permit you an audience with someone you need to know? do you sell the information to that person, or blackmail another? are you more intent to build yourself a better life upon your return, or find somewhere else to call home? the time limit is everpresent, and you can't do everything. there is a fishing mechanic, also. i will always look for more games like this. thank you very much. | Very fun and interesting! Has a good story. :) 

Time catches up on you...

This is a nice, simple, RPG.  I loaded up Pathfinder: WOTR and tried to play it a few times.  I just found it to be too much.  I was looking for an RPG I could pick up and play with some learning but not PhD level.  I found Zoria, which I had been looking at for awhile.  It is kind of rough in some ways but I am having fun.  It is really well done and I have had zero bugs.  Give it a shot.

Update:  At 7 hours, the game gets far more interesting.   | 還行，這價格玩起來CP值很高。

還沒玩之前。看到有評論區說每次打架前要休息解破甲很累人。實際玩了以後覺得其實根本不用一直解，一般的小戰鬥就算有些Debuff也沒甚麼。也許高難度才會有大差異吧，普通難度玩到目前為止，覺得還滿簡單的。

 | An old school tactical RPG with a fascinating story. It reminds me of Larian's Divinity Original Sin 2, but lower quality, hence it is cheaper. Still, I find that it worth every penny for me. I like the beginning of the story and can't wait to see how will it develop.

Upd: after playing 10 more hours, I am certain this is a great indy game. There are drawbacks, such as some quest show on the map, but you have to finish other quest to enter the location where they are. Still, the world is great, the story is great, the grind is fun, and I enjoy sending my addon characters to missions while questing with my main team. | In all seriousness, the overall experience of the game is not great, and most of the issues stem from the map design.

The maps are overly large yet lack substantial content. Additionally, optimization seems to be a major challenge, as the camera cannot move far enough, nor can anchor points be placed at a distance. This results in players spending excessive time just trying to navigate. On top of that, the maps are filled with invisible walls, and the environment design often makes it difficult to distinguish which terrain is passable and which is not, making exploration even more frustrating. In fact, one could argue that dealing with the map is more of a hassle than the enjoyment gained from combat.

The combat itself is fun, but occasional bugs cause characters to get stuck. While the game is enjoyable, content noticeably diminishes in the later stages, making it apparent that the development team rushed to finish the game. Speaking of bugs, the game frequently encounters issues where the background music fails to play, and in the arena, a bug prevents players from completing the level 20 challenges, effectively soft-locking progress.

That being said, completing a game is an achievement in itself, and I respect the effort put into it. I hope the development team continues to improve and brings even better experiences in the future.

Translated by chatGPT

------------------------------

認真說來,遊戲的體驗並不算太好，大多的問題都出在遊戲地圖設計上。
地圖大而無當，沒有太多實質內容,加上可能是最佳化很困難的原因,導致攝影機無法移動到遠處,也無法在遠方放定錨點,讓玩家花費大量時間在找路上,加上地圖上一堆隱形牆,地圖美術又看往往看不出來那些地形是可以通過,那些不能，讓找路變得更加痛苦。
甚至可以說地圖造成的麻煩比戰鬥帶來的樂趣更多。

遊戲本身的戰鬥是有趣的,但偶爾會發生人物卡死的bug，
並且在遊戲越後期內容越來越少，明顯感受到的開發團隊的趕工，
bug的部分,這個遊戲頻繁的發生BGM不播放的bug,並且在競技場也會發生無法打敗20級挑戰的bug,導致遊戲完全卡死。

不論如何，能夠完整開發完一款遊戲都該值得尊敬，我希望開發團隊再接再厲。 | Great!

Got a little easy for me, so I didn't finish. The story was good, good combat, nice crafting system, and polished questing system.

The graphics aren't fantastic, but those didn't distract me from this well put together game.

Infelizmente o cubeword que jogávamos se perdeu, parece ter sido feito uma adaptação para o estilo souls like, claramente tem atenção e sem carinho com os jogadores, o jogo possui um tipo de reset, que ao chegar nos mapas vizinhos o seus itens somem, ficam fracos e inuteis, a não ser que sejam com drops muito raros itens do tipo plus (+) que duram apenas um mapa vizinho, assim o jogo fica resetando, ao invez da sensação de evoluir, o jogo te passa a sensação de patinar e dar ré, este retrocesso faz você perder a vontade de farmar novos itens e recursos ja que com cerca de 4 a 5 horas vc vai para outro mapa e perderá tudo. enquanto não mudar logo esse sistema e talvez implementar uma maneira de aprimar itens para que se tornem definitivos (apenas uma sugestão aki) perderam um jogador e se perguntarem minha opinião, perderam outros. attc Roger Borba | Um jogo fofo, facil e repetitivo. é isso que ele se resumiu depois de atualizações e cortes de mecânicas, mas que dá pra se divertir durante um tempo.
Dito isso o prequel é muito melhor | Played the og. Was waiting for YEARS for it to release. Finally did, and Woolay abandoned it.

Gameplay loop is crap. You farm and farm and farm for gear, go to a new area and suddenly your gear is utterly useless.

It's cute, and I was really hoping for the game to actually be fully fleshed out, have constant updates etc etc but no. Woolay has gone dark since the release. So many other solo indie devs that communicate with their fans and add updates. Shame Woolay isn't one of them. | 6 yıldır bir kere güncellemesi gelmemiş rezalet ötesi bir oyun alpha versiyonunu seviyordum bölge kitleme muhabetti beni hiç ama hiç sarmıyor | The game is fun, but when will it be updated?

I feel like before people buy this, they should know the EA label REALLY means EA. This game is very, very ambitious and only has a small team working on it. What is here is a fantastic foundation with gameplay mechanics that show the devs really know how to make fun, satisfying, and engaging mechanics. You really can just do whatever the hell you want, to an extent.

Obviously, the game is being worked on and nowhere near full release. The cities, while really well designed at the moment, feel disjointed and unfinished. Enemy variety is lacking, encounters in the overworld map get stale pretty fast, and the performance is a little rough.

HOWEVER, there's a SHITE ton of build variety, skills, weapons, armor etc. Reminds me a bit of Terraria mixed with World of Warcraft. The skills feel great to use and the combat in general makes the repetitive encounters fun and interesting just about every time. I'm having a lot of fun going around as a Necromancer, raising giant armies of skeletons and casting dark magic and whatnot. Super fun.

Everything has a level tied to it, from running around to crafting gear or cooking food, there's a lot of stuff to do and grind. Think Runescape, where you can level specific hobbies but The Bloodline uses engaging minigames for the leveling processes.

My one suggestion for the devs is one seen a lot in this game's reviews, in that they should put most of their focus on polishing the stuff they already have rather than constantly adding new stuff that also needs more polish. It's like building up a house with old wood and instead of making the old wood sturdier, you just keep adding more old wood. Eventually, the end result won't be too pretty. Just take the time to polish out the older stuff and get it finished!

TL;DR, The game is very unfinished but what's here is worth playing and it's especially worth supporting the devs, as they're clearly passionate about making a fun, vast and sprawling game with great depth. 7/10 from me.

January 23, 2025 | I can say with utmost certainty that the store page is severely underwhelming in comparison to the actual game.

So far I've been running around with blood magic, levitating hordes of enemies and causing blood bursts that weaken and ragdoll all enemies within a radius. If things start to get really bad, I slurp down a potion like the potion-guzzling heathen I am, which grants 60 defense, 100 health, and health regeneration. After which, I pull out my sword that lights on fire after a successful parry, and proceed to slice down my foes.

The game has A LOT of areas to explore with a massive overworld which acts as a world map that you physically interact with to travel to other locations. Some areas don't have an actual building on the map to interact with, so you "camp" there, which places you inside of the zone itself, that transitions from a top-down world map, to a first person perspective where you play the game.

While on the world map, you can encounter a multitude of events. Some have wolf packs, others having mining/woodcutting opportunities, and them some which can initate combat or special events like a meteor shower to mine. If you aren't in a position to fight, you can throw down items to distract the aggressors, or attempt to run away.

There are TONS of skills in the game, both in skill trees and found out in the wild. Puzzles are everywhere in the world and it contains a handful of secrets that grant both funny and useful abilities. So far I only have about 24 hours, and I feel as if I've barely scratched the surface of everything in the game. 

At the start you can begin construction of your town if you wish to engage with it (I haven't done so, and have yet to find any issues with the game). It has pre-set locations with houses on them, when interacted with you get to choose the buildings profession. At the start you build a bakery, but there are plenty of options that even go so far as to specialize in a specific skill (druidism, necromancy, blood magic, archery, lute magic, etc.)

I would heavily recommend it for people looking for an open world RPG that has an extremely diverse amount of content you can play around with. There is plenty of lore to find around the world and tons of small minigames that never get old. The game has a diverse amount of aesthetics throughout the world and they're all executed amazingly. | This has become my favorite sandbox game. 

If you are a steam deck user, IT CAN BE PLAYED. You have to remap some buttons to make the game functionally sound, not you'll still miss out on a couple features that help play, but are not necessary to play.

At the time of writing this, this game is most certainly a working progress. If you're okay with a game that has unfinished areas and whatnot, buy it when you got free funds. 

Me personally? I am here for the journey to the destination and then the golden destination will be a reward unto itself. This is all written coded and developed by one person so the end is not anywhere in sight, but that means that this is solely one person's vision one person's artistic direction and they deserve all the support we can give for such a heavy undertaking.

If the dev happens to see this, you are a hero to me (had similar vision growing up, but no skills) and if you need help with anything other than coding just hmu because I would not mind helping for free for this project. | I have only played for about 2 and a half hour, but I have to say this is one of the most fun games I have played in a while

The exploring is quite fun, I loved the small mini games that I have to do whenever I have to mine or to make a weapon, and most of all I really love the combat in this game, It's not just attack and block, it's more than that. I have done quite some creative ways to attack a goblin with a spear and that's the only weapon I have used currently, I wonder how many more creative ways I can kill an enemy with other types of weapons.

Some people in the reviews are mentioning that some quests have bugs in them, I haven't experienced any bugs yet but there are chances that it will happen eventually but I am fine with that as long as it doesn't happen too often. I have also seen that some areas in this game gives a bit poor performance and frame drops sometimes, and my computer heats up a bit more while playing this game so I kinda hope the developers manage to fix that a bit by optimizing some of the areas in the game a little more to prevent frame drops and PC heating up. (It's still very playable for me but more optimization is still needed)

I have a few suggestions about things that I would like to have in game (I am not sure if some of them are already in the game since I have only played for 2 hours or if the devs have already planned it for the future, so sorry in advance). 

- It would be nice to have some sort of daily quests where each day there would be a different type of quests to do, maybe mining certain ores or defeating certain amount of enemies and stuff like that, or some NPCs which have endless amount of quests like those (like I said, I only have played for about 2 hours I am not sure if there's already NPC's with endless amount of quests or not)

- I would love to have sliding as a movement in this game, just sprint and slide, it will make the combat even more satisfying and sliding down hills would be fun too, maybe there can be some upgrades for sliding as well like uhh leave a fire trail behind while sliding for a bit or something like that. I would love if there are more stuff added for the combat and movements like that, maybe even able to front or backflip while in the air and if you manage to hit a trickshot then you get extra XP for style... actually on second thought I think the backflip thing might be too much, but uhh yeah sliding would be great.

- Some more enemy types, I saw a goblin with a gun and a jet pack and I was like "Holy shit". I would love to have more unique enemies like that, maybe like some mad wizard which confuses you and inverts your controls so you have trouble moving for a bit or some enemies who are healers and go ahead and heal others so you have to kill the healers first. 

- More settings for difficulties, for enemies and even the mini games. If you fail to mine an ore perfectly, your pickaxe would explode and you will die or something like that, that would be funny, but that's up to the devs. 


To summarize all this: The game is great, the combat & movement is satisfying (I would really love more movement, combats and difficulty settings added in the future updates, sliding pls) The game needs a bit more optimization to prevent frame drops and PC heating. ALSO ONE OF THE SOUNDTRACKS IS VERY PEACEFUL. Seriously this is amazing. This game truly has potential, I really love these types of games. | This game surprised me in more ways than I can ever explain. I never felt more rewarded for exploration, even tho the game clearly is not finished I somehow could feel the entire experience the developers were trying to pass on. The combat is amazing, the quests amazing, the tools given to you were incredibly fun. I will keep my eye on this one cause I'm sure that when it's done it will be a VERY special RPG.

I played first one until finished with joy. They improve the game at second edition. This is underrated game and deserves better sales I think. Art style, musics, weapons, playable characters; everything is good. Buy it if u play good rogulike fps. | Great game. I just wish there was a multiplayer mode. Thats what is missing in this game. Co-op modes for Ziggurat 3!!!! But yeah great game, great value. | Great fun with this one, if you're into roguelite FPS definitely give it a try. More so if you like fantasy! | Roguelites have issues with balancing builds, how you build them and their consequences, and you often end killing your run, or completely trivialise the game. You come to expect that and it becomes part of the fun, figuring out the interactions, learning and theorycrafting, finding ways you can salvage from poor RNG earlier in a run (which feels very rewarding when it happens), but I felt none of that here.

Most weapons, upgrades, characters, abilities, felt inconsequential beyond some minor utility. A lot was bloat copy paste of the same thing six times over the six damage types or over mana/weapon categories or health the three health types, or were mutually exclusive (+ stat while jumping, + stat while sprinting, + stat while stationary, + stat while full health, + stat while low on health, + stat when low on mana, + stat while high on mana...). The more stuff I unlocked the more it diluted out the interesting items from the RNG pool and I wish it could be constrained in some way before a run to scale it back to what it was in the first 20 runs or the last game.

Builds don't feel like collecting complimentary upgrades that specialise you into a play style or power fantasy, instead Its a checklist of things you need so the game doesn't end up with bullet sponges that slow the game to a crawl. A strong build doesn't change the game, things just die a bit quicker. A poor build is one that
- Doesn't have enough mana, so you spend an extra 5 minutes each fight trying to kill everything with a wand
- Doesnt have enough damage, so you spend an extra 5 minutes each fight trying to kill everything. 
- Doesnt have good damage type coverage, so you spend an extra 5 minutes each fight against those enemies with resistance to your damage type
- Doesnt have area of effect, so you spend an extra 5 minutes each fight against swarming enemies.
You get the idea

Atop of this, some features do nothing but slow the game down further.
- Enemies are tougher room event
- Enemies respawn once room event
- Curse status effect (halves your damage)
- Shield/Healer/Summoner enemy types (particularly shield)

Some actions + abilities being slow and locking you out of all others was also frustrating.

I gave it a chance and pushed through, but nothing changed, and it left me exhausted, bored and frustrated.

This would be a great game if the devs actually cared to do any work on it, updating or even making DLC for it, or maybe even a sequel. Literally any content. As it stands there is very little ship variety, not nearly enough to call this a "full release" game. The last significant update was in November of 2022, the modding community is dead because there is basically no support for it, so you can't even get new variety that way.

I have 200 hours so obviously I enjoyed the game, but i got it in early access and was holding onto the hope that the developer would make significant improvements to the game. They did manage to add a few ships and an actual "story", but most people in the community dislike the new story anyway because it is slow and unskippable. Plus once you get to end game there really is no end game content or new game plus. | A great game to play after working a 12 hour shift. Just Put on your favorite tv show or podcast, measure twice and cut once. | This is a good game. 
With amazing soundtrack. And very good atmosphere. 
This game will make you angry on the managers and the corporations.
And you should be angry. 
This game will also make you think about common people and the government and some policies of some government that lead to the people exploitation and anti-union laws. 
This in my eyes only a good game can do. 
As a side piece you will also get a nice puzzles of breaking some ships. 
You can even ignore the story altogether if you really wish to do so.  
 | Very fun game for what it is but as a caution, the game is abandoned by the developers. 

That being said, it is extremely satisfying to fully break up a ship and sort the parts into the right furnace.  Recommended to buy on sale. | 我特么不关注你们什么又臭又长的故事线！还不能跳过！

分割，切块，收集！爆炸，辐射，冷冻！
我要更多船！更！多！船！！！！！！！！

i adore this game!!! its a little grueling at times and can make you VERY frustrated, but its incredibly charming and definitely made with a lot of love. it also has some goofy ass dialog thats genuinely made me chuckle!!!
I think if you can get past the poop butt combat, horribly long day/night/rain cycle, having to run a marathon everytime you need to go to town/get a quest, you'll love this game!!!

when i first tried it I kinda gave up after a couple hours in, but after giving it another shot i'm really glad that I did!!! i love u wigmund!!! | A fun way to pass a weekend. Lovely visuals, a decent enough story with some likable characters, and nothing too complicated to figure out. The hack-n-slash mechanics are pretty straight forward. It's hard to believe that only two people made this, one programmer and one artist. It usually takes a team of artists to come up with that many different things to look at. My only complaint is the same as everyone else's - I wanted it to last longer because I had such a good time with it.
I really hope the expand on this game or a sequel. I really enjoyed it. | The game is sort of fun, once you learn the old school WASD controls, but it sin;t as fun as other dungeon crawlers. My main issue is not being able to readily heal during battles easily. Once I got to the dragon, and he hots once for almost half my health points, I was done. I uninstalled the game and moved on to something more entertaining. | Great indie game! Took 2 days to play through and the time was well spent, don't regret a second! Well done. | A small splendid game that captured my attention and drew me in from the very first moment. I really hope that the devs will bring more content for this game or maybe a new title.

Teardown — это игра, которая пробудила во мне ребёнка, обожающего ломать всё подряд, но с изящностью взрослого стратегического мышления. С самого первого уровня я понял, что эта игра особенная: здесь нет правильного пути, есть только ваш собственный план и полная свобода действий.

Разрушения в Teardown — это искусство. Вы не просто рушите здания или поджигаете всё подряд, вы создаёте свой собственный хаос. Разбить стену грузовиком, аккуратно подорвать мост взрывчаткой или просто взять молоток и начать крушить всё вокруг — каждое действие приносит удовольствие.

Физика здесь на высоте. Каждая деталь реагирует настолько реалистично, что я буквально залипал на то, как обрушивается крыша или как огонь постепенно пожирает деревянные конструкции. Каждый уровень — это песочница для творчества, где вы сами решаете, как выполнять задания: тихо и аккуратно или с оглушительными взрывами и тотальным хаосом.

Игра постоянно подкидывает новые инструменты и задачи, которые заставляют придумывать нестандартные решения. Машины, ракеты, бомба-банан?! — всё это можно использовать так, как захочется. И знаете что? Каждый раз, когда я завершал уровень, мне хотелось вернуться и попробовать всё по-другому.

Teardown — это не просто игра, это идеальный способ расслабиться и получить массу удовольствия. Она учит мыслить творчески, наслаждаться процессом и даже веселиться от собственных провалов. Это уникальный опыт, который я рекомендую каждому, кто хочет почувствовать себя мастером разрушений! | Looks amazing, sounds perfect, missions are loads of fun. 10/10, would procrastinate again. | Teardown is an amazing game with great graphics and awesome physics, very fun to play and combined with very easy modding, this game never gets boring. | 游戏是好玩但是你们他妈不要尬吹物理引擎了，一个点撑起整个房子我是真难绷 | Since Saber joined (took over) game started to be plagued by Saber business model releasing low content expensive dlcs with mixed reviews at best. Saber interactive is the new plague in gaming industry. Thats why I cant recommend this game. Not because the game is not fun or good, but because of them.

Прекрасная концепция, удивительно подробный крафт, достаточно хорошая система скиллов.
Однако если вы не собираетесь врываться толпой или не собираетесь сразу примыкать к какой-то гильдии из местных старичков - то лучше не стоит.
Игра тотально недружелюбна к нубам, причем не только из-за кривой обучения (это-то как раз окей), а из-за сложившегося конгломерата подвальных кончелыг с серьёзными эго-проблемами, составляющих где-то 80 процентов активного состава (не более 1000 человек в хороший день).

Пофармить вам не дадут, развиться вам не дадут, ничего вам не дадут и будут воспринимать исключительно как молодое мясо для какой-нибудь гильдии.

Очень жаль, ведь игра уникальная, как говорится - нынче так не делают. |  This game doesn't respect your time in the slightest. If you thought OSRs was a time sink, wait until you play this game. I have played this game for 1.7k hours, I'm not sure how many of those hours were spent actually playing the game. | This game has the absolute worst customer service, The customer service "GM" selectively decide who to help determined by who their friends are in game. The game recently has had many issue and if you aren't odinseed or koto then you wont get any assistance. anyone who answers is allied with odinseed or koto and the GM's are corrupt, i have seen them resurrect a friends 125 white bear in one of his streams where he clicked log out and log in, contacted a GM and said he lagged out and disconnected and they resurrected his bear and him, but when i die to an actual bug, GM Crio says his hands are tied. My friend showed me his video from 2 weeks ago. | Paid for the game, liked the game despite its problems, and then they introduced a monthly fee. Would never have bought it if I knew. Feel a bit shafted to be honest. Thanks starvault | Haven does not prepare you for the game you will never have a new player base! Yes hardcore games are fun you have what could be a GREAT GAME but you added a 15$ monthly sub for a walking sim horses are to expensive and hard to find so and your town is so spread out that if you dont  have a horse it takes 15 min run to the vendors then back to bank.  centralize your towns make a better map that is useful make haven harder so when you get to the actual game is closer and your more prepared. Map design is garbage need more ways to access things instead you have to walk 30 min around a cliff or you follow a path that leads to a dead end is stupid and this is why your player base will never grow

曾经以为古墓丽影系列会是我的罐头游戏最爱 直到碰见这部星战

采取了魂游的形式 难度自选 手残友好 
画面表现力也不错 故事也不无聊
动作流畅 地图设计也高于平均水平 
驯龙和攀爬过程中了解绝地团未来的这两段让人印象深刻

就是跑图有半点三百六十五里路的感觉 
二周目没办法快进跳过剧情 有点费时间 | 美中不足的强粉丝向作品。
作为星战粉丝，这是一部可以无脑入的游戏，毕竟星战粉丝真没有什么星战IP游戏能玩，除了半死不活的前线二。
缺点也非常明显，它的解密、不能传送真的是硬伤，导致有时体验很差。
战斗系统确实是有一定的局限，我手柄玩的，总感觉闪避和弹反体验怪怪的，也可能是我的问题，但你可以很明显的体会到和其他大厂在这种战斗体验上极大的差距。
我挺喜欢这种超大地图的设计的，在线性游玩时能给我很强的沉浸感。（能传送把错过的路补上就更好了）
人物剧情逻辑方面的塑造还是缺乏一定的功底，但我还是很喜欢里面的二姐、瑟蕾、梅林、格里兹等人。
总之我是爽了，毕竟能玩光剑，能看到Darth Vader就已经超值了。 | Another mostly great Star Wars game, I really enjoyed the combat in this one. The only thing I found frustrating was the way the world was laid out, it made exploration confusing and involved a lot more backtracking than I would like. Otherwise the graphics were great, and the campaign was fun.

You get a good bit of  abilities to unlock, and there are plenty of treasures to search for if you have patience for all the backtracking. I honestly died way more than I expected to so I consider combat fairly challenging in this one. Fun game for any Star Wars fan. | One of the best games I've played recently. The jedi master mode is unfair, the last bossfight lasted like 1:20h, I was getting killed all the time, they tried to make a hard fight but it was just unfair, I have only this point to complain about this game.

Not bad. Fighting baddies using pong and power ups. I think you get your money worth with the quests and online play and new outfits. I dont think I will finish the game. This is just not for me. | this is my favorite ARPG (action role-playing game) as of this moment.
I'm not joking in the slightest.

Game Name: Six Ages: Ride Like the Wind
Reviews:
I had high hopes for the game as I really like the theme. However, the game feels rather underdeveloped. 

It is really opaque in terms of understanding what to do. I get it for the rituals, but for many decisions it feels like I should just play the game 1000 times and then I'll be good at it. But it's not fun enough to get to that point honestly. 
Sometimes seemingly minor decisions have immense consequences (lose a battle and lose 80 goods worth 80 herds), while you click your way through a lot of decisions which look important but have very minor consequences (+1 mood, a clan mocks you). 
The battle system feels way too RNG based, you clearly have the upper hand, but somehow the enemy while losing men left and right will gain two advantages and you lose. 
The system of obtaining lore is weird; it would be good if there was some guidance even if vaguely how to get that. | Esse e King of Dragon Pass estão entre os melhores RPGs já feitos. A história e o modo de apresentação são únicos; você é um chefe tribal tentando fazer com que a sua tribo sobreviva na época dos mitos. | King of Dragon Passの精神的後継作品です。

King of Dragon Passとの大きな違いとしては、戦闘が複雑になりプレイヤーの選択によって様々な変化が起こります。（氏族のリーダーがやられることもあります）
追加された要素としては精霊が特徴的で、力を借りることができれば様々な手助けをしてくれます。（自分はよく魔力を提供します）

ゲームは英語オンリーなので辞書が必要になってきますが、とても楽しいゲームです。

初心者の方への個人的なアドバイス（主に氏族創生について）
・先祖の敵は水の力にすることをお勧めします。
・部外者への扱いは「市民として受け入れた」を選んだ方が良いです。
・ゲームのリロードは無制限にすることをお勧めします。 | Played it some time ago, got bored and put it aside to revisit later.

This time, I took the time to read the lore, get more invested in what I was doing, and enjoyed it more as a result. There is coherency behind the story, like an imagined culture not unlike those of ancient civilisations. All in all, it's an improvement to their first game. 

During rituals, it was a bit confusing as to why I'd follow the lore but would lose, so the feedback could have been a bit better around that. At some point I randomly started picking options more suited to the strengths of the quester and started ignoring the lore, and the rituals started going more smoothly after that. Maybe that's what Hyalor meant by choosing your own path? 

I played through aggressively three times, and ended up losing each time. The fourth time, I played a bit more diplomatically, and as a result managed to wed Beren to his love. I was pleasantly surprised to learn that is what led to a win. 

Each time I lost due to a Ram invasion from the south, they would say they'd learned to ride horses from some Rider I'd never heard of. When one of the options was for Beren to teach them how to ride, I realised that if I taught them...the invaders couldn't come! Excite. I'm looking forward to trying the sequel, now. | Beautiful and immersive

Game Name: Terra Alia: The Language Discovery RPG

Game Name: Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous - Enhanced Edition
Reviews:
I hated this game, when I first started. Then I tried again, and hated it. Then I tried again and now I'm hooked. Honestly I read online the game was designed for real time pause, and I tried to play that way. Once I bit the bullet and just played on turn based the game got so so much more enjoyable. I use real time to set up charges and nuke the first enemy in combat but other than that - switching over to turn based made this game actually fun. | 剧情写的不错但是气氛真的很好游戏里的情绪价值给玩家拉满了。配乐也是非常顶。闻着臭吃的香


但是闻的优点太臭了哥们，圣教军真是狗狗又史史啊 还有玩到迷宇不破防的玩家你碰到就赶紧嫁了吧你做什么他都会容忍你的 | Cara que historia boa serio, baldurs gate 3 é bom mas essa historia é fantástica e toda hora vc se surpreende com novas coisas acontecendo. 
O desafio do jogo é grande e voce ter que lidar com varias builds fantasticas deixa o jogo melhor ainda... talvez assuste um pouco iniciantesq ue querem a simplicidade do BG3, tem romance, tem vários desfechos realmente importantes e com resultado no final diferente do que fica em aberto no BG3. 
O jogo melhorou 100% agora com localização para nosso português brasileiros permitindo uma imersão maior ainda para a historia | Some games promise that different decisions effect the game, well, this game actually follows through pretty hard. I really genuinely feel the weight of every decision. I like that alot. Aside from that, the gameplay is VERY customizable and VERY easy to grasp. I love the characters, I love the story, and I REALLY love the immense amount of classes and subclasses you get to choose from. My only problem with the game is trying to decide on an actual class to play. 

10/10 will play again | One of the best CRPGs in the Market. DO check the recommended mods though, they will make for a smoother ride

Game Name: Deathtrap Dungeon: The Interactive Video Adventure
Reviews: very good , done just like the game books... plz do more

Fun but no dpad support like sts. I get RSI using touchpad which is unfortunate. | Пишу мнение после 43 часов игры. В целом мне всё нравилось до тех пор, пока я не сел за корабль с дронами на 2м возвышении. И вот тут моё мнение начало кардинально меняться. Также начал замечать неприятные моменты, которые до этого почему-то не бросались в глаза.
Итак, по порядку:
1. Баланс. Начиная со 2го возвышения у врагов увеличивается атака. Захожу буквально во 2й бой с практически стартовой колодой. А там 3 корабля одновременно вносят по тебе 30-40 урона. И всё, новый забег.
2. Корабль с дронами. Механика запуска дронов довольно интересная. Но почему так мало карт для неё? Есть карта запуска обычного дрона, карта дрона помощнее, карта урона от количества дронов и карта увеличения атаки дронов. Это всё. И встречаются они не так часто. А, ещё есть какая-то сверхредкая карта на дронов, которую не раздобыть на первых 2-3 актах. На том же 2ом возвышении на дронах играть просто нереально. Пока разгонишься, тебя уже снесут. И ещё заметил косяк: некоторые враги сбивают дронов. Так почему же в этом случае урон ещё и по моему кораблю проходит? Тоже непонятно.
3. Кат-сцены. Они медленные до ужаса. Например, сцена космоса, неторопливо выплывает корабль, снизу появляется какой-то текст, и всё,  эта картинка висит секунд 5.
4. Игровые события. Их мало, они все однообразные и повторяются на всех актах.

Итог: в целом игра не самая плохая, но неприятный опыт последних 10-15 часов игры в неё на 2ом возвышении побудил меня написать именно негативный отзыв.

Enshrouded, as an Early Access title, does some things well and some not so well, but it is all subject to change. We'll see how things go over the next few years. Overall, it's fun enough, and the developers have been very forthcoming with game additions and are also very open and responsive to player feedback. This game does Early Access right.

Pros:
-Gorgeous visuals
-Gorgeous world, procedurally-generated and then lovingly populated with hand-crafted locations
-Incredible, detailed and interesting dungeons to delve through, filled with puzzles and environment hazards
-Beautiful, if inconsistent, armor and weapon designs, which are fun to collect.
-A fairly robust building system, with benefits to decorating and constructing a base that you then populate with craftspeople and villagers
-Simple, but satisfying combat
-A leveling system that revolves around perks instead of stat increases (though you can still boost your stats from the perk tree)
-Dedicated cosmetic slots for your armor, with options to hide both your headgear and your gloves
-Fully cosmetic clothing sets to find behind exploration and bosses
-A food-based buff system, wherein the food you eat increases your stats and stat regeneration
-Lots of lore to discover through characters, locales, obelisks and books throughout the world
-Highly customizable game settings, including the ability to turn off weapon and tool durability or turn on starvation mechanics

Cons:
-The bonuses from armor and weapons are largely pointless, or too small to make much of a difference. Some are even entirely pointless, such as one set that offers a small 10-20% bonus to unarmed damage, with unarmed attacks dealing only 8 damage to enemies (when your mace is doing over 400 per swing, and swings faster than your fists)
-There are tons of weapons, but there are very little differences between weapons of the same class: All one-handed weapons use the same three-swing combo, regardless of what the weapon actually is, and even legendary items don't have anything to differentiate them outside of their raw damage and visuals
-The few weapons with "unique" effects are things like 5% lifesteal, 1 point of health regen, or some bonus critical chance and damage. None of the weapons are build-defining or unique in any meaningful way. For example, the "Dragon Sword", found only one hidden place and tied to a piece of esoteric lore found in your travels, just adds a flat +7 fire damage... Five times in a row. The Dragon Sword is a weapon with nothing going for it except minuscule damage bonuses that don't even interact with your perks.
-Extremely linear item and location progression: New areas are blocked off by "Deadly Shroud," a gas that simply kills you if you haven't leveled up your base enough yet (using the heads of bosses and regional materials). Essentially, your ability to explore the "open world" aspect of the game is heavily restricted by boss progression.
-Heavily reused enemies with very limited attack variety
-The magic system is bland, being exclusively ranged elemental attacks and two healing spells. There is no utility magic to speak of, outside of a single knockback spell
-The perks you gain from leveling are very restrictive in what they affect, very strictly confining their offerings to their respective stat tree (Strength, Intelligence, Dexterity) with very little overlap
-Every quest is a fetch or kill quest with some lore sprinkled around it. "Skyrim quest" is how I would describe them: Talk to a person, go to a place, get a thing, repeat until you run out of quests | I have played for about 800 hrs. The story is interesting, and the game is definitely playable solo. I completed the game, through level 35 as a solo player with out much problem. Some things take longer (i.e. Hollow Halls), but nothing is impossible to complete. The group play is pretty good too, though there are currently performance issue, though not surprising since this in in EA. There is also no in-game chat (text or voice), but I found a group of people, and we were able to overcome it using Discord. Used basic building blocks in-game to write out Discord info.

I absolutely love the building system. Though it could use work with camera control and additional options (round shapes), the building potential is endless. Of my almost 800 hrs of play, at least 600 has been spent building.

I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes survival/building games! | Started playing this on steam deck non oled version and it plays and runs great straight out of the box. This should be verified and not unsupported | 結論からいうと面白い

ジャンルはオープンワールドサバイバルクラフト。
資源を集めて道具を作って敵を倒してエリア開拓してというあれである。
ARKや7 Days to Die、Valheimなどの名作を経てこの霧の王国に移住したが、これはこれできちんと楽しませてくれた。

剣があり弓があり魔法がありパリイありと、アクション面はオーソドックス。
特徴としては前述のゲームらと違い、かなり進行の導線が強め。行ける場所が進行度によって明確に区切られ、またストーリーにおいても順序がきちんと立てられている。

建築はだいぶストレスフリー。プレイヤーが設置した祭壇を中心とした特定範囲内のみ建築可能というシステムで、その範囲内ならば重力などを気にせず自由に設置できる。空中に農園を置くことだって可能。効率を取るか、デザインを取るか、プレイヤーは悩むことになるだろう。

横道となるサブクエストも豊富で、NPCが豊富にいるのも特徴か。この手のゲームをやっていて、立派な基地を作っても俺しかいないしなあ…と寂しさを感じたプレイヤーは少なくないと思うが、それだけに基地をNPCがうろついてるのはなんとなく嬉しい。

自由な進行こそ制限されているものの、全体的なプレイ感として、建築要素のあるSkyrimといった感じが近いと思う。シャウトはないけど。

ネックとしては早期アクセスゲームであり、バグがまあまああるところ。こればかりは今後の改善を期待するしかないが、一応個人の体験として進行不能になるほど重篤なバグには遭遇しなかった。

全体の総括として「現時点で十分面白いし、更に今後のアプデが期待出来るのは嬉しい」といったところ。サバイバルクラフトゲーの移住先を考えてる人、おすすめです。
 | Enshrouded has ahte right amount of most anything. Building check. Monster hunting check. Good story check. mysteries check. [h1] [La idea de un nabo rebelde que evade impuestos es muy absurda, pero funciona de **** madre. La exploración simple, el arte del juego y su humor te mantiene enganchado hasta el platino] [/h1]

[h1] Puntuación: 8/10 [/h1]

[h2] Gráficos: [/h2]

El apartado visual de [i] Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion [/i] es uno de sus mayores aciertos. Su estilo gráfico adorable y colorido, similar al de [i] Forager [/i], logra transmitir una atmósfera encantadora y ligera que encaja perfectamente con el tono humorístico del juego. Los personajes y entornos están diseñados con una atención al detalle que los hace memorables, y cada rincón del mapa está lleno de elementos visuales que refuerzan el estilo caricaturesco y simpático.

[h2] Gameplay: [/h2]

La jugabilidad es sencilla pero efectiva. Combina exploración, resolución de puzles y combates ligeros, manteniendo una experiencia ágil y divertida. Una de las características más destacadas son los chistes y referencias constantes, que añaden un toque de humor irreverente y logran que el juego se sienta fresco y dinámico. Sin embargo, la necesidad de recorrer el mapa repetidamente puede volverse un poco tediosa, especialmente en zonas más alejadas. A pesar de esto, el diseño de niveles y las mecánicas básicas son lo suficientemente entretenidos como para mantener el interés hasta el final.

[h2] Historia: [/h2]

La trama es sencilla, pero no por ello menos divertida. La premisa de un nabo rebelde que evade impuestos es tan absurda como hilarante, y el juego aprovecha esta idea para construir una narrativa llena de humor y situaciones extravagantes. Aunque no es una historia profunda ni compleja, su tono ligero y las interacciones con los personajes hacen que sea muy disfrutable.

[h2] Relación calidad/precio: [/h2]
 
Por su duración y contenido, [i] Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion [/i] ofrece una relación calidad/precio razonable, especialmente si se adquiere en oferta. El juego no es muy largo, pero su encanto visual, humor y mecánicas entretenidas hacen que valga la pena. Además, incita a completar todos sus desafíos y secretos, lo que añade valor para quienes disfrutan de platinar juegos.

[h2] Conclusión: [/h2]

[i] Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion [/i] es un juego encantador y entretenido que combina un estilo visual adorable con un humor irreverente y mecánicas accesibles. Aunque el backtracking puede resultar un poco molesto, su propuesta general es lo suficientemente fresca y divertida como para recomendarlo. Es ideal para quienes buscan una experiencia ligera, llena de risas y con un toque único. | Fun little silly game. It takes an extreme tonal shift towards the end and then goes back to being silly. Very short game, I 100%'d it in 3 hours. Still a silly and fun game nonetheless, but I'd recommend buying it on sale. | This game was very enjoyable. The jokes were funny and the bosses were fun but not too hard. It reminded me of Link to the Past which I would assume the game was based on as there are puzzles throughout the game and the boss battles are similar too. The story was pretty good, it started out all cutesy and ended up turning a bit dark. I would give this game a solid 8/10, Its a short game but that's okay. I would recommend checking out Garden Story if you liked this, | i loved this game the graphics are appealing to the eyes and its very funny. | Excellent game. Terrific humorus story and characters. Pentiment is that kind of game where the phrase "Medieval Europe + monks + murder" hooks you, and you can't quite figure out why it sounds so cool. But Obsidian managed to turn this into not just a historical tour but an actual interactive novel.

You play as Andreas Maler, an artist who gets caught up in a murder investigation at a monastery. The story feels like your favorite TV series — it’s gripping, and the choices make you question your own morality.

The art style resembles old manuscripts, and the animation is minimalistic, but that’s the charm — it feels like you’re living inside a book. Although, at times, you’ll wish for a medieval mouse to fast-forward through some dialogues. This game could really use a skip the boring monk button.

The humor is subtle, sometimes so much so that you only realize they were joking after the fact. For instance, one character might delve into deep philosophy and then casually ask who stole the cheese. It’s like if Socrates moonlit as a fridge guard.

Pentiment isn’t for those looking for action or drama around every corner. But if you want to immerse yourself in an era where even the choice of font matters and discover that medieval bureaucracy was just as terrifying as dragons, this game is for you. | *Originally played on Game Pass and later got it on steam to support.

This is probably my favorite setting in videogames. There's a dense, layered history you need to sift, and lots of secrets to discover through the time periods it explores. There are a lot of controversial and challenging themes, but they're not presented with condescension or malevolence. The writing is impeccable, and I was deeply invested in the evolution of townsfolk by the game's end. 

What it doesn't quite succeed at is being a detective game. You will not get the satisfaction of a definitive right answer during any of the investigations, and there's no real way to fail. The purpose is to use the investigation to pull back on the town's secrets and better understand their world. And it succeeds with flying colors in that area. Just don't expect The Golden Idol.

Ultimately, this is a story about history and how we interact with it. Do we bury the past when we don't like what it says? Do we warp it to fit our modern beliefs? Does it matter if we choose to believe something simple when the reality is much more complicated? There's a lot this game poses about the lens we look at the past, and I can't think of another game that handles it as deftly.

Don't skip this, history freaks. | Masterpiece of video games as art, specifically made for me: someone fascinated by philosophy, history & historiography, and the intersection between them. This feels like the game Josh Sawyer wanted to make for decades, and I'm so glad he and the team he had got to make it |        可以说是我玩过的文字剧情类游戏里最特别的一个，十几个小时让我对里面每一个人都有着深刻的感情。案件的推理很有意思，嫌疑人的理由都很充分，做出选择很困难但是留给安德里亚斯的时间实在不宽裕。身为局外人能更好地看清小镇发生的每一件事、人们背后说的每一句话。精神上的折磨困扰了他很久很久，幸运的是最后他离开了自己想象的避风港。
       用中文玩给游戏的体验有很大程度上的扣分，用过原文试过，结局的时候直接震撼到了，让我理解了文字、文本的魅力。

While I appreciate the character DLCs, I don't really like the direction this game has taken for replayability. Having seasonal mechanics tacked on seems like the easy approach but doesn't add much to the overall game. They really should take the Dead Cells model with the stage scheming and add more branching zones and tilesets to make things feel fresh. Add more variety to the rooms per stage, like with the recent anxi desert change. Stick to one overarching mechanic that players can keep grinding on instead of adding seasonal ones that shift character useability and run approach every 4 months.

Subsequent updates also seem to be introducing some lag to the game. Tabbing out, even in singleplayer makes the game hang for a split second. Entering one room in multiplayer after someone else causes the game to hang at times. If the devs really do want to stick to the seasonal plan, then expand the skins to include the characters as well and make them limited to events! Soul essence is already a persistent currency that players can acquire with a grind. | I've sunk a few hundred hours into this game; once you grasp the connections between guns, abilities, and scrolls, it becomes  seriously addicting. I've played every season variation, and the way star link expands upon your character build is the most fun yet. I can easily justify $20 due to the amount of content it offers. | I didn't give this game much thought until I started playing it. The game is a well-made rogue-lite that's fun to play. The experience is even better with friends, up to three people, or you can find online matches.
I've highlighted 3 points that I think are important to mention:

Seasons
The season system is well-made. I've only played the last 2 seasons. At first, it's hard to understand the mechanics, but you get the hang of it over time. You just have to pay close attention to the readings, but they're very fun and varied. The season pass is free, easy and quick to get, and gives you beautiful and well-made cosmetics, which is a very positive point.

Replayability
I particularly enjoyed replaying the game. Putting on a playlist to listen to while playing is a pleasant experience. The game has many achievements and some of them require time and effort to complete, a huge variety of weapons to unlock, which gives a great feeling when you get a new weapon, in days when in any game you have to keep paying to get new things in the game (the game has 3 DLC with weapons, but the game also adds free weapons in each season).

Game modes
The game has few modes, only three, being the conventional mode, the main game mode where you have the stages and their difficulty to choose and challenge yourself and it is in this mode that you unlock most of the weapons and achievements in the game. The daily challenge mode, nothing special, the name already says what it is, a mode with a modifier that changes daily, just to get some achievements and challenge yourself. And the last mode, the horde mode, is a mode where you can equip some improvements to your characters and fight against large hordes of enemies that get harder and harder over time, but it has a final boss, so the hordes end. It's fun, but it only has two maps so far, and it ends up being repetitive.

My final thoughts are that the game is worth it for those who like games of this style, it's very different and diverse from the others. For the base game I think the price is worth it, but for the DLC I think it's worth waiting for a sale.

Enjoy and feedback! :) | Eu queria muito dar uma tryhardada em Gunfire Reborn, mas estava meio complicado de jogar sozinho. Então, surgiu uma promoção de conteudo adicional do game e resolvi comprar uma das 3 DLC's do jogo.
E rapaziada... de longe foi a melhor coisa que eu ja fiz!!! ^^ 

Gunfire Reborn é um game Roguelike/Roguelite, FPS, com leves elementos de RPG. Existem 12 personagens jogavéis que são bicinhos bem fofinhos (não sei se chega a ser furry), em que todos possuem 2 habilidades unicas e especiais, dando uma pegada de que cada run seja realmente diferenciada e unica. 6 são free, onde você desbloqueia apenas jogando, e os outros 6 são de dlc's. 

O jogo possui bastante coisa legal, como uma variedade boa de armas, inimigos, pergaminhos para buildar e uma arvore de talentos bacana até.
Durante a play, você vai se deparar com 3 steps até o final. É como se fosse o começo, meio e fim, bem padrão!! E em cada stage diferente, existe a possibilidade de vir 2 tipos de chefes. É sempre sortido, nunca da pra saber ao certo quem vai vir. 

Agora, como eu disse la em cima, no começo era realmente f0da de jogar sozinho. Eu até tive a cara de pau de sair chamando usuarios aqui da Steam pra jogar junto a mim, mas foi tudo em vão, infelizmente kkkkkkkk. Masssss, acabei descobrindo que da pra colocar bots [IA] pra ajudar e facilitar a gameplay!!! E isso foi extremamente util. *-* 
Eles até atacam, mas no geral são bem ignorantes KKKKKKKKKK, o que de fato eles são bons é em te levantar quando você é derrubado por algum monstro, assim evitando que sua jornada seja finalizada precocemente!!!!! 

Os graficos até que são decentes. Os mapas e cenarios são bem variados! Alguns são curtos e outros extensos. A arte do jogo é legal e a trilha sonora é meio chatinha mas da pra se acostumar.
Uma coisa que eu não curti muito foi que pra jogar no controle é meio ruimzinho. Eu sugiro muito que se você puder, jogue com um mouse & teclado. No joystick da pra brinca de boa, mas vai por mim e confia no que eu to falando!!!!!!!!!! Outro ponto também é a fisica e movimentação dos bonecos. É tudo muito duro, meio travado! Parece que os bichos tão com 500kg de concreto nas roupas huehuehuehuehue. 
Mas enfim... creio eu que isso seja proposital do jogo mesmo. Até porque tem itens que te dão um pouqinho a mais de velocidade. 

E pra encerrar, se você quer muito jogar sofrendo o minimo possivel eu recomendo duas coisas: a primeira é que jogue com amigos e conhecidos!!!! Vai ser bemmmmmmm mais "suave" a caminhada de todos até ficarem full broken. E a segunda é, caso for jogatinar sozinho, compre a DLC chamada Artisan and Magician. Vai por mim, de longe este conteudo adicional é DISPARADO o melhor de todos. Ela possui uma personagem bem OP que vai melhorar bastante o seu early game. 

E é isso aew galera. Sem sombra de duvidas recomendo simmmmmmmmmm Gunfire Reborn a todo mundo!!!!!!!!!!! Muito obrigado a você que chegou até aqui, um forte abraço e nos vemos nas proximas analises. Até la, bjbjbjbj e fuyyyyyyyyyyyy :* õ/

возврат | Sea of Stars is a very solid JRPG designed in a way to capture that nostalgic feeling of playing games such as Chrono Trigger for the first time as a kid. The game offer an extremely solid package of mechanics with some of the most beautiful sprite works I have seen in any game that is clearly inspired by 16-bits JRPGs. This game went as far as taking the best Indie Game from the Games Award in 2023. However, as solid as the game may be, it has a good amount of flaws within its system if you take a deeper look beyond the surface.

To start off with, I truly do believe that Sea of Stars have probably the best 16-bit art style I have had the pleasure to enjoy of any games I have played as of writing. The colors are vibrant and the animations are simply a treat to enjoy. Anywhere you look from in game battles to traversing the overworld and even fishing, everything just looks so crisp and move so smoothly. This game is an absolute visual treat to all 16-bit graphic enjoyers. Every map design and enemy design are masterfully crafted, with creative designs that are very befitting to the area/ maps you play in. The soundtrack and sound design are also very solid, giving you that satisfying retro ping when you land a successful timed attack or pick up something from a chest and a soundtrack that is very befitting for a fantasy adventure.

The combat is very solid, offering you a typical turn-based battle system with the option to time your attacks with a button press to do extra damage or deal extra hits, similar to systems you would find in a Mario and Luigi RPG game. The game also introduces a unique "lock" system that reminds me of Octopath Traveler where the enemy would periodically have "locks" that need to be broken by attacking them with abilities that are associated with the lock type. If you can break all the locks within a certain number of turns, you will completely stop the enemy from being able to use their attack, otherwise you'll simply reduce the damage they do. This mechanic make it where instead of trying to hit hard, you have to plan out your attacks and keep an eye on your resources instead of spending it all in case you run into an enemy that needs you to break all their locks within one turn.

Now while the combat does sound very interesting on paper, the game unfortunately doesn't really do much with it afterward, which is the first crack I noticed in the game before I start seeing all the other cracks in other parts of the game. See, while you do get a decent size party of 6 different characters, they all only get 3 different skills max if you exclude their ultimate attacks that you unlock near the end of the game. Now I do want to say this is remedy by the fact you also get "combo" abilities where you spend combo points and then two of your characters will combine their abilities to form a new one and you have the ability to switch between characters while in battle freely, but even this feels underutilized. One of the core things that comes with this type of game is the excitement of unlocking new abilities or getting stronger, but the sense of progression is is completely halted when your characters pretty much unlocked their entire kit pretty early in the game. Even with the combo system, which is pretty much your regular ability but with an extra flair to it, the system starts to feel stale extremely fast, only to be temporarily engaging when you unlock a new companion. This fatal flaw make combat extremely dull as you pretty much seen everything you can do very early in the game. Even with the boss fights, which are all a visual treat, feels pretty much the same as all you do is chip away at their health while trying to stop them from taking their turn.

The stale combat is made worse when you realize that there isn't really a point to the RPG system at all. Your progression come in forms of levels and item gears like your traditional RPG game. However, your stats mean very little in the game as you will be doing very similar damage regardless of where you dump your stats, with mana point being the only stat that gives you any real gameplay impact. The gear progression is also very weak, with arbitrary incremental number boost that just keeps you relevant to the current mobs you are fighting. The only real "progression" I can say is the relic system, which is Sea of Star's unique difficulty system. Throughout the game, you can gain relics each with very unique effects that can alter your gameplay such as being able to see enemy weakness, being able to automatically time your attacks, or stat boost/ reduction. That being said, the vast majority of it just serve as a QOL such as easier fishing or faster cooking rather than anything impactful that would give you any meaning feeling of progression.

I also think by far the worst aspect of the game would be the storytelling and writing. While it is definitely serviceable to drive you from point A to point B of the game, a lot of the writing decision just takes me out of the game. There are a lot of plot point that get introduce throughout this game that just don't get flesh out much at all, making it feel like a checklist of cool ideas rather than feeling like a natural part of the world that is well thought out. But by far the worst offense this game has to offer is the childhood companion Garl. Garl is your trope of "Cinnamon Bun solves everything by being nice" dialed up to 11 at the determent of the main characters. Normally I don't mind the overly optimistic companion, but man it just don't make sense how Garl literally solves everything just by being nice. It is to the point where the game feels like he is the main character instead of the two Solstice Warrior that you play as. And speaking of the two Solstice Warriors, you play as Zale or Valare, the two last guardians of the world destined to defeat the big evils of the world. You would think a lot of their personality and story would revolve around that and the storyline about their order, but instead, it seem like all they care about is Garl. Like literally, every scene where they talk with a few exception is "Garl is so cool, haha Garl is the best, Garl would know what to do, Garl is everything". Like its fine you want to drive home the point that he means a lot to our MC, but the way it is executed makes it like their only point to exist is to glaze up Garl. Which is a shame because the game set up a lot of interesting characters and set pieces, if only they had a fraction of spotlight that Garl had.

There are also a good amount of other aspect I didn't enjoy about the game such as the use of tools to progress, the minigames, the true ending being locked behind collecting 100% of these rainbow shell scattered throughout the game. But at the end, you can tell the developer really wanted to make a great JRPG that everyone can love and they did a great job at it. They even released updates to address some of the initial concerns that people raised about the game. At the end of the day, its still a very solid game and a solid love letter to the JRPG genre. As a whole, the game provide a solid gaming experience provided you don't go in focusing too much on the combat or the story. | If you start the game and like Garl, boy you're going to love this game. The main characters have no personality to speak of. The option to choose one or the other is tossed out when you play them both throughout the game anyways. I found myself uninterested in the story but tried to push on because the game seemed kind of fun. But I'm around 40% through the game and I just can't anymore. The game play is fine, but gets overly repetitive really fast.

The visuals and sound design are top notch. The pixel graphics and turn based game play were why I wanted to play and love this game. But God damn the story sucks, it's just my 2 asshole "main" characters watching Garl do all the work. Fuck Garl, and this game.

Отличная игра своего жанра. Собираете колоды в красивых сказочных мирах. Приятная музыка, понятные механики. Все прекрасно проходится, если не торопиться и вдумчиво анализировать противников. Прохожу с удовольствием. | I got this on a discounted sale price of $2 and for that price I would definitely say this game is worth playing.  With one important note.  The biggest strike against this game is that it doesn't respect your time.

Gold that is used for spells and summons goes up by 2-4 per stage and as the game gets more difficult, this never increases.  Orbs needed to summon more creatures are exceedingly rare though I was lucky to get some boots that made summoning take one less orb.  Finally to get to the last stage you have to grind 60 keys and that was finally when I called it.  17 hours for $2 is a good value but the terrible high grind shows a lack of respect for the player, so only buy on sale. | 玩法极其单调，冲着1折入手，勉强玩几局就腻了。 | Its a fun and unique cardfight game. i like it. Furthermore have my native sub, so even more enjoyable. :D

Game Name: The Life and Suffering of Sir Brante
Reviews:
세번의 죽음 끝 완벽한 죽음까지
 나는 위대한 혁명가 , 독실한 순교자 , 혹은 처음부터 끝까지 방관자 , 귀족 그 모든게 브란테 바로 나,
 | Sometimes in "choices matter" games the choices don't matter enough. This is an example of a game where choices matter too much -- you either make the exact right choices at every single point of the story, or the game takes reins from you. It is just another way of stripping away player agency, and at least to me far more frustrating one. 

The things I really liked: the game has a lot of world lore and an interesting moral/political setup (social contract vs unquestioned tradition), they make for an excellent basis for the story.

Then more ambivalent things. There's quite a lot of content. However that only means one will waste several hours during the first playthrough before inexorably sinking into the impassable quagmire that is the endgame (more of that later). The music and sound effects are sparse, but they fit the game and do enhance the mood. 

The illustrations are black-and-white, rather crude comic book art style ink drawings. They are not remarkable as such, but they are numerous, and they enhance the story by adding visual details (although they don't always match the text). There is also an "Animated illustrations" setting, but none of the illustrations accompanying the story have any actual animations, the entire images just move back and forth slightly, which adds nothing but distracts reading. Only the introductory screens at the beginning of each chapter are (rudimentarily) animated.

Then the negative things. The beef of the game are the story and the choice mechanics. 

Unfortunately I grew to actively dislike the writing of this game. Writing is extremely hamfisted, void of any humor, and perfunctory. Nothing has nuances. Everything is so exaggaratingly grim that the story reads like a parody. Most characters are extremely unlikable, making it very hard to care for goals like saving your family (yet the game will punish you severely if you fail to do so). Some characters also don't act coherently, but change their personality as required by the scenes. There are scenes that actually convey something worthwhile, but they are too few and far between. Drudging through the sludge of endless forced unrefined drama intermitted by occasional info dumps first became numbing and then vexing. So it is fair to say I definitely did not enjoy the story. However, this is a matter of taste, and the choice mechanics could still make the game interesting even if the story would fail to impress.

But the choice mechanics are fatally flawed. Every choice one makes in the game adds something -- stat, willpower, relationship change, destiny token. These will be needed later in the game to open more choices. All dandy so far, and for many hours this does indeed seem like a perfectly fine mechanism (the game even let's you see what you will immediately gain with each individual choice). Until, in the last third of the game, you find out that you should have made the exact right choices from the beginning of the game (but you had no way of knowing what they could possibly be at the time), otherwise you will be literally locked out of any meaningful choices for the rest of the game. So you just wasted several hours, and should now spend several hours again, and again, until you manage to find the combination of choices in all earlier phases that actually will allow you to proceed to the end of your own volition. So much for roleplaying. Unlike in most visual novels, there is no option to fast forward already seen text. The game's inner logic also goes out the window during the final third. The story starts proceeding in ways that ignore things that have occurred, and on several occasions you cannot do things that definitely should be possible with the choices made (like: I can't contact a person because he's "in hiding", even though I've hidden him myself at my workplace precisely to keep him safe and available). This ruins what little immersion and sense of agency there may have been left. 

This is of course just one experience. Many reviewers have enjoyed the writing; if you happen to like it, you may enjoy the game a lot more than I did. And if you are OK with this game being a (sometimes illogical) puzzle that requires arduous, very time-consuming trial-and-error choice min/maxing instead of an RPG (which it claims to be), you may like the game mechanics as well. But there is no shortage of much better story-heavy games where choices really matter in a sane way. Check out Choice of Games, for example, they offer several very enjoyable (and affordable) ChoiceScript games, such as Choice of Robots and Tin Star just to name a couple. | Интерсная игра, играл еще в бэту, потом купил, когда вышла, интересная, но сложная. Затягивает, пришлось пару ночей в ней посидеть) | Действительно достойная игра, искренне советую к ознакомлению. Я не дошёл до минусов, которые озвучивали другие игроки, но на данный момент, могу сказать, что игра действительно цепляет и берёт за душу. Подобная стилистика и "жанр" для меня первые, по этому и первое впечатление получилось прекрасным. Авторам спасибо, гойда | 《我在现实主义西幻中古世界当小登》

主要是真不想当小登了（

If you enjoy Super Metroid, Castlevania, and Zelda, this game's got your back. | In terms of audio and visual presentation, and spritework, this game is highly above average, it has a charm to it but somehow lacks in atmosphere. The writing seems to be overly enthusiastic, all the characters seem to have the same inclination towards the protagonist whenever he finished a quest or does anything right, it's very jarring that there are no risky situations and intensity to the conversations, even though the action set pieces has some gripping moments which makes it all the more disappointing that the writing is so subpar.
