I have been offline playing this for some time so my hours dont reflect the actual time spent. So take that for what you will.
I also have been observing this games growth for a while even before starting, so again, i think im in a place to say something, especially as a fan of classic action platformers as well as an unhealthy love for the legend of Zelda and Castlevania.

This lovingly frustruating platformer is incredible. I wouldn't change a single mechanic, the ledge grab might filter some, but to me it gives this game grit, and the exploration has been awesome for what is currently out there, and the art is not pixel slop, its the best of what is possible in its chosen medium. When completed, it has potential to be as good as its inspirations or better.

Game Name: Fallout: A Post Nuclear Role Playing Game
Reviews:
Fallout це коли ти сидиш із цілковитою впевненістю, що все під контролем, а гра робить тебе об’єктом для експериментів. Увійшов у кімнату, відкрив двері І ОПА НАХ СЮДА ІДІ, Найткін із плазмовою гвинтівкою вже обіймає тебе теплом радіаційного удару. [b]Ласкаво просимо в момент, де ти розумієш, що не зберігався години чотири.[/b]

А боїїї, мммм. У твоїх руках пістолет, шанси на влучання - 99.99%. Перша куля в землю, друга - в стелю, третя... прямо в голову напарника. Він, до речі, теж не втикає: вирішує розстріляти радтаракана з дробовика, обов’язково через тебе. Зрештою, таракан вижив, ти ні.

Собацюра або ж Dogmeat. Найкращий друг. Найвірніший союзник. І головний герой твоїх збережень, бо це не партія, якщо вона не помирає кожен раз коли ти згадуєш про неї(завжди). Поки ти відволікся на рейдерів, вона кидається на радтаракана, який взагалі міг би спокійно жити своїм життям. Три постріли по ній, і ти знову натискаєш “Завантажити”, але на цей раз точно востаннє))) ага.
 
Ти допомагаєш торговцю розібратися з рейдерами, а потім з’ясовуєш, що його "торгфвля" - це проституція, і твоя винагорода - це безкоштовний сеанс, про який ти пошкодуєш до кінця гри.

Ти допомагаєш фермеру, захищаєш його від рейдерів, і в знак подяки він каже: "Дякую! А тепер залишайся на ніч, бо вранці ми з тобою граємо в рулетку за мою доньку". 

Ти вирішуєш поговорити з супермутантом, бо у тебе високий рівень красномовства. Він спокійно вислуховує тебе, киває головою, а потім каже: "Ну а тепер ми просто тебе захаваєм, бо [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ITh3FwqighU&ab_channel=UamusicKo] ти дофіга піздиш. [/url]

Ти вбиваєш супермутанта, знімаєш із нього броню і думаєш: "Це найкращий лут у грі." Через 5 хвилин з'ясовуєш, що броня радіоактивна, і тепер у тебе з кожною секундою все більше "несподіваних новоутворень".

Це гра, яка нагадує, що ти не просто гравець, а головний клоун у цирку апокаліпсису. Кожен твій вибір - це помилка, кожен крок - це шанс втратити останній шматок здорового глузду. | This was my first CRPG and I would argue it was a great place to start (especially if you are like me and can't run Baldur's Gate III). I went into this primarily as a fan of Fallout: New Vegas and that's kind of how I'm framing this review (no major spoilers though). I had come to understand that despite being in an entirely different genre, the rich and believable world of Fallout: New Vegas, along with its willingness to present tough choices with real consequences, could be traced back to the original game in the series. I wanted more of that universe and its choices, and Fallout 1 more than delivered.

That being said, the game asks a lot of you. It requires far more patience than just about any modern game I've played, and even then the reward for this patience is less tangible than, say, defeating a boss in a soulslike. This game asks you to do a lot of reading, with the reward ultimately kind of being... more reading. However mundane that sounds, the dialogue here is among the best rewards in any game I can think of. The writing is subtler than New Vegas, the comedy a little more sparse (yet equally funny), and the tone more focused... and what a tone it is. This game is *bleak*. It hasn't yet been 100 years since the bombs fell, and it shows. Civilization is only just beginning to rebuild. Fallout 1's characters take this world very seriously, because it appears they have no other choice.

Having given all that praise, on a first playthrough, I did feel like I was waving a cane in the dark. Stats are everything, so build a character poorly and you could be SOL, especially given the time limit on the main quest (the timer is actually quite forgiving, but it definitely didn't feel that way without knowing how far along the quest I was). Dialogue choices with major consequences are often not presented that way, and combat encounters come out of absolute nowhere at times. I learned to save frequently which mostly circumvented these problems, but there was definitely a good deal of frustration, especially at first. I also had to use a guide a few times, with some clues for progression being just a little too cryptic in my opinion (oldheads may disagree).

Ultimately, all of the resistance that came along with this game only made it that much more rewarding to complete. The feeling of finally taking out a Deathclaw, or repairing a robot using context clues alone and watching it clear a path forward, or realizing that the once-unintuitive controls had become second nature, or random-encountering a crashed alien spaceship, or losing a companion and choosing to let the story go on without them. Each of these moments meant a lot, and there were countless others like them.

This is definitely not a game to come home to during a stressful week at work, but it *is* a game to fall in love with on a long weekend. I highly recommend. | Despite its age and dated graphics, Fallout 1 remains an outstanding experience that truly embodies the post-apocalyptic genre. The game’s gripping narrative, immersive setting, and brutal atmosphere all combine to create a world that feels genuinely hostile and unforgiving.

One of Fallout 1’s greatest strengths is its complexity. There are no convenient quest markers here—if you want to succeed, you’ll have to pay attention, explore, and put in the effort. In the early stages, you’ll feel weak and vulnerable, yet good tactics and resourcefulness can carry you further than you’d expect. When you finally grow strong, that sense of power is palpable, but the game never stops being dangerous; even a high-level character can still meet a swift demise if you’re careless.

Overall, Fallout 1 delivers a challenging, deeply rewarding experience that stands the test of time. It’s a must-play for anyone looking to truly immerse themselves in a stark, post-nuclear world. Fallout New Vegas is called the best Fallout game even, but this one set the tone and started it all! | Не идеальная, но прекрасная игра. В начале может показаться, что слишком много свободы, боишься, что запутаешься, не сможешь понять, куда идти дальше, но поговорив с нпс всё становится понятно.
10 крышек из 10. | Even as somebody who was introduced to Fallout through the 3D games, this game has quickly become one of my favorites. The main thing I love about Fallout 1 is that the game allows you to fail. If you mess up and treat the game like a low stakes sandbox where you just wander about and mess around, you will lose the game and your vault will perish. This sense of stakes makes the player act realistically, and quickly you'll find yourself role-playing without even knowing it. That is the magic of Fallout 1, the gentle hand of the games setting which forces you to adapt. 9/10

Game Name: Fallout 2: A Post Nuclear Role Playing Game
Reviews:
[h3]Що тут тільки зі мною не відбувалось. Пристебніться і полетіли.[/h3]

[b]Вмантюлив дитині електрошокером. Просто так, заради наукового експерименту. Результати експерименту: дитина більше не бігає, я - задоволений.[/b]

[b]Торгував з людьми людьми, а потім у певний момент я знайшов плащ і почав ходити по місту, наче Бетмен. Жителі міста це не оцінили, але дехто заплатив, щоб я від них відчепився. Бізнес є бізнес.[/b]

[b]Заробляти гроші на боях скорпіонів - ідеально. До того моменту, коли я вирішив, що можу перемогти скорпіона самотужки. Скорпіон мав іншу думку, і мої амбіції швидко зійшли нанівець.[/b]

[b]Пройти гру як абсолютний ідіот - це окреме мистецтво. Якщо зробити персонажа з мінімальним інтелектом, діалоги перетворюються на безглузде бурмотіння. NPC сміються, вороги б’ють, а я просто живу своїм звичним життям.[/b]

[b]Розмовляв із коровою. Що тут ще додати? Вони були значно розумнішими за багатьох людей.[/b]

[b]Став президентом США. КАМАЛА СОСАТЬ.[/b]

[b]Годував наркоманів хімікатами, просто щоб перевірити, чи стане їм краще. Їм не стало. Але тепер я знаю, що таке передозування з п’ятої спроби.[/b]

[b]Крав у дітей.. Не те щоб воно мені були потрібно, просто хотілося подивитися, як далеко я можу зайти...[/b]

[b]Переконав секту пустелі, що я їхній пророк. Вони дали мені свою віру, я віддав їх рейдерам. Угода вдалася.[/b]

[b]Обдурив власника казино, сказавши, що я його давно зниклий родич. Чудово мати родину.[/b]

[b]Запустив ядерну ракету в невідомому напрямку. Бо чому б і ні? Світ уже зруйнований, одна ракета туди, одна ракета сюди) [/b]

[b]Переконав мутанта, що я теж мутант. [/b]

[b]Вирішив усі конфлікти дипломатією, а потім під кінець все одно всіх перестріляв. Стара добра класика.[/b]

[b]Змінив стать персонажа посеред гри і зрозумів, що життя після цього не стало простішим.[/b]

[b]Отримав «синдром імпотенції» після невдалого побачення. життєво. [/b]

[b]Став героєм дітей-сиріт, принісши їм або солодощі, або зброю. Вибір очевидний - діти мають вчитися виживати.[/b]

[b]Зібрав усі можливі хвороби у грі і став ходячою загрозою для суспільства. Навіть мутанти зі мною не спілкувались.[/b]

[b]Підписав контракт на зйомки в порно в Нью-Рено. Все йшло чудово, поки характеристики не підвели, і я став посміховиськом індустрії.[/b]

Гра - справжній витвір мистецтва з чудовою атмосферою постапокаліпсису. Брудний, занедбаний світ, де ніхто не дбає про мораль, але всі дбають про виживання. Діалоги похмурі, цинічні та наповнені чорним гумором, що чудово передає відчайдушну атмосферу світу після війни. Музика - шедевр, а голоси персонажів дивом не викликають бажання вимкнути звук.
Звісно, є і мінуси. Графіка стара, і гра не адаптована під сучасні роздільні здатності, тому іноді важко зрозуміти, чи ти дивишся на купу пікселів, чи на чергового ворога. Гра не прощає помилок: неправильний вибір навичок - і ти офіційно перестворюєш збередення. 

Також зауважте, що Steam версія цензурована - без дітей і тд, що позбавляє багатьох можливостей для... соціального експерименту :) | É engraçado como esse jogo é enorme em playtime (vai de 45h~50h pra finalizar a main quest e fazer outras sidequests) e ainda assim parece uma expansão do Fallout 1. Ele melhora muitas coisas, mas a história é inferior a do primeiro, mas como complemento (e de novo, pensando como se fosse uma DLC) funciona bem demais. É um jogo frustrante (no bom sentido) que força e incita vários playthroughs, assim como o primeiro também possui essa qualidade. Sinto que o Fallout 1 é melhor pelo fator inovação e por apresentar um mundo tão ou mais complexo que o desse jogo, mesmo com uma duração e mundo bem menores. Se o Fallout 2 tem uma boa história, é porque ele se alicerça muito em quase todas as fundações que o primeiro construiu. E se for pra colocar algum defeito, é que o budget desse jogo foi claramente muito pequeno. Tem vários cenários repetidos ao longo do jogo, assim como cenários idênticos aos do primeiro jogo. Pra se ter uma ideia, no final do Fallout 1 você tinha artes conceituais que contavam o futuro de cada terreno do jogo. Neste, eles mal conseguiram fazer essas artes pra todos os territórios, em vários, eles só tinham umas fotos que vagamente remetiam ao cenário originário.

Enfim, eu recomendo bastante, mas acho que ele te pegará e prenderá muito mais se você jogar o primeiro antes. O combate pode ser chato e até meio complicado no começo, mas depois, quando você entende como ele funciona, vira uma das coisas mais divertidas desses jogos. | Me da mucho miedo el mosco ese de la portada, me regaña porque no traigo servoarmadura, que bueno que me lo chingué | My character:

- lost the match in chess against a radscorpion,
- became a p*rn star,
- blew up the toilet and left the whole village in local excrement,
- slept with someone's wife,
- kidnapped a young drug maker and sold him to the slave guild (because why not),
- won in a boxing tournament and became famous,

[h1] Peak RPG experience 10/10 [/h1] | Second best fallout-like RPG ever. Still stands strong to this day (minus some technical issues and some dated UI/gameplay mechanics).
The intro/tutorial sequence is the most annoying part in the game probably, but it IS a "temple of trials" after all. If you can survive that, the rest of the game will be very much enjoyable till the end.

Fallout Tactics takes the beloved Fallout universe and shifts it into squad-based, tactical combat—think XCOM meets the wasteland. Unlike the main RPG entries, this game focuses on strategic battles, giving you full control over a squad of Brotherhood of Steel soldiers as they fight raiders, mutants, and all the horrors of post-apocalyptic America.

The combat is deep and rewarding, offering both turn-based and real-time modes to suit different playstyles. Customizing your squad, managing resources, and adapting to brutal encounters keeps things engaging. While it lacks the open-world freedom of mainline Fallout games, its tight mission structure and tactical depth make it a unique and underrated gem in the series.

It may not be everyone’s cup of Nuka-Cola, but for strategy fans who love Fallout’s setting, Tactics delivers a challenging and satisfying experience—just don’t expect deep dialogue or karma decisions. | Tactical ? Déplacements moisie, angles de vues pourris, tour par tour lent, des trucs qui vont pas avec les PA que je ne peux pas utiliser entièrement pour un déplacement. Tutoriel probablement incomplet ? Ou jeu bidon. | Se você já conhece a franquia, vou direto para a parte que talvez possa lhe interessar:

Fallout Tactics é muito dinâmico, os combates não são por turno (a menos que você use VATS, claro) e você precisa montar estratégias de combate para vencer os inimigos.
Você monta seu esquadrão (até 6 pessoas) e vai upando as habilidades deles.
Basicamente você e seu esquadrão são integrantes da Brotherhood e seu superior fica te enviando para algum lugar para cumprir uma missão de resgatar uma pessoa, buscar tecnologia, etc.
Portanto, não é mundo aberto nem 100% RPG. Também não espere uma história com um enredo mega desenvolvido.

Em conclusão, se você ama Fallout e quer jogar um jogo mais antigo que o Fallout 3, sugiro começar por este. | *Sigh* This is Fallout Tactics Brotherhood of Steel (It's alright) | Эта игра лучше чем 99% игр которые вы играли в своей жизни если ваш возраст до 40 лет

This game could be really amazing. Being a fan of the series, for quite some time, I cannot deny that I liked an experience that strongly reminded me of Fallout 4, a game that I truly loved. However my negative review is based on the following 3 main issues:

[b]I.[/b]	First things first as the game isn’t f2p and carries that kind of price tag, I expected access to a wider variety of content and amenities, which now seem to be locked behind a series of paywalls. Additionally even with a Fallout 1st monthly subscription, which costs extra 15€ and in my opinion is quite overpriced, you still have to further purchase Atoms in order to fully unlock the desired cosmetics and utilities. 

[b]II.[/b]	Secondly the game remains real fun until the moment you discover that your personal stashbox is full. From now on you have to keep a close eye on your inventory, scraping, donating and selling equipment that you may want to keep but cannot store. In a survival game where scavenging is a core mechanic, constantly worrying about your limited available storage space is definitely not enjoyable, at all!

In my opinion it is unthinkable that the scrap box and ammo box, are locked behind a paywall reserved exclusively for the owners of a paid subscription. For us “commoners” that do not want (or cannot afford) the subscription everything we collect goes in our stashbox, which may contain categories in there but most players of open world survival games (that like me came here directly from Fallout 4 and Skyrim), are accustomed in keeping their items categorized in few separate containers not in just one. I guess in this game some simple QoL amenities cannot be taken as granted.

[b]III.[/b]	Third and not least you may ignore the grind, the walking simulator quests and the absurd in-game price system where the NPC vendors seem to blatantly steal your caps worth of the items you trade, but you can definitely not ignore the fact that some main quests are plagued by game breaking bugs that do not allow you to complete them. Few personal examples are the “IAM Become Death” quest where the nuclear code pieces don’t work as well as the infamous “Ol’ Weston Shuffle” quest that bars you from following the Raiders quest-line. 


Summing up, I joined this game with high hopes and expectations that the previous series had cultivated and so I expected to find something, at the very least, amazing. The developers have shown us with their work that when they want they can truly perform miracles creating epic open world RPGs. Unfortunately apart from a distant reminiscence of Fallout 4 what I found in 76 was a game rife with micro-transactions, constantly strangled by self imposed limits, basic content that was barred with paywalls, game breaking bugs that still haven’t been fixed and so my authentic survival game experience was totally disrupted.

[u] Right now you pay good money for a game in which you have to pay again, each month (Subscription), to gain access to some fundamental amenities and then you may have to pay again (Atoms) in order to further purchase any desired cosmetics, utilities and content.[/u]

[b]For all those reasons I cannot recommend this game to any fellow gamers.[/b] | en comparacion de cuando salió, es un juego totalmente diferente y disfrutable, ni tengo amigos para jugarlo y de por si es entretenido | На мой взгляд интересная игра, которая затягивает своими возможностями. Для новичка есть линейка заданий, которая поможет разобраться в нюансах. Но даже отыграв 500+ часов, я продолжаю для себя открывать что-то новое. Улучшениям нет предела. Различные перки, навыки, стили игры - всё хочется попробовать. Разнообразный мир, постоянные обновления и новые сезоны заставляют возвращаться в игру. | Just not doing it for me. The grind is boring. Ich gebe dem Spiel eine 5/10 | This is the most simplistic of the trio of sandbox city builders I've played recently but it's also the oldest and cheapest one. There's just enough options to play with the lighting and color schemes for a different stylized city every time and you can carve some really creative cities once you get the hang of the tools and rules. Recommended if you're looking for a city builder game without the gameplay or a 3D modeling program without the learning curve.

There's not much to say about the building process because it's so simple... You left-click to place a block and right-click to remove a block. There's 15 colors to choose from, giving you a lot of creativity not only with color schemes but with the layout of the city: blocks "react" differently to connections depending on height, color, and terrain. The tools provided make it easy to put up a complex city in under half an hour, but it would go even faster if the tools were more PC-friendly. Unfortunately, there aren't bounding boxes to draw or remove multiple blocks at once, leaving you to place and remove everything individually. 

Some other wishlist items include options to manually choose flat or angled roofs, an option to click and drag to choose height, and more options for terrain. Currently you can make grass and bushes with closed loops of buildings, but there's no options for other foliage placement. There's also no options for unplaced terrain, meaning everyone is stuck living on the open ocean. Otherwise, the tools provided are simple enough that it's fun to just play with them and discover new things.

Townscaper is one of the few "comfy" games that I can safely recommend because of the low price point and the unique experience it provides. Tiny Glade provides a more robust experience, with more nuanced tools and more detailed environments, but this provides a much larger scale and a cleaner aesthetic. Worth checking out if you're on the fence about 3D art or if you just want to make some cute landscapes for social media.

子供のころ大好きだったドラゴンクエスト

I wasn't sure if I wanted to recommend this game or not but it feels fair to recommend it for what it is. 
This game is an old adventure book from the 90's where you hold one finger on the previous page in case you chose the worst option. In that regard, you get exactly what you want if you know that the Fabled Lands is one of those books. 

It was fun back then but it does not translate very well to a modern computer game.  The reason that rogue-likes are popular is that you need some kind of reward when you start over and you don't want the game to be exactly the same on every try. This is static as a book, because it is a book. | очень приятная и весьма глубокий хекс крол с механиками игр из старых книжных игр ,предупреждаю есть старомодный дизайн с легкостью смерти при провале одного кубика | Choose Your Own Adventure books have always been my favorite books to read since I was a kid.

With this one, I've played through the actual game play a ton of times this series has fun mechanics, though it does get too easy once you max your character out. it was fun for a bit but updates are slow and no workshop so just get it on sale | This game has a lot of bugs that need to be fleshed out. The targeting/pathing for the allied soldiers is horrendous, especially when they are placed on walls or towers. When you issue a command they will get stuck or not come down from the tower. Alongside this, if you lose during the night there is no fast forward and you have to either sit around and wait for up to 5 mins or longer and wait for the night to end and kill the enemies or you will have to load a previous save. There is no fast forward button so everything is sluggishly show. If your stone quarry gets destroyed and you don't have the stone to rebuild it you have to destroy it and rebuild it otherwise you are soft locked from stone. The repair system inst great. Troops are wayyyy to expensive for the food cost. Food is very sparse even with the materials turned up. Game sound is extremely loud and i found that if i had the sound nearly off is the best to not having it blast my ears. This game has a lot of potential the bugs just need to be fleshed out. For things like troops, siege machines, and traps i believe these should have their own menu so that you don't have to search your whole kingdom to find these buildings just to create these things. Research cost for the most part is pretty solid, if not a hair to expensive, but i wouldn't focus to much on that. Losing vital building can almost be run ending if you start losing residents. It just becomes a downwards spiral that is not fun to fix. Overall I would give this game a 5/10 with potential of being a 8-9/10. Don't get me wrong this game was fun in the time i played it, but would be much better if there was a focus on polishing the game. | Its sad that I'm here but unfortunately I am. This game was really good for about a year or 2 but in the last year that has been no updates at all. Last thing was a news blog from Oct 29,2024 and that blog was an update of a previous blog from Apr 18. I understand this a Ukrainian and German studio so I know there are conflicts with the team being able to work. 

Since the last update (Dec 2023, over a year) they added seasons and I personally think the seasons needs to be toned down. Wither its lightning hitting all of your buildings and catching them on fire, hitting your little amount of units and killing them, or a winter that is brutal and can kill your whole base. Im not against the seasons but I do think they need some tweaking. 

Pathing has been an issue since release. They have worked on it some but it still has a long ways to go, Units get stuck, some get unresponsive and wont move, units will get bunched up and trapped on walls and towers, etc. Enemy units can be just as bad and will sometimes not even move when spawned.

Overall I have enjoyed this game and like many others say it is a fun escape from sweaty shooters for a while but sadly with the very slow updates and current bugs in the game, I cant recommend it. I hope the team hasnt abandoned the game and they can start releasing updates again soon because the potential is huge. | Combat macht kein Spaß weil das Gameplay schlichtweg verbuggt ist wie z.b. werden befehle gar nicht ausgeführt. | using this box to fill word limit. It's rare but every now and then you find one of those special games that you know will stay with you, and Stray was one of them for me. Man, I don't even know where to start. No bugs or stutters, played perfectly on a middle of the road PC and you can tell there was so much love and care put into making this game. Tired of looking through the steam library and feeling like there's nothing good to play? Well this game satisfied that feeling for me. Len's Island feels like playing a combination of Runescape/Diablo/The Forest. What a combo right? I never thought i'd find something like that, I also never thought i'd commit 200 hours to it but here I am. So when you're fed up with playing all the usual stuff and want something fresh, this is what you're going to play. It's made by an Australian Dev team too, so if you're Aussie reading this, just send it.

Seriously, great game. Super relaxing, heaps of content, cool mechanics, graphics aren't overly cooked, atmosphere is awesome, music slaps and it's just the right amount of difficulty, try it for yourself I don't need to waffle on anymore. | The TL;DR - Good game. It's a really nice place to visit.

Len's Island is a pretty good game even though it is an Early Access title. Right now in it's current state it is as good if not better than some other games that are considered "complete". At the time of this review I found this game to be well worth the cost for adding it to my game library.

I was sucked into the game and have to admit I became slightly addicted to playing it. Visually it appeals to me and I like the game soundtrack that loops in the background as you play. Len's Island is a world I enjoy living and exploring in. It's a place where it is OK to exercise your imagination.

There is something I feel many prospective players are not aware of and that is the game settings allow for players to make adjustments that have a real impact on their playtime experience.  If you want an easy time and just want to farm, fish and gather resources to build you can do that. If you want to almost punish yourself by making night time and dungeons more dangerous you can do that too. If you haven't watched the Flow Studio mode select video I recommend you do so.

Len's Island isn't perfect and it's not going to hit the same with everyone that plays it. I found several things that I wish had been done to better suit what I prefer but I find things similar in almost every game I play, even those that get pushed out by triple A studios with huge teams and big budgets.

One thing I am concerned about is how user friendly (or unfriendly) Len's Island will be for the aged or disabled gamer that want to play. I use a mouse and keyboard and at times I feet it is a challenge to get Len to do what I want.

Lastly the game ran well on my Win10 PC. The game did stop responding a couple times in my near 150 hour playtime and I had to kill the process and restart. Within a few moments I was back to playing and hadn't lost much thanks to the autosave system. The downside to the autosave is that at times it caused micro-pauses at inopportune times but all in all it was not too bad. | 기본에 충실한 상당히 재미있는 게임이다. 파밍, 사냥, 하우징과 같은 컨텐츠를 모두 즐길 수 있다. 또한 한글 패치를 추가해준 배려에 감사합니다. 최초 플레이 했을 당시보다 많은 점이 개선되었다. 난이도 조절, 원활한 플레이를 위한 인터페이스 정돈, 튜토리얼, 동료들, 이외에도 다양한 요소들이 추가되어 매우 만족한다. 요즘은 어떤것이 주제인지 명확하지 않은 게임들이 많은데, 단연 장점이 돋보이는 딱 필요한 요소가 모두 있는 게임다운 게임이다. 다만 NPC들이 조금 더 액티브하거나 (게임세계에 더 애착을 가질 수 있도록)초반 몰입을 위한 포인트 요소가 추가되면 더욱 재미있을것같다. 초반 진행을 꼭 해야만 하는 이유 (스토리적인 가이드)를 부여하면, 스스로 할 일을 찾을 수 있는 능숙한 RPG 팬들 말고도, 초보적인 유저들 또한 더욱 즐길 수 있을것입니다. | nice little indi game

currently about 20h contend to do almost everything
pro:

- nice looks

con:

- islands a bit small for bigger base builds

technical stuff
- game seems not to be made for bigger base building when reaching a 3 floor i had issues with some stairs clipping to other floors also mobs spawn on it 
- sometimes in the underground you see bridges which you can build to get to the other side but sometimes this gaps can be bypassed by jumping closeby but again sometimes these points where you can cross by jumping are 1 sided so without mats you could get stuck foreever inside a cave its low odds for this to happen but possible and low odds x playercount is it may happens to some unlucky soul at somepoint and the game does auto save so... 
- when you die inside a dungeon you get asked to respawn at the entrance but you spawn outside of the entrance and not inside the dungeon which more then doubles the loading time while it doesnt need to:
first it needs to unload the dungeon
then it needs to load the outside world
and then you walk inside the dungeon again which makes you unload the outside and load the dungeon again while all that would need to be done is reset the dungeon which can be anoying when you play on a hdd | A great game that needs just a little more content to be amazing. 
It's one of those games that starts small and cute, and bit by bit you expand your world in a way that doesn't feel rushed or confusing. It doesn't frustrate you with complex crafting or assault you with tons of useless recipes or ingredients.

The downsides are:
1. the map is large, but it consists mostly of boring, empty ocean. The islands are too small and too few. 
2. the pet companions are pretty useless. Most of them collect raws from the field, but they don't do this reliably, so I end up still collecting my own materials. The other type of pet is supposed to help in combat, but once again they seem to mostly stare off into the distance instead of helping. 
3. building is fun and rewarding, but very quickly causes the game to stutter.

The upsides:
1. plenty to do
2. good building
3. easy to understand
4. game settings can be customised to make the experience suited to your needs/likes
5. developers are active and have already improved the game considerably since early access launched

不是特别好玩，推理解密的模式过于繁琐。主角的移动速度太慢，对话速度太慢，且不能自主地存档读档。就一周目体验而言，我已经玩的都有些不耐烦了，好在流程较短，体验还算不错。但结局之后弹出成就告诉我，还有七个结局等我解锁时，我就觉得这游戏作者脑子多少有病。这游戏本质就是剧情推理游戏，剧情分支虽然取决于主角的选择和推理，但整个主线并没有过大的变化，游戏中也没有什么值得二周目去探索挖掘的细节和互动，再加上我之前说的不能自主存读档和不能加速不能跳过的慢腾腾的对话（且重复性高达98%0），配上主角的移速和一堆不能跳过的主角的内心独白，导致多周目的体验跟死一样，还必须重头打七遍才能解锁所有成就。剧情方面，我个人感觉算不上惊艳，比这优秀的剧情游戏和推理游戏太多了。不建议有成就收集癖的玩家购买，如果是奔着推理来的，我想只有第一章符合你们的口味（然而一点都不难），奔着赛博朋克的，我只能说你体验不都未来科技的氛围，这个故事全部剧情和环境扔到现代都没什么问题。只是给背景加了个星球殖民和太阳系，你就能再次体验到经典美式个人主义警探解决国际冲突的故事。我的评价是，这款游戏远没有其他人评价的好 | This game kinda left a bad taste in my mouth, tbh.

First of all. the story feels like it's on rails for a good 90% of it -- that is, it doesn't *feel* like any of your choices matter, and according to the list of endings, only the last two choices affect the ending in a significant way.

I also found the story really uninspired, and the "where is this all headed" was pretty obvious from act 1.

Oh, and [i]so good[/i] to see developers still forcing WASD on us in current year. | 不得不说，这个游戏做到了一个剧情游戏该做到的一切。相对紧凑的节奏，整体不错的剧情，足够沉浸的代入感。唯一有一点，作为一个推理游戏，推理部分的难度属实是有点低了。 | Brilliant! Great writing and storytelling, complex enough but not complicated or confusing. Satisfying difficulty
plus multiple story arcs and different endings. All this wrapped up with nostalgic pixel art and a beautiful soundtrack, makes this game as thought-provoking as a very good book and as entertaining as a masterfully made movie. Hat off to the creators. | 6/10
美术，好，气氛很到位，很喜欢。但我是推理唐氏儿，线索是查不全的，图是忘了怎么跑的，关联是看了就忘的，推是死活推不对的，最后打出的结局遗憾诸多，但也不想重打了。去B站找了其他结局观摩，感想为只有推理的基本都对才能获得完整的剧情体验，要么就去打多周目。唉唉，累了，总之打折购入值得一玩

It has a game breaking bug at chapter 2. I found this 21 HOURS IN! I pulled a lever before turning a furnace on first, and this caused my game to not give me the item the lever should have given. Now I am stuck, because I can't pull the level again. And there is no patch for 8 months, so I have given up waiting for a patch. The game is kinda nice, cryptic as all hell. I think it's cryptic as the original Hexen. But a game breaking bug like this just makes me want to quit. | This is a somewhat cautious recommended. Whilst it can be fun and more engaging than the glut of simplistic but oh so flashy indie shooters that seem to be the norm these days, it is a flawed product that can be irritating in places.

Graven is a first-person mixture of melee and ranged combat, with exploration, platforming and some mild puzzle elements.  Generally all of those things are done reasonably well, though it tends to stumble in enough little ways that it lessens the experience.

Your weapons can be enjoyable, particularly when the effects are explosive, but you tend to find there isn't much difference between them. I have four weapons that are all essentially the same: something that looks like a crossbow and can be upgraded to fire explosives, an actual crossbow that...fires explosives, and...uh..a different crossbow that fires...um...explosives. Then a final non-crossbow that fires....*can you guess what?* explosives.

The same can said for a melee staff versus using a sword (though that does let you block projectiles, to be fair), or using a flail. Nothing really differentiates them when it comes to bashing a monsters face in, so even though its fun bashing a monsters face in there is still the disappointment that every "new" weapon is rarely exciting to obtain.

And whoever designed this in a way that you have to wait as animations finish when switching weapons and items needs some sense knocking into them. As it can be annoyingly slow changing between them, and even better yet there isn't a weapons wheel when using a controller, so the whole thing is sluggish and fiddly.

Most of the time it isn't too bad, but when the action gets hectic it feels like a poor choice to have made. Which is a shame, as it's quite visceral and enjoyable upto a point. Boss-battles are simplistic sh*te, though there's only three of them, and in all fairness, I can't recall the last game of this type (be it a boomer shooter, or fantasy combat like this) that wasn't utterly crap in this regard.

Its not exactly an endorsement of this title that everyone else produces dog-sh*t when it comes to these supposedly "thrilling" encounters, but as I said: there's not that many of them, so I'll let it slide.  

Exploration is nice, as this isn't a linear title and it has pleasant secrets hidden about, or "cute" progression  compared to something where its just switch-hunting or finding keys. Like, you know, the bazillions of  simplistic boomer shooters that don't even have those two activities, never-mind anything even vaguely more sophisticated.

But then it doesn't give you a map, and any time you save out of an area you don't restart at the same place. Instead you go back to a hub area and have to make your way back. The game isn't exactly short, but the 30 hours I've clocked up so far is a lot of back-tracking, either because I missed something obscure, or because of quitting before a level was finished.

So far this sounds like I have more issues with it than positives, and it's true that you need patience to "enjoy" this, but it is still fun....mostly. Perhaps I'm just sick of dumb shooty-shooty-bang-bang, of which a blind person throwing a dart at titles on steam could hit, I dunno, a thousand of the same mind-numbingly dull DOOM Eternal wannabes with PS1 era graphics (thumbs down: not enough polygonal warbling or pop-in, and it has hi-res textures...disgusting in this day and age!!)

Something about Graven, despite its many issues, makes it more appealing than those kinds of games, but it is just "okay" and should have been better. This isn't Dishonored, Thief or Dark messiah of might and magic, but then again - what is these days? I'd really like to know of any title that comes even vaguely close to those games, because beyond the likes of them conventional shooters just bore me to tears.

This game will probably bore you to tears, or frustrate you, but it may not. I just appreciate that it has somewhat more depth than most, and there's slim pickings to be had in the genre so it will have to suffice. Maybe Avowed won't be too bad and will have fewer rough edges, but I won't hold my breath based on what I've seen of it so far (the game-play could be great, but the graphics are yucky, which is awkward..because they aren't even deliberately making it look crap and outdated)

In the meantime I wouldn't recommend this over Amid Evil (which is better than this in most ways, although the bosses are rubbish there too), or Hands of necromancy (great combat and exploration, but insipid woeful boss-battles...what a shock....),  but I did find it more appealing than the likes of Elderborn.

PS: The reviews mentioning soft-locks may have been correct at the time of release, but it was very stable for me so I think that has been fixed. The level design can make it SEEM like it has screwed you over, and I thought that a couple of times, but in the end they always do provide a means for alternate access.

You maybe get to an area by pulling a switch that activates a lift, and then that lever stops working. "The game is broke" you think, but no! The lever only stops working when you have completed that bit, and some other exit has opened up. It would be easy to say its bust, and maybe it was before, but now its just on you as the player for not figuring it out.

I'm in the last area of the game (act 3), so unless there is a massive f**k-up at the end - it's working fine when people are saying they couldn't get past act 1! | Broken game. With my first profile I got locked on act 1 library dungeon lift bug on 6th hour into the game. I liked the game enough to restart with a 2nd profile. I got locked again on act 2 boss not spawning on 24th hour. Game doesn't allow multiple saves so you can go back to a save that was before triggering a game breaking bug and retry. Don't buy it, don't invest your time on it. | [h1][b]Just treat Graven like a GF with psych issues and you may end up enjoying some of your time together.[/b][/h1]

I enjoy the concept this game tries to bring to life.  A retro immersive sim set in a gothic/medieval realm.  The atmosphere, sound effects and score as well as the movement animations and fluidity stand out among Graven's many triumphs.  Imagine what a remake of Hexen on the PS1 could play like and you might have some idea what to expect from this game.  Unfortunately, the downsides you will likely come across are SIGNIFICANT to say the least.  DO NOT BUY FOR ANYTHING LESS THAN A STEEP DISCOUNT.

The opening cutscene stuttered like a slideshow the entire time and made me wonder if DX12 shader caching could be even more poorly optimized than in many modern games or if there is some sort of compatibility issue at play.  In-game Graven runs smoothly on modern hardware but the game's "quirks" are not limited in scope.

Saves are limited to checkpoints unless you wish to dabble in the dark arts of Teh Haxxor trainers.  Getting to a checkpoint and using the save and quit feature will still end up loading you back in town although your progress seems to be saved more or less (notes found, items/gold collected, etc).  Sometimes you will reload your save and find you have no blue mana until you move around or enter the menus and return to game.  Sometimes your mana count may not match the one you had prior to your last checkpoint, save and quit.  Bugs such as the ol' "Completely Evaporating Inventory"™ lies in wait so buyer beware.  Also, you lose your inventory on death and retrieving all of it may be a hit or miss endeavor.

I have yet to track Graven's wacky occurrences against a lunar calendar for signs of manic schizophrenia but I would not be surprised to find signs of the devil in it's tea leaves.

I can't strongly recommend to anyone unwilling to cope with its many issues but sometimes you just want to indulge a fantasy that the industry has largely abandoned.  Keep that trainer handy to replace what you may lose as best you are able and consider running a casual playthrough to limit frustration if you are willing to risk playing Graven. | Nice game, I like the style. Though it has some bugs and some players have a hard time with it, the game has room to grow. I hope the devs will work on fixing and improving this game. 7 out of 10

I enjoyed the actual game itself and the gameplay but I can't recommend the game currently based off of the lack of support and communication from the devs.  They still have multiplayer listed as a core feature of the game even though it has yet to be implemented.  It still shows on the roadmap that the FIRST update was going to be multiplayer.  There is still no multiplayer nor mention of when its coming.  There's also only a small amount of content in the game right now as the devs promise to add more chapters in future updates.  After 4 or 5 months of no communication, they finally announce that the Breach update (the story and map update that was supposed to come out AFTER multiplayer) will be SHOWN on March 11.  Not released, mind you, just shown in a showcase.  This is pretty unacceptable for the price that they charge and for the expectations they set at the games EA launch.  I understand EA games often have plans change but missing every milestone and deadline THEY set and then being radio silent isn't acceptable. | 这游戏给我最大的教训就是EA阶段的游戏最好别买，真是半年多都不更新一点内容，纯纯的用半成品骗钱。 | Here's the text on the game listing right now, as of 1/23/25: 

“The feature roadmap shown on this page is the main outline for Early Access." 

Notice anything strange? The developers removed the road map from the Steam listing last year, and it's not surprising why. They haven't shipped a meaningful update in the better part of a year and are now hush hush in Discord servers where they won't give firm dates on anything. It's the definition of "Thanks for your money, enjoy a half-baked game." 

If the developers ever decide to make good on their promise I'll update my review, but I'm not holding my breath. Unless you enjoy playing incomplete, abandonware games -- spend your $40 elsewhere. You've been warned. | 虽然内容实在太少，但是战斗手感和画面美术都是顶级，不建议现在入手，但是实在感兴趣不妨玩玩看 | I sadly came here to echo the frustrations of other players. I love this game, even with a short 17 hours I look for any reason to jump back in but the promise of coop feels a mile away and the updates to the rogue like systems feel like a waste of development time especially with the coop not being in yet. I understand these systems and game play features were likely massively easier to develop and iterate on as the core of a lot of it was already there. That being said I feel like early access was a huge misstep for this studio and this game. Very little overall communication and while every time they do tell us something its a highlight its very few and far between. The new trailer feels like the peak of all of this... a trailer to announce a deep dive.......scheduled for almost two months from now, when MASSIVE games will be releasing in between.

A cautionary note from a clown who has played way too many video games, if you're going to do a game like this in early access you need to have regular monthly or bi-monthly developer diaries planned, you need to be constantly showing gameplay systems and their progress even if its early dev content. This game WILL be massively successful one day and everyone who's already here is going to come back and play it but the reviews show a clear distrust now that Moon Studios has never had to contend with from its core audience and its due to the most fundamental aspect of giving someone your money in EA....Communication

이 게임 자잘한 버그 (땟목에서 안 나와진다던가, 원숭이들이 갑자기 사라져서 멀리 뿅 생긴다던가)가 은근히 많은데 원숭이 훈련시켜서 일하게 만든다는 아이디어도 좋았고 인디게임 특유의 소소한 재미가 있어 추천합니다. 파밍, 크래프팅 재미도 있구요. 다만 도과 따시는 분들 멀티하면 게스트는 안 되고 호스트만 따지는 부분이 있으니 방장을 바꿔가며 노가다를 좀 해야 합니다 ㅠ | This would be a great survival game with a lot of great elements, but unfortunately some poor design choices and bugs prevent the player to get immersed.

At first the fact that every action can be done with only one key, (space) looks like a great approach, but given that -everything- is perfomed by that, very often unvanted actions occur/trigger, which is very annoying.
You should forget about this and use a proper key assignment layout like other decent games.

Also the item handling, splitting, etc. is very different from the already widely established scheme based on common sense.
On its own it would not be an issue. If it would work fine. But it is messy and don't have much logic.

In the mazes, the camera movement is quite unfortunate as the snapping or stationary camera is not a good idea when all of the other parts of the game use a camera fixed on the player.
As the camera stops on the border of rooms and only snaps to the next room when the player enters, it cannot be seen exactly what is on the other side of the door, even when open. So a situation when a player enters another room in the face of an enemy without seeing it, can happen and get attacked.
Which is silly.

Quite often we had desyncs and players dropped, which is also very annoying.
The last drop was when in a maze all of our progress got lost due to a disconnection/desync error.

Due to these and if a game produces this many bugs and is this unstable, then at least a usual rotating autosave feature would be nice, so users would have a way to restore the lost content and time.

I guess no devs will read this or will not give a damn anyway, but if you want to improve your game, then here you go.

-every aspect of the game feels like its strapped on only to get the game to be longer and not interesting or fun. | This game has an issue with saving whenever I tried to load one of my saves it sets me back to when I first saved (when you generate a world)

A phenomenal puzzle game with a technically impressive and visually stunning main mechanic let down by an absolutely awful story. [u] I genuinely recommend playing with voice acting volume set to zero and subtitles off, you will be playing a better game. [/u]

The characters are uninteresting and voice acted poorly, but most importantly they don't give any of the game's stellar moments time to breathe. Whenever something cool happens, you have someone chiming in remarking on how cool it is before you have a moment to go "Damn, that was really cool!". To me, robbing the player of the agency to react to spectacle is a game design sin, and it really held me back from fully absorbing the game's best moments.

The story is also actively painful. The message it's trying to send is ham-fisted, and the world is absent any internal logic. [spoiler] The entire game takes place in a VR simulation, yet it seems people lived here, even ate here. People are conducting research here, but who on earth builds a machine in VR to prove it'll work in real life? It ends with you leaving the simulation with a physical object, which makes zero sense. [/spoiler] Trying to make sense of these paradoxes simply raises more questions, and I never found them resolving in a satisfying way.

Don't let all this negativity distract you from how good this game is, though. It is absolutely worth playing. But I do genuinely recommend turning of voice acting and subtitles - it'll turn the story from generic and eyerolling to mysterious and intriguing. | 劇情跟環境保護有關 關卡都不會太難 視覺效果與邏輯也都做得很好 美中不足就是玩到各關卡有趣的部分時那整關也就差不多結束了 但整體還是很不錯 很值得體驗。 | [h2]Gameplay[/h2]
Viewfinder has amazing and creative puzzle mechanics. New mechanics are introduced over time and it doesn't overstay its welcome. If you're a completionist or want a bit of exploration, take note there are some pictures you could explore and objects (not part of the puzzle) you could interact. For the most part, the puzzles are easy while a few others are either mildly challenging or require some unconventional approach.

It's worth to note this game also has lots of accessibility features. I never use either, but you could get hints and disable the timer on timed puzzles. Besides that, there are also features for subtitle and text size which are helpful since I use a monitor with big resolution.

[h2]Visual & Audio[/h2]
It goes without saying the visual looks great and clean. The animation/transition when interacting with the puzzle feels smooth and satisfying. Both SFX and BGM are just good enough to do their intended job, although voice acting doesn't help the poor story.

[h2]Story[/h2]
The story is simply bad, in the sense that I don't care about the story and characters. I barely sense any build-up or suspense & most of the characters feel one-dimensional. The problem isn't the story-telling approach (which combines exploration, hearing past conversations and reading notes/articles) either, when other games (such as Deliver Us The Moon) can deliver a good story while using similar approach.

[hr][/hr]
Viewfinder is an amazing puzzle game. But considering the bad story and gameplay duration, you probably want to wait for a discount. | Everything that the dialogue and voice acting achieve would be better achieved by their absence. | Великолепная игра, при чем со всех сторон. Приятная игра чтобы отдохнуть и подумать, даже ах#еть придется

Oyun başarılı bir şekilde yapılmış. Kesinlikle öneririm. 9/10. 
Önceki oyunlarını oynamadım. Eski karakterler var ama fazla etkilediğini düşünmüyorum. Netten gereken bir kaç bilgiyi bulmuştum.
Buglarla karşılaştım. Bazen az bekleyince düzeliyor, bazen da oyunu kapatmak zorunda kalmıştım.
Özellikleri:
[list] [*] Loot sistemi çok iyi. Bir lootu alırken uzun bir çaptaki tüm lootları dahil ediyor ve sırayla toplanıyor. Ayrıca çanta sınırsız. Her şeyi topla, sakla, sana kalmış.
[*] Savaş sistemi güzel. Tüm rakip/dost birimler aynı anda sırasını oynuyor. Tek tek herkes beklenmiyor.
[*] Hikaye ve grafik tatmin edici. Seçimler önemli. Hikaye yön alıyor ona göre.
[*] Seçimlerde öldürmedin ama pişman mı oldun? Durduk yere istediğine saldırıp, öldürebilirsin, karakteri gördüğün sürece. Belki kilit birkaç karakterler hariç olabilir. Denemedim.
[*] Görüş sistemi tam olmamış. Özellikle kapı geçişlerinde. Bölgeye açık kapıdasın ve içeri görünmüyor. 2 adım sonra açılıyor biraz. Ayrıca evcil hayvanın gittiği yer de karanlık kalıyor. Hiç yoktan pozisyonunu görmek için kısa bir görüş verilebilirdi.
[*] Özel skillere tuş atanabilse daha iyiydi. Tabanca da bir skili, tek turda 10 kere(1AP) kullanabiliyorsun. Mecbur fareyle, tek tek tıklayarak 2 aşamada yapıyoruz.
[*] Çeşitli yetenekler var ve bunları ilk oynanışta biri hariç hepsini maxlayıp tecrübe ettim. Zor seviyede başladım. XP bonusa yüklenmedim. Ona rağmen yetişti.
[*] Menüde eksik kalmış (UI sistemi). Yetenek puanını harcayınca kaydet yok. Sayfa değiştirince soruyor. O şekilde kaydoluyor.
[*] Hızlı kayıt sistemi var ve etkili. Yükleme hızı fena değil.
[*]Bu tarzlarda genelde yan görevlerde yazıları geçerdim ama bunda göz atmak iyi oluyor. O yüzden İngilizce bilmeyenler için dublaj öneririm. Komik yazıları da var. Ayrıca bazı yazı seçimleri yetenek şartı istiyor. İstese bile iyi seçim olmuyor. O yüzden gözü kapalı, bu kesin iyidir deyip, okumadan geçmemeli.
[/list]
Oyun içi öneriler:
[olist]
[*] Bu tarz sıralı oyunlar tecrübeliysen, zor seviyede ve karakter oluşturmakla başlamanızı öneririm. Hazır karakterlerden daha iyi. Ekstra pasif var ve karakterin birkaç alanda uzmanlık olması daha etkili.
[*] Tüm karakterlere 1 level hayvancılık öneririm. Hepsi evcil hayvan alabiliyor ve 1 lvl Tavşan XP bonus veriyor. Sonradan fark ettiğim özellik. Savaşta da destek oluyorlar.
[*] Yetenek arttıran kitaplar var. Bunları en etkili kullanma yöntemi yetenek 9 seviye iken 10'a çıkarmaktır.
[*] Karakter yetenek sıfırlama mevcut ama her sıfırlamada fiyatı fazla artıyor. Dikkat etmek lazım. [b]Eğer sıfırlanan kişi kitap okuduysa, o da sıfırlanıyor.[/b] Kitap boşa gidiyor.
[*] Craft yapmayı sevsen de burada her şeyi craftlama. Scrap sınırlı miktarda ve bazı iyi craftlar çok fazla istiyor. Darda kalmadıkça kullanılabilir eşyaları (mermi, bandaj vs.) craftama, satın al. Craft silahlarının hepsi en iyi silah değil. Aklında tut.
[*] Crafta özel tarifler var ve malzemeleri "Junk" item olarak geçiyor. O yüzden bunları craftlamak istiyorsan, Junk itemleri toplu olarak satma. Biriktir. Silah modundan Junk item pasifini aldıktan sonra satmaya başla. İyi para ediyor.
[/olist] | Não conhecia saga, mas simplesmente amei quando joguei pela primeira vez. Tem bugs ? Sim kkk, porém não deixa o jogo ruim por isso, apenas estressa as vezes kkkk. Para quem gosta de jogos de estratégia e combate por turno. Este é um prato cheio! 8/10. Ansioso para sua sequência! Caso alguém queira jogar um coop, só adicionar. | Best part of this game is it's unique humor. Totally my taste and therefore a really fun game.

The last section of the game feels a bit unpolished and anticlimactic. So don't expect there too much. I think the first third of the game was the most fun and afterwards it was still a pretty good game.

Recommend if you like:
- Decisions
- Skill Trees
- Tactical RPGs
- Dark Humor

Most annoying for me was the balancing of weapons. Some are good in early game but weak in late game and vice versa. So you really should spread out your options. | I haven't played the other Wastelands... but after getting back into tactical RPGs like Rogue Trader (loved it) and Baldur's Gate 3 (Awesome return to D&D), Wasteland 3 (mostly) satisfies that nostalgic Old School Fallout vibe/feel/itch. The tactical gameplay is fun and somewhat varied but some of the systems could have been polished and fleshed out more. Also the the variety of encounters could have been a little better since there was not much need for reevaluating strategies once you found one that worked. Also, initially I didn't understand how some of the attributes and skills actually affected gameplay and leveling. Figured it out but the game doesn't do a great job explaining everything. Some of the world and story could have been more open ended (though you can wander ish). Overall it was great though, with some interesting characters and a story that's serviceable enough to keep you mad maxxing across Colorado. An easy "yes" to purchase on sale. | A Masterpiece of Tactical RPG Storytelling

Wasteland 3 is an absolute triumph for fans of tactical RPGs and post-apocalyptic storytelling. From the moment you step into the frozen wastelands of Colorado, you’re drawn into an immersive world filled with tough moral choices, deeply layered characters, and unforgettable encounters.

Gameplay
The combat in Wasteland 3 is a standout feature, blending classic turn-based strategy with modern mechanics. Every decision matters, from positioning your squad to selecting the right mix of abilities and gear. The battles are challenging but rewarding, encouraging creative strategies and clever use of your environment.

Storytelling
The narrative is where Wasteland 3 truly shines. The writing is sharp, witty, and emotionally engaging, with decisions that genuinely impact the world around you. Whether you’re negotiating with strange cults, deciding the fate of a desperate town, or dealing with the consequences of your alliances, the game keeps you constantly invested in its branching storyline.

Atmosphere and World-Building
The frozen post-apocalypse of Colorado is beautifully crafted, with stunning environments and a hauntingly atmospheric soundtrack. Every location feels unique and packed with details that add depth to the world. The quirky characters and dark humor are perfectly balanced with the serious tones of survival and sacrifice.

Customizability
From building your squad to upgrading your base, Wasteland 3 offers a wealth of customization options. You can tailor your team to suit your playstyle, making every playthrough feel unique.

Co-Op
For those looking to share the experience, the co-op mode is a fantastic addition, allowing you to strategize and make tough decisions with a friend.

Conclusion
Wasteland 3 is a must-play for RPG enthusiasts and anyone who loves a game that challenges your mind and tugs at your emotions. InXile Entertainment has delivered a masterpiece that respects the legacy of the Wasteland series while modernizing it for a new generation of gamers. If you're ready for a journey filled with tough choices, tactical depth, and a world that feels alive, Wasteland 3 is the game for you.

I started a game and I was hooked. It was soooo difficult to keep going with Germany for instance, but came so close to maintaining office a few first times, that I knew I could do better. It's a massive puzzle game with a very simple interface that makes it easy to absorb the information and navigate the myriad of implications of your decisions. I'm still learning about the game, and wonder what the replayabillity is like once I figure out the massive puzzle, but so far it's very engaging and rewarding when I manage to continue as President in office. | Great game for people like me, who are chronically addicted to politics (it's not healthy). The game is definitely an improvement over Democracy 3. The UI, mod support and policy balance is improved. But the same old problem remains any politics addict with a strong ideological alingment. The game as a lib-left bend (although not as pronounced as in Democracy 4). Depending on your personal view, this might be a good or a bad thing. The game is harder with a free-market approach, although this can be balanced through mods. The game offers a lot of different countries to play in, but has a very american perspective on policy. 

I find myself resorting to my preferred political playstyle of free-market capitalism, but you can go ahead and experiment. I highly recommend this game. | Too expensive for what it is and a lot of the cause & effect makes very little sense - Why are the only contributing factors to environmental protests the state of the environment and how many environmentalists there are? Surely if Environmentalists are happy with my government they would be significantly less inclined to protest it? - meaning otherwise seemingly pointless policies need to be put in place like tear gas, water cannons, etc. that tank approval for literally no reason.

There's also too few positive situations and/or goals to achieve, which wouldn't be a huge deal if not for the fact that this being a simulation of democracy means there's no real endgame, it means a lot of the time unless you have something in mind to work towards there's not much impetus to play for very long at a time, no carrot on the end of the proverbial stick to keep encouraging you to work towards achieving it.

Worth a play if you see it at a significant discount during a sale, otherwise I would give it a miss. | I personally have had a lot of fun on this game! I like all the laws and such you can change. | This is a fun Game for those who like strategy, slow pace, and who like to govern. You can change policies to try winning an election or just to see what will happen if you start chipping people and freedom is taken. so many options. I enjoy it because I have 4 kids and 3 Dogs and a wife and a job so I can get up and walk away no pause needed. Per turn game.

The game has a lot of potential, however it is very strange that it has such a limited inventory management system. For a survival game, carfting a lot of things are essential, that means various type of materials need to be collected but in this game this is not possible cause of the very limited storage which becomes very fruastrating. 

Why the devs decided that this limitation is the way to go is beyond me, this game could have been very enjoyable had it not have the super limited inventory.

The sailing mechanic is very nice, the combat is needs some work but the real deal breaker is the inventory space.

Unfortunately I cannot recommend this game at this stage. | A game about sailing.

Windbound was not a perfect game by my expectations. However, was is still a very much enjoyable experience.
I could not shake the feeling of a missed potential in some parts though. Like there could be more
of the underwater world to explore. Then, it didn't feel like a much-needed content because
the game worked without such innovations.

I deem Windbound a well-designed but imperfectly produced game.

It taught me patience.

First, I played the Survivalist difficulty level. I'm no hardcore gaming enthusiast but I believe the Storyteller
difficulty wouldn't keep me as engaged in the narrative. Just like in Dark Souls there is a feeling of catharsis
after losing progress, same feeling applies here. Coming back all the way to chapter 1 while retaining
the knowledge of the previous iteration didn't spoil the experience. The maps of each chapter were procedurally
generated. An example of that just mentioned were the so called "bonus shrines" which you could interact with
and they granted bonuses. It was always a game of chance whether this time you would get extra health or stamina.
However, the problem of losing most of the progress (except for the "held" inventory items) slowed the pace
of the game significantly.

Immersive adaptive music.

Second, whether it be a change of weather from clear to stormy during sailing or an enemy attack
the sudden changes of ambience played a crucial role in immersion. The sound design was well
done where audio helped identify comfort from danger. Most prominently, each creature encountered
had its own specific track attached to it. It played whenever the creature was idly wandering around.
Namely, there were boars appearing from chapter 1 whose specific track was a nylon guitar.
It added to the feeling you could have a hunter's intuition as if being able to track and observe
patterns that led you to your prey.

The great physics bug.

On the other note, the game appeared to be rough around the edges because of the minor bugs
I experienced on my way through the story. Sometimes I would get stuck in the environment
during a fight and had to roll off away, then I would get struck with a debuff only to restart
the game and cleanse the effect. There were problems in the game that affected the way
I played, something like I had to accommodate, adapt my playstyle using some bugs to counter
other bugs. I also found one particular I'd call a major one that shouldn't be there.
It was when one of the creatures of the islands landed a hit on me and I was sent flying
like a superman. I landed in water outside the island and almost had the character lose
consciousness from swimming back.

To conclude, despite the ups and the downs I recommend playing the game. It was an interesting
blend of sailing mechanics, action-survival gameplay and an interesting story in itself.
The main metaphor I could make out of the story was that no problem can be solved if there
is no established dialog between people.
One more thing to note is that Windbound can also be interpreted as an essay on loneliness.
Everyone sails their own boat. We just do happen to sometimes reach the same island (a concept
of belonging). We also just so happen to part out ways later. Singleplayer experience is purposeful
here in reaching this feeling of solitude on everyone's personal journey. As if encircled by
a storm in a closed space with just your own thoughts... | A very fun and beautiful game | Seria um jogo bom, se a mecânica de luta dele não fosse uma merda!!!

Then start doing boarding and hard dungeons. One tank and three healers to win.

Quando comecei a jogar Nobody Saves the World, confesso que não sabia exatamente o que esperar. Porém, desde os primeiros minutos, fui completamente fisgado por sua proposta única e seu visual. Os gráficos, com aquele estilo cartunesco exagerado, são simplesmente incríveis. Cada cenário parece ter saído diretamente de um desenho animado, com cores vibrantes, traços caricatos e detalhes que dão vida ao mundo maluco e cheio de personalidade do jogo.

O humor, por sua vez, é um espetáculo à parte. É aquele tipo de nonsense que te faz rir alto em momentos inesperados. Desde os diálogos cheios de ironia até as situações absurdas que você encontra pelo caminho, tudo em Nobody Saves the World parece rir de si mesmo e, de quebra, da gente também.

Mas o que realmente faz o jogo brilhar é a mecânica das formas. A possibilidade de se transformar em diferentes criaturas — desde um rato até um cavaleiro ou até uma lesma — é simplesmente genial. Cada forma tem habilidades próprias, e a criatividade que o jogo te exige para combinar essas habilidades e resolver desafios ou enfrentar inimigos é de cair o queixo. Você nunca se sente preso a um único estilo de jogo, já que pode experimentar livremente e se adaptar a cada situação com uma nova transformação.

E, claro, não posso deixar de mencionar o quão divertido o jogo é. Não importa se você está explorando masmorras, enfrentando hordas de inimigos ou simplesmente experimentando combinações de habilidades, Nobody Saves the World é uma fonte inesgotável de diversão. É aquele tipo de jogo que te faz perder a noção do tempo, porque cada novo desafio ou descoberta te deixa ainda mais empolgado para ver o que vem a seguir.

Resumindo, Nobody Saves the World é uma experiência única que combina um visual incrível, humor despretensioso e mecânicas de jogo criativas em um pacote absurdamente divertido. Se você gosta de jogos que saem do comum e te desafiam a pensar fora da caixa, este é obrigatório! | steam版玩了一半，因为psn会免在ps5上通关白金了。变身系统挺有特色，后期升级任务太多太烦，感觉全程大部分时间都在刷各种升阶任务。 | Geniale e divertente.
L'ho comprato con non molte aspettative ma in realtà si è rivelato un gioco bellissimo. Si basa tutto su un mondo ironico, personaggi e trasformazioni con forme più buffe possibili e abilità e attacchi altrettanto peculiari. La bellezza sta nel fatto che puoi giocare con la forma che più ti piace e riuscire a divertirti a modo tuo, ma non solo perchè le abilità sono interscambiabili e puoi creare quello che più ti piace.
 Inoltre sebbene il gioco non sia di una difficoltà così elevata, presenta diverse "challenge" che devono essere comprese per essere battute. 
Ultima cosa, sebbene la grafica sicuramente non è pesante (anche se molto ben fatta e perfettamente affine al gioco, con tanti easter egg in giro) il gioco è FLUIDO come pochi, nessun caricamento elevato, nessun problema per entrare e uscire dai posti. 
Consigliatissimo
ps: in 2 è 10 volte più divertente, anche se il gioco e la lore sono progettati per una persona sola, la seconda ha pieni poteri e aiuta a sviluppare più velocemente i personaggi | 非常好玩！难度适中！有经济实力可直接买拓展包！ | 剧情可以，游戏性可以，玩法很不错，被宣传片介绍玩法视频耽误了的好游戏。

[h3] 一次短暂而又令人毛骨悚然的奇妙经历 [/h3]
本作与其说是动作冒险游戏,倒不如说是解谜+平台跳跃游戏;流程是完全线性的,并且有且只有由是否全收集来决定的结局的差异。
毋庸置疑,游戏的故事十分精彩,配合上时间卡的相当紧的追逐战和多样化关卡设计,基本上全程都有新鲜感,游戏流程虽短[spoiler] 全要素通关四小时左右 [/spoiler],但没什么垃圾时间。

[b] 下方略剧透 [/b]
——————————————————
但通关后回头望去,主角安塔尔是什么样的人、驱使他去微笑群岛成为救主的动机是什么，这样的问题仍然处于迷雾中[spoiler] 就连姐弟两都更为生动 [/spoiler],只是如老说书人所说的"[i] 这是名少年的故事,他名叫安塔尔.他非常,非常想去一个奇妙的仙境,那儿被称为微笑群岛.... [/i]",就像是以前童话集里的开场那样,对即将出场的主角进行了设定,这也正印证了南托的评价: 提线木偶;
说书人的命运与其唯一的故事相纠缠,故事的结束对说书人意味着什么虽然在游戏中没有明确指出,但从老说书人致力于令故事主角无法"如愿以偿"便可管中窥豹。
游戏原名应为Savior,后因版权问题改为Saviorless,直译为救世主/无救世主使故事增添了讽刺,官中译为破灭则是概括了整个故事；
重复着的轮回的中断、救不了任何人的救主、野心与牺牲最终只造就了一个看门的怪物，以及最后故事的彻底终结。 | 线性闯关，解谜+平台跳跃，跳跃手感笨重速度又慢，角色一碰就死，挫败感太强 | J'aime bien l'univers qui a été créé dans ce jeu cubain. C'est simple et onirique. La jouabilité est intéressante, parfois surprenante. Il y a de l'ingéniosité. Petit problème de son dans ma dernière séance de jeu, qui est peut-être du à mon hardware. | O jogo é ok. Nada incrível, mas se estiver barato e você gosta do estilo, compre. | Muy buen juego aunque un poco corto ... historia interesante ... y desafío de dificultad medio.

Genres: Indie, RPG, Simulation, Strategy, Early Access
Reviews:
Любитель тактических RPG определенно стоит оценить данный проект. Сам проиграл не малое количество времени по пиратке, но решил поддержать разработчика и приобрел игру. Обязательно вернусь еще в игру, но жду обновления и нужное настроение. 
Обновления выходят, за что респект разработчику и желаю ему успехов!!!
Игру рекомендую | Fun game with lots of potential. If dev continues to add more combat and magic skills, this could compete with ToME, | I don't recommend this quite yet.

Needs a more fleshed out character creator and magic added before I'd recommend buying. | Потенциал имеется, уже контента неплохое количество. Роадмап действительно впечатляет, поэтому ждём | Good on the developer for listening to the playerbase.  As for the game, it reminds me of Stoneshard in many respects, including dying in the first 10 minutes of Prologue.  Worth a replay.

I can expound a bit on my first impressions about the game, in the context of the Hunter class. 🏹 These are just my opinions.

Every build of a Hunter needs Athletics or there just isn't survivability, for me.  Again, just my opinion.  I am amused that Steam doesn't know what "survivability" is. 😀

The character background should be presented to the player after the inventory is known, I think.  A Hunter's background talks about a bow, but he could start with a crossbow.  Sleeping on a crossbow is very uncomfortable, even in a forest. 😄

Reroll should also cycle between the weapon types, instead of being random.  I rerolled one character build a total of nine times to get a bow.  That's not really worth recording on video except as a joke.

Finally out of the Prologue after six failed Hunter builds, I reflected on the progress thus far, trying my best not to chuckle.  The Hunter's starting mastery with a bow is indeed very low.  That's fine, but the background needs rewriting to accommodate.  Constructively, I could suggest a background like,

"Your father taught you how to use a <weapon> at a young age, and though you liked it, you weren't catching on quickly enough, so were eventually reassigned to <insert skill choice> and to practice a bit of <other skill>, during your time at the village.  Mostly, you cared for the village cats and disposed of the vermin they caught.  More recently, you found by the roadside another <weapon>.  It's not that great for quality, but picking it up, feeling its weight, <aiming down the bolt shaft/testing the bowstring>, that old instinct is definitely coming back to you." 🤔 Probably too long---I'm always so long-winded with my thoughts! 🤣

This might better fit the bonuses the Hunter gets, with the mastery or lack there of, he actually has, without needing to make the player more capable of handling those 1-kilo iguanas and rattus critters. 🐀

My record so far for number of arrows pulled from a single iguana is 11.  Arrows act like tracer bullets, if you've ever fired multiple arrows at a single target in real life, where the more arrows you fire, the more you're able to correct the next shot's path.  Progressively decreasing the chance for a miss with more shots, would be part of that bow instinct.  Now, a crossbow, this can be a bit different since you may be putting your back into reloading it.  A lighter crossbow which can be rearmed with, well, the arms might see you training your eye on the target, each shot getting better but a serious crossbow is going to feature you using the stirrup with your foot, completely losing the target in the process of rearming it.

I was excited for the variety in arrows, although I actually saw no arrows for sale in the two towns I visited.  I didn't get far toward finding more towns before "Exhausted!" occurred.  This left my Hunter inexcusably naked with no arrows in an arrowless zone, getting teleported a wearisomely long distance away.  It was at this point that a Debug command to load one of the archer kits was considered, for the sake of sanity.

I did also level up the appropriate Masteries, and I used Cheat Engine 🙄 to get every ability for Ranged and Archery---because level 27 for a weapon mastery is not necessarily enough to get all of its abilities.  I did this because they all would very neatly fit on the Neverwinter Nights sized toolbar, including Jump from Athletics.  Call it OCD, or whatever you like. 🤪

Actually, NWN had 12 slots per toolbar, not the 10 we see in Doors of Trithius.  Either way, thanks to Debug Mode, things are much better and the game is playable, enjoyable, and makes me smile. 😉 My Hunter could even hit a rattus and one of those adorable sleeping snakes. 🐍  I've not seen cuter serpent coils in a game.

As a final note, of course you see the thumbs up.  Doors of Trithius scratches vigorously that traditional roguelike itch.  I'm likely to cycle between it and Stoneshard, for awhile. 😁

Game Name: The Dark Side of the Moon: An Interactive FMV Thriller
Reviews:
Bonne surprise !
Un petit coté nanar sympathique mais accrochant ! 
Avec des possibilités, des choix et des conséquences différentes. Y compris la fin du jeu.
J'ai passée un bon moment dessus.
Pas de regrets.

I will start by saying, I love this game.
It's incredibly fun and immersive and hasn't gotten dull or boring after putting 70 hours into it the past few weeks.

The reason I can't recommend it is due to some pretty severe bugs that my friend and I have encountered.

Co-op is the reason I play the game, I wouldn't play it solo, its probably still fun solo, I just prefer playing with friends.
I am not sure if these game-breaking bugs are present in single player and I'm not keen on finding out.

There are some minor bugs here and there, NPCs roaming the map are invisible, the death animation for the two handed mace is backwards. These things I can look past.

The problem becomes when my friend and I spend over an hour clearing out a bandit camp and when we finally finish the fight, we get a black screen with no way to get out of it besides closing the game completely. This is a problem because then we have to go back to a previous save, which can sometimes be right outside the camp, within the battle, or sometimes we lose hours of progress. We have to be religious about saving the game because we have encountered this bug numerous times.

I can even look past this happening in bandit camps, because those are not necessary to the story. We can just skip them if the bug happens over and over. However, what I can't look past is when it happens in a story mission. My friend and I basically had to skip a whole region entirely because we were soft locked on a specific story mission in that area. We can't progress in the region without completing it, and no matter what we did, every time we fought the battle, it resulted in a black screen for both of us. After hours of trying to fix it we eventually cut our losses and moved to the next region. 

I am not sure if many other people experience this bug, I haven't seen much chatter about it online. But for me, It really takes the wind out of our sails after spending hours on a really tough fight, only for none of it to matter and have to go to an earlier save to attempt it again. All the while wondering if it will even work the next time.

I will change my review to recommended after this bug gets resolved, but until then I have to not recommend it, even though the game is great :(. |
