Reviews:
Stay away from this game, Go join a game that doesn't try to dumps your wallet well over fifty dollars every month for misc items then just a Subscription.
-This game has an OK community
-The issue is the Devs, trying to dump hundreds of outfits to whales to sale to a very inflated market
-The Devs have also backstabbed several times the community
-Making a Gunslinger after stating they would NOT make a gun class(Nice)
-If you want to play this game, DO NOT SPEND MONEY.
-The community is mostly dying as less and less people fight world bosses on NA, it use to be an all server wide thing but now only a hand full. | DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME.

Developers are completely out of touch, servers as unstable as the Somalian economy. They make promises they never keep or if they keep them its years after they said they would do it. Really wish I could recommend it but I can't. | As fun as the gameplay is, that's like literally the only compliment i can give it outside of the game looking beautiful, it's a sadistic grindfest that is so unbelievably overwhelming for any player, i have 200 hours and i still have zero clue what im doing because i am being constantly bombarded with new items and systems that by the time i get a grasp on one thing, i have to learn 5 more new things. | I didn't really doing anything in the first 6 hours and ended up with a full inventory of stuff... just stuff. The combat early on seems pointless as you can be surrounded by 20 mobs and take no damage. The graphics in the game are quirky with a ton of lighting issues making the game look awful most of the time. The user interface is horrid with overlays overlaying other overlays upon more overlays... it's a mess visually. Why would I want to get notified of other players failing crafting when I am just starting the game? It's a UX/UI designers nightmare. Early story and quests are meh. If I were to summarize my new experience, I wouldn't say it was "bad", I would say it's "a turn off". | Black Desert Online has one of the best early and mid-game experiences. Progress feels rewarding, the world is vast and fun to explore, and there's a real sense of discovery. However, the late game is a completely different story.

Once you hit the late-game grind, progression slows down dramatically, taking anywhere from 20 to 100 hours just to see any improvement. Season characters are a great addition, but they also remove the early game entirely by handing out free PEN gear, which can feel like skipping one of the best parts of the game.

The biggest issue is how demanding the late game is, both in time and money. The game leans heavily into pay-to-win mechanics—you can buy Crons, making enhancement much less painful for those willing to spend money. While Black Desert has an incredible combat system and PvP is amazing, there's just not enough meaningful PvP content in the open world.

Overall, Black Desert isn’t a terrible game, but the late-game grind and monetization model make it hard to recommend unless you're ready to sink an absurd amount of time (or money) into it.

这游戏最后让人感觉就是浪费了毫无意义的6个小时……解迷基本上没有难度，个别地方确实有点脑筋急转弯，但并不是那种需要反复思考的类型；除此之外最无语的就是这个非常没有意义的剧情，虽然有让人推进的欲望，但总体而言都能猜到走向；另外这张地图看着很复杂，但是大多数元素都是冗余信息，只能让人产生些毫无意义的干扰。最后就是这个核心玩法，居然就是无聊到小学生都不一定想玩的看图找物。而且因为没有搜索功能，我大多数时间都在痛苦的翻书和翻植物。 | 幻想植物店の薬草師として、お客の注文や話を聞きながら
生活するオカルトパズル作品。
客の要望を聞いて主人公がどう行動するかで
物語の結末が変わります。

[h1][b]- 作品の特徴と長所 -[/b][/h1]
[b]・顕微鏡に図鑑に情報のイメージなど
　数々の情報から推測して、要求している花を当てるパズル
・花だけではなく、事件現場や新種の場所を推測する
　地図のパズルなど様々な謎解き要素が有り
・時間制限は無し
・間違いすぎると正気を失って……?
・世界観はダーク系[/b]
演出が斬新なパズルで、外見だけでなく
効力や学名を読んでいる事でハッと気がつく要素も有り
謎解き好きには良い手応えです。

[h1]- 個人的な短所 -[/h1]
[b]・ジョウロ[/b]
別に水やりをしなくても植物は平気なのですが
地図パズルに失敗すると、気力が減少して
回復を待たなければいけません。
植物に水をやる事で気力が回復するのですが
それでも割と回復に時間がかかるので
もう少し早いと快適でした。

[h1][b]- 総評 -[/b][/h1]
個人的にはPapers, Pleaseから時間制限や
収入関係の要素を消してパズル特化にした作風の印象です。
花屋という題材、街の地図自体がパズル、
演出はどれもクリエイティブで中々楽しめました。
ただしパズルは少々難解なモノもあるので、
パズルが苦手な方には合わないかもしれません。
謎解きが好きな人にお勧めします。 | If you're looking for a cozy yet spooky puzzler, Strange Horticulture is it. The graphics are fantastic, the story is intriguing, and the puzzles require you to really use your noggin without being too hard. I loved running my own gloomy little plant shop and helping to solve a murder mystery along the way. Absolutely recommend! | Pros:
+ Cool plants

Cons:

- Really didn't like that you can't open the interactive map until the "Will to explore" meter is full 
- I love dark occult mystery, but the story just didn't grip me, it was kind of bland

Cozy but tedious overall, overstays it's welcome. | Esse jogo é muito foda, muito interativo, lindo, complexo, mas nem tanto... adorei desvendar os segredos e ajudar os meus clientes. Me senti muito inteligente em alguns momentos por conseguir decifrar as pistas dos cartões sem dicas (usei até o paint em alguns momentos pra me localizar), achei muito divertida a dinâmica  do jogo, como sempre te levam a pensar e a desbravar as possibilidades, que são várias, durante o jogo você pode fazer várias coisas ao mesmo tempo, e é gostoso demais de jogar em dias chuvosos tomando um café, slk me diverti muito!!

es bueno un historia god y las deciones son muy buenas | While I get the moral of this game, the degree of which the game pushes against you for the choices you make can be infuriating at times. 

The game itself is a big guilt trip where you're targeted for every single choice that you make, regardless of what it is. While this has meaning behind it, there are many touches and details throughout the game that can bury that meaning under frustration. There were some points that made me feel insulted rather than stop and think like it wants you to:

- Any case where the narrator berated me for one decision, then berated me for the other after I switched choices.
- The dog, which would have been tolerable to bring up a few more times, if it weren't for the joke that the devs "saved the dog" and the achievement for saving the dog by simply leaving the question. (I get the best way to win the game is to not play, but come on).
- You have hardly any effect towards the story at all, yet the game wants to pretend that you do.

The whole game feels like this "fuck you for playing" that isn't my, nor many people's, cup of tea at all. It was meaningful, and I got the message, but I don't think it was worth it. | Delivers on the concept. Short but interesting. | Even if you've seen other people play this game, you are not prepared enough for the things thrown at you. | I got the game on sale for $2.19 USD and it STILL was not worth it.

I love the game but please be aware that at the time of this review, the game developers have essentially moved to just bug fixes and no new content. I'm not sure if it'll change back at some point. 
If you'd like to play a management sim based around blacksmithing then this is a really good game for it, but don't expect there to be more that what's in the game at the moment. | Anvil Saga is not a perfect game, and although I have quite a few issues with it, ultimately I believe (hesitantly) it is a game worth the play through if you want a cozy game about running your own smithy with light local politics. 

What I enjoyed:
Overall, I thought the story was enjoyable. It was fun to see the tug of war of the rival factions as they vied for control over the Province. I enjoyed the angle of having this rival who has the same love as you but also acts as a "boss" at the end of every act or chapter that you have to face off against. I felt that the Fair that occurred at the end of the Chapter really pushes you to focus on what roles you want your apprentices to fill, what equipment to use, what books to read, etc. You feel like you really need to adequately prepare for each competition even if you are going in semi-blind between the 3. I also enjoyed the diverging paths in the story where depending on where your current relationship with each faction in-game really pushed the narrative of the story, and the scenery in your village would reflect that as well. It felt like I was leaving some impact on the world to a degree. I also thought the hire system was kinda fun as well as the cameos that occurred throughout the story. Finally, I thought the game play loop was satisfactory. It was fun and kept me entertained for my 18 hour play through (might be quicker on easier difficulties). 

Neutral Thought(s):
Mostly, I thought the game was just a tad too easy. I played it on the hardest difficulty possible, and although it had a learning curve in the beginning with all of the different factions and how they worked when they stood in queue for your shop, once you understood this it was fairly easy to pick up. Once you picked up the game play loop and what needed to be done to your shop, it was just a matter of doing it all. Managing the relationships with the different factions was also fairly simple, and overall once you got in the "groove" of things, the game wasn't very difficult. That said, I know this is a cozier game, and can be picked up by just about anybody, so I'm not going to outright hold that against Anvil Saga, but I felt it was at the very least worth mentioning.

What I didn't care for:
I hope I don't contradict myself too hard. I really did enjoy the game or else I wouldn't have completed it, and even though I liked a particular aspect of the game throughout it's majority, I felt by act three that even it's best qualities were getting old. So, by that, I mean the game overstayed it's welcome a bit (for me at least). By act/chapter 3, I essentially had my forge fully upgraded, and my house expanded completely. Every room was fully upgraded, everyone had the best equipment for their role, I had a full staff of apprentices, I was at 100% or near 100% with nearly every single faction, and I also had my father's house fixed with someone in it (the guy who gets logs, I cannot remember his job atm and I'm too lazy to google it). With that well oiled of a machine, the game play loop got stale pretty fast, and it was already nearing that by the end of the second act. I know that the game does have story and environmental elements that help keep things fresh, but I found myself not really affected too harshly at that point in the game by negative environmental/societal forces. I also felt that aspects of the game were also forgettable at that point (see comment about "log man" above). When you've gotten along with the bandits or the witches for so long that you haven't paid your employees or taxes properly for a good 2/3 of the game, it made choosing who lived in your parent's old house significantly easier, and even then, once I chose the job of the person who lived there, I kinda forgot about that particular aspect as well. I said earlier that I liked the hire/fire element to the game, but I never really used the firing aspect. Everyone I hired I kept on. Why? Because they've been doing their job for days, why would I fire them -- especially when they essentially work for free due to the witches/bandits -- when the skill they have now is higher than anyone else on the perspective job market? It really didn't seem necessary to me at least. On the topic of paying employees, I kinda wonder what the point of payment is at all? Like, why do we pay them? Of course, it's because they are learning from us as the smith and we need to be provided a wage or else they will get upset and leave, but like there isn't much more to the game play than just "pay them or they will leave". It's not like the employees themselves used the wage I paid them for anything. They live, work, and eat under the same roof and never leave the shop unless I send them on a quest with one of the cameo characters. They really don't do anything with the money outside of affecting their overall mood and work ethic (I guess that answers the question I just posed, but hear me out). I think, personally, that it would have been a much more fun mechanic to have them work on "shifts". Maybe they still stay at the house, etc, but additionally, they might go out in the village to spend their paycheck and have a percentage chance of something happening to them:
      - it can be a good thing such as a new business venture or cameo character
      - it can be a bad thing like they get into a fight at the local tavern and now Arthur/We are faced with a dilemma of either 
         firing our apprentice and saving face with the faction that they got into an altercation with at the expense of 
         potentially upsetting other apprentices, or defending our apprentice at the cost of paying a fine and/or losing 
         reputation points with upset/offended faction
I think something like what I have above at least gives a more interesting way to interact with the village whilst also giving another in-game reason to why we pay the apprentices versus what is currently implemented in the game. I feel like the game play loop does feel mobile game-esque in regard to some other comments made in other reviews here, and although that didn't bother me too much; it did hurt the game in the third act when the game play loop was getting old. Finally, the bugs. I know every bad review talks about the bugs in this game, and although I didn't encounter too many through out my first run, the ones I did encounter were fairly annoying and did bump the difficulty spike briefly; whether it be me assisting a customer of a faction that didn't like me just to not get any points added despite me seeing the +1 or +2 above their head, or me completing an order correctly in a fair competition to still lose points. Regardless, instances like those were fairly frustrating but they were rare compared to other folks' reviews.

TL;DR
Anvil Saga does have some issues and is far from a perfect game; however, if you enjoy cozy games, you don't mind putting up with some quirks, or you think being a black smith sounds fun, then Anvil Saga is a game that you will have a good time with! I do recommend buying this on sale (unless you got some cash burning a hole in your pocket) as I believe $20 is a bit too steep of a price for the content, imo. | Очень милая игра на 2-3 вечера.

Кампания заканчивается как раз, когда геймплей становится скучноват.

Есть баги, но для прохождения не критичны. 
Проблемные ситуации решаются перезапуском игры | В техническом пане игра полностью сломана. Неработающие квесты. Бесконечный поток заказов, что нельзя остановить. Открытие, и обучение новым верстакам, после 10 дней как поступил первый заказ на материалы с них. Авто выполнение некоторых квестов. И т.д. | Game is abandoned since april 2024, no more fixes, impossible do play, dont waste your money even in a promotion

It's very hard to decide whether to recommend the game or not. I really, really want to congratulate it on it's unique ideas, but the rest of the game just drags it all down.
The main premise of the game is very good and uniquely fun, creating the world from pieces is truly fun and basically caries the game on it's shoulders. Everything else about the game ranges from meh to offensively bad.  
- Character portraits have that aftertaste of generated slop, and even though I can't tell if it is, the fact that it's indistinguishable from the generated slop is telling enough. 
- I'm sorry to say it, but the writing and the story is soulwretchingly bad. Either it's generated, badly translated, or both, it's basically that placeholder story that designers put in the game at the beginning, with the intent to change for a real story later. The writing is one step above of lorem ipsum and gets somehow worse as the game progresses. 
- Probably the worst quality of the game design is it's primary gameplay loop that consists of holding a use button in the vicinity of an object, hold if for just enough time to get bored, but not enough to start getting distracted. Holding the button in boredom is basically 80% of the game and it's baaaaad. 
- Combat is somehow even worse, it's clunky, unresponsive, ranging from boring to annoying, I can't even tell what's worse, melee or ranged.

The fact that I finished the story despite all that is a testament to how fun the premise is. But for all the hours of my life that the game stole from me, making me hold the button down like it's some kind of illegal psychological experiment, I have to not recommend it afterall. | Неплохая игра в своём жанре, необычная механика строительства мира (напомнила мне настольную игру Каркасон).
Немного игра напоминает Вальхейм, но более упрощенный/примитивный.
По полной цене брать точно не стоит.
 | This game is unique. The tile system is pretty cool. The stupid wolf pet is quite annoying, though. That being said, I found a game breaking bug and cannot find a solution. When given Basil's boots to call the cows, my inventory was full. I did not get the boots. Now, I can't progress in the game. Too bad, its not a bad game. | It's a fun and relaxing game, the freedom to build and explore a massive world it's quite nice.
I was having so much fun and suddenly I finished the game without even realize it was the last quest, that's my only comply, the game is too short.

 | Im Grunde ganz nett gestaltet. Niedliche Grafik. Spiel fehlt es absolut an Tiefe. Vergleichbar mit Handygames. Leider alles viel zu oberflächlich und nicht gut durchdacht. Der Preis rechtfertigt zudem nicht was man bekommt. Bleibt nur auf DLC´s oder Updates zu warten.... Wirklich schade

First thing, this game is very very addictive, I'd give you that. Once you start a game you will find it very very hard to stop playing. My 227 hours play time should be evidence enough to prove my point. But sadly, among my 227 play time, 99% of it was solo play. I would dearly like to join a clan and play with some other players. But alas, although the game does support clan play, some feature of the game or should I say lack of it, made it very unfriendly for clan play.  

The one thing I hate about this game is that all members within a clan shares everything. And in everything, I mean freaking EVERYTHING. All you can do is to trust in your clan member's ethics and hope they won't rob you blind when you're not in the game. Even the stuff in your so-call personal strongbox can be access by your clan members. So what good is a personal strongbox if everyone can get the stuff you stashed in it. I mean, why put in a personal strongbox in the first place is its utterly useless. At least put in some permission settings for the owner to restrict access to their stuff. 

Another thing is the loot system. I once cleared a tier 2 rift boss when another player came in and took all my loot dropped from the boss. The player was not even a clan member, just another solo player who came in and ninja looted all my stuff. 

All of this BS is making it very hard for anyone to form and invite people into a clan unless all the clan members are also real life friends. No one likes to be betrayed and rob of their hard earn possessions when they are not looking.

But, after mentioning all the bad stuff, I'm still gonna recommend this to others. The solo play is still worth playing. | 76小时全成就，已经被多人残酷模式狠狠地恶心到了。游戏虽然有诸多可圈可点的设计，但瑜不掩瑕，其槽点之多让人忍不住想要打个差评好好说道说道。

1.异常不合理的数值，多动症到离谱的boss以及仿佛断了腿一般的主角性能。玩家作为一个高贵的吸血鬼，也是人见狗嫌走到哪被打到哪，机动性比隔壁魂游的不死人都要差的多的多。平时顶着残疾人的移速跑图就已经无比折磨了，打boss时更是只能依靠cd10秒以上的闪现来躲避攻击，背板躲招式几乎是刚需。而对比鲜明的是boss各种位移闪现aoe，快到根本看不清抬手的大范围攻击以及一刀砍一半血的离谱伤害技能比比皆是：制作组对boss的理解显然还停留在力大砖飞上，所谓的残酷模式就是闭着眼睛填数值，甚至多人打boss的体验远不如单人来的舒适，不仅boss的血量会超级加倍，满场不间断召唤的小怪和额外招式也是恶心至极。

2.后期极度枯燥乏味的物资刷取，以及重复度高达100%的科技树系统。整个游戏前中期还算有些新鲜感，但默认设置的合成材料倍率以及制造时间简直让人不知所谓：造一块铁就需要好几分钟，而建筑和武器又需要消耗大量各种不同的物资，导致时间都花在了反复刷取材料等待合成上面。每进入下一个科技阶段，材料其实只是换了个名字以及更加麻烦的获取方式，甚至还得手动去翻箱倒柜的刷取一些进阶材料，才能获得批量制造的许可。如此无聊的重复作业，以及套娃一般合成配方一直持续到了通关为止。此外，游戏后期还有许多明显只是为了拉长游戏时间的恶心设计，例如武器碎片、宝珠随机词条的刷取，还有限时的大地图关卡，每次只能刷取少的可怜的暗影碎片，用量却又多的吓人。

3.为了所谓的pvp平衡性而牺牲的pve体验。这一点是最让人无法理解，游戏内看似有多个法术体系和流派，还有多种武器装备，按理说应该能够支持自由度非常高的bd系统，但制作组侧重pvp的莫名自信让几乎绝大部分的法术都变成了换皮的垃圾，boss无脑免疫控制更是让部分法术显得有些小丑。相似的模板换个颜色改一改词条，就又是一个新法术了；只能装备两个法术的底层逻辑让构筑毫无自由可言，更加不存在什么所谓的法术之间的combo，数值给的也是无比保守，简直是生怕玩家打怪打爽了。

4.不合理的奖励解锁顺序。这游戏的法术是按照等级123的顺序来解锁的，打赢特定的boss可以给一个指定等级的技能点，而每个等级的法术又有好几个——制作组看似贴心地让你有选择优先解锁的权利，但实际上后解锁的技能本就是被玩家淘汰下来的，装备栏又只有两个，导致后解锁的技能点处在一个食之无味，弃之可惜的尴尬境地，塞进boss奖励里多少有些敷衍。此外，游戏的装备分为了不同流派，而高级的衣服也是需要打boss解锁的。策划的大智慧就体现在，他们非常贴心地给你安排了一个线性的解锁顺序，保证你在当前阶段只能先穿着没有任何词条的白板衣服去打boss，然后依次解锁制造台、制造材料1、制造材料2...直到你打完了前面所有的boss，都快要通关这个章节了，你才能做出一套完整的衣服。而这套衣服还没有焐热，当你们打完章节头目后，恭喜你——新的上位白板衣服又出现了，快拿着它去挑战下一章的新boss吧。

...其实还有不少零零散散的槽点，一时半会也想不起来/懒得写了，那就先这样吧。这个游戏明明有不少的优点，但在诸多槽点的结合之下，我的游玩体验并不是很好。考虑到它并不是一个半成品，而是已经开发了多年的游戏，部分问题的出现更是让人难以理解...好消息是目前制作组貌似还在继续更新游戏，这一点确实值得肯定。只能说，希望它早日成为一个更加优秀的游戏吧。 | Bir oyunun grindi bile hiç sıkmaz mı? Bu oyunun sıkmıyor. Atmosferi, combat mekanikleri, base tasarlaması vs. her şeyiyle 10/10. Bayılıyorum sana V Rising. | V Rising é um jogo incrível e muito divertido. Ele oferece uma experiência completa, com a possibilidade de construir castelos lindos e personalizados. É extremamente satisfatório, especialmente quando você derrota um boss depois de várias tentativas. A sensação de conquista é única e torna cada vitória ainda mais gratificante | 이 게임을 비추하는 사람들의 글을 읽어본 결과 공통적으로 게임 내에서 다 제공되는 기능으로 해결이 가능한 부분입니다. 입맛에 맞게 조율할 수 있도록 설계가 되어있는데 자기들이 매운맛 시켜놓고 맵다고 찡찡대는데 순한 맛으로 드시면 됩니다. 기본 맛은 매울 수 있는건 인정합니다. 저는 추천이지만 비추 글만 읽는 사람이 오해할까봐 비추에 적습니다.

Почему Dune: Spice Wars заработала Shiro Games существенно меньше денег, чем Northgard или хотя бы Wartales?

Думаю, дело в следующем:

1. Сложнее въехать (чем в другие работы Shiro). Надо провести хотя бы часов 5-6. И сходу непонятны не только мелкие нюансы, а целые механики.

2. Это не римейк той самой Dune 2. Нет танков, ракетниц, выдуманных Ордосов и много чего ещё. Так уж получилось, что совершенно неканоническая разработка Westwood для многих игроков является первоисточником.

3. Это не особо похоже на Northgard. Вернее, совсем непохоже.

4. Это не RTS, а стратегия 4X. Может быть не такая навороченная как некоторые представители жанра. Но тут точно не работает никакой раш и типовые для RTS подходы.

А теперь то же самое, но с точки зрения плюсов:

1. Что такое 5-6 часов для 4X? Я в своё время в Civ5 въезжал дольше, а в Stellaris окончательно понял как играть через 30 часов. 5-6 часов - просто идеальное время для понимания стратегии такого типа.

2. Shiro гораздо бережнее поработали с книгами. И эта работа с ограничениями заставила их выверять подходы и особенности до мелочей.

3. Если честно, я Spice Wars полгода боялся запускать. Так как думал, что это рескин Northgard с некоторыми наворотами. Ура, это не он!

4. Кому-то вообще нужна была бы Dune 3000? Серьёзно? Жанр устарел ещё в начале 00-х.

А ещё! Здесь редко бывает больше 10-12 юнитов под контролем - и это заставляет включать голову. Общая медлительность позволяет воевать на 2, а иногда даже на 3 фронта. Есть активная пауза (для соло-игры). Дерево развития выверено до мелочей. Стороны сильно отличаются по фишкам. Графика, стиль и вообще UI в целом - идеал.

Короче, отличная игра. Одна из лучших стратегий, в которые я играл за последнее время. | Interesting to begin with.  The game plateaus very quickly though. Very little replayable value for me.  After a couple of hours it gets tedious.  Boring.  I regret buying this game. | The novel Dune was written during the Cold War, and this game has that aura.

Do not expect a standard RTS. This is a game about statecraft, about cold wars, about the balance of power, about paranoia. Warfare is a continuation of policy by other means- often an inevitable one, but more pursued to deny the enemy victory than to seize it. It's more about medieval-style raids & chevauchées than massive campaigns. The Landsraad and intelligence systems are brilliant. Expect assassinations to be a more common threat than sieges of enemy capitals are.

As an adaptation of the novel within the confines of a Civ-style game, it's excellent. The great dangers of Arrakis, the thirst & the worms, are of both strategic & tactical importance- by which I mean they will destroy your entire army if you slip up. So many of the little details of the world are here as well, down to the Fremen donkeys. The factions from the book are invoked wonderfully in gameplay too- the honor and "honor" of the Atreides, the drugged-up thuggery of the Harkonnen troops, the vicious, vampiric fanaticism of the Fremen, the Corrinos lurking aside, playing one House against another until they can throw down a fortress from orbit and seize the planet for themselves. The additional factions are flavorful too.

I'd recommend this game in particular to those who love the book & its cynical philosophy, and to those who like the idea of games like Civ but want something leaner, quicker, & smarter. 

Note that God created the single-player mode to train for the multiplayer mode. This review has assumed that it's the latter you'll be getting the game for. | Feels great. The environment is very dangerous but fair. Politics works, which is impressive for this kind of game. The factions have good differentiation- Harkonnens oppress their people and throw away their own people to feed the machine. Fremen move easily in the desert but they don't get to vote in politics. Atreides can be very effective politcally and can take villages peacefully. And whoever you are, there are the constant pressures of collecting the Spice. | It's too much like the game Civilization and not enough like DUNE 2000.  

It's not a bad game and i can even see how it could have become oddly addicting for many people but for me personally it doesn't really have what i want to satisfy me.  The biggest issue is the lack of strategy involved for how you set up your base/territories.  In fact there is very little actual decision making that goes into your base setup at all.  Instead it's a repetitive process of taking over preexisting villages, then haphazardly placing whatever structures you need around it for that given territory depending on which resources the territory has.  It makes zero strategic difference where you place your buildings because they're never attacked anyway.   It's only the Villages themselves that ever come under threat.. which by the way you defend by repetitively hiring militia for every annex'd village.  In this regard, the game is totally brainless and requires no strategic thinking for how you go about setting up your territories.  In DUNE 2000, for example, there was a very satisfying sense of accomplishment for the way you choose to build your base and design it's defenses.  Spice Wars just doesn't have that.

There is a lot more i could say both negatively and positively about the game but it's mostly the lack of strategy and satisfaction that comes with conquering territories that bothers me.

This game is cool! It has a clever way of bundling cards with car upgrades and allowing you to customize constantly.  The strategy is pretty solid.  It gets a tad repetative but it's lots of fun and I hope they add complexity via expansions and new game modes. | Yeah, this is an excellent game.

But it isn't without a few bumps and the occasional pothole.

The tutorial doesn't cover some fairly important mechanics and, whilst once you grok how to read the cards things get quite a bit easier, the presentation of the cars is a little lacking in that it isn't clear at first how priorities work, in what sequence certain things happen, and generally, there are quite a few moving parts under the bonnet (hood for our North American friends).

But once you get behind the wheel for a few runs, the handling starts to make sense, and you can put some pretty satisfying builds together. 

I'm a dabbler in deck builders but hardly a committed theory-crafter. I do get the impression that there is less variety of potential builds in this than in some other deckkies, but your mileage may vary. I'm probably not the best to make a definitive judgement on that front.

I'm judging the game purely on whether I enjoyed my time with it, and it's a definite yes.

It's a green light from me!





 | Cool deck builder with mechanics that match the theme, | Jeux sympa, reste quelques bugs malheureusement . | Macht Spaß!^^

TL;DR I would only recommend this for die-hard Borderlands fans.

The pre-endgame is exceedingly easy despite setting the difficulty to "Intense". I never struggled once up until the end game boss. The most difficult parts of earlier games were the burst damage some enemies did that was hard to overcome as a solo. While I am glad they scaled that back in this game, with no other challenge provided the core loop is reduced to holding down M1 until the enemy dies. To top it off, every quest was just "go here press E, go here shoot this, go here press E". It was a bit disappointing. 

Now admittedly this wouldn't be so egregious if there was a gripping story or moment-to-moment writing like Borderlands 2 had, but personally this game fell very flat in that regard. I listened to every dialogue line and did every side quest expecting at least some moments with the same charm as the previous games, but I didn't find any. Perhaps I have simply become jaded, but there were no hard-hitting lines nor engaging plot lines. I lightly chuckled twice the entire game. I never cringed or wondered what the writers were smoking as I did with BL3, but the Wonderlands plot was simply bland.

This isn't to say the entire game is horrible. I like much of the balance changes they made, the art style is charming, and the class system is interesting. The legendary drop rate is lowered in this game compared to BL3, which was desperately needed as they felt a dime-a-dozen in that game. This is balanced out by having your loot luck increase as you progress in the game which I felt fit very well. The new gun types, the few that aren't recycled from BL3 that is, are fun to play with and a welcome addition. And I appreciate the take on classes with a respeccable second class, although I think I still prefer the per-character system from the mainline games.

Should also be mentioned the end game is potentially the best in a Borderlands game so far: a set of repeatable trial chambers which tie closely into the "Chaos Level" system that increases enemy toughness and unlocks better tiers of gear. I have not completed all the Chaos Levels and won't pretend to have beaten each end game in all BL games, but I would like to say that this feels the most replayable and fair.

Overall a game with fun mechanics that falls entirely flat in the story department. | It's an alright game.

Basic borderlands looter shooter concept, but DnD themed.
Skill trees I feel are less impacting than previous iterations of the game.
You can do a dual class system which I like a lot.
The introduction of companions for most classes is cool, but I feel like they fall pretty short, even when trying to spec into them.
The weapons aren't that much different than other borderlands games. With a difference that you can different melee weapons, and a spell equipped. These are nice twists, and spells can be pretty fun with the variety of options.
The story is kind of dull to be honest. Very heavy in dialogue, which I understand it's a DnD game. But you start to tune out after a while.
The gameplay loop isn't really that exciting. The difficulty is pretty moderate with that you can clear most mobs easily, but then you have to play a little tactfully with others.

Overall I'd say it's worth a heavy discount. Definitely never worth the full asking price.

制作者的妈临死前想见他一面，制作者急不可耐放下传送门，上面显示需要等待10分钟

对于泰拉瑞亚的拙劣模仿者 | 建议加一个衣服皮肤栏位，然后更新更多好看的衣服，这样我觉得会吸引更多人来玩。穿着好看衣服的同时，不会影响本身的护甲和属性。 | 这游戏前期确实玩着上头，但是仅限前期，当你玩到后期打到新三泰坦的时候，你就会发现这游戏为了留住玩家做了什么恶心的事情，巨大的世界，频繁无意义的跑图，三块小宝石，找不到就打不了BOSS，不是哥们，我玩游戏还是游戏玩我，我第一次打游戏打到出现疲惫无力的感觉，只能说制作组在恶心玩家这上面是有一手的。 | [i]Core Keeper[/i] initially impresses, but then the diminishing returns reduce the fun factor.

I loved what I saw in Early Access. I decided that this game would be best played with friends once it hit 1.0, so I put it down for Future Me, and Future Us, to experience together.

Early on, it was great. We’re all veterans of [i]Terraria[/i]. In particular, I enjoyed the automation of gathering nodes and sending them along back to base.

But once you crack that initial outer wall open, oh boy, does it get grindy right quick.

You need ten whatsits to create the thingamajig that lets you scan for the boss. Fine, OK. But then you’re going to need 10 whozsamutsises to create the next boss scanning item, unless you want to explore the entirely-too-big map to find the boss on your own. So just adjust your playstyle and preferences accordingly, because you, son, are going to grind, and grind, and grind if you want to participate in this world.

I wasn’t having fun. I felt bad that I recommended this game to my friend group, and when I floated the idea that maybe we should move on to something less grindy, they basically said, “Oh, yeah, absolutely. We were only playing this because we thought you were really into it.” Admittedly, I was. At first.

The map needs to be smaller if this game is going for a boss-rush gameplay model. The grind needs to be lessened if you want people with lives and jobs to be interested. There’s a lot to love about the first handful of hours played, but it’s an absolute fumble after that point. Quite the disappointment. | 太好玩了太好玩了呜呜呜，即使缝合也缝合的非常好，一玩起来根本停不下来啊，我要借我好兄弟20年的寿命接着玩，太好玩了太好玩了

One of the greatest turn-based strategy games of all time, remastered.  A few new heroes added, a few UI tweaks, graphics upgraded, hex-based terrain instead of grid-based.  All in all a complete win of an upgrade.  I bought the original for $50 in 1994 and played it for almost 30 years - now I have a replacement that's worth the name. | Apparently this game was released in 2022 but I've only just got it in 2025. So far so good, it's a solid rework of the original 1994 Master of Magic from Simtex. Pretty 3D graphics, overland and combat maps in hex format and improved UI. Some highlights that I've noted so far:

Pros

A sensible build queue for towns that can be allowed to run and then adjusted as necessary.
Itemised notification of micro-events.
New buildings for previously neglected races e.g. Orcs get the Amplifier (for Nodes) and Fisherman's Hut (Food source).
New races e.g. Goblins are available a Myrror race.
Improved Trading.
New traits to go alongside spellbooks.
New overland/city events with choices!
Spellcasting now results in a micro-event rather than forcing immediate casting.
Fixes for old MoM 'exploits' and 'bugs' such as Endurance extra effects, Cloak of Fear (it works), Floating Island (now flies over land and sea), Earth to Mud, Web et al.
Combat can be player-controlled or familiar-controlled (automatic) as required with percentage success chances provided upfront.
Combat changes to rock-hurling units e.g. Giants, Catapults add extra functionality.

Cons

Occasionally confusing L-click vs R-click inconsistency in UI, not a stopper but can lead to WTF?! moments in combat.
Spell research animations have, disappointingly, not been brought into the 2020's.
Inability to customise city names on founding (or I may have missed how to this).
Inability to customise hero names on summoning/hiring (or I may have missed how to this).
Wonky Diplomacy (something dodgy here).

I have yet to find any serious bugs although to be fair it's early days. What I have found is a solid, entertaining 4X game that builds on the legacy of the original. | Great remake with additional content and the original awesome gameplay. | I've been pretty disappointed with video game remakes in the past. Not this time, in fact I'd say it's the best remake.
Why?
1. It keeps the original mechanics of the game.
2. It has lots new mechanics that are OPTIONAL. But I've tried four different optional updates, including the 2 DLCs, and I gotta say, I loved them and felt they blended in seamlessly. 
3. Allows workshop content.
4. Not buggy. | the audio cuts out and it took almost 20 min to even start a game from booting the game up. it could be my potato of a PC but i have played other games with higher Requirements and it did not run this bad

This game has taught me that I'm absolutely amazing at organizing things. Wow, I feel great about myself. Thank you, devs! | a little to the left is a satisfying puzzle game with fun, creative ways to tidy up but the daily tidy is a drag. doing it for consecutive days gets boring and since it's required for 100% achievements, it ends up feeling more like a chore especially when the puzzles are underwhelming. great game, just wish the daily part wasn’t such a hassle. | I found a lot of the later levels to be unclear as far as the intended sort order or objective.

To quote another reviewer who put it better than I could:

"The game started out strong and I felt satisfied after finishing each level. That wore out too quickly and I felt frustration for the rest of the game. The biggest drawback is the lack of visible anchor points. The game wants the player to pick up items and put them in exact spots to trigger level completion, but the player cannot see those anchor points."

- Puddles | This game scratches an itch i didn't know i had. I want to keep playing this game. I wish it were a bit longer, but I'm glad there's DLC at least | 打折期入手还蛮划算，关卡不算少，个别关卡更像是强迫症？少了一些其他的方案

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Simulation, Early Access
Reviews:
I love this game, I really do.
Unfortunately, the performance of this game has gotten worse with each patch, not better.
So I can't recommend it to anyone as this has been a long standing issue, that I have not seen the devs acknowledge or try to fix. | This game isn't bad, but it's got a long way still to go it's basically raft in a blimp. could use some better tutorials and some quest markers maybe something you can turn off and on if you wanted. there isn't much to do once you've got the cure and the game is still in early access so honestly id say get the game on sale for like 15-20 bucks that's about right for what I got from it. out of 10 id say 5/10 nice middle ground but not enough happening in game for my liking also would be great to get a little polish to movement and some more diversity in environments and some world stuff everything just kinda ends up looking the same this is also true for the life pods if we came form space were's all the cool toys? if it sounds interesting to you check it out on sale but I can't say there's enough here for me to recommend

Oh and two last thing a booster back or something would be great in this game surprised they didn't put it in and some more enemies wouldn't hurt think there's like four in the entire game. | Wife and I are playing game. We have hard time finding good games for both of us. This is a great story and fun to play. It has a bit of everything crafting, searching, looting,  light building. Exploring. It is open world but has a story to follow. | Even in early access, this game is pretty good. The combat and survival systems are serviceable, with the story being unfinished pending the full release. Game atmosphere and base building aspects are fantastic.

Most of my nearly 80 hours in my first *two weeks* of playing was spent building and vibing in my ship. I was absolutely addicted to designing and rebuilding my ship every time I got a new building unlock. I also really enjoyed the game's take on a post-apocalypse Earth. Taking my newly rebuilt ship into the sky to admire the swirling dust below was a regular pastime.

I have exhausted nearly everything there is to do in game currently, so I am now eagerly awaiting the full release. In addition to concluding the story, my wishlist for 1.0 and beyond would be ship presets, cheaper paint, more POIs, and concave hull pieces to make proper airplane bodies. | This game is pretty meh.  It's a tedium simulator and in that regard it does it very well. 

If I was to compare it to other games it would be Raft crossed with Subnautica but without the sharks.  Therein lies the problem:  I miss the sharks.  Eventually you start coming across these Mantis things but combat with them is incredibly janky to the point that I just face tanked them with my knife.

If you enjoyed Subnautica but found that the creatures just got in the way of the story, you'll probably like this game.  If you're expecting a survival game with combat and threats, stay away.

Game Name: Age of Empires IV: Anniversary Edition
Reviews:
I was banned for "map hacking," even though I didn’t cheat—I was simply using the Imperial Spies ability from the Chinese civilization. During the match, I was dominating my opponent, and they started flaming me in chat before reporting me. Somehow, that led to me getting banned.

I submitted a ban appeal, but the response took so long that the ban is effectively over by the time they rejected it. When I asked for more information to understand what triggered the ban and how to avoid it in the future, they refused to provide any details, claiming it would "jeopardize the integrity of their moderation system." As a result, I have no idea what I did that caused the ban.

It’s hard to recommend a game where you can get banned simply because you’re winning and other players report you out of spite. The slow appeal process and lack of transparency make it clear: play at your own risk.

Feel free to review my games if you think I'm lying: https://aoe4world.com/players/8767995-BunBun | 我一个单机玩家你把修改器给封了，是不是有毛病。你要封就封联网玩家就行了，你管我们单机玩家开修改器干吗？我买了这游戏就是当单机来打发时间的，你不允许单机你早说啊。 | When I heard about Age of Empires IV (AoEIV) I couldn't wait to play it, since playing all of the previous entries had gave me one of the most memorable experiences I had ever had in gaming. And here is what I have to say:

I love how AoEIV had taken the time and effort to bring us a historically-accurate stories that are tied to the gameplay. I really enjoyed the aesthetic of it; it certainly makes the game so unique with their colors, their sound design and the way you can experience the gameplay and the cinematics. I think this is the part that I love the most.

Each of the civilizations feel unique, although not as unique as in Age of Empires III (AoEIII), in my opinion, with exceptions, naturally. I think it a bit as a combination between Age of empires II (AoEII) and AoEIII, leaning a little bit towards AoEII, which, by the way, is my favorite Age of Empires due to several reasons. The strategies and battles are surely good and I enjoy having different kinds of the same group of units, each with different functions. The walls' mechanics are also a good addition and adds a lot in terms of strategies and siege.

I know for a fact that many of the updates have solved many of the issues that player the player base have experienced by now and I applaud this; it was actually the bugs that led me to abandon the game some time ago, hoping for it to get better after some updates. And it really happened, even releasing a DLC. Reading this DLC's reviews, which I won't buy at least for now, shows me that AoEIV may be in a limbo where instead of taking advantage of what it is, it is just a bit nervous about the steps they need to follow to earn new and old fans of the series.

One of the things I don't like at all is that there's too little focus on the single-player experience. What I loved about AoEII was the different heroes, scenarios and setting of the campaigns, and that is also one of the things that made AoEII so memorable for many people; the amount of content that you could experience on your own was tremendous and adding the multiplayer was just perfect for all types of players. AoEIV is lacking heavily on this side: there's only half the campaigns for each of the civilizations that you can play. This is, you can't have a designed single-player experience focused on each civilization, which I find upsetting. Even more: I believe that releasing a DLC with single-player DLC-civ's campaigns before having the base game civ's ones is unforgivable.

The game really wants to push you into multiplayer, which, of course, is a big part —maybe even the most important part— of these types of game. And even though I understand why this has been done, I think that leaving the single-player experience ins such a small featuring is something that takes too big a hit on the experience.

Finally, I want to say that I played all the campaigns but I was not able to get one of the achievements due to a long-known bug. The game has been out for years by now and I think that having this bug, something so small, still lingering in the game after all the feedback is so embarrassing. 

With that being said, I think that the game is a good one and for the time I played it I had fun. It obviously had a new and good idea of what to do and what it wanted to be, but I think that the execution is a half-baked product that leaves aside a great portion of the players. I think that the game can continue with this fresh appearance and twist on the series, which I think is amazing, but it also has to take into consideration all of the accomplishments made by previous games to be better that the sum of its parts.

Solid game, but it still needs some work.

6/10 | You either are forced to play at a fast pace or lose. There is no longer a nice build up time, its all action nonstop. I miss my relaxed games and campaigns but devs decided to appeal to the zoomers 0.5s attention span and make the game feel rushed all the time. Going back to AoE2 and AoE3 for slower and relaxed games. | I've played RTS games for 18 years now (started when I was 4 with the original starcraft). I was always horrible at playing multiplayer. This is without the doubt the best RTS game to start playing multiplayer if you always wanted to give multiplayer a shot but were scared of being bad at it (like me!).

The players in ranked and quick matches are not some high level players! For the most part they are like me and you who just play this game for fun and not for being overly competitive. While the campaign is nothing really to write home about (though the cutscenes are pretty cool), I cannot recommend this game enough if you wanted to ever have a go at RTS multiplayer that is not overly sweaty!

But don't just take my word for it! Here is a very great video on the topic if you have some free time: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rl4myN8q_KM&t=3237s&ab_channel=CloudCuckooCountry

Cheers!

There is a big BUT in this review.......
Yes I would recommend it but there is definitely some misleading marketing happening.

THE GOOD:
This is a super easy to use, 3D mapping software with a very intuitive user interface, easy control system, and is over all pleasant to create with. Out of the box you have numerous options that allow you to build any map you like in nearly any setting you like. 

The software also comes with an export feature with allows you to export the map out of Dungeon Alchemist and into the more popular, if not many of the online VTT systems like Foundry VTT and Roll20. 

BUT BUT BUT BUT BUT

THE BAD: 
For all the power this software has, it cannot export 3D maps, meaning you can look at your amazing 3D map all you want in the Dungeon Alchemist software, but don't expect to get it out. Exports will 100% in 2D. I don't know how complex it would be to do this but for all this software does and all this amazing marketing footage....your 3D map is essentially stuck. 

I spoke to one of their Discord mods who said that some people do things with the 3D images to make handouts and other have used the interface as a VTT...but when you consider all of the automation and optimization in a platform like Foundry VTT offers, there is no way I would ever sacrifice all of that just to have a 3D environment. 

HOWEVER.........BACK TO THE GOOD NEWS

Exporting your 3D map into a 2D format does still save you tons of time as the 2D export comes with well placed wall and doors and it all setup for lighting. With the Dungeon Alchemist software having a much smoother and versatile interface then trying to build a map into Foundry VTT, this is still worth the price. 

TLDR: 
I like the software but the the marketing is very misleading. You cannot export 3D maps out of Dungeon Alchemist and all the hype about what it can do in their videos and Steam advertisement is locked to the software itself. The export feature only exports 2D maps. | Muito agradável, facilita demais a criação de mapas de batalha e quando fica sem criatividade ele ajuda com a IA para geração de decoração das salas. Muito bom, recomendo para mestres de RPG. | a really good tabeltop map builder. quite worth the money. 
one thing id personally like more of is more ocean themed items, things like boats and sea shells! 
awesome otherwise. very fun to just play around with. | Saves me a great deal of time prepping maps for my two DnD campaigns. Looking forward to more additions, especially multistory. | Worth all the money spent - not only the functionality of the program itself but also access to a workshop where a bunch of talented people do what is really missing. I use it to create maps for my dnd campaign - city district, port, ship map (there were difficulties but in principle it is realizable). There are rare glitches in the work, and sometimes lacks some functionality, but all that is needed already as I realized there is in the project roadmap so I am calm.

A lovely story driven game with pretty visuals, breathtaking music and lots of love poured into it. 
I highly recommend using a controller for the platforming and just overall feel.
While hunting for collectibles, I was really happy about the menu showcasing if I had gotten everything from each area. Same thing with the chapter selection after I had finished playing the game! | 对我来说这游戏比起游戏性更大的价值是了解萨米族文化，打折才10块钱，要什么自行车啊

游戏体验不是很好，手残+电脑太破一卡一卡的，拼尽全力无法战胜，而且看网上的评论好像游戏更新还把跳跃距离改短了，打得像吃了屎一样难受，游戏大部分流程都在跑路，如果在跑路中多加一点能让人享受的内容就好了，8章之后本人的破电脑已经卡成了ppt，最后两章是看攻略视频云的，但话又说回来10块钱要什么自行车啊
玩（云）下来对萨米族的很多文化和生活细节有了一个大致的了解，希望能有更多宣传原住民文化的游戏的所以给好评，其实可以再多塞一点民族文化的内容进去的，听说有续作，期待

以下是一些借题发挥的内容
========================
欧亚大陆北部的游猎民族具有极高的相似性，形成了一个独特的文化圈
这个文化圈包括日本的阿伊努、中俄的鄂温克和鄂伦春、北欧的萨米等等
（特别是使鹿鄂温克和萨米人同样驯养驯鹿，相似度非常高）
而在近现代，被国界所分割的这一文化圈中的各民族面临着相同的境遇，即作为边缘文明被歧视、被消解、被主流文化所同化的境遇
近年来，原住民的身份和权利问题逐步得到重视，许多人也在努力复兴原住民的文化
不仅通过文字、音频、影像等记录“过去的文化”，更重要的是创作出了依然活着的、依然在被传承的原住民文化
这个游戏正是这样的产物，制作组从身为萨米人的文化自觉出发，以游戏这一较新的媒体阐释自己的文化，是前所未有的创作
无论最终成果如何，这一努力都是弥足珍贵的。

初次了解萨米族是很多年以前偶然听到萨米族歌手Mari Boine的歌，像是把北欧的森林和土地都浓缩在旋律里一样，陌生却带有奇异的乡愁
多年以后又玩到这样的作品，能感受到一代又一代的人们为了保存自己的文化正不断努力着
给原住民文化的存续这一（我认为）充满哀伤的话题带来了一点希望的色彩。
真好，萨米人依然是充满生命力的民族呢。

[strike] 如果鄂温克也能有这样的作品就好了 [/strike] | Samisk
Lots of bugs, especially with achievements, causing me to have to do a lot of replaying and trying to determine what will actually give me progress.

I absolutely love Limbo, Inside, and Cocoon. This game falls flat. Lacking in story and quality gameplay. The single word that I feel summarizes this game the best is: Tedious. | Просто пустая бессмыслица в сюжете.
Пустая трата времени. | + графически интересная и вайбовая

очень сомнительный экспириенс | ※無駄に長い文章ですがお勧め度に比例はしてません！

２.５DのＳＦ・インタラクティブ・雰囲気・ウォーキングシム。
INSIDEっぽい映像表現は美麗ですがゲーム性は酷かった。
言語は一切なし、ガイドを見ながらやり直したので７時間強。
物語のテーマは「未知との遭遇とコミュニケーション」。
言語無しはエイリアンと言葉が通じないことを強調するため？

内容：エイリアンのせいで家族とはぐれたので探そう
操作：横スクロール２.５D、面によっては奥行きが追加
方法：WASDで移動＋マウスの左右クリック。単純すぎが罠。
良い：アート（映画的演出や、暗めの落ち着いた絵柄）
悪い：たくさん（足遅すぎ、導線が不明瞭、操作しづらい）

感想：ゲームとしてはAlien‥アリえんが映像美で大満足
言語が全くないので、解釈は想像にゆだねられています。
操作性が酷いのを我慢しつつ進み、エイリアンに侵略されてあちこちもうダメぽ‥とわかるあたりで「これはたぶん、JAMを防げなかった地球の未来に違いない！」と３０年ぐらい前に読んだ戦闘妖精・雪風が思い浮かび、がぜんやる気がでてきました。むしろ製作者が雪風のOVAを知ってるんじゃあるまいな‥と思うくらい、エイリアンの無生物的表現がゴンゾのアニメに似ています。
人間のキャラ絵は似てなくて幸い。おっさん万歳。
終盤に出るエイリアンとの関係は雪風＆同じ作者の「今宵、銀河を杯にして」やボンズのアニメ「KURAU Phantom Memory」、コミュニケーション方法はスタニスワフ・レムの「エデン」、能力は「ソラリス」を彷彿とさせ‥などと書くと私のＳＦの好みやアニメオタクっぷりがバレそうだ。

ギミックは平凡なわりに扱いにくいのですが、雰囲気が超好みなので機嫌よく時速１kmで疾走していたら死にました。何度も。
引き返してもダメだ死。どこに行けばいいか分からない死。
隠れる場所は見えない死。キャトル光線が、うおっまぶ死。
自力をあきらめ、ガイドを見ながら風景を楽しむことにしました。

操作はひたすら移動をグニグニ押しながらクリックするだけなのに判定が変で指がつりそう、猛烈にストレスがたまる。
終盤の味方が出現するシーンのあまりのカッコよさに夜中に「なにこれぇ！？」と大声を上げ、大急ぎて録画ソフトを立ち上げ、カッコいいシーン見たさに爆笑しながらわざと何度も死んでリスタートし続けたくらい精神がやられました。医者はどこだ。

エンディング分岐は分かるわけがないのでガイド必読。
「理解して解説できる人は何者だよ‥」と思うくらい途中に出てきた落書きやボールちゃんたちに意味不明な意義がありました。
最初から分かって探す方がゲーム性が上がったのに残念すぎ。
スタート画面でコンティニューを選べばエンディング直前に戻るので、分岐と実績を回収するのは理屈上は簡単です。
ただし肝心のラストが一番、操作性が悪いというダメっぷり。
良くない個性を最後まで遺憾なく発揮してくれました。

ラスト操作：スペースキー押しっぱなしで左右と手をつないだままにする／自分の番になるまで少し待つ／クリックは長押ししてから離す、をタイミングよく／時間内に既定の回数光らせないと無効。

結論：アートやＳＦが好きな辛抱強い人ならOKかも
本作で戦闘妖精・雪風を思い出し、近況はどうかのぅ、完結までどうか作者も私もイ㌔‥と調べたら単行本のみ既刊の
「アグレッサーズ　戦闘妖精・雪風」の文庫＆Kindle版が数日前に出たことに気づいた！！　わーい、わーい、ばんじゃーい！！！
‥‥何のレビューでしたっけ。 | I remember when this game was announced on steam before it was launched I was extremely excited to play it (I had no idea it can only be played with controller however) lots of negative reviews flooded in from early on, so I waited for a while ended up purchasing it in a big discount wait for a opportunity until someday I could play it, got myself a steam deck and it plays pretty decent I must say. :)) 

I will say, this game didn’t disappoint me, story was really good and puzzles. I don’t normally do much 100% achievements on games unless I really liked the story and if the gameplay was easy to play of course. Actually a few hidden spots I didn’t know until I finished all the achievements for it I was surprised how much I missed.

The gameplay is very similar puzzles to limbo or inside, the vibe of the game really reminded me of War of the Worlds scenario  got a few jump scares! 

Also the end-game will easily go to the bad ending story for you. HINT to remember all the interactions with your robot aliens you met along the way remember the colours they make, note it down to it, it’ll give you different endings if you don’t want to look up guides to find the different endings. 

I also saw someone mentioned the game was based on UK, and said the festival area is the main feature from a town :) thought that was cool. Happy gaming! <3

This game is so funny that my sister saw me playing it for five seconds on facetime (the infinite hole daydreaming scene) and came down and played entire thing in one sitting while I sat next to her and watched. Nice way to spend the day with her we both laughed basically for four or five hours straight | The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe
[B]Mé celkové hodnocení: [95%][/B]

[B]KLADY:[/B]
+ jedinečná hra příběhem i vyprávěním
+ množství endingů, easter-eggů, secretů...
+ dokonalý vypravěč
+ děj mě nepřestával překvapovat

[B]CELKOVÉ SHRNUTÍ:[/B]
Velmi často ve hrách zkouším jít přesně na opačnou stranu, jestli tam náhodou něco není. Kliknu na všechny dveře, co kdyby se náhodou nějaké neotevřeli? Skáču tam, kam se očividně doskočit nemá, neposlouchám hinty a doufám, že na to hra nějak zareaguje...

The Stanley Parable je hra, která [B]konečně[/B] s tímto vším počítá a ještě víc. Jak říkám, je až neuvěřitelné co vše fungovalo, ačkoliv jsem si říkala "S tímto určitě nikdo z vývojářů nepočítal. To nemůže přeci fungovat..." A ejhle...

Vypravěč a průvodce hrou je naprosto dokonalý a je vidět, že měl možnost se při dabingu vyblbnout dosytosti ❤️ Stejně tak všechny srandičky, nápady, tajemství, kterými je hra doslova prolezlá skrz naskrz, jsou děsně cool, originální, výstřední, nečekané...

Pro mě naprosto jedinečný herní zážitek, první hra svého druhu. Zpracovaná dokonale a vyprávěná rovněž tak.

Genres: Adventure, Indie, RPG, Strategy, Early Access
Reviews:
A fantasy rpg meets HOMM, together they meet great writing and stunningly colorful pixelart and while not skiping on a lovely retro atmosphere, they all meet modern UX. What's there not to like about it? | I played for a bit over one hour and I want to share my positive initial impressions. 
The pixel art is a true joy for the eyes, I often stopped to just stare at the environment for entire minutes and enjoyed all the little details. I need to have this on my desktop as an animated wallpaper!
The beginning of the story is catchy, with good narrative enhanced by a great voice acting. That was a real surprise, it's rare to find full voice acting in indie games. It does a great deal for the immersion and I must compliment the devs and the actors.
I enjoyed the exploration and my first combat sessions, and I'm looking forward to see how the RPG elements develop.
The only -minor- issue I found is that a few UI elements seemed not in their intended position after changing resolution, as if they ended up slightly shifted. This didn't affect the experience at all and it's important to remember the game is in Early Access.
Now if you excuse me, I'll go back to Anchorage, adventure awaits! | Very solid foundations for the game. A bit of early access indie dev syndrome here and there with interactibles missing tooltips, or buildings claiming functionality that isn't implemented yet such as investing resources to upgrade your units. At least, if that's supposed to be implemented I haven't figured it out because the buildings are non-interactible once constructed and the corresponding landmarks don't seem to have any purpose.

But beyond that I feel like there's more to this game than advertised. I'm several hours in to the replayable campaign and frankly it doesn't seem that short to me as I've barely even left the first zone. A game of Jebus Cross in HoMM3 would've been done by now. It's also innovating a lot more on the HoMM formula than I expected, combining it with card and RPG mechanics in combat rather than stacks, and not having strategic turns like you're zooming around in your nwcnebuchadnezzar. An animation speed option for those lengthy cross-map treks would be nice though. | The core gameplay loop seems to be clicking past dialogue in order to be rewarded with more dialogue to click past

I didn't like the mix of Heroes combat with card-based combat. I think doing one or the other but not both would be better | Very cool game reminiscent of the original King's Bounty with a touch of HOMM, AOW, and Disciples 2. It's exploration and adventure based, with turn-based battles, with characters you can recruit during the story and add to your party.

The world is extremely fresh and creative and beautifully depicted in pixel art. What a cool new setting for a fantasy game at a time when most fantasy worlds are getting more and more samey and cookie cutter. Here you can play as humans/merfolk, wild nature based beasts, mysterious otherworldly cultists, or advanced techy cyborgs. All the factions are very creative, interesting, and distinct. The characters all have tons of personality and charm and you can role play your leader's background and personality and develop the story however you choose.

There are some bugs and jank but that is to be expected at this point in development. Super impressive entry from an indie developer and I'm very excited to see where this game goes during Early Access.
To say it clear: For me it is one of the best games of all times.

Not a hard game on any of its aspects, but it works and feels good, be it for mostly any of its features.

A fun distraction.

I just wish it would have been an easier setup (controls wise) on the Steam Deck. | It's good.  It has modular building, something I wish Starsector had.  Only gripe is that it's limited in how much content their is, I was really hoping it would have some sort of NG+ or Infinite Progression given the whole "Multiverse" thing that's going on with it.

Hope that's remedied in the future. | Top down space fighters are a dime a dozen.  This one separates itself from the pack.  Looks great, combat is great, ship building is great, exploration is great AND writing is great.  I really enjoyed the story and commentary by my crew.  I'd say 8/10. | Good, well balanced game. Length is fine, story is good, lore is exceptional | Fun game, would say this is a 30 hour title before you get tired of the gameplay loop.  This is much so a read for lore and where decisions have consequences.  If you like reading books and playing at your pace solo its a fun starship game.

What a neat game! One of my favourites from Sokpop, for sure! The map is very neat and I like the idea of there being this tiny fantasy world to have a tiny adventure in. The Lich glitched on one of my run and only started spawning tentacles once I lost a fight against it, getting later similarly stuck in another place. Other than that & some other glitches I had a great time. | I played this over and over again with my friend. Such a great RPG!

I have been looking for an RPG of this style for close to 8 years now. I have been going through a nostalgia kick lately and Castle of the Winds was one of my favorite older RPG's. The simplisic yet strategic fighting style was something very few games manage to incorporate correctly. I'm not a fan of the rogue-like where you continuously make new characters. I really would love to see a second game in the series or a completely different game with the rpg elements in Of Blades and Tails. Seriously great work I'm so happy with this purchase | Too much bugs, and not minor ones. It's just frustrating when you get stuck in combat without being able to do anything ( both you and enemies are frozen still and no items or actions can be used ), resulting in you having to restart the game and lose all the items as it counts as dying. Maybe think about adding a manual save option to somewhat bypass the completely broken game logic and design. | Game has a lot of potential. Can't wait to see if there is future content added. | It's a fun turn based RPG
No Reviews

I don't have money to buy any more of them right now, but I've looked through your other games, and they all sound incredible. Your games are super unique and creative, I hope you keep making them! I love the concept, and the graphics are gorgeous. I hope to get 'Star Explorers' next time. | Вы видите картинку, вы читаете описание про олдскул 80'х. Всё это есть. Всё соответствует, игру рекомендую...

Но непонятно, зачем же всё буквально делать, как на заре жанра. Тогда ведь просто технологии были убогими, а некоторые "quality life" моменты ещё не придумали, зачем убирать из игры простые, логичные механики , появившиеся позже? Олдскул хорош "по духу", а не по "букве технического исполнения". Графика- пусть её. Но бинд кнопок для разного активного оружия и фонаря - это не сломает ваш олдскульный опыт, а сделает его более прикольным. И смена топора на молот , при прокладке пути сквозь заросли, где камни чередуются деревьями станет приятным. А то что я посекундно должен делать 5 лишних движений, чтобы сменить топор на молот- это убого!
Эта игра будит воображение и желание, чтобы кто-то с наличием нормального бюджета, воплотил такой вот "олдскул" в жизнь на современный лад, как это когда-то сделал Гримрок! Чтобы сохранили этот вот геймплей данжен-краулинга в странных местах и подземельях, но при этом графон получше, поатмосфернее смогли вытянуть, и механики для удобства игры сделали! Я могу стерпеть этот олдскул с пустыми домами, где в 4 стенах или вообще пусто или там крыса или пара ящиков, чтобы разбить или гордо стоит в пустой комнате однотипный НПС, я могу это стерпеть, но хочется большего, современого, а нету. Печалька( | Very fun little adventure game with light rpg mechanics. The quests really encourage you to interact with the world and its people; You almost forget that it's a tile game. The controls are fun to use, although I found my hands cramped up after a while. Certainly worth the money I payed for it. | Very enjoyable. | Amazing game!

Let me say this first: this was not my type of game. I did not enjoy the gameplay, the controls were a clunky sometimes and the ending was unsatisfying. However, the graphics were well-done, same with the atmosphere. For this reason, I can't say I would not recommend this game to someone who enjoys these types of games. | This game was obviously made by people who love Another World. It has a great story, great atmosphere, no scroll (moving forward screen by screen), it uses cinematics for deaths, ...

The puzzles are mostly easy, with a few exceptions. But, it's not a game only focused with puzzles, so they are not extremely relevant.

On the other hand, the character movement and her movement reactions are a bit slow, which is a bit frustrating when enemies are following you or you need to react quickly to avoid any danger.
 | A small sized cinematic platformer that you can finish in about 3 hours. It's incredibly on point when it comes to recreating the vibe of the 16bit wave of the genre. I think it could've gone for longer, specially since the last third of the game is when it starts introducing more original imagery and situations. It's consistently good, but nothing outstanding.

If the developers keep making cinematic platformers in this vein, I bet they could make a classic. They just need to cut down the time you spend in ventilation vents, focus more on dynamic/original situations, and double the length. As it is, Full Void is neat. A nice time. I would easily recommend it if you crave a game in the same gameplay and visual style as Flashback and company. Could've been more, but it's still really cool to get a game like this when Inside/Planet of Lana and other modern approaches are dominating the subgenre.
 | Spent 4 great hours and gotta tell you this:
If you like Another world (out of this world) or Flashback, you will definitely like this one.......

Genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
Reviews:
I used to play this. A lot, as you can see from the playtime. Most of the time I spent in the game was in 2022-23. I had a good group of people I played with and the servers were full of great people. We didn't really know what we were getting into, however, and eventually we all started playing less and less. Mostly because we realized that this isn't really a game. It's a job that you can pay your employer for the privilege of playing. You either pay to skip the grind or you perform ridiculous amounts of fetch quests and spam the 'G' (interact) key. I'm not kidding when I'm saying there are things that you need to do hundreds to thousands and tens of thousand times. There is an 'island soul' that has a less than 1% chance to drop from a pouch that has a less than 1% chance to drop from a mob. I don't know what the math on that works out to exactly, but googling says in the thousands of hours.

Gear 'honing' has abysmal success rates and you lose materials on every attempt. The honing materials are tiered and each level requires a different material so all your old mats are virtually worthless when you move up a tier. Drop rates for 'collection' items are extremely low and many mobs, bosses, events, and/or islands only spawn once or twice a day/week, so collection can take hundreds of hours for a single item.

Every system in the game is designed to take as much time as possible, every single day, unless you pay. Even if you pay, the time gates and drop rates stay the same, so you still have to grind. Beyond the currency bloat, there are also 4+ XP systems you need to grind.

I stopped eventually because of the sheer grindiness and utterly ridiculous currency and loot box mechanics. I came back recently because I heard some of the newer updates reduced the grind and simplified the currency. I thought I'd take a look and see whether it was worth coming back to.

I should not have. The grind is all still there and, if anything, is worse. The currency has been simplified a bit but it is still ridiculous. There is still silver, gold, crystals, royal crystals, pirate coins, open seas coins, pheons, shards, fragments, and probably others that I've just forgotten. There are six different 'profession' currencies that you have to collect and each of them has multi tiered rarities. You can convert between all of these at awful (like 10 to 1) exchange rates. There are sinks for all of them everywhere.

Despite simplifying some things, they've added whole new systems to make things even more grindy and confusing. These systems have new fetch and farm quests and use different materials that you need to use that have low drop and conversion rates. It's just more of the same.

Trying to play content from before the endgame is hit or miss because people are simply not there and the content is not accessible by just one person. You can ask in chat and you might get lucky, but there is very little incentive for an end-game character to help out with content that they probably haven't touched in years. There is a 'solo' mode option for some pre-endgame content, which can be useful, but it's a little laughable having a 'solo' mode anything in an MMO.

I could try to find a guild and try out discord to get some older, wider content done, but that doesn't solve the grind and loot box issues this game has. I don't mind grinding for an item, but grinding for just a chance at an item is a special level of hell.

There are some nice people still playing and you might be able to connect with them in game or over discord and get some things done if you are new or returning, but if you value your time, money, and sanity, don't. Pick another MMO. | Quiero aclarar que el juego en si es muy bueno, el problema es que no recomendaría este juego a un jugador nuevo, ya que solo puedes jugar a este juego y disfrutarlo siendo nuevo jugador si tienes amigos que ya jueguen de antes y tengan personajes muy avanzados. Los jugadores nuevos son muy fácilmente identificables, siendo muy difícil que te inviten a grupos para poder realizar el contenido final del juego. Por otro lado, es un juego extremadamente exigente respecto a las horas necesarias dedicadas al día, por lo tanto, es necesaria una inversión de horas extremadamente elevada para que puedas jugar de manera autónoma, pudiendo ser frustrante para muchos jugadores nuevos. | This game suffers a major struggle as one that is developed by a Korean development company and published by an American company who pushes the game updates from KR to the western version of the game. The publisher has no power or will to transform the new (or current) player experience in a meaningful, permanent way that will help them ascend to the relative power levels of veteran players.

One of the best examples: Gearing a character in this game requires collections of 'cards' for card sets which are a huge component of damage or support power for players. As such, it requires too much time commitment and/or money for new players to get to a point where they are comfortably playing endgame content with veteran players or normal consistent raid lobbies at all due to this huge missing chunk of damage or support power.

Due to the nature of raid leaders being able to inspect the full range of gear for applicants to raid lobbies, many players will be rejected because of their lack in raid power. Due to the difficulty and dps checks of some raids, the lower power players will have a hard time clearing raid content with each other at all even if they do make their own lobbies.

The developers did make content called 'solo raids' which can be completed for some of the relevant gear materials, but due to the content release schedule of the game, players are never quite able to catch up because their rate of growth is too slow.

By the time a newer player is ready to play a newer raid, most of the population will have moved on to a newer raid, and a fresh player will not have an easy time finding a raid group in the Lobby Finder that will help them learn an older raid. The older raids are referred to as 'homework', and players are often expected to already have played and farmed the raid enough by that time, so as not to hold back the players who want to complete this 'homework' raid for their needed gold.

Speaking of gold, the Western version of the game is suffering from very high economic inflation due to the rampant and seemingly unstoppable plague of gold farming bots. Korea doesn't suffer from this issue because their game client requires a Korean SSN to verify identity. Steam has no such requirements, so bot accounts can be made in mass volumes to this day.
It's against the terms of service for players to purchase gold from these bots, but they continue to do so and purchase (from the Auction House) either large volumes of honing materials or high value gear which also happens to be in high demand from the general population.

Lost Ark at its core was such a cool game and I'm happy to have played it since launch, but as of Feb2025 it's not hard to see that this game's publisher (Amazon Game Studios) and/or developers (Smilegate) continue to betray its audience at large by not acknowledging core issues at all or addressing them in a timely manner.

There are other issues I'm sure I forgot to mention, but needless to say I can't recommend this game for any new or current players at this time. | i love the game, but management is  the worst you can get in MMO. 
IF you looking for developer or publisher communications, feedback review and improvements, addressing community needs and adapting to changing economy, meaningful monetization and much more, this is not a game for you to play! 
The only way to play it is wait for progression event -> choose the class you like -> do some solo content (raids). Rest of the game is completely out of touch with reality and will never be improved no matter how hard you wanted it to, User can never be heard! | Strongly do not recommend this game. If you are a returning player even with purchase of starter pack you will get falsely banned for botting. LEVEL 5 by the way the highest degree of cheating. My friend has max 20 hours on this game and has not logged on since 2022 so tell me how they botted? They have 10 gold to their name at most like please be for real?

When he submitted an appeal, it got denied within 3 minutes. So you're telling me someone actually took a look at his account and determined it as a denial IN 2 MINUTES? I really don't understand.
