Reviews: No Reviews

Nice progression and pleasant pixel art. Overall a simple and beautiful introduction to Tactical RPGs. | Pretty cool game. I like the overall concept but feel like the game is a bit too much of a stat check rather than a game about strategizing my lineup of folks. Would definitely appreciate differences in enemy design which would encourage building different comps rather than just, more simply, brute forcing the game by upgrading the equips of my existing folks | you can finish the game in 6 hours... and I don't see much replayability (maybe challange modes). However, it is worthy. Most of professions seems a bit useless, unless you upgrade the character and in this game I think it could cost you the match

Türkçe anlıyor anasına sövünce saldırıyor çok güzel oyun | This game needs more balance, it's still good for what it is though. Items are way too expensive and you lvl up very slowly. I feel the slow progression and expensive items are a huge turn off to wanting to grind/play more. I enjoy the fact that this game is way more scary than Phasmophobia but I do wish it shared some mechanics like exp and money earning being mirrored. I hope we get updates and more exploration with items and item lvls. The elephant in the room is the fact that this game is a lot like phas, but way better on the thrill/scare side. However, it definitely lacks in other areas but I could see the devs trying and experimenting with future updates. | Game is scary the first time you play but is slow to progress and a bit repetitive because of it. Overall, I wouldn't recommend - especially if you're looking for something in-depth like Phasmophobia. | Se vc está se perguntando se este é um jogo igual ao Phasmophobia, não, ele não é. Além dos gráficos serem melhores, ele tem muito mais jumpscares (que são os eventos), e realmente dá um frio na espinha nas primeiras 1000 partidas que vc jogar. Também tem missões adicionais q vc pode fazer depois de votar no fantasma e fogem do padrão Phasmophobia. | I really wanted to like this, but after learning that AI is being used I cannot abide playing this literally at all. I've requested a refund, and it makes me really sad! I love Phasmophobia and wanted another immersive sort of game like it, and it really seemed like Demonologist would have been it - but it wasn't.

The graphics are pretty but that's literally where it begins and ends. The game is laggy as hell with frequent frame drops, despite the fact I have 48GB of ram and a 4080 Nvidia graphics card. I have a 1GB upload and download speed and experienced connectivity issues as well. 

I played for about an hour, everything is completely scripted and every time we'd go in to play, it was repetitive to the point I was desensitized by the second round. The customization is bare bones and everything felt like a cheap asset flip. I feel like I was scammed and is honestly an ugly rip off of Phasmophobia, designed to allure long-time players into buying the product in hopes of having a fresh but familiar experience. It wasn't. 

Everything about the game was incredibly unintuitive, to the point that we had to go to outside sources to even figure out what each object was and how to use it. There was no tutorial, or if there was - it's unintuitive enough to where I could not find it.

I genuinely do not mind the overused assets and animations, it doesn't really bother me! If it can be used well and I can have an enjoyable experience, then whatever! But the collected experience of everything that it did poorly and nothing done well (hell not even optimized) I cannot support this. 

I don't care if this is a one-man or small dev team. You can hire an artist to do the work that was generated by fugly ass AI. Honestly with it attempting to shamelessly ride the coattails of Phasmophobia instead of attempting to innovate, I should have known better! If you have any respect for uniqueness or creativity, then don't buy this.

Well, that was a 10/10. Highly recommended to puzzle amateurs.

++ great art with a warm colour palette
++ interesting "translation" mechanics, mixed with minigames and stealth segments
++ right length and pacing
++ a touching story on the theme of the tower of Babel, with an optimistic twist. It's told in a minimalist way, mostly with environmental storytelling
+ puzzles are on the easy side, but still satisfying to solve. 
+ no missable or stupid achievements if you're into that | Un petit bijou indé et français, comme on aimerait en voir plus souvent !
Cinq langues et cinq cultures très différentes, à découvrir au travers de tableaux, d'interactions, de jeux, d'énigmes et d'infiltration dans des environnements très variés.
Avis aux amoureux de la linguistique, vous allez vous régaler comme jamais ! | I started playing this game for fun linguistics puzzles; I was not expecting the end to feel so cathartic. I will definitely be replaying it, but it would be nice to somehow play it for the first time again. | Beautiful, smooth graphics and great puzzles! I got stuck on a non-linguistic puzzle here and there, but overall it was the perfect difficulty for a casual puzzle lover (I love puzzle games, but I'm usually not very good at the harder ones). I especially loved the parts where I got to translate/interpret between the cultures, and the fact that not just the characters/vocabulary changed between them, but also the grammar. | What a wonderful experience! I stood up and clapped as the end credits rolled.

[I]Chants of Sennaar[/I] is a somewhat challenging puzzle adventure game with very little hand-holding. There's much joy to be had in exploration, experimentation, and figuring things out for yourself. Most prominently, you must decipher foreign languages, specifically their orthography, grammar, and even meanings in translation. That might sound like a poor fit for a video game, but the mechanics for it are sensible and comprehensible.

The story is unveiled in layers (literally!) and is enticing from beginning to end. Every veneer you peel off reveals something new, interesting, and often delightful.

The presentation is simple but beautiful, comprising expressive animations, alluring color palettes, and wonderful music pieces.

If I have to complain about something, it's the controller interface. It can be a bit tedious to sort through the many orthographic symbols. Also, picking directions and objects can be finicky. I have a feeling that most playtesting was done with mouse and keyboard. But this blemish did not affect my pleasure, and I should emphasize that it's absolutely playable with a controller, even if it's not always ideal.

What a lovingly crafted and satisfying game! [I]Chants of Sennaar[/I] is an instant classic and a must-play for fans of puzzle adventure games.

really short and lacks the content, replay ability, and overall game play that all the other games had, wish I could recommend but there is no world were this serves to live up to the kingdom name, would have preferred if they worked more diligently on the games already released or the 4th traditional game in the series. For games that are infinitely repayable I would appreciate a focus on content than story, even so the story was very cookie cutter and disappointing at best and almost a joke at its best, this whole game seems like a half-hearted leap into new grounds and while I appreciate the effort none of them hit there marks and it ended up sacrificing a lot of what made kingdom so great. I look forward to seeing future releases but besides the amazing art and aesthetics this was a miss for me, | Good game if you've never played Kingdom before. Boring and basic if you have. Imho, Eighties is basically an episodic and linear story that has the gameplay of a stripped down, nearly naked Kingdom game. I'm recommending it because the game somewhat accomplishes what it advertised. I'm assuming most of us who are buying this are probably Kingdom fans though; if you are, change and reduce your expectations to have an enjoyable experience.

As a standalone, Eighties can be an okay purchase if you're looking to play a simple, story-forward game that you can definitely finish in less than 10 hours (in normal mode). Just buy it at a discount lol. It's for you if you enjoy a game with light plot, great aesthetics and soundtrack, and limited gameplay. Also, consider that there's not a lot of replayability. Once you've reached the end and have watched all of the cutscenes, the game is over. There's nothing left to do or explore. And even if you play it again, you don't make any active choices to change the course of the story so its not like you'll unlock a new type of ending. You either defeat the greed or restart at some level. And sure, even though all of the other Kingdom games are like this, the heavy emphasis on the story makes Eighties feel way more concluded and final once you get to the end. 

For Kingdom fans (especially Two Crowns fans who enjoy the other DLC), like no. There's no easy way to play Eighties and not compare its lack of features to previous iterations. Many of the unique features you'd find in Two Crowns like the pikemen/ninja/fishermen, farm/farmers, and certain structures (war horn, farm/stable, catapult, portals, etc) don't exist in Eighties and there are no good alternatives imo. I assume these reductions are because it doesn't work with the plot. Since the monarch is a teen in the eighties, there's no way you'd have a farmer or banker in your camp alongside the "workers/kids" you recruit (not without creative writing at least). My most critical note is that because there's not a lot to do, I got drowsy twice during my whole playthough and took a nap on both occasions. And to be super nitpicky, I so hate how the mounts move. So annoying to have to move back-and-forth numerous times just because the mount has an extended stop and doesn't fully stop moving once you literally lift your finger off the button. There are a few more nitpicky things but….ugh.

Sigh. I really wanted to love it. I don't regret the purchase but I also won't be playing it again. As beautiful as it is, I bought Eighties for interesting new gameplay which it sort of delivered. I didn't buy it just to experience subpar Kingdom gameplay in a new skin. Oh well. | Kingdom Versión: Adolescentes esclavizando niños.

Juego  Pasado

Para los veteranos, jueguen en difícil, el normal es muy fácil.

Mecánicas Mejoradas: 
No mas nomos, los que te mejoraban las construcciones pasaron a ser tus compañeros, te seguirán por todos lados, pero sacaron algunas construcciones (menos nomos).

No hay Granjas, ahora los niños(esclavos) trabajan Cortando el césped, vendiendo Pizza, Asaltando un Banco (con sus explosiones),etc

No tenemos Estaciones (no mas invierno) para alguno bueno otro malo.

Lo que no me gusto:

No tenemos el multijugador, lo sacaron

El juego es corto, tal vez culpa de las torretas (eran las torres de arqueros) o por que no hay invierno. por eso te aconsejo que lo juegues en difícil.

Si jugaste kingdom two crowns y todos sus DLC, te va a gustar pero lo sentirás como un DLC con mejoras y menos mecánicas. | 游戏本身还是王国的味道，但是属于番外，流程大概五小时左右。比较短。
唯一想吐槽的是主角团过于政治正确，黑白混血男主+高智商黑人骇客+无脑大力士拉丁裔猛男+反主流白女的组合，加一对白女黑男的长辈，过于美式政治正确。
正当我以为如此正确的游戏应该由一个十分多元化游戏团队制作时，最后的制作人员照片显示全员白人23333，过于典了。 | In short: 4 hours taking it VERY slow and already completed. Utterly disappointing and cheap re-skin with 0 replay-ability.

- If you don't have Kingdom Two Crowns, definitely buy that one and have a much much better experience and feel like its totally worth your money. You can also enjoy playing with a friend which is a feature missing in this one.

- If you have Kingdom Two Crowns don't even bother. The game is very short and feels like a cheap cash grab. Graphics are splattered all over the place making it actually hard to see what you're doing, never mind the dumb story that you can easily miss out on. This game feels like they had an intern who was bored and re-skinned the first game in the series missing the better features of the later games. It's also extremely short and to easy with no replay-ability at all.

The game after this one will have to be VERY GOOD and return to form or else this developer will be something to forget. Such a shame after the hundreds of fun hours my wife and I had playing every DLC and challenge on the hardest difficulty in Two Crowns.

TL;DR: Don't bother with this "game" and save your money for something better.

Honestly, it comes across as a bit barebones for a game that, even on sale, I feel is a bit overpriced. I wanted to give it a try since I love zombies and I love turn-based combat, but nothing in the writing nor gameplay strikes me as particularly interesting. If the price was lowered substantially, I could see myself giving this a more fair go, but at 20 bucks (15 on sale when I tried it) I feel like the minimal amount of content and depth I experienced in the first couple hours just didn't make it worthwhile. The UI was a little finicky and wouldn't respond to my clicks pretty frequently, and some of the writing comes across as a bit amateurish (I mean this in the nicest way I can, since this is clearly a small team effort). 

Again, maybe for an incredibly deep sale (as in maybe 5-8 bucks) I would repurchase the game and give it another go, but from what I've seen, I don't think it's quite worth the purchase. | Relatively short game. Theoretically a game you could replay several times but its highly frustrating. Sometimes you get enemy zombies which are just to strong and wipe your team. And there are near to no possabilities to heal your team except the weird ones where you can hope that you have enough apples, otherwise you get fucket even harder because you dont have enough apples.

Theoreically a funny casual game idea, but terribly balanced and voice over instead of text only would have been good for the game for the atmosphere.. | Nice mix of initiative based combat with FTL style exploration with zombie infested Latvian cities in background.

Pros:
* Combat system gives you a lot of choices and party composition + trinkets allows you to explore different builds.
* Art and music in this game captures Rīga in spirit and map is recognizable for anyone who lived in that city.
* Story is nice if you're in a mood to read. Additional points for individual character stories in the end.

Cons:
* UI can take a bit of work, clicks sometimes didn't register the first time I clicked and it looks underpolished.
* Freezed couple of times when I switched to a different desktop (macos) | Good little game. Solid depth combat mechanics, and music. Has a steep learning curve and some mechanics are unintuitive. Relatively short but a great time
 | Refunded.
Well, I did just play it until a few fights after killing the dogmaster, and it was seriously boring, but that's on me.

Combat was good, very tactical, you could literally kill anything with statuses like bleed or poison, but then, it was linear as hell.
One thing I never liked on any game, you choose the lower path and that's it, no way to go back to the previous selection, no way to just "wait" where you're at, even if you're starved or don't have food/fuel. Maybe that's an option that opens up later in the game but it makes no sense to be that linear without that small part of agency on an RPG.

The permadeath is good, as expected but aside from that my main gripe is how linear it is, and all that in 30 minutes, YEAH.

[h1]Сначала человек изобрёл шахматы. Затем человек изобрёл дробовик, чтобы в этих шахматах можно было выиграть.[/h1]

Великолепное переосмысление самой переоценённой игры в истории, отправляется в список моих любимых рогаликов. Я в шоке от глубины проработки и как из такого простого концепта можно выжать столько игровых механик, которые генерируют столько неожиданных геймплейных ситуаций. Потенциал билдов более чем раскрыт, тащить можно чем угодно. Меты как таковой нету, бóльшая часть перков так или иначе полезная, так что всё в ваших руках и на высоких рангах майндгейм зашкаливает. Справедливости ради, чаще всего вас банально будут зажимать фигуры, потому что ходят они по несколько штук за один ход. Да сложно, да рандом душит порой, но тем не менее затягивает. Дал поиграть деду, он кончил. А у него уже лет 30 не стоит... Говорит о многом.

Из минусов хотел бы отметить дизбаланс прогрессии а также невозможность пропуска выбора. Тобишь, чёрные карты почти всегда уступают белым и ты регулярно обязан выбирать между двумя плохими наборами. Имбовые чёрные карты тоже есть, но на мой взгляд маловато элементарных стат-апов на фоне полутора десятка белых карт, которые откровенно руинят забег если ты их подбираешь. Чего только стоят Таймер, Хилящие офицеры, Стреляющие короли и Кошмарные Кони. Ну или игра наролит кучу фигур на доске и вдруг оказывается что оружие ниxepa не способно вынести прущий навстречу легион. Особенно это всё ощущается на высоких рангах, которые надо проходить молитвами нaxyй. 

[code]Стоит отметить, что игра довольно короткая и забег в среднем проходит за 7-15 минут, так что слив не столь фрустрирует как в каких-нибудь комплексных рогаликах, где по полчаса трайхардить приходится.[/code] 

Учитывая что игру относительно часто обновляют, жду когда добавят больше карт на урон, патроны и уменьшение разброса. И почините наконец эту хрень когда убиваешь фигуру позади которой стояла другая и тебя ваншотит перманентно. Что самое интересное, если убить преграждающую фигуру гранатой то ваншот не прокнет, но я вам этого не говорил... | This is exactly my kind of silliness. Shotgun King is a chess game except you only have your king left and he has a shotgun. If that makes you think "Wait a minute, that's not chess at all!" then you would be correct. The game only wears its chess influence only on the surface, the game actually is a turn-based strategy roguelike. You have to play through 12 rounds and defeat the final boss at the end. Each round your goal is to kill the white king. You can do this by firing your shotgun, each white piece have different amount of HP, pawns and knights have the lowest and the king has the most. Your shotgun has three main stats: firepower, range and firing arc. Firepower defines how many pellets your shotgun fires, each pellet dealing exactly one damage. Multiple pellets can hit the same target, can hit multiple targets or completely miss any target. There is some RNG involved here but the closer you stand to your target, the more likely you are to hit it. Range shows the maximum travel range of your pellets. Your firing arc shows the spread of your pellets, they will always be inside this arc. Shooting an enemy that stands directly before you will always make all pellets hit him. It's the same concept as in other shooting games, the shotgun is more powerful close range and loses its power the further you stand away. However, sometimes a wider spread might be beneficial to hit more pieces. There are some strategic decisions you can make here.
Shooting or moving will always pass your turn. White pieces will move on their turn and they can move multiple pieces at the same time. They have their own speed stat that defines how many turns they have to wait until they can move.
Moving will also reload your shotgun. This is important, so you can move outside of check and fire on your next turn.
Your shotgun has only limited ammo, which does regenerate but very slowly, so you don't want to kill every piece, you want to focus on the king but still deal with troublesome pieces.

After each floor you will come in contact with the roguelike mechanic of the game, the cards. You get a selection of two different black cards which help you for the rest of the run. These can be simple like more firepower, ammo or range but they also can give you completely new abilites like a melee attack that does not use ammo or grenades, that will hit multiple pieces but can also kill you.
Each black card is tied to a white card. These are upgrades for the white side. They can get more pieces, change how pieces move and give pieces more HP or speed. You will have to evaluate what upgrades you need but also what downsides you can endure in return. One white card that always appears is the white queen after floor 3. You can't escape her, she is everywhere.
Killing a non-pawn piece will give you an edge however. You get their "soul" which you can activate to move in the same pattern as the piece you killed. You can only store one soul but you can get black cards that allow you to store more or have some other synergy with it. These soul cards are best used to get out of check or close the distance to the white king.

The game is incredibly goofy with its concept but its also a challenging strategy game that will take you some time to master. And as you beat th egame, you will start to unlock new difficulty levels that add extra pieces at the start, improve the enemy AI and give the white king more HP. You can also unlock new shotguns that have different starting stats. There is a surprising amount of variety in this small game. The game still gets updates to this day, despite being almost three years old. It's funny, it's challening and it's the exact type of game to play at the evening after a long work day. | It was a great fun game with levels that get a little bit harder, and you can get different shotguns and after each round you pick a card that upgrades your side, and the enemy. The normal amount of turns in a round is maybe 20-30, and 9 rounds in the level and i think 8 levels. There is also endless and chase.
 | This game is a very fun strategy and roguelike game, i love the variety of cards for you and the enemy and the achievements have kept me playing for a bit now, definitely worth it for the price but would pick it up on a sale like I did. | Fun game, nice and easy but with just the right amount of strategy involved.

Game Name: Slay the Princess — The Pristine Cut
Reviews:
"Slay the Princess" - это адский капкан для твоей психики, и выбраться из него нереально. Тебе говорят убить принцессу, и сначала всё вроде понятно. Но чем дальше заходишь, тем больше не понимаешь, что вообще происходит. Это замкнутый круг, где каждый шаг - словно ложь, тянущая тебя всё глубже.

С каждым разом, когда ты убиваешь её, ты чувствуешь не освобождение, а привязанность. Ты влюбляешься в неё сильнее, будто тонешь, понимая, что это далеко не конец.
Ты убиваешь её, но она возвращается, как кусочек чего-то большего, что ты никогда не соберёшь целиком. И ты уже не уверен, где ложь, а где правда, и правильно ли вообще то, что ты делаешь.

С каждым разом, когда она убивает тебя, тебе так искренне жаль лишь ее.

Чем дальше, тем я больше не понимаю. А музыка…Саунд, который проигрывается, когда мы остаемся в конце, буквально парализует.

Очень грустное, но такое красивое ❤️

Огромное количество концовок, интересные пути для ачивок, но последнюю я так и не осилила (галерея). Возможно вернусь позже, не хочется случайно перенасытится этой красотой. | This game is a trip.

I thought I'd be on a fun little chart game experience, have a little story, have a little spooky (at least the game was advertised as such).

Turns out I was genuinely surprised by both the writing, the concept of looping and the (sometimes) disturbing psychological/ body/ cosmic horror that Slay the Princess has.

There isn't wrong choices just new perspectives.

👍
-The art is genuinely awesome
-The story is full of twists and turns, getting the whole picture is very rewarding
-The music is awesome
-The protag is pretty cool uwu

👎
-The 100% is very grindful and an achievement can glitch out once in awhile.
-I felt very sad about finishing the game :( 

TLDR: 100% would recommend! | Slay the Princess was really enjoyable to play from start to finish! This game reminds me of The Stanley Parable, with every choice you make having real consequences and a Narrator guiding you through... along with some other voices popping in too! The amount of content is insane, it took me 25 hours to see everything, and sometimes just when I thought I'd seen it all, another twist or surprise would show up. It's dark, funny, and even a little thought-provoking at times! I highly recommend it!

선택마다 중요하더라고요 놀랍고 어둡고 가끔 웃겨요! | -get to know the game
-think it's an intriguing adventure 
-full of paths, twists and emotions
-a moral dilemma
-buy the game
-play
-discover that you're stuck in a time loop 
-it's just one place, the same scenery that keeps changing its appearance endlessly
-the same dialogues, the same people, endlessly
-repeat the same dialog 50000 times
-just skip the dialogues, you're already tired of reading them
-kill or save the princess, it doesn't matter
-keep going until you get somewhere
-discover that they're just confused “gods”
-they don't know what they are
-the author of the game doesn't know either
-you don't know either
-no one knows
-play for 2 hours and get blurred vision from reading the same things over and over again
-be covered in “philosophical” drivel
-all the answers are like: “you don't understand, it's hard to explain, I'm an entity”
-the game has no message
-"it's all conceptual, you don't understand”
-exactly the same as the characters
-nothing matters
-dying, killing, saving, everything leads to the same place, there's no happy or sad ending.
-there are several confused princesses, without any criteria, totally random and without personality
-you have zero interest in discovering more irrelevant endings 
-go to the support page to ask for a refund, discover that it's been more than 14 days since you bought the game and now there's no way to get your money back, you're stuck with a mentally fragmented entity in the form of a princess, an irrelevant narrator and yourself, apparently a bird that can't look at itself in the mirror. Where are we? What is the world? Who are we? Knowing these things makes absolutely no difference, there is no consolation or purpose, you will either cease to exist or live forever, in no scenario will these things matter. You'll want to erase your own memory over and over again in the hope that you won't get bored the next time you repeat the same story. Kill or save the princess, it doesn't matter, it's the same. Discover that they are entities, confused gods, building themselves and then destroying themselves, you don't know what they are, they don't know what they are, the author doesn't know what they are, nobody knows anything, it's all a mess, play until you get the picture, go to the refund page, but you bought it on 01/01/2025, it's been 14 days, there's no refund, you're stuck... A! I'm sorry, am I repeating the same things? That's exactly what the game does. It would be fine if it was interesting, but it's boring, it has no purpose, no message, there's a person before playing Slay the Princess and there's a person after playing Slay the Princess, they're exactly the same person.

 | I saw a few clips of this game on youtube and felt compelled to play. It was already late but the moment I started playing, I couldn't drop it. Playing it made me wish I could wipe my memory and relive the feeling of playing it for the first time. I often wish I knew a lot less entering the game, because the experience is better going completely blind. But even so, the content of this game is so vast with your choices greatly affecting game play, so I was still left surprised by a lot of things. 

I'd buy this game a second time in a heartbeat.

I will just be honest with you.

Dont buy it. its seems funny but it is not. It is like a Scary movie part which take all relationg moments from Other Fantasy themes and tries to make it funny but again its not fonny. Am poretty sure they just mess up the poante somehow. Its like Grand thaft auto 2 or 1 and it sorta forced you through unfunny stuff all the way through. and it wont get better no matter how much you hope for it, so if you buy it set your alarmclock to 1:50 hours so you can still give it back. and yes. it wount be funn in 2 hours. it wount be fun in 4 hours. its getting just more and more annoing.. just like Farcry 5 | Кусок говна. Как настоящий говноед я пройду ее до конца.

Из плюсов: сюжет с отсылками на фэнтези 
Из минусов: все остальное. Кривое, ужасное управление. 
Управление боем кривое и раздражающее. 
Хитбоксы не понятные - вообще никакого урона, когда вплотную стоишь к противнику. 
Левелдизайн - запутанный лабиринт

It's a Twilight Imperium 4th edition knockoff. Don't get me wrong, great idea, TI4 is a fantastic game and Stellaris Nexus  (because that's what it was sold as all through EA and it changed less than a month before release) does a decent job of it. Sadly, whatever support it was  going to get was probably gutted when Paradox rug pulled the Stellaris theme from it, changed the name to that of a phone, pushed 1.0 release, and dropped it like a rock. It's highly doubtful it'll receive any additional updates or playable races, the potential for multiplayer outside known friend groups is slightly more lively than a cactus shop in the Sonora, and there are still some rather glaring bugs that will probably never be fixed. It's depressing really, you can tell the devs were really excited until they put out a completely bland corporate buzzword filled post about the name changing, EA ending, and a launch without any fanfare. Paradox kills another game that probably would have been good, this time because they couldn't figure out how to squeeze 50 DLCs from it. | Incroyable mini stellaris avec des mécaniques fun et facile à prendre en main. | Pretty good 4x game with a big emphasis on quick play. Certain mechanics can feel odd to get used to, but the moving pieces work well together. | Every match is different and has so much depth. Every class is unique and the abilities is different. One is a peaceful class and another one is focusing on fighting. There is a lot of playtime to invest to figure everything out. Campagne was also really fun. Only critic I have:

- implement more overviews like which research technology I am using 
- in the building menu I would like to see if I have the building already or not
- increase number of winning points or match modes like deathmatch (or at least an endless option to continue playing after meeting winning condition)

This game recommandation comes from hearth and is definitively a secret insider tip. | great 4x game and fast pace

[strike]奔着"刷宝射击游戏"标签买的，结果只有刷没有宝。[/strike]
只有刚开始有点意思，可以说宣传视频已经展示了游戏的大部分内容了，战斗机和机甲各有几种武器，但是各个武器的玩法差异小，小到玩了不到十分钟就没新鲜感，升级基本都是数值加强，没有玩法和视觉效果的变化！后面都是无聊的用同一种法子杀那几种虫子，没有新地图、敌人变种或剧情推进，除开无聊的重复体验，游戏的实际内容也就一小时，玩4.5小时基本没体验到什么乐趣，唯一的优点就是画面还行。 | 单纯的数值罢了，没有任何深度的构筑，所有近战武器的攻击动作都是一样的。 | 开始飞机切换机甲，以为是最优解了。但是玩着玩着发现还是飞机安逸，10个小飞机自动索敌，主飞机开启自动射击，注意躲避地板技和高伤害群潮。直接无脑冲！机甲就是切出来放个技能，再切回小飞机。 | 玩久了容易疲劳，适度玩玩就很容上瘾 | 还行，较为优秀的rougelike类游戏但是优化较差，且游戏内容较少，后期同质化严重，较为枯燥

It's a shame they chose such a terrible art style. The game was magical in the 90s with the highly detailed pixel art presenting pretty much the best possible realism at the time. They've ditched that to present a Cartoon Network reject style of art.

The game itself is good, follows the same storytelling tropes and puzzles. Just the art is horrible and whoever directed the art style should be exiled from game development. | There's a lot to like about this game, a lot that is done well and made for an enjoyable adventure. Avoiding spoilders, there's a few parts I felt were a misstep, one of which was genuinely upsetting early on in the game.

What kills this game for me is the ending. It's in line with Monkey Island 2, but doesn't have the luxury of being unexpected or the extra layers that make it seem more sinister. This just leans on unreliable narrator for its ending and feels more like a copout. They even give you a quiet moment to reflect, which just makes me certain that this game has to sit as my least favorite of the series. | If you're not stuck on a nostalgia trip looking for the childhood sense of wonder you had when playing M.I.1 and 2 then this is a great Point and Click adventure game. I love pixel art and could complain about the style and look, but the dialogue, puzzles, sound, world, story, all hit clean as ever. Not to keen on the ending but i had a lot of laughs getting there. | Turned out to be a nice and chill experience to play with controller on the couch. It has the Monkey Island humor I liked from the earlier games, lots of return characters and was fun in general. I picked easy difficulty, but might replay it in the future on hard. 

Only downer was the ending which felt a meh, but the ride to the end was cool, so still a positive in the end. | I really enjoyed this. Monkey Island 1 & 2 are always going to hold a special place in my heart since I played them as a child (I missed all the later versions), and this sequel does a really good job of capturing what was fun about those first games.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, RPG, Strategy
Reviews:
I randomly re-stumbled on this game in my library after forgetting about it and found myself having a lot of fun with it. If you are a fan of Vampire Survivors or similar roguelite games, then this should be on your Wishlist!

There is a lot of replayability and fun to be had by the large amount of unique characters (each with their unique Skill Tree) that you will experiment leveling up with each run. Only a few characters to choose from at the start, but you will unlock many characters with various hints in the selection screen about doing so. I was highly amused by the obvious homage to Vampire Survivors and the use of the Konami code as an old school gamer. | Great game! Unlocking new characters is cool specially the Contra cheat code ehehe | Very fun and well worth the money. You can jump in for a quick easy run, or spend hours unlocking everything. Love the artwork as well. Great game. | Great little game, works perfect on the Steamdeck aswell. | 资源太匮乏了，看似选项很多其实资源还有生存压力把路卡死了，每把的体验都没有太大的区别。局外的培养也没有能改变游戏面貌的能力，都是小缝小补

This gets a definite Recommend from me. If I only got to say one thing, it'd be "give this a try." especially if you like Isometrics, Roguelikes, ARPGs or *Risk of Rain.*
I was surprised to see it not overwhelmingly positive so lets touch on that. 
"Runs take hours"- a player with 0.5 hours of playtime. No, No they don't. You can loop infinitely though if you choose.
"you can't save"- this is a roguelike. Your overall progress is automatically saved, and each run you start will be different and from scratch...just like every other roguelike.

Now to the obvious: Isometric Risk of Rain. Which is a GREAT thing. Yes there are differences but if that is ALL you have to go on, that is a huge win. Gameplay is smooth, all the characters are viable and can become extremely powerful, unlocking everything was a blast.
Difficulty: This seems to have people divided. There is a difficulty selector for a reason...Though I would say after unlocking everything, learning the mechanics and good builds, they could add something more challenging. 
Lastly: This is in early access! The current state is vastly different then the videos I watched to check it out 8 months ago. It will continue to develop, get content and get polished. I'm very excited to see where it goes. | Превосходная графика, хороший дизайн и интересные названия а также хороший интересный геймплей. Общая оценка игра хорошая но может не понравится то что онлайна почти нету | It's fun to the core... just lacking in content.

Just wish there were more items and interesting ways of building characters. More interesting objectives or end goals in the end of a run. Every run with a given character will pretty much feel the same. 

Give it a year and it can rival Risk of Rain 2 in sheer funness and replayability?? | This game fixes several annoyances I had with Risk of Rain 2.
Here I no longer need to pause the game and look up what items do on my phone. Thank GOD! It also tells you what you need to do to unlock things. A couple I needed to look up but majority of them are straight forward.

Played exclusively on Steam Deck and it can usually hold 60fps but once it starts getting crazy with a lot of enemies and particle effects it will drop down to 40's or less so it definitely needs more optimization. Also one of the characters (Echo) is unplayable on controller right now but I read they already are fixing controller issues in the next big update. 

Overall, for a team of like 4 devs its a solid game with a lot of potential and I'm excited for the next update! | This is what ARPGs should be.  Fighting is fast paced but challenging, items are powerful, and the vibes are immaculate.

Every part of this works together harmoniously

About the only thing this game lacks is more planets, but hey, that's early access for you.

This review is a little biased because this is the first Harry Potter universe game I’ve fully completed and gotten 100% achievements in.  

First of all, I’m so glad this isn’t another game where you just play as Harry Potter. Instead, you get to create your own character and fully experience the world of Hogwarts. That alone made it worth playing for me.  

 [h2]Gameplay[/h2]
The developers clearly put a lot of love into this game, and it shows. [b]Hogwarts Castle[/b] is absolutely stunning so much so that it actually made me tear up at times. Everything feels alive, from NPCs casually using magic to paint pictures or prank each other to weird potion experiments happening in the bathrooms. I could spend hours just listening to NPC conversations.  

The game has three main areas:  
- [b]Hogwarts Castle[/b] – Easily the best part of the game, full of detail, personality, and magic everywhere.  
- [b]Hogsmeade[/b] – A charming, lively village that’s fun to explore and next to the castle.
- [b]The Open World[/b] – This was hit-or-miss for me. It has some interesting moments, but compared to Hogwarts, it feels less polished and emptier. It honestly felt like two different teams worked on these areas—the castle is [b]bursting with life[/b], while the open world feels [b]weaker in quality[/b]. Most collectibles and side quests take place in the open world, which was fine, but I personally would’ve loved more focus on the castle itself.  

That said, side missions were actually fun and never felt like a chore. The Forbidden Forest, while well-designed, didn’t feel as scary as I imagined it would be.  
This game also has [b]a ton[/b] of collectibles and optional content for 100% completion. Unfortunately, three of the achievements require replaying the game three times up to a certain point, which felt like a grind and should honestly be removed.  
Spiders. Spiders everywhere. Every five minutes, the game throws you into another cave full of horrifying spiders. Thankfully, the devs included an [b]Arachnophobia Mode[/b] for those who can’t handle them.  

[h2]Combat[/h2]
I’m absolutely in love with the combat. It’s even better on Hard difficulty, but Normal strikes a great balance between fun and challenge. Honestly, this game has ruined traditional mage/wizard combat for me nothing else feels as good after playing this. The spell combos, dodging, and enemy variety make every fight feel pretty dynamic.  
Although opinions on this are mixed, I personally really vibed with it.

[h2] Story[/h2]
The story was [b]okay[/b] nothing special. It’s your typical "kill the bad guy to save the world" kind of plot. The side quests and relationship quests were way more engaging than the main story, and I actually found myself more invested in those.  

[h2]❌ Cons[/h2]

- [b]Major Lighting Issues in Interior Areas [/b] :
(As of new update on January 30th 2025)
Many caves and rooms are blindingly bright, like a flashbang directly to the eyes—completely white screens that are painful to look at. If you have epilepsy, be careful. This is a weird bug since these areas are fully enclosed with no sunlight source, but the moment you step into certain spots, it’s like staring directly into the sun.

- [b]Performance Issues[/b] : 
I’m running this game on an RTX 4060 at 1440p, and while it looks great, it has some serious issues:  

[b]Texture Pop-in / Loading Issues[/b] – My biggest complaint. This is a well-known PC bug that happens even on the lowest settings. NPCs, grass, and objects suddenly pop into existence right in front of you, completely ruining immersion. What’s frustrating is that the game used to run way better at launch, but the last update (around six months ago) broke a lot of things, and they never fixed it.  
Some examples of texture pop-in issues:  
- NPCs suddenly appearing a few steps away when I turn the camera.  
- Half-invisible cows in Hogsmeade.  
- Grass abruptly loading every time the camera angle changes during a conversation or cutscene.  
- Even opening the menu and returning to the game makes textures freak out.  
>[b]Edit[/b] : As of the new update on 30th January texture pop in issues is mostly fixed, its still here and there but nothing immersion breaking.

[b]Ray Tracing is a Mess[/b] – Turning on RT causes micro-stutters and makes texture pop-in even worse. It’s simply not worth using in this game currently, it used to be way better before.
>[b]Edit[/b] : As of the new update on 30th January, they added ray reconstruction, DLSS 4 to this game. RT performance is a bit better but its still a mess in open world areas.

[b]Winter Season FPS Drops[/b] – For some reason, when it snows, my FPS gets cut in half. It’s a massive bummer because winter in Hogwarts should feel magical, but instead, it just lags.  (I have not checked this in the new update)

- [b]Low Replayability[/b] – While each house has an exclusive quest, replaying the whole game just for one extra mission isn’t very appealing. However, the upcoming PC modding update should help with this issue.  I'm honestly depressed this game is over I want to experience it more :(
>[b]Edit[/b] : New mod update did not help with this but there's rumours about them adding possible new story content to the game, nothing concrete tho.

If they ever fix these issues, this game would be so much more enjoyable.  

[h2]Final Thoughts[/h2]
I just want to thank the devs for creating such an amazing game. It was one of the best gaming experiences I’ve had. Despite its flaws, I still highly recommend it. This game is worth picking up at full price and even more so at a discount! | With the latest update, the terms of service now include a section where they can, without notifying you, disclose your personal information (IP address, personal information, chat logs, payment information and other information) to third parties. 

When I tried to opt out of this, I got redirected to a page which informs you "The Warner Bros. Discovery Privacy Center is Not Available in Your Region."

I've sunk 80+ hours of time into this game, which is now being held hostage unless I agree to give them my person information. Very disappointing.


For reference here's the relevant section, straight from their terms of service:

If you are a user outside the United States, you also consent to the transfer of your data to the United States." | 一款瑕不掩瑜但平平无奇的作品。说它瑕不掩瑜，因为本作就是哈利波特IP下最优秀最还原的作品之一，仅凭这一亮点就足以掩盖种种问题。说它平平无奇，因为本作从玩法，到小怪、boss、机制、剧情、细节打磨，方方面面不是普普通通，就是存在不足。可以看出制作组有下功夫加入很多内容，但最终游玩的体验却是有些不尽如人意。总的来说，哈利波特系列的粉丝推荐入手，毕竟是IP下最优秀的游戏之一，但如果对系列无感，推荐观望等骨折再考虑入手，因为没有粉丝属性加持，而本作的游戏性并不顶尖。

[h3] 设定 [/h3]
不用多说，本作最大的优点之一。哈利波特系列有数不尽的粉丝，本作也确实称得上这一IP下最优秀的那一档游戏。虽然说有些流水线味道，但足够庞大的地图和填充的超量内容也还算得上是最还原的游戏了。遗憾的是，抛开背景设定的优势，本作剩下的亮点就不多了。

[h3] 美术 [/h3]
优点。很多建筑、地形的设计本身就颇具魔法世界的味道，再加上近几年新游戏的画质提升，可以说游戏的美术挺有表现力的。

[h3] 玩法 [/h3]
经典的主线任务+大量支线任务+地图满地开宝箱捡装备的流水线设计。做任务学新咒语，做任务升级，做任务推剧情，基本上是经典罐头开放世界的老一套了。主要的问题还是等级机制带来的数值不平衡。尽管我已经在满地跑腿开地图的时候做了一点支线，但是打到主线大boss兰洛克的时候还是被他压了好几级。这本身并不是什么问题，无非就是boss血量厚一点，我伤害低一点，但是配合上战斗系统的缺陷，就让这种数值上的问题给人较差的体验（这部分会在战斗系统里讨论）。
此外，同样是等级机制，敌人的等级本身我觉得也是设计有问题的。既然制作组在设置中已经提供了几个不同的难度选项，就没必要在敌人等级上动手脚了，完全可以把boss等级下调5级然后填和现在完全一样的数值，这完全不会对游玩难度有任何影响。因此，我只能认为，故意把boss等级设置成高于玩家好几级，配合那个一直跳出来的“等级高于你的敌人威胁较大”的提示，是单纯为了鼓励玩家做支线任务升级的拖时间设计，让我有点反感。我觉得制作组自己对于自己设计的支线任务都没有信心，如果支线任务真的趣味十足，或者剧情引人入胜，玩家自然会有探索的动力，为什么需要拉高boss的等级来“诱骗”玩家去做支线升级呢？
总的来说，玩法中规中矩，不好不差，是经典的罐头开放世界，但是在优秀的大作满天飞的时代，没有创新且给人的体验仅仅及格，就是缺点。

[h3] 战斗系统和小怪设计 [/h3]
本作最大的毒点之一，也是支撑我连夜打完主线后一定要发评测抨击的主要动力。
声明一下，我全程游玩的是一般难度，是除了最难以外第二难的选项，如果最高难度下一些细节有所不同请见谅。不过我觉得在一般难度下已经存在了大量问题，数值和机制都有，我并不认为游玩最高难度能有所改善。此外我全程没有用三种不可饶恕咒，这可能是感觉伤害略显刮痧的原因之一。但一款背靠哈利波特这个超级IP的游戏，不当黑巫师不猛猛Crucio Imperio 啃大瓜就会伤害不足，是有点影响体验的，毕竟原作最终击败伏地魔都没用上不可饶恕咒。
具体聊一下细节。
首先就是设计上毫无创新和诚意。铁甲咒是格挡，在合适的时机使用铁甲咒会自动打一发昏迷咒，也就是弹反。也缝合了潜行玩法，可以用幻身咒潜行，用全身束縛咒背刺秒怪。剩下的咒语就是各种各样的控制或者伤害。恕我直言，这种战斗方式完全就是从现有的成熟框架里抄的，只是换成了魔法世界的咒语名字，可以说是十分甚至九分的一致。
然而借鉴缝合了不少东西并没有带来更好的体验。主线敌人中潜行玩法大部分时候也就是每个场景偷袭最外侧的三五个小怪，后期中央区域成堆的小怪和交叉视野，想要靠潜行背刺清理，需要用吸引注意力然后逐个击破的方式搞很久。而如果选择直接冲进去开无双，也完全没有割草游戏的爽快，只有打一地血牛的疲惫。正如前文所提到，由于等级机制的存在，很可能小怪肉的一批而玩家的伤害感人，然而小怪的攻击又几乎没有威胁和变数，所有攻击最终都分为两种：能弹反的弹反，不能弹反的翻滚闪避。于是战斗环节，玩家就是站在怪堆里，翻来覆去地弹反翻滚开技能普攻（以及使用消耗道具），键盘按的手疼终于打完一波，空中红光一闪，又来了一地血牛。
小怪的设计也是颇为匮乏和同质化。本身在主线流程里，主要的敌人就只有黑巫师、妖精、蜘蛛等几类，搞笑的是每类敌人基本上只需要分成近战和远程敌人，能弹反的和必须闪避的敌人，除此以外，他们对玩家的战斗体验几乎不会带来任何区别。黑巫师可以远程施放咒语或者召唤阴尸近战，妖精有近战妖精和远程妖精，蜘蛛可以近战攻击或者远程吐毒液或丝，不管是黑巫师还是妖精蜘蛛都是一次来一窝，近战远程混搭，我请问这在体验方面能带来任何区别吗？
当然，制作组也给每种敌人加了一个弱点，会有一定伤害加成，但几乎被等级机制带来的数值问题掩盖住了。在游玩过程中我不知道多少次见到全身着火的蜘蛛或者阴尸对我发起不断的进攻，说好的怕火呢？哦，原来是血条太长没烧死，可真是太有设计了。
显然，设计师学习借鉴缝合了很多东西，但是最终他们也没想明白自己战斗系统的主要基调是什么。小怪数量多，血条厚，同质化严重，伤害感人（几乎不具备秒杀玩家的能力，即使玩家失误挨揍了，只要有治疗药就可以一直不死），带来的就是长时间高度一致、无聊且磨叽的战斗感受，既没有那些高难度动作游戏刀尖起舞的紧张感，也没有无双割草游戏风卷残云般横扫千军的爽快感。

[h3] boss和机制设计 [/h3]
boss战和机制设计更是拉了一坨特大的。极度匮乏的机制数量和毫无想象力的设计，让整个战斗系统就像一个笑话。
打完大boss兰洛克后，我突然意识到，其实在前两三个小时我竟然就已经体验完了制作组设计的全部战斗机制。在非常早期，玩家学会了应该如何击破敌人的护盾：用对应颜色的咒语攻击该颜色的护盾。玩家也学会了使用古代魔法从地上捡石头或炸药桶扔到敌人身上打伤害。于是，在兰洛克boss战中，我们要做的，就是用对应颜色的咒语攻击boss召唤的护盾，用古代魔法把boss扔过来的红色子弹扔回去，以及能弹反的弹反，不能弹反的闪避。兰洛克会采取的行动一共只有五六种，一种可以弹反，一种可以扔回去，一种是召唤护盾，剩下两三种无脑翻滚闪避。这就是制作组精心设计的主线大boss，真是太有设计感了。
前文也提到了，在等级机制的加持下，boss血量较多而玩家伤害一般，又由于兰洛克本身攻击方式的威胁一般，又没什么变数，完全就是公式化循环，因此boss战也和小怪战体验高度相似：同质化和磨叽。boss血条长，玩家血药多，打了半天都没啥事，于是在挺帅的过场动画后，就是漫长的血牛互博环节。当然，战斗时长跟以难度著称的魂类游戏是没法比的，但是霍格沃兹之遗本身就不是这类游戏，更何况声名在外的优秀魂类游戏可没有全游戏小怪和boss加起来共享三四个机制的逆天设计。
总的来说，整个战斗机制就是一坨大的，在设计师的努力下，同时做到了毫无创新和体验一般，借鉴都借鉴不太明白，也算是颇具实力了。

[h3] 剧情 [/h3]
及格水平。整个主线给我的感受就是合理或者说意料之中。往好了说，并没有太大的毛病，但与此同时，也几乎没有亮点。整个主线就像一杯白开水，没什么毒点也没什么亮点，平平淡淡没有感觉。

[h3] 细节打磨 [/h3]
可以看出制作组有下功夫构建一个范围相当大的游戏世界，也努力地填充了不少可以探索的内容，但或许是受到产能和时间的压力，很多细节有欠缺打磨。
[b] 服装bug [/b]
我大概第一次进游戏不超过半小时，长袍就在腿上疯狂穿模乱抖了。不过我相信制作组已经努力修复了，或许是技术限制导致有些地方修不好，可以理解。
[b] 所罗门 [/b]
所罗门boss战可以说非常明显的暴露了制作组欠缺细节打磨这一问题。剧情组想要把所罗门塑造成一个极度反感黑魔法的人，而boss设计组却不知为了什么目的（也许是想增加点难度），在所罗门boss战里面加入了大量和他一伙的阴尸。于是最终呈现出来的，就是所罗门一边怒斥玩家和塞巴斯蒂安自甘堕落（其实老子流程里就从来没用过不可饶恕咒），一边伙同满地的阴尸群殴玩家，可谓是狗屁不通。其实修改起来非常简单，如果图省事，可以直接删除boss战里面的阴尸。给所罗门做一个帅帅的过场动画，上来直接一个大招把一地阴尸全秒了，然后开始怒斥玩家和塞巴斯蒂安，随后进行boss战，这样不是更凸显他正派而又固执的角色形象吗？或者也可以保留阴尸，但是对代码做点改进，除了玩家、友军、敌军阵营，让所罗门自己单独处于一个阵营，阴尸就近选择锁定玩家或者所罗门攻击，如果担心改变boss战难度，可以设置让阴尸打所罗门不造成打断和硬直效果，伤害调到几乎没有，或者让所罗门每次被阴尸攻击就直接闪现到远离阴尸的地方躲开攻击，然后设置所罗门AI不锁定阴尸，只打玩家。这样改和现在boss战区别不会特别大，但是看起来就合理很多，现在这个所罗门站在一堆阴尸里面群殴玩家，阴尸对他视而不见，我真不知道设计师自己玩没玩过这一段，反正我是没绷住。

[h3] 总结 [/h3]
正如开篇所说，本作的亮点和不足都相当明确。对于哈利波特的粉丝来说，它可以说是最值得入手游玩的衍生游戏；而对于系列无感或更看重游戏性的玩家来讲，或许本作就算不上顶尖佳作了。 | 剧情=0，满地图收集物-10，情怀+100，霍格沃兹城堡+200。今天你阿瓦达啃大瓜了吗 | After the new update (the one with mods) i can't pass the "Do not sell or share my personal information" quest.

After playing Civ 7 I was delighted to play a game where obvious attention and care went towards the interface.
Pleasant traditional roguelike with really nice interface+controls and a lot of DnD-esque flavor. Reminds me a bit of DCSS and Incursion. | dev:

maybe too late to add, but I really think a classic RPG interface with visual slots for weapons and so on would add so much to the game and let people instantly connect to it. (look at 'Caves of Qud' which just released last year and has an insanely well done UI for this now, even for characters with 4 arms or nearby floatables)

it feels like such an essential part of immersing yourself into the game... the lines of text may work as a nostalgia play, but scare off anyone who doesn't want to deal with a frankly incredibly clunky way of doing inventory and equipment.

I don't want to give it a bad rating, because the game essentially is exactly what it promises to be, but I simply can't enjoy games that force you to do min-maxy try-hard roguelike experience sans any fun, adventure, exploration and so on.
people already tend to min-max the fun out of games and if you force people into challenge modes that's all they're gonna do. 

if I could just save and reload, I could challenge myself, play more relaxed and not be annoyed when the only reason I died was because I didn't know that X -> bad idea.

I know that there are people that like that, a lot claim to like it, but very few in fact do.

what people do like is to play in this manner in a game they already mastered or understand really well. I play roguelike modes in games, or games with meta progression, i.e. rogueLITEs (capitalization for emphasis. it seems that term isn't used any more, but that's how people called it back then) 

a story mode, or normal RPG mode with just exploration and leveling and so on would have been amazing for this game.... 

I just wanna play *my* character, not do speedruns or no hit stuff or hardcore runs. this stuff is fun to watch others do, but it's just so boring to me because whenever I get attached to my character, I die. it just kills the game for me.

I can't criticize or downvote a game because it said "roguelike" and delivered that and I didn't enjoy it :D -- but if I played through in a normal save scum mode as most people do, I'd way way way more likely enjoy the roguelike experience.

if you only do a challenge mode game (which is what this essentially is), the best way to do these games is simply with heavy meta progression, but that is quite the headache in a genre like this, I suppose. how would you even scale this? I have no idea... but it would at least "sell me" on the idea that this is still "my character". restarting as the same character from 0 does not do that - for me at least.

you can always limit a game mode to be more challenging, or simply have several seemingly equal ways to play a game. limiting the ways you can play a game needlessly seems unwise, even if you yourself are purely interested in a roguelike experience.

the game's incredibly well executed. I like everything except that I can't shoot through people -- but that's kinda personal taste and I guess makes sense, but is a bit annoying when you play a ranged character with hirelings that constantly spawn in their pets and you barely get to fire an arrow.

Заходив я в цю гру без величезних очікувань, адже у більшості думок про цю гру її хвалили за візуальний стиль, наявність локалізації, гарну ціну - проте ніяк не геймплей. Враховуючи що автобатлером мене не злякати, я кинув виклик кампанії на макс складності і після 25+ годин маю сказати - це дуже крутий досвід! Концептуально ні глобальна мапа ні бойовка не є прям потужними сторонами гри, втім те як це все скомбіновано навколо динамічної і цікавої історії - мені щиро сподобалось! В відеоогляді можете побачити і геймплейну складову і послухати більш детально про всі моменти, текстом нижче я поділюсь ключовими тезами. https://youtu.be/CJlz9DBEthE 

[h3] Сильні сторони гри: [/h3]
[b] +сюжетна кампанія, кінематографічність [/b]
Доволі цікаво що маючи всього кілька заставок, за рахунок цікавої історії грі вдається створювати ефект блокбастеру. В грі ніколи немає можливості розслабитися - ціль кожної місії міняється по кілька разів, відносини з різними персонажами мінливі, є ключовий шлях, проте дослідивши все повністю - можна знайти сховані цікавинки. Це круто! Не думаю що я можу щиро рекомендувати комусь залетіти в гру щоб насолодитися наприклад бойовкою, але за рахунок історії і її подачі - відносна простота бойовки відразу йде на другий план.

[b] +стратегічна складова [/b]
Хоча в грі і не сильно накреативиш в рамках однієї битви, втім планування в глобальному плані є надзвичайно важливим. Часом потрібно створити загін який матиме єдину ціль знищити захищених саппортів арміїі супротивника. Часом героя треба прокачати в напрямку навичок на глобальній мапі щоб він не був класним воїном, проте відкрив можливості для інших героїв наймати сильних юнітів. Часом треба умисно створювати перепони на шляху ворога щоб виграти кілька ходів для маневну основною армією. Цього тут вистачає, і переважно працює за рахунок того, що після нападу чи успішної облоги - у юніта закінчуються очки руху. Це місцями злить, проте в плані стратегічності відкриває додаткові можливості для маневну і трохи змінює динаміку гри, до якої ми звикли в тих же Героях.

[b] +візуальний стиль, озвучка, локалізація [/b]
Гра з чудовим візуальним стилем, деякі юніти дуже соковито зроблені, музика приємна і радує душу. Бачив коменти що локалізація була погана - можливо, проте наразі вона досить якісна і мене в ній все влаштувало, не було жодних конфузів щодо реплік чи ходу сюжету. Ці всі елементи доповнюючі, але всі ми знаємо, як ці побічні елементи впливають на сприйняття гри і задоволення від знаходження в ній.

[h3] Спірні сторони гри: [/h3]
[b] +-бойовка і тактична складова [/b]
Хоча всі сильні сторони нівелювали для мене відносну простоту бойовки, я не можу сказати, що вона мені прям сподобалась. Активні скіли і формація можуть дуже сильно змінити хід бою, проте все ж таки можливості перевернути бій дуже обмежені, частково все залежить від рандому адже ви можете певним чином направляти бійців, проте це не захищає вас від якихось їх сумбурних дій між активним використанням карток (наприклад в 3 випадках вони можуть добити юніт до кінця, а в 2 з певних причин переключитись на інший юніт, а це може бути критично). Через це саме в тактичному плані на рівні конкретної битви - комбінація дій дуже часто буде ідентичною, з мінімальними відмінностями залежно від структури юнітів ворога. Дещо вирулюють ситуацію юніти - кожен тип бійців дуже різний і гра дає можливість погратися з тим стилем армії, який більше імпонує конкретному гравцю.

[b] +-прокачка героїв [/b]
Доволі незвично коли ви замість активного скіла можете взяти герою за рівень покращення замку чи щось подібне. По грі ця механіка добре обігрується, адже ці покращення часто можуть бути значно важливіші за якусь примітивну активку, проте є й інша сторона - у деяких героїв пул цих активних скілів дуже малий. Відповідно граючи за героя з 6-7 скілами ти в боях відчуваєш себе полководцем. Граючи за іншого героя - у вас може бути 2-3 дуже ситуативних скіла, і автобатлер стає майже повним автобатлером, ти не відчуваєш контролю. Битви можна пришвидшувати тому це не така проблема, проте в таких битвах досить складно впливати на кількість втрат і відповідно гра без активних карток часом може бути болючою.

[h3] То що в результаті [/h3]
Як думаю ви відчули, гра мені сподобалась. За свою ціну, з офігенною кампанією - це чудова можливість на 20-25 годин залетіти насолодитися цим проектом і отримати купу фану. Саме так це було для мене. Гра для мене не стане чимось культовим як умовні Age of Wonders, Герої чи Warcraft, проте свою ціль вона виконує і протягом всієї кампанії у мене не було відчуття, що я проводжу час нецікаво, а це як на мене головне. Мій щирий рекомендасьйон

Якщо цікавитесь інді іграми, особливо РПГ/тактикою, то також запрошую на мій [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_3mBOq0pq00QOXxrpMFhZg?sub_confirmation=1] Youtube канал, [/url] там часом можна побачити якийсь прихований діамант ігрової індустрії, який ви могли пропустити. Буду радий вас там бачити :) | A very strong "meh" from me, with a very slight unbalance into the not recommended side.
I thought the first couple of hours were great, but it went stale very very fast.
Halfway through chapter 6 and I'm wondering if I should just not bother with the rest.

The closest comparison I can make here is a mix of 'Fantasy General' and 'Gwent: Thronebreaker'.... kind of. But this is more boring than both of those.
It's a pretty repetitive slog. The story could've been good as the world is interesting, but the storytelling is pretty lacklustre.
The gameplay is mostly surviving the same enemy waves coming again and again and again, while building your economy in the background so that you can curbstomp the enemy after a while.

The art is great tho. | Don't Buy this game.

I don't have an entire semester to explain to you how this game managed to go from from "Dude, you gotta play this!" to "I'm thinking of ending..this game's existence in my account". But what I will say, the Dev's went out of their way in Campaign to hamstring & ruin any fun you can have after chapter one.
How TF are you gonna reset each Hero's(Every hero is forgetable except Lorelai) army, City and World every other Paragraph. 
The game is pretty and the music and audio is excellent. Heck, even the "RTS" gameplay is good once you realize the only way to strategize is to Conquer 3 cities and sit and defend for 10 turns to actually build up a proper army.
Also, this isn't an RTS, it's a Combat-Autoclicker and a node-point miner(The cities are the nodes).
Anyways, getting to the End of the game, even the "Easy" mode where you can't lose(Fun Fact, yes you can) The Dev's go out of their way in what I hope was the final mission before I uninstalled this game, to force the player to use 2 seperate groups on the same team who have to share resources to fight 2 types of "Battles" where Team A has to stumble around, turn-by-turn, looking for a city that has F. U.C. K. you levels of monster's sitting there while you team can't earn reinforcement thanks to the F. U. C. K. awful low resource generation and reset armies. Team B has to "Defend" against an army that is 10 movement turns, but actually is like 5 depending on if the game decides the fully filled out enemy is going to ignore it's movement penalty for being filled with tier-3 level monsters and kill 3 cities in just as many turns. At this point, I thought, maybe it's bugged or I suck, but shocker, I opened the chapter back up in the hardest & balanced difficulties and the game still pulls this BS for no discernible reason.

I can see the makings of something fun and unique in this game but every time you start to have fun the chapter "Ends" or the story demands you to "Focus on Movement" or they force-kill a character that has strategic value for the sake of "Story". I'm to youtube to watch the end of the game and then forget this game exist. | [h1]True hidden Gem![/h1]

Самая уникальная и невероятная стратегия 2024-го года!
Горючая смесь из 4х стратегии, автобатлера и карточного дек-билдера. Играется свежо и похоже на Legendary Creatures 2, с той лишь разницей, что тут есть полноценная кампания и сетевая игра, которую я давно просил в подобном жанре и больше нигде не встречал. 
Так же тут сногсшибательный арт и гениальная музыка уровня Джона Уильямса и Голливудского блокбастера. Уникальные юниты,  уникальные герои, коих аж 28 классов, возможность улучшения карт. А геймплей за каждую расу настолько кардинально отличается, будто мне после людей дали протосов. Отличия далеко не во внешнем виде и циферках! 

Ложкой дёгтя является то, что это сделано на Юнити, потому оптимизация оставляет желать лучшего. Но ни критичных багов, ни вылетов замечено не было.

Вывод : рекомендую всем любителям классики типа Age of Wonders 2, Warlords 4, Disciples 2, Dominions 4 и, быть может, даже, внезапно, Master of Magic! Короче, шедевр, 9,5/10 | I don't really like writing these things but since this game seems to be a smaller title, and I'm enjoying so much I figured I'd say that I say it's worth the price of admission.  The battle system is a fresh take IMO and the world is straight up beautiful.  Fun fantasy, strategy, army building and city development.  Good game.  Good fun.
bad graphics, bad game design, didn't like this one, doesn't feel intuitive - easy to get stuck on maps without finding exit | It's good

I went from being obsessed with the game to disappointed. Reasons: when I played the beta I played it on a desk top, the game seemed like a laid back game where there is lots to do but it was a beta so it obviously needed a bit a work, I wasn’t worried about it. 

I bought the game and bought a steam deck along with it. While I played the game it was laggy and the characters eyes seemed to disappear. When you have quests they don’t really show up on the map so for some quests it makes sense such as “ search and find”, but other quest like speak to “ “ it would have been nice for it to be indicated on the map. What I’m trying to say is that things on the map i personally wish were a lot more clear. 

To add when you play and gain an item if your bag is full it doesn’t drop the item or ask you if you want to discard and old one to make room for the new one, the new item is just gone. So if you find cool armor or a weapon you automatically lose it. It was frustrating once I experienced it. The graphics are nice, it gives a cozy feel which I love, but what gets in the way is the lag I experience once playing. On pc it was less laggy, but still experienced occasional lag. I wish I could feel excited as I once did with the game but it needs a little work. | The art is lovely, but the game is incomplete. It would have been better to release as Early Access, at least then it could be said that the game would improve in time, currently it just isn't worth it. | Although the game still has some bugs, I have not come across anything game breaking yet.  And although the game has bugs, the developers are consistently putting updates to fix the issues and also adding more features into the game. | Как игрок, который полностью прошёл игру и выполнил практически все ачивки, могу сказать следующее..

1) Во-первых, сама игра неплохая, тут можно следить за фермой, чтобы развивать экономическое положение, либо просто фармить ресурсы и сражаться с врагами. Что выгоднее не могу сказать, т.к. за 42 часа, я преследовал не подобного рода цели, а чисто хотел пройти игру на все ачивки.
2) Во-вторых, какой бы путь вы не выбрали, игра не будет супер скучной, т.к. тут присутствует смена времени года, всё как положено:
[u]Весна и Лето[/u] - цветение, красота, тепло.
[u]Осень[/u] - грозы, дожди, листва.
[u]Зима[/u] - снег, холод, ёлки и снеговики, праздничная атмосфера.
Вдобавок ко всему, само исследование мира весьма занятное.. нахождение различных записок, где может быть грустная или весёлая история, всяческие пасхалочки, пускай и не слишком запутанные, да и особо не несущие в себе смысла, нахождение новых монстров и ресурсов, либо просто какого-то интересного участка локации, а такие там есть. Самое интересное для меня было - это приобретение ездового животного, взял себе единорога, и крафт оружия, брони и ювелирки, как ни крути, система крафта очень муторная и в то же время - приятная, уж поверьте, когда вы скрафтите свой первый крутой меч или топор, счастье не передать словами. И пока я тут расписываю как всё хорошо, немного задену плохие стороны игры, которые были плохими лично для меня. 
Первое и самое очевидное - это оптимизация игры, она тут явно хромает, мой комп с rtx 4080 и i7 14700kf + 32 gb ddr5 на 6400 МГц (фулл настроенный по частотам и таймингами), фризил как собака в этой игре на настройках 144 гц (2к), даже если я отключал тени, местами всё равно зависало, особенно это заметно при смене локации (когда телепортируетесь с точки на точку и чуток пробегаете вперёд). Не знаю как у вас, но буду рад, если всё хорошо.
Второе, полное отсутствие магических эффектов, даже если они есть у врагов, у вас только оружие ближнего и дальнего боя, а если вы захотите поиграть с луком на хардкоре - удачи вам :)
Третье, бесячая система диалогов с нпс, это вообще забейте.. хуже ничего не видел, может первые пару минут будет смотреться круто, но когда вам потребуется для "галочки" прокачать харизму и романтические отношения с нпс - вы вспомните мои слова.
Четвёртое, невозможность быстрого скипа сезона, если у вас лето, то существуют культуры земледелия, которые хрен вы посадите летом, вам придется запастись едой и кликать около получаса на спальный мешок, чтобы проматывать время и ждать наступления нужного сезона, а почему это важно? Да потому что есть задания, которые требуют от вас, вырастить какое-то из растений, чтобы его потом кое куда засунуть и кое что открыть.
Пятое, ужаснейший звук, в каком-нибудь лесу, ваши ушки завянут.. нет здесь гибкой настройки звука, а только несколько ползунков, я вообще играл на минимальном звуке, чтобы не устать от игры, хотя музыка неплохая как и некоторые эффекты, но всё же эта часть в игре явно страдает.

[h3]Теперь для тех, кто не хочет читать всё вышеперечисленное и ему интересны плюсы и минусы, опять же, всё индивидуально, это моё субъективное мнение.[/h3]
[b]Плюсы:[/b]
1) Затягивающая игра, не знаю как это объяснить, но она затягивает, пускай и ненадолго, но мне было интересно проходить её на протяжении всех (активных игровых часов), имею ввиду где я не стоял афк прокручивая время года или качая диалоги, а путешествовал, решал загадки и фармил ресурсы.
2) Хоть и нелепая, но сочная система боя, прям нравится попадать оружием по врагу.
3) В игре присутствует какой-никакой визуал, то есть есть погружение и небольшое внимание к деталям.
4) Прокачка талантов и возможность выбора навыков, я думаю это многим нравится в играх.
5) Возможность сохранения игры и переключение хардкора прям во время боя.
6) Возможность создать свою ферму.
7) Обширный выбор брони и оружия с ювелиркой.
8) Малый размер игры.
9) Приятная озвучка от девушки во время сюжетных моментов XD
10) Ведьмы, духи, вампиры, оборотни, и т.д.. если вы любители такого, то вам сюда.
11) Звуки некоторых монстров введут вас в ступор.

[b]Минусы:[/b]
1) Плохая оптимизация игры.
2) Ужаснейший фоновый звук, без возможности его гибкой настройки.
3) Нудные диалоговые окна с нпс, которые нужно осуществлять, чтобы прокачивать харизму.
4) Дорого, всё очень дорого! Чтобы собрать себе парочку золотых инструментов, придётся горы свернуть, а про приобретение чертежей для феры и ездового животного я вообще молчу!
5) Отсутствие магии, есть только меч, топор и лук.
6) Смена года, всё бы ничего и как бы, верно, что её нельзя скипать быстро, но они связали задание с посадкой семян по сезонам, и вот представьте картину, вам осталось собрать 10 кочанов кукурузки, чтобы сдать задание, а вы её не можете посадить в этом сезоне, тут и начнётся возгорание пятой точки.
7) Малое количество боссов, а ещё тут мобы весьма скучноватые, лишь парочку интересных монстров можно найти.
8) Звуки монстров, кому-то это может быть плюсом, но для кого-то будет минусом, т.к. услышав оборотней или Спиригганов, вы забоитесь двигаться дальше.
9) Если будете бегать в густом лесу или в локации с руинами, можете потерять персонажа, т.к. он пропадает в текстурах крон деревьев и зданий, это тоже сильно бесит порой.
10) Цена игры, отдавать 1200 рублей за такую игру по нынешнему курсу я бы не стал. По скидке в 50%+ можно взять.
[h2]Выводы:[/h2]
Поиграть можно, уверен, что кого-то данная игра затянет, особенно если он сможет построить ферму, хоть в игре явный перевес минусов, всё же хорошие стороны тоже присутствуют, поэтому всем удачи с выбором и приятной игры. | I am really enjoying this game! It has it all, farming, combat, and relationship building.  I am looking forward to seeing where this game is going to go!

Cool art style, decently chill to play besides the quick day/ night cycles can seem hectic at first.
Medium length for the base game, lots of back and forth for fishing/quests.
You can die but you just respawn with no penalties, you can save and quits at any dock.
Decent exploration but not a ton, the story had some mystery and I liked the ending. | A great and peaceful game with a big history. Until you play during night

This game is so good and has such replay ability that I'm on my 3rd play trough. |        一次接触死亡空间系列还是在小学的时候，差不多是2011年、2012年那会儿。当时听同学说死亡空间很好玩，于是在盗版网站上下载了死亡空间2来玩，结果被吓个半死。我至今都记得刚开局不到5分钟就被一堆怪物追着跑，结果被墙角坐在轮椅上装死的老比登来了个抱脸杀。还有墙体突然破裂被吸进太空，以及我最害怕的突然熄灯然后出怪。以上种种对我年幼的心灵造成了成吨的伤害，以至于我只玩了2个小时之后就再也不敢打开这个游戏了。
       如今时隔十数年，突然发现死亡空间出了重制版，抱着重温童年阴影的想法，便入手了这个游戏。虽然小时候玩的是二代，但是一代的重制版还是与我的记忆中的那种压抑恐怖的氛围相差无几。唯一的遗憾是我发现死亡空间已经吓不到我了，一把小切在手便是神挡杀神佛挡杀佛。怪来了都懒得打腿，直接往手臂射两枪打掉骨刃，然后动态能力吸过来直接把怪钉墙上，一套操作行云流水，现在的我冷静的可怕。遥想小时候还只会一通乱打，然后绝望地发现怪趴地上了都还没死。言归正传，虽然死亡空间已经吓不到我了，但这部作品的氛围塑造十分优秀，配合上阴森的配乐以及血腥的场景，让我在游玩过程中不免还是会紧绷着神经。
       此次重制版属于完全重制，上到剧情演出，下到贴图纹理都进行了十足的优化，光影效果也进行了迭代，甚至加入了二代的部分枪械，可谓用心十足，非常推荐想要尝试恐怖游戏或对死亡空间感兴趣的朋友入手。
