Game Name: Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord
Reviews:
This is not a game for everyone. It's a game from the 1980's even with a new coat of paint and a few balancing and QOL features, but it's still a tough, unforgiving dungeon crawler that is as much about preparation and patience as it is about learning to roll with the punches when the dice form a middle finger in your face. 

Despite all of this, I found this game very gripping and captivating. Every victory felt earned and you start feeling attached to your guys whom have no given personality. The graphics feel like it's an updated old school game like the Sega AGES games back in the day and the atmosphere can be tense. It's a game that I, once I got over the frustrations and accepted that I usually should keep a party of people that you can send to carry your bones for revival out, made even easier by the recruitment system. Really I feel money is the issue in this game where the most issues are. You either have barely a coin to spare or you are flushed with gold that it kinda feels meaningless.

I found the game super engaging and captivating. If you wanna see what was one of the three great progenitors of Roleplaying video games and a piece of important video game history, I would say this game is worth experiencing! Just don't try to 100% achievements, those 40 hours of searching every enemy to complete the bestiary were carried by my lizard brain liking the sight of levels going up.

... So when is the Knight of Diamonds scenario coming out? | I am a fan of the Wizardry series, so it's nature that I would recommend this game. However, it is not for everyone because the core mechanism of the game is developed 40 years ago. My personal opinion is that Wizardry 7 is the best of the series and you can play Wizardry 7 instead of this one. However, if you like the conventional dungeon-crawler game, this one is a classic. 
Below is the breakdown list  of the features you should be aware of in this game, if you don't like it, don't play it.
1. The choice of gears and loots in this game is very limited. For example, there is no ranged weapon in this game so you need to rely on spells, which are quite few in the early phase of the game.
2. The character's development is also limited. There is no perk, feat, skill tree, etc; no, there is no such thing. When you level up, you only get attribute points, hit points and spells. You can tolerate this in Wizardry 7 because the diversity and versatility of the spells and the multiclass mechanism, but this is not the case in this game.
3. The so-called multiclass in this game is actually re-edit you character to level 1, where you only keep your hit points and spells, while your hard-earned attributes and abilities are lost. 
4. The character may be permanently lost; for example, a fail in resurrect (the chance depends on your vitality) may cause your beloved character forever gone. Yes, he/she is gone "forever". 
5. The same as above, you need to accept that all your team members are replaceable. When your team is wiped out, it is usually a better idea to fully re-create your whole team rather than to rescue them. It means, the bonds between you and your characters are poor. 
6. No automapping. No. You need to repeatedly cast a level 1 mage spell to do that, but with very few information on the map. I know this is a claimed "fun" feature of the series. However, from the standpoint of modern gaming, this may not be necessary. 
7. No manual save-load. The game is auto-saved; so it is very hard to use the save-load scum. You need to quit the game during the process and re-enter the game to load. However, you may regard that everything in this game is probably irreversible.
8. There is only ONE town. You need to go everytime back to town to level up, rest, sell/buy gears and etc. And there is no auto-comparison to your currently equipped items when you buy gears. 
9. The inventory slots are very limited. 

So, in summary, this game is very focused. If you can attach yourself to the very core of the dungeon-crawler game, then this game is simple but good, actually a classic. If not, try other modern CRPG games. | Wiz１をファミコンや88/98等で遊んだ事がある人に向けてのレビューかも
・１戦闘が異様に長くて昔のようにサクサク敵を処理できない（戦闘高速化ONが高速化してる気がしない）
・友好的なMOBが中々でてこなくて善悪が変えづら過ぎる（１０F到達まにで友好的な敵に出会った回数１）
・とにかくゲームが固まって再起動しなければならない事が多すぎる

結論：FCかSFCを中古で買ってカセットを買う　これがベストな気がする　そんなゲームでした。 | its the old Wizardry game from when I was a kid, just playing my first RPG, and its been made more modern, but still the same... I've been waiting for this for what feels like 35 years. | Makes me wish I had saved my NES version, I remember you could roll a possible 99 for starting a character on their version. But any version of wizardry too me is fun. Really wish wizardry online would make a come back some day.

After finishing it, I can conclude that Dragon's Dogma 2 might be the biggest disappointment I've ever experienced in gaming. I could go on for paragraphs about all the things that are bad about it, but I'll just summarize because I've already spent over 100 hours playing this when I could have been doing something else, like plucking my asshole hairs individually.

First and foremost, Dragon's Dogma Dark Arisen exists. In a world where DDDA didn't exist, this game would stand about where DDDA was - blatantly unfinished, didn't live up to it's potential, lot's of contemplating on how it could be better, but essentially just the skeleton of something great with pretty decent gameplay. [i]However[/i].

DDDA exists. Not only does it exist, Dragon's Dogma 2 is a marked downgrade in nearly every single metric already established by the prior game twelve years ago. Eleven if you want to be generous for the addition of Dark Arisen. There is less enemy variety, there are less vocations, equipment variety is worse, the story is worse, there are both less major characters and they have infinitely less screen time/importance/value, the music is just... nothing. I could keep going. The only measure DD2 is a genuine improvement and not just a side grade is in the graphics department, and this comes at a cost of the game being complete dog ass to run on your average PC. Sure you'll probably get 30-60fps consistently but it will chug randomly for no reason all over the place. Ignore Capcom's nonsense about it being NPCs in town, I was getting 18fps just loading the model in my inventory. Something about REengine or Denuvo has this game in a complete stranglehold and unfortunately it'll probably never get fixed.

If DDDA didn't exist, Dragon's Dogma 2 would just be a kind of stupid action RPG with good gameplay. But instead it's an abysmal sequel to a game with an already kind of stupid plot with better gameplay, and it manages to take that original idea and basically photocopy it with a scanner that was pretty low on ink. This game is so frustratingly undercooked. Let's just use an example. 

In the original game, you took damage and you lost HP and your "loss gauge" increased. This missing HP couldn't be healed for free with Anodyne, so you could either go to an inn or use healing items. Healing items had weight and were limited, and though you'd eventually be swimming in them, the healing your loss gauge meant you wanted to have them just in case. In DD2, you take damage and your loss gauge builds up, and... healing items don't do anything different than Anodyne. Okay, so this immediately makes healing items fucking worthless since they're still making you heavier (and slower) but they do the same thing as Anodyne, which mages can cast for free, all the time. In fact you'd only not have a mage with anodyne because you specifically chose to have no mage in your party. In exchange, you now have to go camping. Camping is so... fucking... NOTHING. It's just completely devoid of anything. Find one of the spots all over the map, use your tent item which can break but not only will this basically never happen you find tents constantly - all so you can cook meat and get an actual video of someone grilling a steak on a pan in real life, and get a buff. You have the same one line of dialogue with your pawn at the camp site and go to sleep. But keep in mind you can only cook meat - not fish, not fruit, not potatoes, and you certainly can't make meals or anything fancy. In fact there are 8 types of meat you can cook for the entire game and they're all just variations of two types of meat, Scrag and Beast Steak. Combining them makes Dried whatever meat and if you let it rot you get Rotten whatever meat (which you can still cook and your pawns will say it's delicious because their canned yummy yummy response is also completely fucking nothing).

This is DD2. It's just so empty. It builds on nothing from DDDA. It's got a bigger world except it's almost exclusively just roads and cliffs that make traveling at night more annoying, and lots and lots of fighting fodder enemies. Which is fun! In fact, the first 20-30 hours of this game are spectacular. But the more you play it, the more and more obviously unfinished it is. Until the final sequence where the credits are rolling and some NPC I maybe met twice in 80 hours and don't care about is literally explaining to me what the Dragon's Dogma is. Holy shit.

I want to live in a world where this game never came out, because at least before I could hope about what Dragon's Dogma 2 could be. Now it's out, and it's too late. We'll never have that, just like we didn't get to have the Dragon's Dogma 1 that "we were supposed to".

At least I got to kill thousands of Goblins. Do not recommend. | Game hasnt been updated in months (sept) Really feels abandoned and needs optimizations badly. Could have been a good game but missed the mark. | Dragons dogma 2 é um bom jogo, o combate desse jogo sempre foi sem igual, vc consegue interagir tanto com o inimigos quanto Monster hunter, se vc gosta de combate esse tem um dos melhores de todos.

DITO ISSO: Dragons dogma 2 n é uma boa sequencia do primeiro jogo, é uma vergonha na verdade esse ser considerado uma "continuaçao", os mesmos defeitos que tinham no primeiro jogo também tem nesse. Vc consegue minimizar algumas coisas com mods, mas sem isso é bem improvavel que vc termine o jogo se já tiver jogado o primeiro.

**- VELHOS JOGADORES, se vc era muito fã do outro jogo, mas sabia que ele tinha defeitos, então com certeza terá uma experiência ruim com esse jogo, no começo até tem muita coisa nova pra ver, mas depois que vc nota que é tão vazio e que n foi implementado nada de novo, vc ficará puto, N VALE O PREÇO FULL. **
1 - FAST TRAVEL LIMITADO, podre igual ao primeiro jogo, algumas atts colocaram portcrystal nas cidades para facilitar, mas deveriam ter em todas vilas importantes e ter a merda da EternalFerrystone, pra que remover uma coisa que deu certo no primeiro jogo mesmo sabendo que foi demanda dos jogadores????.
2 - MONSTROS LIMITADOS, o combate do jogo é incrivel, mas n ajuda quando vc enfrenta o mesmo inimigo 50 mil vezes por minuto. A cada esquina q vc vira tem inimigo, vc n consegue explorar o mapa por 1 min ser atacado por uma das 50 variantes de goblins, poderiam ter usados alguns monstros de bitterblackisland, n sei pra que removeram a cockatrice por exemplo, era pra ter mais monstros, n menos. 
2.5 - MESMOS MONSTROS,  reutilizaram praticamente todos os monstros do outro jogo, os dragões são os mesmos, grifo o mesmo, tiraram a HIDRA pra por a MEDUSA que tem 2 golpes apenas, enfim, pouquissima variação, eu sei que é o mesmo universo, mas poderia ter bem mais monstros.
3 - NOTICEBOARD, n sei pra que removeram um dos sistemas legais que tinha no outro game, onde vc pegava quests num quadro e conseguia ganhar itens especiais e mais ouro, ganhar ouro nesse jogo é torturantemente dificil, por motivo nenhum.
4 - MAPA GIGANTESCO, mapa desnecessariamente grande, e fica ainda pior quando vc tem um sistema de fast travel limitado, monstros repetidos e uma FODENDO STAMINA limitadissima (Deus abençoes os moders, usem stamina ilimitada fora de combate, ninguém merece essa merda).
5 - SISTEMA DE RECOMPENSAS RUINS, vc quase n é recompensado por explorar o mapa, vc só acha porcarias em qualquer das cavernas que vc explora, todos os itens bons(armaduras,armas) vc consegue de vendedores, n tem incentivo pra vc explorar, n vai ter merda nenhuma pra vc adquirir nessas cavernas q vc n consiga melhor na vila mais próxima.
6 - SEM HARD MODE, era uma funcionalidade do outro jogo e removeram sei lá pq caralhos, os inimigos davam mais dano, mas vc conseguia adquirir as coisas bem mais rapido pois ganhava mais xp e ouro.
7 - NERF DE CLASSES, nerfaram algumas classes removendo a habilidade de usar 2 armas, STRIDER passou a ser ARCHER, podendo usar apenas o arco e é uma porcaria, dano é mediocre comparado ao primeiro jogo, só serve pra derrubar harpias essa merda, no primeiro vc podia usar 2 armas e o arco era mt foda(RANGER). Nerfaram umas magias de sorcerer também, meteoro foi cagado, tiraram diversas magias do jogo, incluindo as de gelo que tinha no outro q era lindo de ver(high gicel) e n colocaram nenhuma magia "suprema" nova, são as mesmas do outro jogo.
8 - PERFORMANCE, esse aqui deve ser puramente por culpa dessa merda de denuvo, minha máquina n é highend, mas n era pra rodar tão cagado, se vc conseguisse diminuir graficos pra rodar mais liso seria ótimo, mas n faz diferença nenhuma vc mexer nas config q o fps continua sempre a mesma bomba, sei lá diminuindo a população ou algo do tipo, de toda forma vai ter npc brotando na sua frente do nada ao entrar na cidade.
9- DEVS DOENTES, resumindo esse jogo é uma copia do outro jogo, tudo que tinha de ruim no outro ainda terá nesse, eles n fizeram questão de melhorar quase nada, e ainda nerfaram e removeram diversas coisas que eram legais no outro jogo.

BONUS: Se vc chegou até aqui tem algumas coisas boas nesse jogo, mas os defeitos minimizam. A quest da Sphinx é super divertida, combate sensacional, os graficos são bonitos, as classes são divertidas apesar de mt nerf, end game o pessoal fala que é a melhor parte do jogo, sistema de Pawns é mt divertido, da pra fazer mts combinações de party, eles são bem inteligentes, os minibosses são mt legais de enfrentar. | 剧情是好的角色是好的战斗是好的
但是你的内容呢？
内容呢？！
这么好的制作就这么糟蹋吗 | 龙信2给我的感受不能说好，也很难说坏，只能说实在是太怪了
一方面，它的设计和制作给我带来了很强的沉浸感，如同真的在和几个队友一起探险一样
但同时，我们探险的这个世界并不有趣…
也就是说，龙信2让我很好地沉浸在了一个无聊的冒险之中
怪

如果你是：看恐怖电影玩恐怖游戏身边的人在乱叫，而你因为画面太快太暗观察力不敏锐反射弧太长等错过了惊吓点的人，那这个游戏毫无乐趣，但有催眠价值。 | When it comes to the liminality phenomenon there are two major genres on Steam: the backrooms and those games with anomalies. [i]Exit 8[/i] belongs to the latter.

These software feature a relatively small playable area and our job is to simply pass it. We can find games taking place in hotel corridors, an office area, a small street or - as it is in this case - an underground passage.

The concept is always the same: go through the area but only in case you haven't found anything unusual. The first couple of times we go through it are considered the tutorial: we have the opportunity to carefully observe everything in our path. There are lamps, posters on the walls, doors, an expatriate walking towards us and even the painting on the floor is important. Not to mention the cameras and the signs.

In case we notice anything odd compared to the original state, we immediately need to turn back. Overall, we need to pass the underground passage 8 times (as in the title) but the final session must be without anomalies as we need to reach the staircase leading up to the surface.

There are over 30 anomalies and following our first completion the game puts up a sign with the number. As we find new anomalies this will decrease. The 2nd achievement is tied to finding everything. Now, finding means actually noticing the anomaly and turning back. 

But what if we make a mistake? That we go through the passage where an anomaly is present? Then we start from the beginning. Just before entering the long corridor, a huge sign shows what level we are on and should we make a mistake we are back to zero. In certain cases failure to react in time can result in death. If you see something fast coming towards you, I suggest you immediately turn back and run.

Due to the concept of liminality (that we are against such supernatural phenomena alone) this can be considered a horror game and some anomalies further justify this. In general, I find these games quite the niche on Steam and the only problem I have with them is that they are short. Still, I recommend this one as it is fun for an hour or so. | ゲームの表現と遊び方の鉱脈はまだまだ底がないことを実証するような、素晴らしいホラーゲーム。この唯一無二のプレイ感は、時に相反する複数の感情の同時提供とその絶妙なバランスにある。
どんな恐怖が襲ってくるかわからない不気味な通路を歩く恐ろしさ、しかし次にどんなユニークな表現の怪異が出てくるかワクワクしてしまう好奇心、ゲームが進むにつれて増大するクリアの為に違和感を見逃すまいと張り詰める緊張感、怪異なしと判断して進む勇気とそれを裏切られた時の絶望感。ゲームプレイを通して常にいろんな感情に振り回され、ジレンマを感じさせてくれる構成は、他のゲームだとなかなか感じ得ないものだった。

怪異の内容もバラエティ豊かでありつつバランスが取れていて、普通に怖いジャンプスケアや、シュールでアーティスティックなオシャレな現象、膝を打つような間違い探し的なネタや、映画のパロディや突っ込みどころがあるものなど様々だ。これが何か特定の要素に大きく振れていたら、ここまでハマらなかったかもしれない。「次はどんな怪異が襲ってくるのかな？」というワクワクを、適度にユーモアたっぷりに期待に応え、時に本当に怯えさせてくれるテンポ感が、やめ時を失う心地よさをもたらしてくれている。
それでいて物見遊山や怖いもの見たさでで楽しむ序盤とはうって変わり、4番出口くらいから徐々に漂い出し、6番出口あたりでピークに達するヒリつく緊張感は、同じ通路を歩いてるだけのはずなのに10分前のプレイフィールとは全く異質なものになってくる。このギャップもまたクセになる。

開発者の掌のうえで感情をもてあそばれてるような気分にさせてくれるインディーは、何度出会っても心が躍る。
またどこかで拓かれるに違いない、新しいゲームの表現の鉱脈まで夢見させてくれる良いタイトルだった。


その他細かい感想
・捕まると即ゲームオーバーの怪異があることで、ちょっと触れてみたい好奇心と、ここまで進んだからやり直しは避けたいというジレンマに悩まされることもあった。怪異とわかっていても触りたくなってしまう
・おじさん良い身体してるなぁ… | A standout title among psychological horror games, whose subtle tricks and occasional scares strike a good balance to make the most of player expectations. Experienced mild motion sickness while playing, possibly due to the repeating tile pattern, but as the game can easily be played in short bursts, this was not an issue for 100% completion. | Прошел игру The Exit 8 за 8 минут, самая быстрая в прохождении игра. Увидел значительную часть негативных отзывов в том, что игра не напугала, хотя по сути это игра на внимательность и память, не более того. Жаль у Куплинова проспойлерил часть аномалий, но не увидев бы игру, никогда бы она ко мне в руки не попала бы, надо было еще пару уровней сделать разработчику. А те, кто еще не смотрел ни у кого и не играл очень советую, дешево и весело

Great game. Absolutely worth the price, even without a sale.  That said, probably won't be adding any more time into it unless more levels are added later.  

The controls take some getting used to, but after a couple hours you don't really think about it.  It's very satisfying creating small optimizations.

I would really like if there were a sandbox mode, or just unlimited budget versions of levels.  I really wanted to see how high the score could go.  Btw, if the dev is reading, one of the levels has a number of people who managed a maximum score, and then some hacker sitting at the very top with a score of like 6000.  It kind of felt like it de-legitimized the whole global scoreboard for the rest of the game. | the cars don't yield, they stop in the middle of a crossing, they try to cross 4 lanes of traffic to make a turn coming up within 12 feet, everyone driving down single lane roads with like 10 times more traffic than during rush hour
its just like real life



its fun but real life solutions only work if people follow basic rules | Nice too see cars collide then decipher the problem I managed to solve all left and right with 3 stars | itt dooeeessssnnnnn'tttttt woorrrkkkk! | Really nice puzzle game.

Reviews:
The more I play this game the less I like it. "Every run is viable" is 100% nonsense. Half the roster is useless, and the other half will continue to be nerfed until they are useless too.  Save yourself a headache and play a game that doesn't think endless horde ambushes is peak level design. | In my opinion, this is one of the best modern rogue likes. It has a very arcade-y feel which I like. I do have one warning. In my 19 hours I have had probably 5 crashes. Be prepared to lose a run or two. | This is a great addition to my list of favorite modern traditional roguelikes (ToME, DCSS, Brogue, CoQ). This game just looks and sounds great. Abundant of QoL features take the friction out of exploration and discovery, and just enough information is presented to make important decisions without overwhelming you with a wall of numbers and stats.

That being said, I would like to see a combat log in the future (which the developer is currently working on). Great game, and a great dev. Looking forward to more updates soon. | amazing game honestly

Fun little spooky puzzler, takes about an hour to beat.

Most of the game amounts to reading a book and looking for clues to figure out a substitution cipher, while nervously checking to make sure a monster hasn't snuck up on you.

Does have some jump scares.

期待了很久的独立游戏。之前还联系了制作组尝试帮助中文汉化，但是制作组准备发售后找翻译公司完成所有其他语言的翻译工作，所以因为中文问题还在犹豫的兄弟们可以等汉化发布了再入手。首发制作组准备九折优惠的结果太激动忘记了也着实难绷，但不妨碍还是目前为止今年最满意的独立游戏了。 | If you're a Millennial, this game is a time capsule of your own memories, an actual drive down memory lane. It took me a couple playthroughs to understand why the setting is so vague - the currency symbol is fake, the town names are an amalgamation of Northern and Western Europe, so you could be anywhere from the west coast of Canada to England to Germany to Scandinavia - no setting is defined. Even the names of the people you meet are not names but descriptions, eg. The Kid, The Bride, etc. I found this clever little obfuscation allowing me to imprint my own experiences onto the game, with memories people and places I haven't thought of in 20 years all flooding back. The generality of everything allows a huge audience with a common lived experience to connect with the game on an extremely personal level. 

As for gameplay, nothing is groundbreaking and you've likely seen most of the mechanics before, but the game exists as a canvas for you to paint your own memories onto. It's really an extraordinary masterpiece. The strongest piece of the design is the freedom afforded to the player - you are given goals, but you don't need to complete them. You set off originally to get to a festival within a month, but the game lasts for 3 months and if you don't want to go to the festival then you don't have to. Nothing is forced, everything is at your discretion. Do drugs, or don't. Buy guns, or don't. Pick up hitchhikers, or don't. You won't be punished for anything except careless driving - but maybe don't get pulled over by the cops when you're drunk, that's a pretty tricky combat. 

Special mention for the soundtrack, absolutely incredible. Honestly the price of the game is worth it for the music, I have no idea how to developers found all this great obscure music, most of the songs in this game have less than 10,000 plays on Spotify. Cruising around in your car listening to this soundtrack is a distinct pleasure. 

Overall, 10/10. Even 11/10. If you get the vibes in this game you will have an extraordinary experience. | ★★★★★ (10/10)

Played the Demo of it for many hours and hyped to see the release. This is how to launch a game! Was even so brazen to E-Mail the devs if there's an opportunity to buy it earlier than the release date. Surprisingly got an answer back, telling me politely that it unfortunately isn't possible, but telling me there is a spotify playlist of the games soundtrack and gave me a link to it. Loved that response!

Keep Driving is a gem in the indie game scene an experience that's as cozy as a road trip at sunset with your favorite playlist on repeat.

Pros: (Spoiler: There are only pros)

- Zero Bugs: Flawlessly smooth. Not once did I encounter any crashes, glitches, or game-breaking issues.
- Stunning Graphics: The visuals are vibrant and charming, capturing the beauty of endless roads and scenic horizons in an incredibly cozy art style.
- Amazing Soundtrack: The music elevates the entire experience. It's chill, captivating, and fitting for the vibe. Bonus points for having the soundtrack as a Spotify playlist!
- Simple Yet Addictive Gameplay: It just clicks — easy to pick up but hard to put down. There's a satisfying rhythm that makes you want to keep driving (pun intended).
- Endless Replayability: Plenty of content to keep you entertained for countless hours.

If you're looking for a chill, feel-good game with polished gameplay and relaxing vibes, this one’s a no-brainer. Buckle up and hit the road, you won't regret it. | - Play for the emergent narrative game play
- Stay for the best-in-class soundtrack
- Run it back because there is *so* much to see and experience.

This feels like Oregon Trail mixed with a modern rogue-like.

The less you know, the better, IMO. | Wow. Honestly, just wow.

Please do not let the 17.99 price tag deter you, Keep Driving is a great game. 

I've currently only experienced two endings so far, but I can tell that there is so much to love about this game. I'm not entirely sure how much replay value there is outside of experiencing every single ending, as I haven't gotten there yet, but with how many endings there are and how long each run lasts, if you try to keep your game purchases around $1/hr you'll easily get your moneys worth out of this one. 

Edit: After doubling my time since review I still think this is amazing. Found a lot of cocaine on one of my runs, decided I'd maybe get some rehab, decided to party and have sex instead. 10/10.

Oczywiście, że polecam, ale tylko starym wyjadaczom. Gra wręcz stworzona dla maniaków i ludzi, którzy z nostalgią wspominają lata dziewięćdziesiąte. Młodzi nawet na to nie zerkną, a jeśli już to bardzo szybko się odbiją. Mechaniki stare jak ja sam :). Oj dawno czegoś takiego nie było na rynku. Ot, takie małe cudeńko. | This game is fantastic. The art style isn't even a needed gimmick. It would be a very solid RPG were it using a more modern art style. I thoroughly enjoyed it. | Insane, dense Lovecraftian atmosphere, enjoyable combat mechanics and very captivating storyline - I enjoyed it a lot highly recommended. Didn't expect to like it as much as I did | I was so excited to play this game. A retro RPG with turn-based combat, pixelated graphics, and Lovecraftian horror theme! Count me in!

It started wonderfully. I restarted a few times to try different characters (hence my 15 hours), then settled on one and started playing. The game was very fun, engaging, and like a breath of fresh air among all other modern "RPG" games.

Then why the negative vote? Simple: It has bugs so severe that you are locked out of progressing in the game. Here be spoilers:  [spoiler]A quest asks you to find food for refugees. You have two options: buy food from smugglers, or take some farmer's goats. The leader of smugglers didn't even present the first option to me, so I went with the second option. I convinced the farmer through diplomacy to hand over his goats, but the game didn't register it! So I took his goats by force and brought them to the camp, but then the questgiver didn't present me the option to complete the quest! So here I was, being locked out from progressing the game. I had the same problem with a side quest but I had moved on, but this was the final nail in the coffin for me.[/spoiler]

So try this game at your own risk. You can enjoy it for hours, only then to get locked out of progressing. | This is a good game ruined by a bad combat system.

Thematically and aesthetically this game is fantastic. It tells a genuinely dark and gripping story. But the fights just aren't fun because the combat system lets this game down.

Basically this game uses grid based tactical fights, but there is one giant problem with them: You cannot move or attack diagonally and every time you kill an enemy in melee the attacking character advances into the space the enemy previously occupied. It creates an absolutely absurd system where nothing is intuitive to what it looks like on the screen.

For example, forming a line of fighters is a terrible strategy, because since you cannot attack diagonally what you're actually doing is ensuring that only one of your characters can attack that enemy. There are circumstances where you can spend several turns just trying to maneuver characters into a position where the can make useful attacks without getting screwed over if the enemy dies and they are forced to advance into its space. 

It's not that this system is impossible to master, but it's such a far flung abstraction from what you want out of a simulation of small group skirmish combat that it puts a stink on the whole game. It makes you feel like every enemy you encounter forces you to solve a puzzle rather than win a fight.

I'd give this game a 7/10. This game is a blast from the past. I likely won't play it much more, but if you're looking for a 2000s style RPG that's unforgiving, has poor graphics, and doesn't hold your hand this is absolutely perfect for you. Unfortunately, once the nostalgia wore off, I realized that isn't actually what I enjoy anymore. I will say I think the price is a bit high for the simplicity of the game. About $20 would be more fair considering there's not much novel or complex here, and it's early access with some systems remaining to be implemented. | Im testing Ashes of Creation Alpha Phase 2, but bought this to play during downtimes. Funny that. This is the game I was looking for. AoC and its social engineering is great for some, but Im old and dont care about youtube drama. This game has the community and style of game I can get down with. Ive stashed that launcher and am going full steam ahead into Pantheon. | As a former Everquest player, I was easily talked into getting this from a buddy.  Started playing and couldn't stop.  My older boys watched me play a bit, asked some questions about it.  I more or less let them know this is a game from my generation and they probably wouldn't like it.  

After a short time, they got it anyway.  I suspected they wouldn't last, this fortnite / rocket league generation has much different expectations of games these days.  I couldn't have been more wrong.

50+ hours later both of them can't stop playing.  They appreciate the difficulty, consequences, and rewarding feeling of progress for the increased effort required for their time.  The 3 of us haven't been into the same game at the same time for a while, but Pantheon definitely had the hook for all of us.

Highly recommended.  Highly recommend recommending it to others you may not think would enjoy it, also.  Looking forward to the completion of this amazing project and hoping to have it around for decades to come. | Fantastic MMO! Only 15 hours in but my god do I want to not stop playing. This is the refresh the genre needed, going back to what made it so good before we all hopped onto the themepark ride. The no map makes you learn the map and not want to venture too deep and the mix of strong monsters and death penalty make you want to play in a group. This then forces you to play the way that makes MMO's the best genre, you play in a group and you explore on edge. Think WOW classic/EQ1 vibes. 

Don't be put off b how it looks as they will improve that but once in game you really don't care as you are having too much fun. 

This one is for heavy MMO fans or feel the genre lost what it once had, well it's back. | UPDATE:
The GMs have replied to the situation I mention below and have refused any accountability, despite the multiple types of proof, including their own staff confirming it, and are trying to sweep it under the rug. VR will never get any support, or references, from me until they rectify the situation. And for an EA game that is likely to be EOS within a year, that is something they should work to avoid.

-------


Original:

I initially enjoyed Pantheon, as it evoked a sense of nostalgia reminiscent of my time with EverQuest. Many of the game’s characteristics—such as long leveling grinds, a strong emphasis on group play, and static mob camping—felt familiar and engaging.

Despite having invested 130 (120-ish of which were active hours) into the game and being an avid MMO enthusiast, I ultimately cannot recommend it. There are several key reasons for this.

First, the game leans too heavily on EverQuest-inspired mechanics without incorporating modern quality-of-life improvements or common enhancements seen in contemporary MMOs - I loved EQ. But if I wanted EQ, I'd go play EQ. Additionally, the community is moderated by individuals who appear more interested in wielding authority than fostering a positive and welcoming environment (It is a cesspool, which honestly most gaming Discords are). This has led to a rather toxic atmosphere. Furthermore, critical game updates and information are disseminated almost exclusively through Twitch streams, with little effort made to provide written summaries or official updates—something that should be standard practice, even with a small development team.

Under normal circumstances, I would still consider supporting and amplifying the game in its Early Access phase, as I generally appreciate the iterative development process. However, recent revelations regarding certain Game Masters (GMs) summoning rare spawns for a specific guild—under the pretense of benefiting "elite testers"—have raised serious concerns. Initially, these actions were denied (Directly by the guilty party), only to later be acknowledged (AFTER all the proof came out). The game director stated that such practices "should not be happening," yet other GM and community manager comments suggest that this behavior has been normalized.

What is most troubling is that, despite the implications of favoritism within a live environment that includes a functioning economy and competitive progression, the developers have shown no remorse. There has been no formal apology or transparent explanation regarding how this situation arose and how they plan to address it moving forward. Given that Pantheon is already a niche title with a relatively small player base, maintaining trust and fairness should be a top priority. And to get ahead of the 'knights', it being EA doesn't matter. It being wiped in 2 years, does not matter. The concept of "We should have a test server" is baked into service games 101. They chose to incentivize testers.

While I do not regret my initial investment in the game, I will not continue to engage with it unless the developers take full accountability, provide a clear explanation of what transpired, and take meaningful steps to rebuild trust within the community.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Early Access
Reviews:
Mit 50 Jahren noch ein Spiel zu entdecken, das einen fesselt, motiviert, zum Überlegen anregt und einfach begeistert , ist wirklich schön - DANKE DAFÜR! | Please fix the crash that results in a total hardware reset. The game is great, but currently unplayable for those that don't wish to damage their computers. | This is a really good game. I'm a newcomer to PoE, having only briefly tried the first game a few years back. I consider myself a fairly casual ARPG player, but I love RPGs in general. This game is very much worth the cost of admission.

This game's combat feels satisfying in a way that no other modern ARPG has quite managed for me. The character progression and build variety have been the real highlights, though. The various systems for managing skills, stats and gear are really enjoyable and easily understandable. The best part is you'll actually have to use these systems since the game isn't afraid to provide a challenge.

The amount of mechanical depth on offer here is really impressive for how intuitive everything is at a glance, you can tell the devs really put a great amount of thought and care into how everything is presented. There are some rough edges, but overall the game is really good in this regard.

I strongly dislike using guides, so I've gone in as blind as possible. I highly recommend taking this approach, despite what some players might say. Using a guide is not necessary, and overpowered builds will likely get nerfed. If you use a guide you are doing yourself a genuine disservice and ignoring the most interesting aspects of the game. That's just my two cents though, play the game however you like.

I don't have many complaints. I think endgame would be more fun if the player could return to an area after dying. The XP loss is a good mechanic in my opinion, but I don't like having to restart from scratch AND use another waystone in order to do so. It's tedious and requires too much attention. The game currently doesn't attempt to accommodate more casual players at endgame. I think more options and a less restrictive structure would help a lot. As it stands now, the campaign is the most enjoyable part of the game.

tldr; gud game, I am lazy, add fishing | Recomendo o Jogo, NÃO A DESENVOLVEDORA. 
Jogue 920 horas do primeiro jogo da desenvolvedora, morra para um bug, tire print, mande para a desenvolvedora, veja eles dizerem "não podemos fazer nada pelos itens que perdeu, pois é nossa politica NÃO DEVOLVER ITENS MESMO COM PRINTS PROVANDO QUE ELES DROPARAM". Se indigne e abandone o jogo não somente por isso, mas por um sistema de punição extremamente punitivo e masoquista que não permite o menor lag na maquina sem prejuizo a você, ou melhor seu xp.
Volte anos depois, pois todo mundo tá dizendo que o jogo mudou, PAGUE o beta, para "testar", veja bugs como, "energy shield, não tanka o dano primeiro antes de ir na vida", veja o sistema punitivo de xp continuar, engula tudo isso pq o jogo está legal de se jogar, mas fique 48 horas tentando reportar um bug DA DESENVOLVEDORA, descubra que NENHUMA CANAL DA DESENVOLVEDORA DÁ ACESSO DIRETO A DIZER PRA ELES "CORRIGAM ESSE BUG QUE TÁ AE A MAIS DE UM MÊS", veja a desenvolvedora correr pra "arrumar bugs "importantes" (leia-se aqueles que o pessoal usa pra ter alguma vantagem) e simplesmente IGNORAR UM BUG DE MAIS DE UM MêS SEGUNDO RELATOS NO PROPRIO FORUM. Vá na sua conta de POE 1, pegue o endereço de email da desenvolvedora, mande um email pedindo para consertarem o bug do seu boneco que por acaso VOCÊ PAGOU para jogar dessa vez, receba um email deles dizendo "lamentamos mas não atendemos mais por email devido a alta demanda" (mas atendem se for por conta de compras né?????), veja eles te passarem os mesmos links que eles não resolveram os problemas de foruns, veja que não tem nenhuma solução, grite bem alto: "VOCÊS CONSEGUEM FAZER UM JOGO BOM E TEREM UM PÓS ATENDIMENTO PÉSSIMO 3G". Continue jogando só pra não abandonar seus colegas. Repita o processo até enjoar do descaso da GGG.
Depois de 1390 horas nos dois jogos, tenho o direito ao desabafo, vocês são horrives GGG, Horriveis! | Great game but if you are not going to bring the Turkish language, please bring the Turkish server
